Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: The beautiful floral aromas of this medium-bodied and soothing wine meet peach and tangy apricot flavors on the palate. It is fresh, attractive and fruity while maintaining a certain subtlety that lends sophistication.
Name: Bella Grace 2018 Estate Vermentino (Amador County)

Description: Clean aromas of lime and toast are very fresh and citrusy on the nose of this can of wine. There is a tangy grip to the palate, which offers simple but pleasant lime-laced pear flavors.
Name: Bonny Doon 2017 La Bulle-Moose Blanche Vermentino (California)

Description: The nose of this wine is abundant in aromas of banana, lemon curd, elderflower and sourdough. The palate is slightly nutty but the banana and elderflower notes don't shy away. Flavors of yeast, banana and florals, plus a bit of nuttiness, make for an enjoyable overall experience.
Name: Early Mountain 2018 Pétillant Naturel Malvasia Bianca (Virginia)

Description: Spicy and lightly smoky, this fruity wine has a mineral edge, touches of green herbs and contrasting lemon and apricot flavors. It's perfumed, crisp and ready to drink.
Name: Domaine de la Croix 2018 Eloge Vermentino (Côtes de Provence)

Description: Young, crisp fruit has an herbal character as well as ripe peach flavors, giving a sense of warmth while retaining the freshness of this wine. Developing further, it should be ready from late 2019.
Name: Château de Pourcieux 2018 Vermentino (Côtes de Provence)

Appellation: Potter Valley, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Strong aromas of fresh earth, buttered popcorn and sauteed veggies vie for attention in this full-bodied and quite mature-tasting wine.
Name: Blue Fox Cellars 2015 Nube Bianco Vineyard Tocai Friulano (Potter Valley)

Description: Aromas suggesting bread crust and hazelnut segue into yellow spring flower and citrus notes. Made with organically grown grapes, the racy focused palate delivers juicy white grapefruit, graphite, apricot and a hint of brioche alongside vibrant acidity and lively continuous perlage. Give this a few more years to develop even more complexity. Drink 2021–2028.
Name: Fongaro 2013 Brut Bio Riserva  (Lessini Durello)

Description: Bread crust, crushed rock, chamomile and apricot aromas mingle with a whiff of smoke. On the elegant palate, bright acidity and a silky perlage provide the refined backdrop for mature yellow apple, pastry cream and citrus zest. A mineral vein carries over to the dry finish.
Name: Gianni Tessari 2008 120 Mesi Extra Brut  (Lessini Durello)

Description: Pastry dough, yellow stone fruit and citrus aromas lead the way on this elegant sparkler. Made with organically farmed native grape Durella, the savory, polished palate doles out Golden Delicious apple, orange zest, bread crust and a hint of crystallized ginger alongside a mineral vein. The silky perlage and fresh acidity give it weightless balance.
Name: Fongaro 2011 Brut Riserva  (Lessini Durello)

Description: Aromas of smoke, bread crust, yellow flower and crushed rock lift out of the glass. On the vibrant, savory palate, fresh acidity lifts yellow peach, pastry dough and lemon cream alongside an elegant perlage. A savory mineral note lingers on the finish.
Name: Sandro de Bruno NV 36 mesi  (Lessini Durello)

Description: Smooth, savory and stunning, this lovely sparkler has delicately enticing aromas of yellow pear, spring flower, toasted brioche, crushed stone and citrus zest. The silky palate delivers Golden Delicious apple, ripe apricot, almond and a honeyed mineral note. An elegant mousse softens the bone-dry finish.
Name: Bellaguardia 2012 Montecchi Pas Dosé  (Lessini Durello)

Description: Inviting aromas of Spanish broom, yellow stone fruit, pastry dough and a whiff of honey form the nose. Enticingly elegant, the vibrant palate offers dried apricot, mature yellow apple, orange zest and a hint of honeyed mineral alongside a soft continuous perlage and fresh acidity. It closes on an almond note.
Name: Gianni Tessari NV 60 Mesi Extra Brut  (Lessini Durello)

Description: White spring wild flower, citrus, yellow stone fruit and crushed rock aromas form the nose. The racy bone-dry palate offers dried apricot, white grapefruit, toasted hazelnut and a hint of fennel set against firm acidity and a vibrant perlage.
Name: Sandro de Bruno 2010 Extra Brut  (Lessini Durello)

Description: Toasted bread crust, white almond and an earthy note of underbrush mingle with stone fruit aromas. It's vibrant, evoking yellow-apple, lemon-zest, salty mineral and grilled herb flavors framed in racy acidity and a refined mousse.
Name: Franchetto 2014 Brut Riserva  (Lessini Durello)

Description: Made with organically farmed Durella grapes, this sparkler opens with aromas of acacia flower, toasted bread crust and orange rind. The aromas carry over to the dry linear palate along with a hint of dried apple and bitter walnut.
Name: Fongaro 2010 Pas Dosé  (Lessini Durello)

Description: Aromas evoking ripe yellow stone fruit, crushed stone, wild herb and a whiff of bread crust shape the nose. The bright sleek palate shows apricot, golden apple, citrus and steely mineral alongside a silky perlage. It closes on an almond note.
Name: Gianni Tessari NV 36 Mesi  (Lessini Durello)

Description: Aromas of brimstone, yellow apple, and citrus carry over to the vibrant palate along with juicy Bartlett pear, honeydew melon and candied lemon drop. Bright acidity and a vivacious perlage provide the racy backdrop.
Name: Cà d'Or 2017 Blanc de Blancs Brut  (Lessini Durello)

Description: Aromas of toasted bread crust chamomile and yellow stone fruit follow over to the racy palate along with grapefruit and bitter almond. Vibrant acidity and a lively perlage provide the backdrop.
Name: Ca' Rugate 2013 2013  (Lessini Durello)

Appellation: Terre del Volturno, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Made from Campania's native Pallagrello Bianco, this opens with aromas of citrus, peach and a whiff of thyme that carry over to the medium-bodied palate. It's balanced by fresh acidity, with a hazelnut note on the close.
Name: Vestini Campagnano 2017 Pallagrello Bianco (Terre del Volturno)

Description: Aromas of toasted bread crust, coconut and mature stone fruit lead the nose. On the mature palate, you'll find more toasted notes, coffee and a hint of butterscotch alongside a soft mousse.
Name: Bellaguardia NV Romeo 66 Mesi Extra Brut  (Lessini Durello)

Description: Toasted bread crust, acacia honey and yellow-apple aromas follow through to the racy palate along with yellow apple and grapefruit and a salty mineral note. Steely bubbles and firm acidity provide the backdrop.
Name: Corte Giacobbe 2012 Cuvée Augusto Dosaggio Zero Riserva  (Lessini Durello)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Bright and fresh aromas of lime blossom, key lime pie, ripe nectarine, chalk and jasmin show on the expressive nose of this bottling. There is a great zing to the palate as well as a chalky grip, allowing ripe pear and peach-oil flavors to shine, though they do become sweeter as the wine breathes and warms.
Name: Brick Barn 2016 Vermentino (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: White flower, summer orchard fruit, pastry dough and a whiff of botanical herb lead the nose. The vibrant palate offers ripe yellow apple, bread crust, lemon drop and chestnut honey alongside and elegant mousse.
Name: Cantina di Soave NV Settecento 33 Riserva  (Lessini Durello)

Description: This fragrant sparkler has intense aromas of white rose, citrus and yellow peach. The off-dry, foaming palate offers apricot, pink grapefruit and wild strawberry alongside vibrant acidity.
Name: Cà di Rajo 2018 Manzoni Rosa Extra Dry Manzoni (Vino Spumante)

Appellation: Hudson River Region, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Stony citrus, apple peel, lemongrass and white flowers grace the nose. This is well rounded on the palate, with ample acidity to balance flavors of melon and citrus, with a tactile, chalky finish.
Name: Millbrook 2017 Proprietor's Special Reserve Tocai Friulano (Hudson River Region)

Description: Yellow-peach, tropical-fruit and Mediterranean brush aromas follow through to the fresh, rounded palate along with a vein of saline and white grapefruit. It's juicy and savory, with a bitter-almond finish.
Name: Poggio al Tesoro 2017 Solosole Vermentino (Toscana)

Description: This Ciliegiolo opens with aromas evoking red berry, forest floor and cedar while the savory palate delivers crushed raspberry, star anise and white pepper. Drink through 2022.
Name: Quercia al Poggio 2015 Canto della Pieve Ciliegiolo (Toscana)

Description: Aromas of citrus blossom and white grapefruit lead the way on this savory white. The aromas follow over to the juicy palate together with apricot and a tangy hint of saline.
Name: Campo alle Comete 2017 Vermentino (Toscana)

Appellation: Vin Santo del Chianti, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Made with dried Trebbiano grapes, this opens with aromas of ripe fig, toasted hazelnut and orange zest. The warm and enveloping palate delivers acacia honey, marzipan and dried apricot.
Name: Castello Sonnino 2011  Vin Santo del Chianti

Description: Aromas of beeswax, white spring flower and citrus rind mingle with a whiff of honey. The aromas follow over to the savory palate along with yellow peach and a hint of crushed thyme. Fresh acidity lifts the finish.
Name: Terre di Talamo 2016 Vento Forte Vermentino (Toscana)

Description: Beeswax, orchard-fruit and almond aromas waft out of the glass. The aromas segue over to the rounded, enveloping palate along with dried peach and a hint of citrus.
Name: Podere La Cappella 2015 Vermentino (Toscana)

Description: This has delicate aromas of white spring flower and a whiff of honeydew melon that carry over to the easygoing palate along with yellow peach and a hint of citrus. It's straightforward and savory.
Name: Poggio al Tufo 2017 Vermentino (Toscana)

Description: Aromas of toasted nut and acacia lead the nose. The aromas follow over to the rather lean, somewhat disjointed palate along with dried apricot, a confectionery note and a hint of honey.
Name: Tenuta del Buonamico 2017 VIVI Vermentino (Toscana)

Description: This opens with subtle aromas of yellow stone fruit and spring flower. The simple, rather fleeting palate offers suggestions of yellow peach, orange rind and a bitter note of chestnut honey.
Name: Torre Matilde 2017 San Giorgio a Canneto Vermentino (Toscana)

Description: This light-bodied white has aromas and flavors suggesting yellow peach, tropical fruit and a hint of banana. It's simple but well made.
Name: Marchesi de' Frescobaldi 2017 Massovino Vermentino (Toscana)

Description: This has aromas evoking toasted nut, pressed flower and lemon peel. The lean simple palate offers grapefruit and a hint of bitter almond alongside a salty note.
Name: Poggio Nicchiaia 2017 Bianco Fiore del Borgo Vermentino (Costa Toscana)

Description: Savory and bright, this delicious red offers aromas of red woodland berry, damp earth, new leather and dark spice. Made with native grape Ciliegiolo, the juicy, structured palate doles out succulent red cherry, raspberry compote, star anise and the merest hint of tangy saline. Firm, refined tannins and fresh acidity lend balance and just enough tension. Drink through 2022.
Name: Fattoria Fibbiano 2016 Ciliegiolo (Toscana)

Description: Made entirely with native grape Ciliegiolo, this full-bodied red offers enticing scents of wild cherry, sun-baked soil, underbrush and a whiff of mint. Mirroring the nose, the firm, structured palate delivers dried cherry, star anise, crushed wild herb and tobacco while close-grained tannins lend support. Drink 2020–2025.
Name: Rascioni e Cecconello 2015 Poggio Ciliegio Ciliegiolo (Toscana)

Description: Vibrant amber in color, this passito offers a bright nose of salted almonds, dried leaves and blood orange rind. It's rounded and sweet on the palate, yet well-honed by pulsing acidity and oolong tea-like astringency. Flavors of dried orange and fig resound on the midpalate and extend through the lingering, nutty finish. A perfect choice alongside a cheese plate.
Name: Botromagno 2008 Gravisano Passito di Malvasia (Murgia)

Description: Aromas of wild berry and tilled soil lead the way on this 100% Ciliegiolo. On the medium-bodied palate, the taut, drying tannins creep up on you, offsetting juicy Morello cherry, crushed raspberry, star anise and a hint of rusty iron. Drink through 2020.
Name: Rascioni e Cecconello 2017 Rotulaia Ciliegiolo (Toscana)

Description: Made from grapes that are dried after harvest, this white bursts in aromas of rose, grapefruit rind and spice. The palate is textural and rounded in feel, with flavors of white plum skin and melon that lead to a lingering spice note on the finish.
Name: Masso Antico 2017 Da Uve Leggermente Appassito Fiano (Salento)

Description: A fresh nose of lemon, grapefruit and apple moves to the pleasantly plump palate. This is juicy and tangy in feel, with a crisp mineral streak down the midpalate that extends to the tactile, astringent finish.
Name: Vespa 2017 Il Bianco dei Vespa Fiano (Salento)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: A longtime white for the Italian-influenced producer, this sings in dried lemon peel and petrol, with a floral aroma of white flower. Fresh and tart with a lightness on the palate in body and ripeness, it finishes in bitter lemon.
Name: Seghesio 2017 Vermentino (Russian River Valley)

Description: Aromas of ripe yellow apple and melon meld with accents of fennel and creamy banana on the nose. There's a fleshy, pleasantly plump feel to the palate, with tangy acidity keeping the tension. A savory note lingers on the finish.
Name: Botromagno 2017 Falanghina (Puglia)

Description: A ripe melon aroma is juxtaposed with sharp herb and flint tones on the nose. There's a nice plumpness to the palate that carries flavors of melon rind and citrus zest, with juicy acidity extending to the blanched almond finish.
Name: Cantina Ariano 2017 Falanghina (Puglia)

Description: Boisterous aromas of confected peach and banana carry to the palate. This is light in feel, with sweet-tart fruit flavors and tangy acidity.
Name: Coppi 2018 Guiscardo Falanghina (Puglia)

Appellation: Vino Bianco d'Italia, Italy Other, Italy
Description: This intriguing amber-colored wine is made entirely with the rare native grape Dorona grown in the Venetian Lagoon. It opens with aromas of dried apricot, honey, fruitcake and smoke that carry over to the mineral-driven palate along with a note of orange rind and saline. An almond note lingers on the finish. Drink through 2022.
Name: Venissa 2012 Dorona (Vino Bianco d'Italia)

Description: Fresh and refined, this elegant sparkler opens with enticing, delicate scents of white stone fruit, spring flower and crushed alpine herb. The dry savory palate delivers Bartlett pear, crunchy apple, lemon zest and ginger set against a foaming mousse. Bright acidity lifts the rich flavors. Delicious!
Name: Nino Franco 2013 Grave di Stecca Brut Glera (Vino Spumante)

Appellation: Vino Bianco d'Italia, Italy Other, Italy
Description: Complex and compelling, this deeply colored white boasts aromas of orange zest, eucalyptus honey, sea breeze and balsamic notes. Made with Dorona, a nearly extinct grape from Venice, the polished focused palate doles out mature yellow peach, maple syrup and almond accompanied by a savory mineral vein. Fresh acidity lifts the dry finish and bestows an age-worthy structure. Drink through 2023.
Name: Venissa 2013 Dorona (Vino Bianco d'Italia)

Description: Aromas of white spring flower and orchard fruit form the nose on this elegant sparkler. Mirroring the aromas, the silky palate doles out ripe pear, juicy golden apple and crushed herb alongside crisp acidity. A foaming mousse lends finesse.
Name: Nino Franco 2016 Brut Nodi  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco)

Description: Fragrant and polished, this elegant sparkler opens with enticing aromas of white spring flower and orchard fruit. On the juicy palate, a silky mousse caresses ripe apple, Bartlett pear and wild herb. It closes on a fennel note.
Designation: Vigneto della Riva di San Floriano
Name: Nino Franco 2017 Vigneto della Riva di San Floriano  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Honeysuckle, green-apple and white-almond aromas follow over to the lightly foaming palate along with pear, crushed herb and a hint of ginger. A soft mousse provides the backdrop.
Name: Nino Franco 2017 Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Appellation: Vermentino di Gallura, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Enticing scents of honeysuckle, apricot and tropical fruit almost leap out of the glass. The juicy rounded palate doles out pineapple, yellow peach and lemon drop while a hint of saline energizes the finish. It's incredibly delicious.
Name: Vigne Surrau 2017 Superiore Sciala  (Vermentino di Gallura)

Appellation: Vermentino di Gallura, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Yellow peach, Mediterranean brush and a whiff sea breeze virtually leap out of the glass. Tangy and savory, the bright, medium-bodied palate doles out juicy apricot, pineapple and a hint of wild fennel. A tangy saline note marks the close.
Name: Vigne Surrau 2017 Branu  (Vermentino di Gallura)

Appellation: Vermentino di Gallura, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Beeswax, orchard fruit and a whiff suggesting kerosene lead the nose. There's a lot happening on the palate, which offers ripe pear, apple, citrus zest, vanilla and a hint of toasted almond. It's well structured and fresh, with an energizing mineral finish.
Name: Siddura 2016 Maia  (Vermentino di Gallura)

Appellation: Vermentino di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Smooth and full-bodied, this delicious white boasts enticing scents of spring wild flower, exotic fruit and Mediterranean scrub. On the tangy, enveloping palate, a saline-like mineral note and fresh acidity brightens juicy pineapple, candied lemon drop, mature apricot, fennel and aromatic herb. Delicious.
Name: Argiolas 2017 Is Argiolas  (Vermentino di Sardegna)

Appellation: Vermentino di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Aromas of apricot, white spring flower, exotic fruit and Mediterranean brush shape the nose on this delicious white. Rounded, full-bodied and enveloping, the smooth, elegant palate offers juicy yellow peach, pineapple and pink grapefruit alongside a tangy saline note that gives it a savory close.
Name: Mesa 2017 Opale  (Vermentino di Sardegna)

Appellation: Nasco di Cagliari, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Pronounced aromas of Spanish broom, exotic fruit, lemon rind and Mediterranean brush take center stage on this savory white. The round full-bodied palate doles out grapefruit, pineapple, apricot, wild herb and ginger. It closes on a note of star anise. This is a big white so rather than pouring as an apéritif, pair it with substantial fish recipes, rice-based dishes or white meat.
Name: Argiolas 2017 Isellis  (Nasco di Cagliari)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Candied honeydew, lime cream, white peach and chalk show on the inviting nose of this organically grown Falanghina, an uncommon grape for California. There's a sizzle of fresh acid on the palate, which is full of balanced flavors of peach and guava.
Name: Castoro Cellars 2017 Whale Rock Vineyard Falanghina (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Vermentino di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Delicately understated but still enticing aromas of ripe apple, beeswax, Mediterranean scrub and a whiff of the seaside mingle together on this medium-bodied white. Reflecting the nose, the smooth fresh palate offers juicy white peach, ripe pear and citrus alongside a hint of saline. A white almond note lingers on the close.
Name: Nuraghe Crabioni 2017 Tresmontes  (Vermentino di Sardegna)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Finding zesty white wines in Paso Robles is a noble quest, and this bottling works well. Broad aromas of pear, grass clippings and pomelo skins lead into a tangy palate of lime peels, lemongrass and kaffir lime leaf. Then it rounds out into green-apple flesh, all framed by a chalky edge.
Name: Robert Hall 2017 Cavern Select Vermentino (Paso Robles)

Description: Paying homage to how the Romans would have fermented their Falanghina in a ceramic vessel, this skin-contact wine is slightly orange and cloudy in the glass, offering aromas of wet stone, orange rind and crushed nuts. Tangy tangerine rind, lemon and apple flavors meet with a touch of rust on the palate.
Name: Wrath 2016 Ex Dolio Falanghina (Monterey)

Appellation: Vermentino di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Aromas of yellow peach and tropical fruit lead the nose. Reflecting the aromas, the tangy, elegant palate offers apricot, citrus and pineapple along with a hint of saline.
Name: Argiolas 2017 Meri  (Vermentino di Sardegna)

Description: From a small batch, natural-leaning producer, this wine is a bright and fruit drop that's easy to like. Stone fruits, red apple skins and florals carry to a palate that slithers smoothly like water over river rock. There're no hard edges and no funk here. Just deliciousness in a glass.
Name: Delinquente 2017 Screaming Betty Vermentino (Riverland)

Appellation: Isola dei Nuraghi, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Aromas of banana, tropical fruit, white spring flower and a whiff of vineyard dust lead the nose. On the full-bodied savory palate, you'll find ripe cantaloupe, juicy pineapple and Mediterranean scrub, while a bitter-almond note wraps up the finish.
Name: Pala 2017 Stellato Nature Vermentino (Isola dei Nuraghi)

Appellation: Vermentino di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Fragrant spring flower, tropical fruit and a whiff of Mediterranean-scrub aromas lead the way. The savory succulent palate offers pineapple, lemon rind and apple alongside an almond note. Tangy acidity lifts the finish while a saline note marks the close.
Name: Ferruccio Deiana 2017 Arvali  (Vermentino di Sardegna)

Appellation: Vermentino di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Aromas of white spring flower, tropical fruit, Mediterranean brush and sea breeze almost jump out of the glass. The juicy palate shows more restraint but reflects the nose, doling out pineapple, grapefruit and a tangy saline note alongside tangy acidity. It closes on a bitter-almond note.
Name: Mora & Memo 2017 Tino  (Vermentino di Sardegna)

Appellation: Vermentino di Gallura, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Tropical-fruit, Mediterranean-scrub, flint and white-almond aromas take center stage on this juicy white. The round structured palate doles out succulent Bartlett pear, pineapple and lemon drop. A tangy saline note lifts the finish.
Name: Siddura 2017 Spera  (Vermentino di Gallura)

Description: This tasty expression of Vermentino is a bargain. The few years of age have slightly honeyed the juicy citrus and fig tones. They're tempered by talc and fresh herbs and lifted by florals. There's a delicious harmony between the slippery texture and prickly acidity on the palate.
Name: Yalumba 2016 The Y Series Vermentino (South Australia)

Description: This wine is fruit-forward in aromas of citrus, green apple, kiwi and lychee. There's chalky minerality in the background, along with a white pepper spice. The palate offers a powdery texture, with racy acidity and crisp, crunchy fruit flavors.
Name: Chalk Hill 2018 Wits End Vermentino (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: Vermentino di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Aromas of white wildflower and yellow stone fruit mingle with a whiff of Mediterranean scrub. The juicy medium-bodied palate offers ripe apricot, yellow peach and citrus alongside a saline note. A hint of bitter almond marks the close.
Name: Pala 2017 I Fiori  (Vermentino di Sardegna)

Description: This unoaked wine is positively charged with crisp apple and grapefruit flavors, has tangy acidity and medium body. Refreshment is in the forefront from the apple-skin aromas to citrus flavors to a mouthwatering finish.
Name: Portalupi 2017 Graziano Vineyard Arneis (Mendocino)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: In the midst of a major transformation to new varieties, a biodynamic vineyard and innovative fermentations, Troon scores with this rich, toasty, barrel-fermented white wine. A ripe mix of fruits brings poached pear and banana to the front, with a lick of vanilla custard as the wine trails off. Delicious already, so drink up.
Name: Troon 2017 Vermentino (Applegate Valley)

Description: As is the case with many Italian varieties, Vermentino triumphs in McLaren Vale's warm, maritime climate. This version is bright, bouncy and delicious. Apple, peach, lemon-lime, white pepper spice and a chalky minerality glide delicately from the nose to the palate. It's light to medium bodied with a talc-like texture and bright acidity. Easy to knock back with or without food.
Name: Chalk Hill 2017 Wits End Vermentino (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: Vermentino di Gallura, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Spring flower, yellow-peach and exotic fruit aromas lead the nose. Bright and savory, the juicy palate doles out apricot, honeydew melon, banana and a hint of saline.
Name: Pedres 2017 Thilibas  (Vermentino di Gallura)

Description: This wine is an austere, almost Riesling-like version of this often fruit-forward variety. There are restrained aromas of waxy lemons and limes alongside stone fruits, blossoms and nettles. The palate is tightly wound in crisp acidity. It's lacking in some fruit generosity and textural weight but a few years in bottle should bring forth intriguing honeyed characters. For now, this needs rich, fatty foods, like a buttery lobster or creamy risotto.
Name: Mitolo 2017 Jester Vermentino (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: Vermentino di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Tropical fruit, banana and yellow stone-fruit aromas lead over to the enveloping full-bodied palate along with ripe apricot and nectarine. Notes of saline and bitter almond lend depth to the finish. This cries out for food and would work better with savory first courses and lighter second courses as opposed to serving as an apéritif.
Name: Pala 2017 Stellato  (Vermentino di Sardegna)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Complementing its Whole Grape Ferment Rieslings, this barrel-fermented (on the skins) wine was aged a half-year in neutral wood. It offers scents of cinnamon spice and lean apple fruit. The racy minerality completes the picture and sets it stylistically apart from the winery's other Vermentino.
Name: Troon 2017 Whole Grape Ferment Vermentino (Applegate Valley)

Description: The 2017 version of this southern Italian variety is still finding its way. Light gold in color, it's wild fermented, unoaked and spends 24 hours on skins. Fruit-led aromas of ripe pineapple, lychee, peach, along with a touch of florals lead into a slippery-textured palate that shows quite a lot of fruit weight and just enough acidity to prop up the richness.
Name: Unico Zelo 2017 Jade & Jasper Fiano (Riverland)

Appellation: Vermentino di Gallura, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: This opens with subtle aromas of exotic fruit, apricot and a whiff of citrus that carry over to the tangy palate along with a candied note. Bitter almond and a hint of saline mark the close.
Name: Vigneti Zanatta 2016 Le Saline  (Vermentino di Gallura)

Description: This is a ripe barrel-fermented Fiano, with a touch of skin contact. Medium gold in hue, it offers aromas of lemon drop, ripe peach, pear and flower stalks. Creamy in texture, the palate has a more wild, floral feel, with a copper penny tang and a herbal, wet hay finish.
Name: Alpha Crucis 2016 Fiano (McLaren Vale)

Appellation: Vermentino di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Aromas of white spring flower, tropical fruit, apple and a whiff of almond carry on to the palate along with citrus zest. Tangy acidity and a hint of saline frame the juicy flavors.
Name: Ledda 2017 Tenuta del Vulcano Pelao Azzesu  (Vermentino di Sardegna)

Appellation: Vermentino di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Spring flower and tropical-fruit aromas follow over to the bright savory palate along with yellow peach and apricot. It closes on a tangy saline note.
Name: Mesa 2017 Giunco  (Vermentino di Sardegna)

Appellation: Isola dei Nuraghi, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Aromas of white spring flower, white orchard fruit and citrus lead the nose. The juicy rounded palate offers peach, apricot and honeydew melon alongside a tangy hint of saline.
Name: Mora & Memo 2017 Tino Sur Lie Vermentino (Isola dei Nuraghi)

Appellation: Nuragus di Cagliari, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Aromas of spring field flower, yellow stone fruit and lemon rind waft out of the glass. The tangy savory palate doles out juicy yellow peach, saline, tangerine rind and a hint of bitter almond.
Name: Pala 2017 I Fiori  (Nuragus di Cagliari)

Appellation: Vermentino di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Aromas of ripe orchard fruit and toasted almond lead the nose along with a whiff of white spring flower. The bright linear palate offers peach, citrus zest, cantaloupe and saline while a nutty note marks the close.
Name: Ledda 2017 Tenuta Matteu Soiànu  (Vermentino di Sardegna)

Description: Kudos to this producer for thinking outside the box. This skin-contact white wine is fermented with native yeast, aged in fudre and bottled with minimal sulphur. It is a divisive style that yields a little volatility with its notes of sour lemon and tropical fruit. There's a nutty, butterscotch-like oxidative note too. The palate is rich but not as much as the nose suggests and a fine line of acidity keeps it lifted.
Name: Koerner 2017 Gullyview Vineyard Rolle Vermentino (Clare Valley)

Appellation: Vermentino di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Subtle aromas evoking Mediterranean brush, exotic fruit and a whiff of thyme lead the way. On the light-bodied palate, bright acidity lifts pineapple, lemon rind and a hint of grapefruit, while a note of bitter almond marks the close.
Name: Sella & Mosca 2017 La Cala  (Vermentino di Sardegna)

Appellation: Vermentino di Gallura, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: This opens with aromas of French oak, toast and a whiff of coconut. Reflecting the nose, the palate offers toast, vanilla, roasted coffee bean and bitter almond while a candied-pineapple note lingers on the close.
Name: Siddura 2015 Bèru  (Vermentino di Gallura)

Appellation: Vermentino di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Ripe orchard fruit and bitter-almond aromas carry over to the simple palate along with cantaloupe and tropical fruit. Tangy acidity lends freshness.
Name: Gabbas 2017 Manzanile  (Vermentino di Sardegna)

Appellation: Vermentino di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Lightly scented, this has delicate aromas suggesting citrus blossom, exotic fruit and a whiff of apricot. The palate is also rather subdued, offering hints of tropical fruit, yellow peach and a bitter almond finish.
Name: Ledda 2017 Tenuta Monte Santu Giaru  (Vermentino di Sardegna)

Appellation: Vermentino di Gallura, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Aromas of field flower and ripe orchard fruit lead the nose along with a hint of toasted nut. On the succulent, easygoing palate, bitter almond adds interest to banana and pineapple.
Name: Mandrolisai 2017 Kent'Annos  (Vermentino di Gallura)

Appellation: Vermentino di Gallura, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: This straightforward rounded white has subdued aromas and flavors of mature pineapple and tropical fruit. It closes on a bitter-almond note.
Name: Sella & Mosca 2017 Superiore Monteoro  (Vermentino di Gallura)

Appellation: Vermentino di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Fun and easy drinking, this rounded white opens with aromas of white spring flower and ripe tropical fruit. The juicy palate delivers pineapple and banana before closing on a white almond note.
Name: Santa Maria La Palma 2017 Aragosta  (Vermentino di Sardegna)

Appellation: Vermentino di Gallura, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: This opens with aromas of banana and tropical fruit. The aromas carry over to the extremely simple palate along with bitter almond.
Name: Vigneti Zanatta 2017  Vermentino di Gallura

Appellation: Vermentino di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: This simple white opens with banana and tropical-fruit aromas that follow through to the juicy palate. A bitter-almond note marks the close.
Name: Vigneti Zanatta 2017 Orion  (Vermentino di Sardegna)

Description: Citrus, pineapple, dried Mediterranean herb and bread dough aromas follow through to the elegant, savory palate along with a hint of ginger. It's gorgeous, fresh and savory, with a bone-dry, mineral finish. Bright acidity and a silky mousse give it finesse and tension.
Name: Dubl NV Esse Dosaggio Zero Metodo Classico Greco (Vino Spumante)

Description: Creamy and delicious, this lovely sparkler offers delicate scents of wildflower, yellow stone fruit, wet stone and a whiff of bread dough. The silky palate delivers golden apple, lemon zest and almond alongside a steely mineral note and crisp acidity. It has a pristine, bone-dry finish.
Name: Casa Cecchin 2011 Dosaggio Zero Riserva  (Lessini Durello)

Description: Enticing scents of Spanish broom, citrus blossom, white stone fruit and Mediterranean herb lift out of the glass. The juicy, savory palate delivers lemon zest, pastry dough, ripe yellow apple and pear alongside fresh acidity. A tangy mineral note gives it a savory, almost salty finish. It's everything an Etna white should be: elegant, fresh and delicious.
Name: Tornatore 2017 Bianco Pietrarizzo  (Etna)

Description: Vibrant and elegant, this has aromas of white stone fruit, acacia and a whiff of bread crust. The silky palate doles out white peach, yellow apple and honey alongside bright acidity. It closes on an almond note.
Name: Corte Moschina 2011 60 Riserva  (Lessini Durello)

Description: Made entirely with Arneis, this fragrant sparkler offers enticing scents of field flower, white stone fruit, crushed herb and a whiff of pastry. The savory, silky palate doles out white peach, yellow apple, tangerine slice and a hint of nutmeg alongside fresh acidity and a creamy mousse. It has complexity but also remarkable freshness for an 11 year old.?
Designation: Faiv Blanc de Blancs Brut Metodo Classico
Name: Marchisio Tenuta Ca' du Russ 2007 Faiv Blanc de Blancs Brut Metodo Classico  (Roero)

Description: Yellow wildflower, chamomile, bread crust and acacia honey aromas follow through to the elegantly sparkling palate together with yellow apple, citrus zest and flinty minerals. A honeyed almond note lingers on the close.
Name: Fattori 2012 Roncà Brut 60 Mesi Metodo Classico  (Lessini Durello)

Description: Made with native grape Durello, this has enticing scents of pressed wildflower, wet stone, bread crust and acacia honey. The honeyed note follows over to the palate along with ripe apple, white peach and hazelnut set against crisp acidity and a polished perlage. A mineral vein energizes the bone-dry finish.
Designation: Roncà Non Dosato 60 Mesi Metodo Classico
Name: Fattori 2012 Roncà Non Dosato 60 Mesi Metodo Classico  (Lessini Durello)

Appellation: El Dorado, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This multi-faceted wine from a new winery that specializes in Italian grape varieties exudes light floral and almond aromas, then brings ripe fruit, a touch of vanilla and great acidity on the palate. It starts out subtly but builds richness with each sip, ending with a long finish.
Name: Via Romano 2017 Fiano (El Dorado)

Description: Delicate scents evoking field flower, orchard fruit, toasted bread, and just a whiff of Mediterranean brush lift out of the glass. Reflecting the nose, the silky palate doles out white peach, yellow apple, juicy citrus and a hint of hazelnut alongside a creamy perlage.
Name: Dubl 2015 + Brut Metodo Classico Greco (Vino Spumante)

Description: Lemon zest and bread crust aromas follow through to the vibrant, creamy palate along with mature yellow apple and a hint of wild herb. A tangy mineral note evoking oyster shell closes the finish while bright acidity and a silky mousse provide the backdrop.
Name: Tonello NV  Lessini Durello

Appellation: Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze, Veneto, Italy
Description: This delicious sparkler opens with heady scents of white spring flower, green apple and vanilla that follow through the creamy palate along with white almond. Fresh acidity brightens the rich flavors while a silky mousse lends elegance and an irresistibly smooth texture.
Name: Le Colture NV Dry  (Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze)

Description: Made in tiny amounts, this vineyard-designate is stainless-steel fermented and aged and shows a spritzy, nervy personality of freshness and focus. Floral gardenia and jasmine give way to bright, developed flavors of Meyer lemon and blood orange.
Name: Sheldon 2017 Las Brisas Vineyard Vermentino (Carneros)

Description: Wildflower, Mediterranean brush and citrus aromas lead the way. The juicy palate delivers lemon zest, pear and crushed stone alongside fresh acidity and an elegant perlage.
Name: Dubl NV Brut Metodo Classico Falanghina (Vino Spumante)

Description: Aromas of yellow spring flower and crushed stone waft out of the glass. It's vibrant, with yellow pear, peach and tangy citrus zest flavors set against crisp acidity. Slow, refined beading provides the soft backdrop.
Name: Casa Cecchin 2013 Extra Brut Nostrum Metodo Classico  (Lessini Durello)

Description: Bottle fermented and bottled on its lees, this has yeasty aromas of bread dough, citrus, nut and chopped herb. Mirroring the nose, the racy palate delivers lime, Golden Delicious apple and almond alongside a tangy mineral note. A softly foaming mousse lends finesse.
Name: Corte Moschina NV Purocaso Metodo Classico Durella (Veneto)

Description: Crisp and lively, this light-bodied wine smells citrusy, tastes tangy and fruity and has a zippy mouthfeel. It's very refreshing and will be great at lunch or to start an evening's festivities.
Name: Enotria 2016 Arneis (Mendocino)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This is a richly textured and well-concentrated wine that brings a lot of substance to each sip. It combines savory herb and mineral flavors with mild fruity notes and a hint of fennel, all carried by a smooth and broad texture.
Name: Via Romano 2016 Vermentino (Sierra Foothills)

Description: White stone fruit, bread crust and almond aromas carry over to the sparkling palate along with white peach and candied citrus. Bright acidity and lively, refined bubbles lift the bitter almond finish.
Name: Zenato 2014 Brut Metodo Classico  (Lugana)

Description: This is a tiny production wine, floral and acid-driven with an underlying note of biscuit. Barrel-fermented and then aged in both neutral French oak and stainless steel, it is well-integrated and lightly ripe, with focused flavors of Meyer lemon, lime and fig.
Name: Satyre Wines 2017 Sinfonia Vermentino (Los Carneros)

Appellation: Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze, Veneto, Italy
Description: Honeysuckle, ripe green apple and banana aromas follow over to the creamy palate along with a note of pastry cream. A silky mousse provides an irresistibly soft texture.
Name: Villa Sandi 2017 Vigna La Rivetta Brut  (Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze)

Appellation: Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze, Veneto, Italy
Description: Delicate scents of banana, honeysuckle and tropical fruit lead the nose on this foaming wine. The off-dry palate offers ripe white peach, pineapple and a dollop of vanilla pastry cream alongside a silky mousse.
Name: Bisol 2017 Dry  (Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze)

Description: This Slovenian aged white wine is amber colored in the glass. It has aromas of lemon zest, sliced green apple and caramelized lemon peel. There are flavors of apple, peach and pear in the mouth and the finish is soft and elegant.
Name: Edi Simcic 2015 Tokata Tocai (Goriska Brda)

Appellation: Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze, Veneto, Italy
Description: Rose, white peach and green apple aromas float over to the bright, creamy palate along with a note of candied lemon zest. A silky mousse lends finesse while fresh acidity lifts the rich flavors.
Name: Andreola 2017 Dry  (Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze)

Appellation: Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze, Veneto, Italy
Description: Heady scents of honeysuckle, wisteria and white stone fruit waft out of the glass. On the foaming palate, fresh acidity brightens ripe Granny Smith apple and white peach, while a confectionery note clings to the finish.
Name: Bortomiol 2017 Dry  (Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze)

Appellation: Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze, Veneto, Italy
Description: This foaming sparkler opens with heady aromas of honeysuckle and green apple that follow on to the palate together with white peach and candied lemon drop. Bright acidity lifts the rich flavors.
Name: Col Vetoraz 2017  Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Fragrant yellow flower and mature orchard fruit aromas lead the nose along with a whiff of ginger. The medium-bodied, savory palate delivers ripe Golden Delicious apple and tangerine while a touch of bitter almond wraps the finish.
Name: Fornacelle 2016  Vernaccia di San Gimignano

Description: This opens with aromas of field flower, yellow stone fruit, citrus and a whiff of medicinal herb. Reflecting the nose, the lively palate offers yellow apple, white peach and a hint of toasted almond alongside bright acidity and a vivacious perlage.
Name: Villa Sparina NV Brut Metodo Classico Cortese (Vino Spumante)

Description: Made entirely with native grape Durello, this svelte sparkler opens with aromas of field flower, Anjou pear and a hint of honeydew melon. On the polished, refreshing palate, bright acidity and a silky mousse lift creamy apple, white peach and tangerine alongside a hint of tangy minerals.
Name: Cà d'Or 2016 Blanc de Blancs  (Lessini Durello)

Description: Herb, chalk and white-pepper notes make this light- to medium-bodied wine unusual and interesting to taste. It shows that Lodi has a hipster side. There is a lean texture, a little nip of mineral flavor and a nice touch of bitterness on the palate.
Name: Peltier 2017 Estate Grown Vermentino (Lodi)

Description: Crushed rock, ripe orchard fruit, citrus and bread crust aromas slowly form the nose. Creamy and vibrant, the linear palate evokes yellow apple, lemon zest and a flinty mineral note set against racy acidity. An elegant perlage softens the firm finish.
Name: Franchetto 2013 Brut Riserva  (Lessini Durello)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Delicate scents suggesting white spring flower, citrus and white stone fruit lead the nose. The bright, enjoyable palate doles out white peach, honeydew melon, lemon zest and a tangy hint reminiscent of oyster shell.
Name: Il Palagione 2017 Hydra  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Description: Made entirely with Grechetto, this opens with scents of citrus blossom, Spanish broom and beeswax. The juicy palate delivers yellow peach, mature Bosc pear and a hint of almond alongside bright acidity. It closes on a saline note.
Name: Roccafiore 2015 Fiorfiore Grechetto (Umbria)

Appellation: Verdicchio di Matelica, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Made with organically farmed grapes, this opens with aromas of yellow peach, chamomile and apricot. The structured palate offers citrus, marzipan and a touch of raw almond on the finish alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Borgo Paglianetto 2015 Rewine  (Verdicchio di Matelica)

Appellation: Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze, Veneto, Italy
Description: Aromas of white rose and orchard fruit lift out of the glass. The aromas carry on to the silky, vibrant palate along with yellow apple, yellow peach and a candied almond note.
Name: Merotto NV Dry  (Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Delicately scented, this offers pressed chamomile, Spanish Broom and tropical fruit aromas. The rich, juicy palate offers pineapple, yellow peach and candied citrus alongside somewhat tangy acidity.
Name: Stefano Antonucci 2015 Riserva  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

Appellation: Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze, Veneto, Italy
Description: Honeysuckle, acacia and white stone fruit aromas delicately shape the nose. On the foaming palate, vibrant acidity brightens ripe yellow apple, Bartlett pear and a candied citrus zest note.
Name: Villa Sandi NV Dry  (Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze)

Description: Lively and fun, this opens with aromas of white spring flower, white stone fruit and a yeasty whiff of bread dough. Made entirely from Garganega, the tangy palate offers ripe yellow apple, citrus zest and white almond alongside lively bubbles.
Name: Ca' Rugate NV Fulbio Beo Metodo Classico Brut Garganega (Vino Spumante)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This opens with subtle aromas of citrus blossom and ripe orchard fruit. The juicy palate delivers lemon zest, ginger and a touch of raw almond alongside rather fresh acidity.
Name: Cecchi 2017  Vernaccia di San Gimignano

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Delicately scented, this has aromas of spring flower, Bartlett pear and a whiff of pastry dough. The crisp, lively palate shows yellow apple, white peach and citrus drop alongside a vivacious perlage. It closes on a note of toasted almond.
Name: Montecappone 2015 Mirizzi Extra Brut Metodo Classico  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi)

Appellation: Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze, Veneto, Italy
Description: Almond blossom and ripe orchard fruit aromas mingle together on this soft sparkler. On the silky palate, fresh acidity lifts ripe yellow pear, apple and citrus.
Name: Carpenè Malvolti NV 1868  (Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of yellow spring flower, cedar and marzipan emerge from the glass. The juicy palate delivers Golden Delicious apple, lemon zest and toasted almond alongside bright acidity. Drink through 2020.
Name: Casalfarneto 2014 Crisio Riserva  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Aromas of yellow spring flower, acacia honey, mature peach and a whiff of hazelnut lead the nose. Reflecting the nose, the linear palate offers dried apricot and a note of honeyed almond.
Name: Panizzi 2016  Vernaccia di San Gimignano

Appellation: Vermentino di Gallura, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: This lively sparkler opens with aromas of spring wildflower and yellow and white stone fruit. The vibrant palate offers yellow apple, white peach and candied lemon drop alongside a vivacious perlage.
Name: Pedres 2017 Sanquista Gold Brut  (Vermentino di Gallura)

Description: Made entirely with Carricante, this brisk white opens with aromas of crushed aromatic herb, Mediterranean scrub, wet stone and a slight whiff of cellar floor. The light-bodied, linear palate offers lemon zest, yellow pear and minerals alongside crisp acidity.
Name: Wiegner 2017 Bianco Contrada Rampante  (Etna)

Description: Aromas of hazelnut, yellow peach and orange flavored liqueur carry over to the racy palate along with bitter yellow apple skin. A refined perlage lends softness and vibrancy.
Name: Corte Moschina 2014 Brut Metodo Classico Durella (Veneto)

Description: Aromas of toast and yeasty bread dough take center stage. The racy, vivacious palate offers yellow apple, roasted coffee bean, chopped dill and lemon zest alongside firm acidity and a lively perlage.
Name: Olivini 2011 Diciannove Marzo Pas Dosé  (Lugana)

Description: Spring field flower, white stone fruit, toast and a whiff of bread crust waft out of the glass. The linear, rather lean palate offers mature yellow apple, bitter almond and orange rind alongside tangy acidity.
Name: Olivini 2012 Brut Metodo Classico  (Lugana)

Appellation: Vino Bianco d'Italia, Italy Other, Italy
Description: Made with 100% Erbaluce, this offers juicy apricot, yellow apple and pear aromas that follow over to the bright palate alongside tangy acidity. A light mineral note brightens the finish.
Name: Villa Guelpa NV Longitudine 8 10 Erbaluce (Vino Bianco d'Italia)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Aromas of yellow stone fruit, citrus and a hint of dried sage lift out of the glass. The ripe palate offers pineapple, yellow peach and a note of toasted almond.
Name: Casa alle Vacche 2017 I Macchioni  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Description: Aromas of white flower open the door to integrated acidity and a grainy texture in this nicely made white from the cool-climate site. Tangerine and lime speak loudest on the palate.
Name: Portalupi 2017 Las Brisas Vineyard Vermentino (Carneros)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with delicate aromas of acacia flower and toasted almond. The aromas carry over to the linear palate along with citrus notes and white peach. Drink soon.
Name: Marchetti 2016 Tenuta del Cavaliere  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Aromas of French oak, vanilla and a whiff of paraffin lead the way. The aromas carry over to the rather lean palate along with butterscotch, vanilla, bitter almond and a note of candied tangerine zest but not much fruit richness. Drink soon.
Name: Palagetto 2014 Riserva  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Description: Aromas of jasmine and white peach emerge from the glass. The easygoing palate offers Golden Delicious apple and pink grapefruit, while a ginger note marks the finish.
Name: Carminucci 2017 Belato  (Offida Pecorino)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of scorched earth, ripe yellow apple and a whiff of toasted nut lead the nose. On the medium-bodied palate, fresh acidity offsets dried yellow peach, a hint of citrus zest and bitter almond. Drink soon to capture the remaining fruit flavors.
Name: Filodivino 2015 Filotto  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Description: This has aromas evoking medicinal herb and adhesive bandage that follow over to the palate along with citrus zest, powdered sage and bitter walnut. Vigorous bubbles and racy acidity provide the lively backdrop.
Name: Gianni Tessari NV Brut Metodo Classico  (Lessini Durello)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Rustic and hearty in style, this medium-bodied wine has earthy aromas, strong acidity and flavors like peach skin and grapefruit rind.
Name: Briceland 2017 Spirit Canyon Vineyard Arneis (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This has delicate aromas of mature apricot and grapefruit that carry over to the forward, simple palate. It closes on a bitter, nutty note. Drink soon.
Name: Quercia Antica 2016  Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi

Description: Made with organic grapes, this has delicate scents of spring blossom. Crisp, light-bodied and simple, the palate suggests dried apricot and a hint of bitter almond.
Name: Barberani 2016 Grechetto (Umbria)

Description: Malmsey is the old English name for Malvasia grapes, which produce a supersweet style of Madeira. Toffee, caramel and dried fruits are shot through with acidity. This is a beautiful wine, aged in wood since the harvest, and ready to drink.
Name: Blandy's 1977 Malmsey Malvasia (Madeira)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: The latest in Mastroberardino's lineup, this gorgeous, mineral-driven white delivers aromas and flavors of ripe apple, oyster shell, a hint of toasted almond, saline and a smoky note that's present in the greatest expressions of Fiano. Elegant and loaded with energy, this will age beautifully and develop even more complexity. To fully enjoy its depth, serve chilled but not too cold.
Name: Mastroberardino 2015 Stilèma  (Fiano di Avellino)

Description: White flower, apple, tropical fruit and wild herb aromas dance around in the glass. Reflecting the nose, the round, juicy palate doles out white peach, honeydew melon, citrus and a savory mineral note alongside soft but still fresh acidity that gives it a juicy finish.
Name: Planeta 2017 Cometa Fiano (Sicilia)

Description: Beeswax, acacia, toasted hazelnut and grilled herb aromas follow over the savory, enveloping palate together with Golden Delicious apple and lime. Fresh acidity and a tangy salinity provide freshness and add depth. Made with organically farmed Carricante.
Name: Vivera 2014 Salisire Contrada Martinella Bianco  (Etna)

Description: This elegant white grown on the slopes of Mount Etna opens with aromas of pressed wildflower, lemon, wet stone and wild herb. The aromas follow over to the bright, linear palate along with Indian fig and a saline note.
Name: Planeta 2017 Bianco  (Etna)

Description: Delicately fragrant, this offers alluring scents of Spanish broom, mature orchard fruit, Mediterranean scrub and flint. On the elegant, medium-bodied palate, fresh acidity supports ripe apple, mature pear, white almond and a saline-driven mineral note.
Name: Pietradolce 2017 Bianco  (Etna)

Description: Spanish broom, yellow stone fruit and crushed herb delicately drive the aromas. Reflecting the nose, the fresh, savory palate delivers juicy yellow pear, lemon zest, wild sage and a graphite note. A saline note perks up the linear finish.
Name: Cusumano 2017 Alta Mora Bianco  (Etna)

Description: Delicate scents of pear, Spanish broom and wild herb form the bouquet of this elegant, almost ethereal white. It's fresh, linear and loaded with finesse, offering juicy citrus, Rennet apple and a hint of pistachio alongside a tangy saline note.
Name: Tenuta di Fessina 2016 Erse Bianco  (Etna)

Description: Opening with delicate but alluring scents of ripe apricot, pressed Spanish broom, candied lemon drop and wild Mediterranean herb, this deeply golden-colored wine is an unusual but intriguing expression of native grape Grillo. Mirroring the nose, the linear palate evokes yellow peach, lemon and saline alongside crisp acidity.
Name: Marilena Barbera 2017 Coste al Vento Grillo (Menfi)

Description: Inviting aromas of fragrant wildflower, white stone fruit, aromatic herb and a whiff of wet stone take center stage. On the linear, savory palate, bright acidity lifts ripe yellow apple, green melon, citrus zest and dried thyme, while a mineral note gives it a savory—almost salty—finish.
Name: Tornatore 2017 Bianco  (Etna)

Description: Made with Carricante, this understated white has delicate scents of Spanish broom, mature pear and a whiff of crushed stone. Bright and linear, the fresh palate delivers lemon, lime, pistachio and mineral before a crisp, clean finish.
Name: Tenuta di Fessina 2015 A' Puddara Bianco  (Etna)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: White spring flower, ripe orchard fruit and white almond aromas take center stage. On the round, fresh palate, a light mineral note adds depth to mature yellow apple, juicy pear and tangy lemon zest.
Name: Mastroberardino 2017 Nova Serra  (Greco di Tufo)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: White spring flower, acacia and tropical fruit aromas lift out of the glass. On the smooth, rounded palate, tangy acidity and a mineral vein energize ripe yellow apple, juicy pear and a drop of honey. A hint of toasted almond signals the close.
Name: Mastroberardino 2017 Radici  (Fiano di Avellino)

Description: Aromas of Spanish broom, Mediterranean brush, citrus zest and a subtle whiff of oak slowly take shape. On the palate, bright acidity frames ripe lemon, golden apple, coffee bean and minerality. This is a serious white made to be paired with savory first courses as opposed to a simple aperitif.
Name: Tenuta delle Terre Nere 2016 Calderara Sottana  (Etna)

Description: Mature yellow apple and bread crust aromas carry over to the lively palate along with bitter walnut and a vanilla note. Fresh acidity and an elegant mousse provide the framework.
Name: Nicosia 2015 Sosta Tre Santi Metodo Classico Carricante (Sicilia)

Description: Delicately alluring aromas of peach blossom, stone fruit and citrus lead the nose. Recalling the aromas, the ripe, rounded palate offers mature yellow apple, candied tangerine zest and pineapple packed in syrup.
Name: Castello di Azeglio 2016  Erbaluce di Caluso

Description: Delicate aromas of acacia, white stone fruit and hazelnut lift out of the glass. On the lean but elegant palate, you'll find dried yellow apple slice, citrus, honeyed nut and a mineral note alongside fresh acidity. Drink soon to capture the remaining fruit.
Name: Benanti 2015 Pietra Marina Bianco  (Etna)

Description: Made with 100% Carricante, this has aromas evoking pineapple, citrus, orchard fruit and a whiff of Mediterranean herb. The bright, linear palate offers apricot, honeydew melon and a hint of saline alongside crisp acidity.
Name: Cottanera 2017 Bianco  (Etna)

Description: Made with dried Malvasia grapes, this opens with aromas of beeswax, candied apricot and marzipan. The sweet, straightforward palate offers chestnut honey and almond.
Name: Colosi 2014 Passito Malvasia (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Aromas of mature orchard fruit, spring blossom and Mediterranean scrub lead the nose. On the tangy palate, a hint of bay leaf accents honeydew melon and citrus. A saline note signals the close.
Name: Tenuta Rapitalà 2016 Classico Vigna Casalj Catarratto (Alcamo)

Description: This opens with aromas evoking Spanish broom and yellow stone fruit. Juicy and enjoyable, the savory, light-bodied palate doles out baked yellow apple, dried apricot and orange rind. A saline-like mineral note enlivens the finish.
Name: Marilena Barbera 2017 Tivitti Inzolia (Menfi)

Description: Here's a fresh, light-bodied white that offers aromas of citrus, apple, wildflower and a hint of Mediterranean herb. The aromas carry over to the tangy palate along with a saline note.
Name: Planeta 2017 La Segreta Grillo (Sicilia)

Appellation: Falanghina del Sannio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of honeysuckle, honeydew melon and tropical fruit lead the nose. On the bright palate, a note of bitter almond accompanies ripe Granny Smith apple and citrus.
Name: Mastroberardino 2017  Falanghina del Sannio

Description: Aromas of butterscotch, toast and vanilla carry over to the palate along with roasted coffee bean, oak and a hint of dried yellow apple. It has bright acidity but lacks the fruit richness needed to stand up to the dominant oak sensations.
Name: Cantina della Serra 2016 Larol  (Erbaluce di Caluso)

Description: Aromas of acacia and mature apricot follow over to the straightforward, rather evolved palate along with a balsamic note and a hint of candied orange slice. It closes on a bitter-almond note. Drink soon to capture the remaining fruit and freshness.
Name: Cantina della Serra 2016 Sessanta  (Erbaluce di Caluso)

Description: Lightly scented, this informal white offers aromas evoking beeswax and a whiff of field flower. The simple palate suggests yellow pear and apple before a fresh finish.
Name: Vite Colte 2017 Merlana  (Erbaluce di Caluso)

Description: Reminiscent of running through an orchard in the peak of autumn, this offers nostalgic aromas of sweet hay with ripe apples and pears. The palate is rounded in feel and concentrated in these same tones, with a revitalizing wet limestone streak from start to finish.
Name: Emidio Pepe 2014  Trebbiano d'Abruzzo

Description: A limited-production wine from a small parcel of old vines, this is ripe and beautifully rich. A touch of oxidation gives an extra dimension of ripeness and brings out a beautiful texture. Drink from 2019.
Name: Domaine Vico 2015 Les Parcellaires A Mina Vermentino (Corse)

Description: A mix of grilled pineapple, citrus oil and sea spray starts off this rich white. Time in oak is apparent yet integrated, offering a delicate brûléed edge to the citrus, pineapple and apricot flavors. Persistent acidity balances it all, leading to a lingering cured lemon finish.
Name: Masciarelli 2015 Marina Cvetic Riserva  (Trebbiano d'Abruzzo)

Appellation: Riviera Ligure di Ponente, Northwestern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of field flower, yellow stone fruit and beeswax float out of the glass. The fresh elegant palate offers ripe apple, pear and citrus while a dollop of vanilla provides backup. It's balanced and interesting, with crisp acidity and a lightly mineral, savory finish.
Name: La Ginestraia 2016 Pigato (Riviera Ligure di Ponente)

Description: This wine has all the warmth of Corsica along with a ripe structure. It is fruity and rounded, full of tropical flavors, bursting with sunshine. The wine is also rich, concentrated and could age. Drink now and until 2022.
Name: Clos Venturi 2017 Vermentino (Corse)

Description: Vermentino (or locally Vermentinu) is the main white grape in Corsica. Its perfumed character and fresh white-fruit character is shot through with a mineral texture and tense acidity. This rich wine is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Vetriccie 2017 Vermentino (Corse)

Description: Made entirely with rare local grape Fumin, this offers delicate but intriguing scents of red-skinned berry, underbrush and hint of smoke. The savory palate offers black cherry, cinnamon and white pepper alongside fresh acidity and polished tannins. Drink through 2021.
Name: Les Crêtes 2016 Fumin (Valle d'Aosta)

Description: A broad nose of yellow apple, golden pear and white flowers mark the nose of this wine made from organic grapes. The medium-bodied palate offers a concentration of crisp orchard fruit, dusted with a chamomile tone and shot through with a bright lemon-lime twang. A salty mineral note lingers on the finish.
Name: Valle Reale 2016  Trebbiano d'Abruzzo

Description: An intensely earthy nose of dried chamomile and hay melds with rustic apple and pear tones on the nose. This is textural and creamy on the palate, with ample astringency, grip and mineral-driven verve that keep the soft orchard-fruit flavor in check. The finish lingers on a salt-cured lemon note.
Name: Emidio Pepe 2015 Pecorino (Colli Aprutini)

Appellation: Colli di Luni, Northwestern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of crushed mint and yellow peach glide over to the tangy palate along with a citrus note. It's fresh, with bright acidity while a hint of saline lends interest.
Name: Lunae 2017 Gray Label Vermentino (Colli di Luni)

Appellation: Riviera Ligure di Ponente, Northwestern Italy, Italy
Description: Delicate aromas of wild flower, toast and ripe yellow stone fruit eventually take shape on this. The full-bodied somewhat subdued palate offers mature apricot and tangerine zest before finishing on a bitter almond note.
Name: La Ginestraia 2016 Le Marige Pigato (Riviera Ligure di Ponente)

Appellation: Terre di Chieti, Central Italy, Italy
Description: An intensely focused nose of crushed stone, white blossoms, citrus and pear gives a vibrant, fresh start to this wine. While the palate is broad in rounded pear and apple flavors, there's a tangy undercurrent of lime zest and wet stone keeping focus.
Name: Ferzo 2017 Pecorino (Terre di Chieti)

Appellation: Terre di Chieti, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Ripe peach, citrus cream and salt carry this textured pour. There's weight and presence to the palate, yet underlying acidity highlights plenty of pear and apple blossom tones.
Name: Tenuta I Fauri 2016 Pecorino (Terre di Chieti)

Description: Bright aromas of lemon peel, fleshy yellow apple and powdered minerals carry to the well-balanced palate. This is lively and mouthwatering in feel, broadened out by plenty of crisp orchard-fruit tones.
Name: Cataldi Madonna 2017  Trebbiano d'Abruzzo

Description: Located close to the sea, this vineyard has a cool character that brings out the minerality in the Vermentino as well as its white fruits and tangy acidity. This is a bright wine, still young with its ebullient fruit right up front. Wait a few months for it to soften and drink from late 2018.
Name: Domaine Petroni 2017 Vermentino (Corse)

Appellation: Terre di Chieti, Central Italy, Italy
Description: A fresh, vibrant nose of yellow apple, pineapple rind and crushed stone translates to the light- to medium-bodied palate. Bright acidity carries these flavors to a crisp, clean finish.
Name: Cantina Valle Tritana 2017 Passerina (Terre di Chieti)

Description: A smooth, warm style of wine, this offers ripe apple and white-fruit flavors. It is floral, perfumed as so often with Vermentino with open fruitiness and a fresh, aromatic aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Santa Giulietta 2017 Vermentino (Corse)

Description: Fruity and perfumed, this is a typical warm and rich Vermentino. Ripe apricot and green-plum flavors go with the crisp texture and touch of minerality. This tangy wine is ready to drink now.
Name: Domaine Vico 2017 Vermentino (Corse)

Description: Ripe aromas of pineapple rind, yellow apple and citrus offer a bright start to this wine. The palate is fresh in character, offering apple pith, peach and orange rind flavors that are focused by a tangy line of acidity.
Name: Illuminati 2017 Pecorino (Controguerra)

Appellation: Colli di Luni, Northwestern Italy, Italy
Description: Intense aromas of mature yellow peach and ripe apricot jump over to the bright linear palate along with a hint of orange peel. Tangy acidity lifts the rich flavors.
Name: Lunae 2017 Black Label Vermentino (Colli di Luni)

Description: Aromas of citrus oil, furniture polish and tarragon start off this single-vineyard Trebbiano. The palate is silken and rounded, with a condensed lemon flavor and a salty, saline finish.
Name: Valle Reale 2013 Vigna Del Convento Di Capestrano  (Trebbiano d'Abruzzo)

Description: An ultraripe expression of peach, citrus cream and butterscotch carries to the richly layered palate. A lush orchard fruit flavor melds with tangy cream and salt, bolstered by zesty acidity and a lingering blossom note.
Name: Cantinarte 2016 Colori Pecorino (Abruzzo)

Description: Ripe, heady aromas of white blossoms, yellow apple and peach carry to the rich, textural palate. Persistent acidity and some astringency help maintain balance as apple skin and sea spray flavors carry it along.
Name: Pasetti 2016 Pecorino (Abruzzo)

Description: Crisp citrus, pear and wet slate aromas carry to the light- to medium-bodied palate. There's a pleasing roundness to the feel, with balanced acidity and a delicate astringent grip on the finish.
Name: Il Feuduccio Di S. Maria D'Orni 2017 Pecorino (Colline Teatine)
Winery: Il Feuduccio Di S. Maria D'Orni

Description: Crisp and lightly textured, this bright wine is clean, packed with citrus and apple fruits, and ready to drink. Its freshness makes it an attractive, easy wine.
Name: Clos Venturi 2017 1769 Vermentino (Corse)

Description: Ultraripe aromas of tropical fruit, Satsuma orange and perfume waft from the glass. This is plush and ripe in feel, boasting a wealth of yellow apple, pear and sweet orange flavors, with a mild vein of acidity offering balance.
Name: Illuminati 2017 Costalupo  (Trebbiano d'Abruzzo)

Appellation: Terre di Chieti, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Faint aromas of banana peel, pear drop and melon carry to the rounded silken palate. This is broad in feel, with a subdued vein of acidity.
Name: Poggio Anima 2016 Gabriel Pecorino (Terre di Chieti)

Description: A heady mix of tropical fruit blends with peach and crushed stone on the nose. This is rounded and textural in feel, boasting fleshy flavors of stone fruit and apple, ending on a delicate peach-skin finish.
Name: La Valentina 2017 Pecorino (Colline Pescaresi)

Appellation: Terre di Chieti, Central Italy, Italy
Description: White blossoms, sea spray and ripe yellow-apple aromas carry to the zesty, bright palate. While light in body, there's a pleasing textural roundness, bolstered by light astringency and crisp acidity.
Name: Umani Ronchi 2017 Vellodoro Pecorino (Terre di Chieti)

Appellation: Terre di Chieti, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Historically, this grape was blended with Trebbiano, however, in recent years, more and more producers have been producing single-variety bottlings. This offers a mild nose and palate of crisp lemon, with hints of fresh pine and wild mint, all housed on a light- to medium-bodied palate.
Name: Ferzo 2017 Cococciola (Terre di Chieti)

Appellation: Terre di Chieti, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Mild aromas of yellow apple, citrus and powdered minerals carry the nose. This is rounded in feel, with a mild vein of acidity and soft melon and yellow-apple flavors that end short on the finish.
Name: Ferzo 2017 Passerina (Terre di Chieti)

Description: Ripe pear, citrus and yellow apple aromas have a fresh, vibrant sea-spray undercurrent on the nose. The palate is rounded and juicy in feel, with enough acidity to maintain balance.
Name: Masciarelli 2017  Trebbiano d'Abruzzo

Description: A mix of citrus-blossom and pear-juice aromas carry the mildly intense nose. The palate is riper in feel, starting off with a tropical banana-peel flavor that transitions to tart apple and pear. This finish is short yet clean.
Name: Jasci & Marchesani 2017 Eco Biologico Superiore Pecorino (Abruzzo)

Description: Quiet aromas of citrus and yellow apple carry to the light-bodied palate. Enjoy this wine for its easygoing, fruit-forward nature and mild acidic verve.
Name: La Valentina 2017 Spelt  (Trebbiano d'Abruzzo)

Description: A quiet nose of citrus and tonic leads to the light-bodied, streamlined palate. Wet stone and blossoms linger on the finish.
Name: Contesa 2017 Pecorino (Abruzzo)

Description: Aromas of dusty apple, mature peach and pollen carry to the oily, rounded palate. A mild backbone of acidity offers some balance yet ultimately flattens out on the finish.
Name: Cataldi Madonna 2017 Giulia Pecorino

Description: Crisp citrus and green pear aromas translate to the light-bodied palate. This is bright and simple, perfect for easy enjoyment.
Name: Citra 2017 Estate Grown  (Trebbiano d'Abruzzo)

Appellation: Terre di Chieti, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Peach juice, pollen and a slightly grassy tone carry the mildly intense nose. Medium in weight, with zesty acidity, this offers tart gooseberry and peach flavors that end on a short, slightly sweet note.
Name: Farnese 2016 Casale Vecchio Pecorino (Terre di Chieti)

Appellation: Terre di Chieti, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Clean citrus and sea-spray aromas carry to the light-bodied palate. This is zesty and bright, yet simplistic and short.
Name: Niro 2016 Pecorino (Terre di Chieti)

Description: A quiet nose of pear and yellow apple translates to the light-bodied palate. This is straightforward and simplistic in its appeal.
Name: Nicodemi 2017 Le Murate  (Trebbiano d'Abruzzo)

Description: Intense and rich, this wine is finely perfumed, packed with spice, acidity and orange-zest flavors. It has an old gold character from the long wood aging. It is sweet, but the acidity keeps that sweetness from being cloying, instead giving it a great lift at the end. Drink this wine now.
Name: H.M. Borges NV 20 Years Malvasia (Madeira)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Wet cement, lime, apple and green-pear aromas emerge slowly from the very light nose of this fresh bottling by Michael Larner. The palate is focused on an extremely grippy texture and zesty acidity, showing delicate flavors of underripe pear, apple and wet stone.
Name: Earthfluence 2017 Vermentino (Santa Barbara County)

Description: Ripe pear and green-melon aromas meld with mild tones of white blossom and wet stone on the nose. The palate offers ample weight, with juicy citrus, pear and smoky oolong tones lingering on the pleasantly astringent finish.
Name: Statti 2016 Greco (Calabria)

Description: With a few swirls of the glass, this eventually reveals subtle aromas of dried Mediterranean herb, citrus, wild flower and a whiff of eucalyptus. On the linear palate, a light mineral note adds interest to grapefruit and ripe orchard fruit.
Name: Contrade di Taurasi–Lonardo 2015 Greco Musc' Roviello (Campania)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This bottling is expressive in aromas of lime blossom, lemon verbena, wet cement and grapefruit peel. The acid-driven palate offers grip and texture, delivering flavors of citrus peel, underripe stonefruit and tangy apple.
Name: Larner 2017 Malvasia Bianca (Ballard Canyon)

Appellation: Terre del Volturno, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Spring flower, wild herb and citrus aromas shape the nose. The crisp palate shows lemon, tart Granny Smith apple and a tangy mineral note that leaves an almost salty finish.
Name: Drengot 2017 Scalillo Asprinio (Terre del Volturno)

Description: A wealth of white peach, red apple peel and white flower aromas carry the nose. Immensely crisp and refreshing on the palate, this carries tart stone-fruit and lime flavors on the front that build to lingering impressions of blossom and wet stone.
Name: Taverna 2017 San Basile Greco (Matera)

Appellation: Falanghina del Sannio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with yellow stone-fruit and spring-flower aromas. The savory palate offers ripe grapefruit, Bartlett pear and a toasted hazelnut note alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Montesole 2016  Falanghina del Sannio

Description: Aromas of fresh lemon balm, cut grass and limestone translate to the palate. These flavors are met with tones of salt and creamy lees. Bright acidity leads the way to a long and savory finish.
Name: Barboursville Vineyards 2016 Reserve Vermentino (Virginia)

Description: Heady aromas of rose, tangerine and potpourri carry to the medium-bodied palate. As bold and brash as this is, it's well-balanced and enjoyable, finishing blossomy but not overdone.
Name: Varvaglione 2017 12 e Mezzo Malvasia Bianca (Salento)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with white-flower and ripe orchard-fruit aromas while the juicy palate delivers mature Golden Delicious apple and lemon jam. It's easy drinking and savory.
Name: Montesole 2016  Greco di Tufo

Appellation: Val di Neto, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Citrus, peach and green herbs carry the nose of this Mantonico. Medium in weight, the palate is textured and balanced, with astringent apple-skin, tart peach and citrus-rind flavors.
Name: Librandi 2016 Efeso Mantonico (Val di Neto)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Delicate aromas of apple and hazelnut carry over to the light-bodied palate along with suggestions of pear and citrus. It closes on a bitter-almond note.
Name: Montesole 2016  Fiano di Avellino

Appellation: Castel del Monte, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Ripe tropical fruit aromas meld with a grassy, floral undertone on the nose. This is fruity yet balanced on the palate, with flavors of red apple, green pear and tart pineapple leading to a crisp, clean finish.
Name: Rivera 2017 Marese Bombino Bianco (Castel del Monte)

Description: Immensely fresh on the nose and palate, loads of crisp apples and pears take center stage. What this lacks in complexity, it makes up for in its balance, intensity and immediate drinkability.
Name: Tenuta Iuzzolini 2017 Bianco  (Cirò)

Description: Ripe and sweet-smelling on the nose, loads of banana and candied citrus jump from the glass. The medium-bodied palate carries the same tropical intensity, with a mildly astringent, hot finish.
Name: Cantine Menhir 2017 Pass-o Fiano Bianco (Salento)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Citrus rinds, pear flesh and a hint of nectarine show on the nose of this bottling. Warm yellow-apple flavors meet with poached pear and blanched almond on the palate.
Name: Sevtap 2016 Vermentino (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: This late harvest Greco Bianco leans ultraripe on the nose in tones of bruised peach, pear and soft baking spices. The palate is low in intensity, with mild acidity carrying to the short oak-spice finish.
Name: Tenuta Iuzzolini 2016 Donna Giovana Greco Bianco (Calabria)

Description: Very faint aromas of lemon and wet stone lead to similarly indistinct flavors on the palate. This is well balanced yet demure, with a finish that is clean but drops off quickly.
Name: Barboursville Vineyards 2017 Reserve Fiano (Virginia)

Description: Aromas of chalk, pineapple and orange blossom are faint on the nose. The palate turns more salty in flavor, with a light body and mild acidity.
Name: The Williamsburg Winery 2017 Limited Release Arneis (Virginia)

Description: This Mantonico has seen time in acacia barrels, giving it a soft rounded feel. Nearly overripe peach and fig tones meld with butter and vanilla on the nose and palate. This is low in intensity and flabby in feel.
Name: Statti 2014 Mantonico (Calabria)

Description: Made entirely with Friulano, this elegant, structured white opens with aromas suggesting toasted nut, acacia and mature orchard fruit. The polished, vibrant palate delivers ripe Golden Delicious apple, dried apricot, crushed herb and citrus zest set against a vein of energizing minerality. An almond note lingers on the finish. Drink through 2025.
Name: Borgo del Tiglio 2016 Ronco della Chiesa Friulano (Collio)

Description: Fragrant spring blossom, white stone-fruit and citrus aromas mingle together on this elegant white. On the fresh savory palate, a white-almond note accompanies creamy yellow apple, nectarine and lemon zest.
Name: Monte del Frà 2017  Lugana

Description: Elegantly structured, this offers delicate scents of spring wild flower, white stone-fruit and grilled herb. The savory linear palate is all about finesse, offering white peach, yellow pear and lemon drop while a saline-like mineral note signals the finish.
Name: Ottella 2015 Molceo Riserva  (Lugana)

Description: Aromas of acacia, toasted almond, yellow stone fruit and wild herb lead the way on this elegant medium-bodied white. Bright and juicy, the savory palate doles out yellow apple, creamy peach, juicy citrus and a hint of cake spice. A saline note and a hint of nut linger on the close.
Name: Selva Capuzza 2017 Selva  (Lugana)

Description: Alluring aromas of bread crust, dried stone fruit and aromatic herb set the tone on this elegant sparkler. On the fresh palate, a refined perlage underscores creamy apple, citrus zest, hazelnut and pear while a tangy, mineral-tinged note enlivens the finish.
Name: Fattori 2013 Roncà Brut  (Lessini Durello)
