Description: Elegant and savory, this lovely white opens with heady aromas of fragrant spring flower, Alpine herb, fennel and citrus. The delicious medium-bodied palate delivers ripe Rennet apple, creamy white peach and baking spice alongside bright acidity. It closes on a lemon-drop note.
Name: Le Morette 2017 Madolara  (Lugana)

Description: Pressed wild flower, yellow stone fruit, citrus zest and baking-spice aromas flow out of the glass. On the fresh medium-bodied palate, tangy acidity underscores creamy yellow apple, yellow peach, pastry cream and tangerine. Saline and toasted almond notes grace the lingering finish.
Name: Prà 2014 Colle Sant'Antonio  (Soave Classico)

Description: Aromas of ripe orchard fruit, citrus, grilled herb and nuts delicately guide the nose. Round and delicious, the medium-bodied palate delivers baked yellow apple, creamy white peach, ginger and white almond alongside tangy acidity. A juicy note of candied lemon drop lingers on the close.
Name: Tenuta Roveglia 2015 Vigne di Catullo Riserva  (Lugana)

Description: Aromas of toasted nut, pressed spring flower and orchard fruit waft out of the glass. Made with organically farmed grapes, the medium-bodied elegant palate delivers yellow apple, pear and white almond alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Marangona 2016 Trecampane  (Lugana)

Appellation: Vigneti delle Dolomiti, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of citrus zest, yellow stone fruit, vanilla, toasted nut and a whiff of oak follow through to the elegantly structured palate along with dried apricot and a hint of coffee. Fresh acidity lends balance while a tangy mineral note of crushed oyster shell lingers on the savory close. Drink through 2025.
Name: Alois Lageder 2016 Fòrra Manzoni (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

Description: Inviting aromas of bread crust, orchard fruit, dried herb and crushed stone mingle together. The enveloping palate delivers golden apple, yellow pear and lemon drop. Fresh acidity lifts the rich flavors while a flinty note backs up the finish. Hold for more complexity. Drink through 2021.
Name: Muzic 2016 Malvasia (Collio)

Description: Acacia, mature citrus rind, honeydew melon and white stone-fruit aromas lead the way. The succulent savory palate doles out creamy white peach, yellow apple and juicy tangerine accompanied by fresh acidity. A white almond note lingers on the finish.
Name: Cà Lojera 2015 Lupo Riserva  (Lugana)

Description: Wild flower, honeyed nut and mature yellow-stone fruit aromas continue on to the structured palate along with orange zest. It closes on a pleasant note of bitter almond that lingers on the finish.
Name: Gradis'ciutta 2016 Friulano (Collio)

Description: Tangy and delicious, this bright wine offers aromas suggesting white spring flower and ripe orchard fruit. The savory, linear palate doles out crisp green apple, honeydew melon and juicy grapefruit alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Ottella 2017  Lugana

Description: Enticing aromas of yellow spring flower, vanilla and orchard fruit lead the way on this elegantly structured white. On the fresh savory palate, a touch of white pepper accents juicy yellow peach, Bartlett pear and tangerine. It finishes on a salty note. Drink through 2021.
Name: Attems 2016 Trebes Ribolla Gialla (Collio)

Description: Citrus, pressed rose, oak, oak-driven spice, toasted nut and vanilla aromas set the tone on this structured, elegant white. On the full-bodied enveloping palate, a tangy saline note underscores dried apricot, candied lemon zest and butterscotch.
Name: Borgo del Tiglio 2016 Italo e Bruno Malvasia (Collio)

Description: Apple and hazelnut aromas lift out of the glass and carry over to the medium-bodied palate along with grapefruit and white-pepper notes. It's elegant and balanced, with fresh acidity. A tangy mineral note enlivens the finish.
Name: Castello di Spessa 2016 Friulano (Collio)

Description: Mouthwatering aromas of grilled herb, acacia, ripe yellow stone fruit and hazelnut waft out of the glass. On the round enveloping palate, a honeyed mineral note underscores yellow apple, apricot and almond. A note of unsweetened lemon drop lingers on the close.
Name: Muzic 2016 Friulano (Collio)

Description: Acacia, beeswax, crushed herb and yellow stone-fruit aromas align with a whiff of oak. The elegantly structured savory palate has apricot, tangerine zest, ginger and toasted nut. A hint of coffee lingers on the close.
Name: Zenato 2015 Sergio Zenato Riserva  (Lugana)

Description: This opens with subtle scents evoking yellow wild flower and ripe orchard fruit. On the medium-bodied, elegant palate, hazelnut and tangerine zest add depth to a core of ripe yellow apple and Bartlett pear. It closes on a graphite note.
Name: Ronco Blanchis 2016 Friulano (Collio)

Description: Inviting aromas of peach, green apple and tropical fruit jump over to the round, juicy palate. Tangy acidity lifts the fruity flavors and gives it a refreshing, savory finish.
Name: Tenuta Roveglia 2017 Limne  (Lugana)

Description: Granny Smith apple, exotic fruit and nectarine aromas lead the nose on this juicy white. The aromas follow over to the succulent savory palate along with tangy acidity.
Name: Tenuta Roveglia 2017 Wighel  (Lugana)

Description: Heady scents of beeswax, wild herb, Spanish broom and yellow stone fruit float from the glass. Bright and balanced, the linear palate doles out apricot, yellow apple and lemon zest alongside crisp acidity.
Name: Castello di Spessa 2016 Ribolla Gialla (Collio)

Description: Aromas of pressed Spanish broom, citrus zest and Mediterranean brush lead the nose. On the elegant, structured palate, a mineral note energizes white peach, baked apple, toasted almond and lemon. Drink through 2022.
Name: Le Morette 2015 Riserva  (Lugana)

Description: Made with dried Verduzzo grapes, this opens with aromas of acacia honey, ripe Golden Delicious apple and apricot jam that carry over to the juicy palate along with a note of marron glacé. It has a long persistent finish.
Name: Russiz Superiore 2010 Verduzzo (Venezia Giulia)

Description: Delicate, enticing scents of white spring blossom, crushed herb and ripe orchard fruit take shape on this elegant white. On the savory linear palate, fresh acidity accompanies apple, white peach and tangy citrus while a hint of white almond wraps up the finish.
Name: Selva Capuzza 2017 San Vigilio  (Lugana)

Description: Jasmine, hawthorn and white stone-fruit aromas lift from the glass. On the bright palate, refreshing acidity balances creamy Granny Smith apple and tangerine zest, while small continuous bubbles lend finesse. A beeswax note signals the close.
Name: Cantina della Serra 2012 Brut Metodo Classico  (Erbaluce di Caluso)

Description: Made with organically farmed Turbiana grapes, this delicious white opens with heady aromas of fragrant spring flower, ripe orchard fruit and a whiff of flint. Bright and linear, the palate delivers crisp Rennet apple, white peach and grapefruit alongside refreshing acidity. A white almond note lingers on the close.
Name: Marangona 2017  Lugana

Description: Spring wild flower and yellow stone-fruit aromas take center stage on this bright linear white. The savory palate offers mature yellow peach, citrus peel and ripe apple set against fresh acidity. It closes crisp and clean.
Name: Gradis'ciutta 2016 Ribolla Gialla (Collio)

Description: Aromas of ginger, candied orange zest and chamomile flower emerge from the glass. On the enveloping palate, notes of eucalyptus honey, fig and sweet almond accent a core of ripe apricot.
Name: Attems 2012 Picolit (Collio)

Description: Intriguing aromas of crushed herb, fragrant wild flower and ripe white stone fruit take center stage on this tangy white. On the linear palate, chopped mint, white pepper and a flinty mineral vein underscore yellow apple and lemon zest.
Name: Marangona 2016 Cemento  (Lugana)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rather than the typical orange-blossom aromas, this bottling is more Sauvignon Blanc-like, with cut grass, lime peels, rainy cement and botanical elements on the nose. The palate is very acidic and stony in texture, with candied kiwi and passion fruit flavors.
Name: Refugio Ranch 2017 Malvasia Bianca (Santa Ynez Valley)

Appellation: San Martino della Battaglia, Veneto, Italy
Description: This offers delicate scents of white spring blossom, yellow stone fruit, hazelnut and citrus. The aromas follow over to the fresh elegant palate along with flinty mineral, tangerine slice and ripe yellow apple.
Name: Selva Capuzza 2016 Campo del Soglio Friulano (San Martino della Battaglia)

Description: Aromas of yellow apple, Bartlett pear and a hint of baking spice carry over to the creamy palate along with lemon drop, crushed herb and a hint of vanilla. Bright acidity lifts the rich flavors.
Name: Castello di Azeglio 2013 Metodo Classico  (Erbaluce di Caluso)

Description: Hazelnut, honey, Spanish broom and yellow apple aromas carry on to the elegant, structured palate along with a hint of pear and lemon zest. Fresh acidity brightens the rich flavors while bitter almond and a hint of saline linger on the close.
Name: Fruscalzo 2016 Friulano (Collio)

Description: Mature apricot, toasted hazelnut, crushed stone and acacia aromas delicately lift out of the glass. The full-bodied enveloping palate delivers ripe yellow apple, pear and lemon zest while a notes of bitter almond and beeswax underscore the finish. Thanks to the fruit richness, you can barely detect the elevated alcohol content. Drink through 2021.
Name: Gradis'ciutta 2016 Malvasia (Collio)

Description: Lightly scented, this offers delicate, alluring aromas of white spring blossom and ripe orchard fruit. On the creamy palate, fresh acidity brightens white peach, yellow apple and lemon zest. A hint of toasted almond lingers on the finish.
Name: Olivini 2016 Demesse Vecchie  (Lugana)

Description: Ripe orchard fruit, spring wild flower and a whiff of grilled herb come together in the glass. It's bright and savory, offering ripe Bartlett pear, white-peach, juicy citrus and white-almond flavors alongside fresh acidity. A mineral note lingers on the close.
Name: Corte Sermana 2016 Cromalgo  (Lugana)

Description: Aromas of tomato leaf, citrus and exotic fruit leap out of the glass. On the savory palate, fresh acidity lifts grapefruit, ripe apple and crushed herb. It closes on a tangy saline note.
Name: Alessandro di Camporeale 2017 Vigna di Mandranova Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of sunbaked earth, grilled herb, toasted nut and pressed wild flower lead the nose on this big white. The brawny full-bodied palate offers dried apricot, baked apple and citrus zest alongside a hint of bitter almond. There is also a warmth of alcohol on the close.
Name: Schiopetto 2016 Malvasia (Collio)

Description: Delicate scents of spring blossom and white stone fruit lift from the glass. Reflecting the nose, the crisp linear palate offers Rennet apple and citrus alongside refreshing acidity before the clean close.
Name: Zuani 2016 Sodevo Ribolla Gialla (Collio)

Description: Made with organically farmed grapes, this has aromas of spring flower, citrus, crushed herb and a whiff of tropical fruit. On the bright palate, fresh acidity underscores green melon, tangerine and pineapple alongside a hint of saline.
Name: Feudo Montoni 2017 Timpa Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Enticing aromas of yellow spring flower, acacia honey and a whiff of citrus lead the nose. The honeyed note follow through to the palate, along with mature yellow apple and a hint of bitter almond.
Name: La Ponca 2016 Friulano (Collio)

Description: This offers heady aromas of Spanish broom, lemon drop and yellow stone fruit. Mirroring the nose, the linear palate offers yellow pear and citrus alongside bright acidity.
Name: La Rajade 2016 Ribolla Gialla (Collio)

Description: Aromas of fragrant spring flower and orchard fruit lead the nose. It's tangy and bright, offering yellow pear and a hint of lemon zest alongside a touch of bitter almond.
Name: Perla del Garda 2017 Organic  (Lugana)

Description: Enticing scents of fragrant spring wild flower and white stone fruit glide out of the glass. Reflecting the nose, the round fresh palate offers ripe white peach, yellow pear and citrus rind alongside tangy acidity. A white-almond note lingers on the close.
Name: Perla del Garda 2017 Perla  (Lugana)

Description: Aromas of toasted nut and mature yellow apple follow over to the bright medium-bodied palate along with candied tangerine drop. Tangy acidity lifts the rich flavors.
Name: Pilandro 2016 Terecrea  (Lugana)

Description: Deep yellow-gold in color, this has aromas suggesting yellow stone fruit, graphite and toasted bread. The mature but still fresh palate offers dried apricot, bitter almond and candied nectarine slice. Drink through 2019.
Name: Tenuta Sant'Antonio 2014 Vecchie Vigne  (Soave)

Description: Aromas of sea breeze, grilled herb and yellow citrus fruit almost leap out of the glass. The aromas carry over to the savory linear palate along with ripe golden apple. It's crisp and refreshing, with a saline finish.
Name: Baglio del Cristo di Campobello 2016 Lalùci Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Honeysuckle and citrus aromas take center stage while the juicy rounded palate doles out honeydew melon, white peach and candied lemon drop. Tangy acidity brightens the rich flavors.
Name: Ancilla 2017 Ella  (Lugana)

Description: Grilled herb, toasted nut, oak and ripe orchard-fruit aromas lead the nose. Reflecting the nose, the medium-bodied structured palate evokes baked yellow apple, ripe citrus peel and bitter almond.
Name: Cà dei Frati 2015 Brolettino  (Lugana)

Description: Made entirely with Verdicchio grapes, this Metodo Classico sparkler has aromas of cream-filled pastry, vanilla, apple and citrus zest that follow over to the palate. Bright acidity and a continuous perlage provide the backdrop.
Name: Colognola 2015 Musa Metodo Classico Verdeca (Vino Spumante)

Description: Made in the Martinotti or Charmat method, this delightful sparkler boasts inviting aromas of bread crust, yellow stone fruit and a whiff of herb. On the palate, bright acidity lifts ripe peach, yellow apple, saline and a hint of almond. A tangerine note seals the finish.
Name: Corte Moschina 2016  Lessini Durello

Description: Aromas of white cherry, exotic fruit, toast and oak-driven spice lead the nose. On the medium-bodied palate, notes of butterscotch and lemon drop back up yellow pear and tangerine zest.
Name: Le Morette 2016 Benedictus  (Lugana)

Description: White spring flower, grilled herb, toasted nut and exotic fruit aromas fill the glass. The tangy palate evokes yellow apple, dried apricot and candied-lemon slice alongside bright acidity.
Name: Cà dei Frati 2016 I Frati  (Lugana)

Description: This opens with aromas suggesting honeysuckle, citrus and a whiff of tropical fruit. Round and zesty, the fresh palate evokes honeydew melon, white peach and a hint of orange rind.
Name: Feliciana 2017 Felugan  (Lugana)

Description: Aromas of grilled herb, grapefruit and crushed stone come together on this linear white, while the palate evokes pineapple and mature apple. A hint of saline backs up the finish.
Name: Pratello 2017 Catulliano  (Lugana)

Description: Bright and refreshing, this opens with delicate scents of field flower, yellow stone fruit and a whiff of crushed mint. The tangy palate delivers tangerine, lemon and yellow peach alongside a hint of white almond.
Name: Zenato 2017 San Benedetto  (Lugana)

Description: This opens with aromas suggesting honeysuckle, citrus and a whiff of tropical fruit. Round and zesty, the fresh palate evokes honeydew melon, white peach and a hint of orange rind.
Name: Feliciana 2017 Felugan  (Lugana)

Description: Initially shy, the nose eventually reveals whiffs of spring blossom, orchard fruit and hazelnut. On the linear palate, fresh acidity accompanies ripe pear, citrus and bitter almond.
Name: Cà Maiol 2017 Molin  (Lugana)

Description: Yellow wild flower, crushed aromatic herb and yellow stone-fruit aromas mingle together. The bright, linear palate offers mature yellow apple, lemon rind and bitter almond set against fresh acidity.
Name: Eugenio Collavini 2016 Friulano (Collio)

Description: This opens with scents of white spring flower and yellow stone fruit, while the light-bodied palate offers white peach and lemon zest. It's balanced, with fresh acidity.
Name: Attems 2017 Ribolla Gialla (Venezia Giulia)

Description: This has rather subdued aromas of bread crust, toasted oak, medicinal herb and dried citrus slice. On the palate, tangy acidity lifts dried apricot, thyme and candied orange peel.
Name: Bulgarini 2015 Cà Vaibò  (Lugana)

Description: Honeysuckle, tropical fruit and citrusy aromas fill the glass. Reflecting the nose, the fresh savory palate doles out juicy grapefruit, pineapple and a note of white almond.
Name: Monte Zovo 2017 Le Civaie  (Lugana)

Description: Round and enveloping, this opens with aromas of mature orchard fruit and pressed wild flower. The fruity palate doles out juicy white peach and candied lemon drop alongside a hint of almond liqueur.
Name: Albino Armani 2017  Lugana

Description: French oak, coconut and citrus-rind aromas follow over to the taut linear palate along with butterscotch, candied lemon drop and a hint of dried apricot. Bright acidity provides support.
Name: Livon 2016 Soluna Malvasia (Collio)

Description: This has delicate aromas suggesting wild herb, field flower and white stone fruit. The ripe palate offers yellow peach, pineapple and bitter almond lifted by fresh acidity.
Name: Monte Cicogna 2016 S. Caterina  (Lugana)

Description: Aromas of white and yellow spring flower mingle with whiffs of white almond. The almond note carries on to the light-bodied juicy palate along with tangy lemon drop and Golden Delicious apple.
Name: Perla del Garda 2017 Ora  (Lugana)

Description: Aromas of honeysuckle, tropical fruit and citrus lead the nose. The bright medium-bodied palate offers juicy white grapefruit, yellow peach and a hint of saline. It has a crisp, tangy finish.
Name: Tasca d'Almerita 2017 Cavallo delle Fate Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of yellow apple and toasted almond emerge from the glass. The aromas carry over to the straightforward palate along with white peach and rather firm acidity.
Name: Fantinel 2016 Tenuta Sant'Helena Friulano (Collio)

Description: Aromas of acacia and tangerine glide over to the dry linear palate along with unsweetened lemon drop and yellow apple. Fresh acidity keeps it light on its feet and gives it a clean finish while a subtle note of white almond marks the close.
Name: La Rajade 2016 Friulano (Collio)

Description: Honeysuckle, hazelnut and ripe orchard fruit aromas lead the way. The fresh medium-bodied palate doles out yellow peach, banana and citrus while a white-almond note marks the close.
Name: Avanzi 2017 Sirmione  (Lugana)

Description: White spring flower, beeswax and white stone-fruit aromas lift out of the glass. On the round ripe palate, white-almond and saline notes add interest to juicy pineapple and baked yellow apple.
Name: Ca' Lojera 2017  Lugana

Description: This opens with aromas suggesting honeysuckle, grapefruit and a whiff of tomato leaf while the light-bodied palate offers white peach, honeydew melon and a hint of pineapple. A note of white almond marks the close.
Name: Cesari 2017 Cento Filari  (Lugana)

Description: Whiffs of green apple, white peach and tropical fruit follow over to the soft fresh palate along with citrus notes. A white-almond note wraps up the close.
Name: Montonale 2017 Montunal  (Lugana)

Description: Scents of fragrant white flower, honeydew melon and tropical fruit leap over to the palate along with green apple and lemon drop. Fresh acidity lifts the rich flavors.
Name: Olivini 2017  Lugana

Description: Whiffs of green apple, white peach and tropical fruit follow over to the soft fresh palate along with citrus notes. A white-almond note wraps up the close.
Name: Montonale 2017 Montunal  (Lugana)

Description: Scents of fragrant white flower, honeydew melon and tropical fruit leap over to the palate along with green apple and lemon drop. Fresh acidity lifts the rich flavors.
Name: Olivini 2017  Lugana

Description: Aromas of mature apricot and dried sage emerge from the glass. The forward palate offers ripe yellow peach and tropical fruit while a bitter almond note signals the close.
Name: Schiopetto 2016 Friulano (Collio)

Description: Aromas of spring blossom, pear and citrus lead the nose. Mirroring the aromas, the bright tangy palate doles out juicy lemon, green melon and yellow apple. It finishes clean and refreshing.
Name: Tasca d'Almerita 2017 Antisa Catarratto (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of citrus, acacia and almond lead the nose. On the tangy palate, bright acidity lifts tangerine and dried herb alongside a saline note.
Name: Valle dell'Acate 2017 Zagra Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: White spring flower and exotic fruit aromas lead the nose. On the enjoyable palate, fresh acidity accompanies yellow apple and ripe Bartlett pear.
Name: Zonin 2017  Lugana

Description: Made with organically grown Turbiana grapes, this fragrant white offers aromas of honeysuckle, hawthorn and white stone fruit. The bright straightforward palate offers white peach and green apple while a hint of bitter almond marks the close.
Name: Pasini San Giovanni 2017  Lugana

Description: This 100% Inzolia has aromas of Bosc pear, white flower and Granny Smith apple. The aromas carry over to the easy-drinking palate accompanied by bright acidity that gives the wine a refreshing close.
Name: Sallier de la Tour 2017 Inzolia (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of citrus and exotic fruit lead the way. Mirroring the nose, the fresh straightforward palate offers lemon zest and pineapple alongside tangy acidity and a light salinity.
Name: Feudo Principi di Butera 2017 Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Jasmine, honeydew melon and citrus aromas take center stage on this crisp white. On the vibrant palate, bright acidity accompanies grapefruit, crushed herb and a hint of sea salt.
Name: MandraRossa 2017 Costadune Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Spring blossom and white stone-fruit aromas lead the nose. The fresh rounded palate offers white peach, fennel and a candied-lemon-drop note.
Name: Monte Cicogna 2016 Imperiale  (Lugana)

Description: Aromas of fragrant white wild flower and tropical fruit lead the nose. On the bright palate, a saline note adds interest to grapefruit and lemon.
Name: Stemmari 2017 Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Heady scents of mature apricot and citrus carry over to the fresh light-bodied palate along with mature yellow apple. A salty note signals the close.
Name: Firriato 2017 Chiaramonte Inzolia (Sicilia)

Description: Made with native grape Turbiana, this sparkler has subdued aromas evoking baked apple, toast and nut. Reflecting the nose, the palate offers dried yellow apple, citrus rind and bitter walnut alongside vigorous bubbles.
Name: Perla del Garda 2011 Millesimato Brut Nature  (Lugana)

Description: Aromas of tropical fruit, citrus and white peach follow over to the fruity palate along with honeydew melon and candied lemon drop. It closes on a hint of white almond.
Name: Bulgarini 2017  Lugana

Description: White wild flower and white stone-fruit aromas delicately waft out of the glass. On the straightforward palate, fresh acidity accompanies suggestions of citrus and white peach.
Name: Feudo Maccari 2017 Olli Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Fermented and aged in barriques, this has a shy nose that eventually reveals suggestions of pressed flower and a whiff of orchard fruit. The medium-bodied palate offers mature yellow apple and a hint of lemon rind alongside toasted oak. It's structured but rather lean in terms of fruit richness.
Name: Avanzi 2015 Borghetta Riserva  (Lugana)

Description: Delicate aromas of spring flower and ripe orchard fruit lead the way. On the fresh, straightforward palate, you'll find ripe Granny Smith, honeydew melon and a hint of candied citrus while a white almond note marks the close.
Name: Cà Maiol 2017  Lugana

Description: Aromas suggesting crushed tomato leaf, citrus and exotic fruit leap out of the glass. On the medium-bodied palate, tangy acidity perks up juicy grapefruit, white peach and pineapple packed in syrup.
Name: Graffetta 2017 Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: This big, round white has subdued aromas while the brawny palate suggests baked apple, mature pear, citrus zest and bitter almond. You'll also detect the warmth of alcohol on finish but fresh acidity manages to keep it lighter on its feet than you'd expect for a wine with this structure.
Name: La Ponca 2016 Malvasia (Collio)

Description: This opens with aromas of French oak, citrus, crushed herb and yellow stone fruit. The palate offers coconut, sage and mature yellow-apple skin alongside a hint of lemon rind. A raw almond note gives it a somewhat bitter finish.
Name: Livon 2016 Maditocai Friulano (Collio)

Description: Aromas of acacia, Spanish broom, toasted nut, orchard fruit and a whiff of oak lead the nose. On the rather lean palate, fresh acidity lifts mature yellow apple, bread crust and bitter almond.
Name: Feudo Principi di Butera 2016 Serò Insolia (Sicilia)

Description: You'll find aromas of fragrant white spring flower and citrus on this bright enjoyable wine. The tangy palate presents orange zest and crushed Mediterranean herb alongside fresh acidity.
Name: MandraRossa 2017 Ciaca Bianca Fiano (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of exotic fruit and white spring flower lead the nose. On the tangy palate, fresh acidity brightens pineapple, grapefruit and a touch of candied lemon drop.
Name: Sallier de la Tour 2017 Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of citrus zest and honeydew melon carry over to the light-bodied palate along with lemon and a hint of sea breeze. Tangy acidity lifts the juicy flavors.
Name: Cantine Ermes 2017 Vento di Mare Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: White spring flower and green-apple aromas follow over to the vibrant palate along with lemon zest and a hint of almond. It's fun and easy drinking, with bright acidity and foaming bubbles.
Name: Luna d'Or NV Brut  (Prosecco Treviso)

Description: This opens with subdued aromas of spring blossom, orchard fruit and a whiff of beeswax. On the simple palate, fresh acidity gives a lift to ripe peach and bitter almond.
Name: Santi 2015 Vigneto di Monteforte  (Soave Classico)

Description: This light-bodied, informal white offers flavors of citrus and a hint of pineapple alongside a saline note. Bright acidity gives it a crisp finish. It's a simple wine enjoyable for everyday.
Name: Cusumano 2017 Catarratto (Sicilia)

Description: Tropical fruit and crushed tomato vine aromas lift out of the glass. On the simple palate, fresh acidity lifts pineapple and a suggestion of grapefruit.
Name: Gorghi Tondi 2017 Kheirè Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: This has delicate scents evoking yellow stone fruit and citrus. The aromas carry over to the somewhat lean palate along with bitter yellow-apple skin and citrus rind. It closes on a note of bitter almond and a hint of sage.
Name: La Ponca 2016 Ribolla Gialla (Collio)

Description: Crushed tomato leaf, hay and a whiff of tropical fruit lead the nose. The tangy, light-bodied palate offers grapefruit, tangerine slice, saline and thyme framed in crisp acidity.
Name: Tenute Orestiadi 2017 Gibellina Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas suggesting tropical fruit and a whiff of Mediterranean herb follow through to the fresh simple palate along with a hint of juicy grapefruit. Tangy acidity lifts the finish.
Name: Tenute Orestiadi 2017 Molino a Vento Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Intense citrus and white-flower aromas jump over to the bright straightforward palate along with a hint of yellow stone fruit. Fresh acidity gives it a zesty close.
Name: Tenute Orestiadi 2017 Molino a Vento Organic Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Honeysuckle and banana aromas waft out of the glass. On the bright easygoing palate, a white-almond note adds interest to a core of ripe yellow pear and a hint of pineapple.
Name: Feudo Principi di Butera 2017 Insolia (Sicilia)

Description: This informal wine has a subdued nose that eventually reveals whiffs of white flower and citrus while the simple palate suggests green apple and white peach. It's bright, with fresh acidity.
Name: Ascevi Luwa 2016 Ceròu Ribolla Gialla (Collio)

Description: This opens with intense citrus aromas of lemon zest and grapefruit that carry over to the fresh simple palate along with a hint of sage. Zesty acidity gives it a crisp finish.
Name: Settesoli 2017 Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Delicately scented, this offers subtle whiffs of white wild flower and orchard fruit. The bright simple palate shows lime and white peach alongside crisp acidity.
Name: Feudo Disisa 2016 Lu Bancu Catarratto (Sicilia)

Description: This opens with delicate scents of citrus blossom and orchard fruit. The refreshing light-bodied palate offers pear and peach alongside crisp acidity. It's simple but well made.
Name: Tenute Orestiadi 2017 Gibellina Catarratto (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of toasted almond and chamomile lead the nose. The aromas carry over to the simple palate along with baked apple.
Name: Santi 2016 Melibèo  (Lugana)

Description: Aromas of orange zest and tropical fruit lead the nose. The aromas carry over to the short simple palate along with the barest hint of white almond and fresh acidity.
Name: Tenuta Sant'Antonio 2015 Monte Ceriani  (Soave)

Description: Light-bodied and tangy, this simple white wine has subdued aromas and flavors suggesting citrus. It's crisp, with a slightly salty finish.
Name: Fazio 2017 U Marusu Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Fruity aromas of tropical fruit and white peach carry over to the simple palate along with the barest hint of bitter almond. Fresh acidity gives it a bright finish.
Name: Bellora 2016  Soave

Description: This simple sparkler has aromas and flavors of bitter medicinal herb, white flower and orchard fruit. The aromas carry over to the palate alongside brisk acidity.
Name: Luna d'Or NV Extra Dry  (Prosecco)

Description: Delicate aromas of Spanish broom and ripe orchard fruit curl out of the glass. It's round and simple, offering lemon drop and a hint of bitter almond.
Name: Villa Erbice 2015  Soave Superiore

Description: Subdued aromas of beeswax, mature apple and citrus carry on to the light-bodied simple palate. It's fresh and easy, with zesty acidity.
Name: Cantine Ermes 2017 Marchese Montefusco Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Made with organically farmed grapes, this brisk, simple white offers suggestions of yellow apple, bitter almond and lemon. A saline note marks the lean close.
Name: Natale Verga 2017 Bio Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Made with native grape Carricante, this lovely sparkler offers heady scents of Spanish broom, ripe orchard fruit and Mediterranean scrub. On the fresh, savory palate, notes of tangerine and lemon drop underscore yellow apple and ripe pear set against a refined persistent perlage. Tangy acidity lifts the rich flavors.
Name: Planeta 2013 Metodo Classico Brut Carricante (Sicilia)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This is a dynamic and lovely white wine that checks all the boxes. Aromas of melon and Meyer lemon meet with honeysuckle and wet cement on the nose. The palate is framed by a grippy tension, yet shows welcoming flavors of nectarine and pear. A powerful streak of lime acidity slices through it all.
Name: Tablas Creek 2017 Estate Grown & Bottled Vermentino (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: It's a treat to welcome a new producer of Vermentino in California. This wine balances vivid herb and ripe apple flavors with vibrant acidity for a mouthfilling but still refreshing character. Touches of lime and lemon perk up the palate while an almost sweet apple-tart note kicks in on the finish.
Name: Monte Volpe 2017 Vermentino (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This remarkable wine is rather rich and creamy in texture, has mild herb and mineral aromas and a green-apple flavor that slowly opens and deepens on the palate. It's medium bodied, well-balanced and has good acidity without being overtly crisp.
Name: La Folia Winery 2016 Vermentino (Sierra Foothills)

Description: Intriguing aromas of Spanish broom, citrus and Mediterranean brush lift from the glass. The fresh savory palate delivers juicy lemon, ripe pear, crushed herb and white pepper alongside tangy acidity. It closes on a saline note.
Name: Tasca d'Almerita 2017 Mozia Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Grapefruit, white stone fruit and Mediterranean herb aromas lead the way along with a scent reminiscent of tomato leaf. Bright and juicy, the medium-bodied palate doles out pineapple, white peach and sage set against crisp acidity. A saline note tops it off.
Name: Donnafugata 2017 Sur Sur Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: This offers delicate scents of white spring flower and citrus. On the bright, linear palate, fresh acidity supports peach and lemon zest while a hint of saline picks up the finish.
Name: Firriato 2017 Altavilla della Corte Grillo (Sicilia)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Candied limes and tangerines meet with slightly reductive notes of grass, lemongrass and kaffir lime on the nose of this beautifully labeled bottling. The palate is extremely tangy and acid-washed, and settles into a pleasant vibe of lime, grapefruit and underripe orange flavors.
Name: Saint K 2017 Flower Bomb French Camp Vineyard Malvasia Bianca (Paso Robles)

Description: Waxy apple and melon dominate on the nose of this dry, moderately structured wine. It is a pretty and floral expression of the grape and does it justice within a light-bodied focus of ripeness.
Name: Fleur 2016 Estate Vineyards Vermentino (Carneros)

Description: Honeysuckle, Spanish broom and tropical-fruit aromas leap out of the glass. On the tangy palate, fresh acidity lifts peach, green apple and citrus.
Name: Caruso & Minini 2017 Naturalmente Bio Catarratto (Sicilia)

Appellation: Amador County, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Herbal, grassy, peppery aromas and flavors give a big personality to this tangy, assertive but light-bodied wine. It has crisp acidity and taut balance.
Name: Bella Grace 2017 Vermentino (Amador County)

Description: Enticing scents of honeysuckle, hawthorn and yellow stone fruit take center stage. On the juicy palate, fresh acidity lifts white peach, honeydew melon and grapefruit.
Name: Feudo Disisa 2017 Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Made entirely with organically farmed Inzolia, this has heady scents of Spanish broom, honeysuckle and ripe orchard fruit. On the palate, fresh acidity lifts honeydew melon and yellow pear while a tangy mineral note closes the finish.
Name: Feudo Montoni 2017 Fornelli Inzolia (Sicilia)

Description: Waxy peach skin and white flowers invite one into this light-bodied springtime wine, which is thick and viscous on the palate. From a longtime grower of the grape, this has moderate acidity and a juiciness that will work well with a variety of food.
Name: Mahoney 2016 Estate Vermentino (Carneros)

Description: Aromas of Mediterranean herb, yellow apple and a whiff of citrus come together on this while the fresh light-bodied palate offers tangy tangerine, white peach and a hint of saline. It has a bright, clean finish.
Name: Gorghi Tondi 2017 Coste a Preola Biologico Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: This opens with aromas of toasted nut, acacia flower and yellow apple. The aromas make their way over the bright, linear palate along with lemon and a hint of oak.
Name: Alessandro di Camporeale 2016 Vigna di Madranova Catarratto (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of honeysuckle and citrus fruit lead the nose while the juicy palate doles out tangerine, ripe honeydew melon and a hint of pineapple. It has a bright, fresh finish.
Name: Tenuta Rapitalà 2017 Viviri Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Light and bright, this leads with subtle scents of white melon and lime peel. Citrus abounds on the zippy palate, with vibrant acidity and an additional note of tart gooseberry that rides through the mouthwatering finish. Drink now.
Name: Blanville 2017 Château Haut-Blanville Collection Solal Vermentino (Pays d'Oc)

Description: A few swirls of the glass releases inviting aromas of citrus, honeysuckle and passion fruit on this easy-drinking enjoyable white. The bright fruity palate offers pineapple, hints of exotic fruit and saline alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Colosi 2017 Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Made with organically farmed grapes, this has aromas of citrus, tropical fruit and a whiff of aromatic herb. The bright fresh palate evokes green apple, pineapple and a mineral undertone alongside crisp acidity.
Name: Feudo Montoni 2017 Masso Catarratto (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of tropical fruit, Mediterranean scrub and citrus carry over to bright linear palate along with lemon notes. Crisp acidity gives it a refreshing finish.
Name: Alessandro di Camporeale 2017 Benedè Catarratto (Sicilia)

Description: Here's a bright simple white that evokes mature yellow-apple and citrus flavors. A saline note and fresh acidity give it a crisp clean finish. It's ideal for everyday enjoyment.
Name: Cusumano 2017 Insolia (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Subdued aromas suggesting beeswax and citrus come together on this. It's simple, offering hints of apple and lemon alongside bright acidity.
Name: Alagna 2016 Baglio Baiata Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: This opens with subtle scents suggesting yellow field flower and yellow stone fruit while the fresh light-bodied palate offers golden apple and tangy tangerine. It's simple but well made.
Name: Valle dell'Acate 2017 Tenuta Ibidini Insolia (Sicilia)

Description: This wine has an earthy, walnutty aroma, sparse fruit flavors improved by a white-pepper and mineral streak, and a very crisp, dry mouthfeel.
Name: Urban Legend 2016 Vermentino (Lodi)

Description: Made with organically grown grapes, this opens with aromas suggesting jasmine and tropical fruit. On the fresh simple palate, bright acidity accompanies candied citrus and ripe green melon.
Name: Casa Girelli 2017 Lamura Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Enticing, delicate scents of tomato vine, exotic fruit and wild herbs fill the glass. On the full-bodied, savory palate, fresh acidity brightens ripe honeydew melon, creamy yellow apple, lemon drop and nutmeg flavors while a tangy mineral note lingers on the finish.
Name: Raccaro 2016 Friulano (Collio)

Appellation: Verdicchio di Matelica, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Delicious and loaded with personality, this structured, medium-bodied white opens with bread crust, yellow stone fruit, citrus zest, honey and toasted almond aromas that follow through to the juicy, elegant palate. Fresh acidity brightens the rich flavors. Drink through 2023.
Name: La Monacesca 2015 Mirum Riserva  (Verdicchio di Matelica)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Delicate spring flower and yellow stone fruit scents gently lead the way in this savory, structured white. The generous, balanced palate is more expressive, offering ripe peach, apricot, yellow apple, dried herb and bitter almond flavors alongside tangy acidity. Energizing mineral and ginger notes brighten the finish.
Name: Bucci 2015 Villa Bucci Riserva  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

Description: This wine's intriguing herb, white pepper, ginger and fennel scents waft out of the glass, along with a balsamic note. They carry over to the structured, savory palate, along with citrus and dried apricot flavors. A salty mineral note backs up the finish and lends depth.
Name: Raccaro 2016 Malvasia (Collio)

Description: Enticing scents of hawthorn, honeysuckle and white stone fruit mingle together in this elegant, structured white. The medium-bodied, savory palate delivers Bartlett pear, ripe apricot and lemon drop notes while a hint of bitter almond backs up the finish.
Name: Villa Russiz 2016 Friulano (Collio)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This compelling, biodynamically farmed white opens with earthy chamomile, Spanish broom, dried wild herb and nut aromas. The full-bodied, delicious palate delivers dried apricot, ripe yellow peach, tangy lemon drop and almond flavors while a mineral note backs up the finish.
Name: Pievalta 2013 San Paolo Riserva  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Made from 95% Vernaccia and 5% Chardonnay planted in 1986, this opens with inviting orchard fruit, spring wildflower and yeasty bread dough scents. Bright and savory, the medium-bodied palate doles out ripe pear, yellow apple, crushed herb and nut hints alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Tenuta Le Calcinaie 2014 Vigna ai Sassi Riserva  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Made from Verdicchio from 45-year-old vines, this structured, elegant white opens with yellow wildflower, beeswax and citrus aromas. The compelling, medium-bodied palate doles out ripe apple, creamy peach and acacia honey notes alongside bright acidity. Bitter almond and saline hints wrap up the finish. Drink through 2025.
Name: Umani Ronchi 2015 Casal di Serra Vecchie Vigne  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Tangy and fresh, this organically grown wine opens with enticing honeysuckle, white stone fruit and crushed stone scents. The juicy, flavorful palate doles out creamy white peach, yellow apple, tangerine and ginger hints while a white almond note lingers on the finish.
Name: Tenuta Le Calcinaie 2016  Vernaccia di San Gimignano

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This opens with toasted hazelnut, ripe yellow stone fruit, bread crust and grilled herb aromas. They carry over to the structured palate, along with vanilla, citrus zest and yellow apple hints. Fresh acidity lifts the finish. Drink through 2022.
Name: Montenidoli 2012 Carato Riserva  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Description: From the vineyard that helped save the Pecorino grape from extinction, this offers enticing white spring flower, acacia, citrus zest and thyme aromas. The full-bodied, elegant palate delivers white peach, Anjou pear and lemon flavors alongside crisp acidity. A flinty mineral note energizes the finish. It will continue to evolve for years. Enjoy through 2023.
Name: Tenuta Cocci Grifoni 2014 Giudo Cocci Grifoni  (Offida Pecorino)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Delicate aromas suggesting pressed Spanish broom, yellow stone fruit, crushed herbs and balsam come together in this. Elegant and full-bodied, the structured palate delivers dried apricot, nectarine zest and honeyed mineral notes while a bitter almond accent announces the close.
Name: Teruzzi & Puthod 2015 6600 Riserva  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Description: This elegant and structured wine's yellow stone fruit, almond, Spanish broom and Alpine herb aromas take shape in the glass. The full-bodied palate delivers ripe yellow apple, juicy citrus and toasted almond flavors. A savory mineral note caps off the finish.
Name: Venica & Venica 2016 Ronco delle Cime Friulano (Collio)

Description: This unusual, deep amber-hued wine opens with toast, candied orange zest, dried herb, acacia and baking spice aromas. Those carry over to the intriguing, vibrant palate, along with dried apricot, ginger and toasted hazelnut hints. Bright acidity provides the backbone. Fans of orange wine will love it.
Name: Primosic 2014 Ribolla di Oslavia Riserva Ribolla Gialla (Collio)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This unusually expressive white offers delicate, enticing scents of white stone fruit, spring wildflowers and wild herbs. It's savory and elegant, with creamy white peach, tangy citrus and green melon flavors and fresh acidity. A white almond note graces the finish.
Name: Tenuta dell'Ugolino 2016 Vigneto del Balluccio  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This wine's white spring flower, beeswax and pink grapefruit aromas emerge in the glass. The juicy palate offers Williams pear, lime and almond notes alongside bright acidity. Enjoy now–2023.
Name: Garofoli 2015 Podium  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Made from organically farmed grapes, this opens with mature apricot, dried herb and pressed Spanish broom aromas. The savory palate doles out ripe peach, yellow pear and bitter almond notes. A citrus zest note marks the close.
Name: Alessandro Tofanari 2015 Astrea  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Description: Made from 100% Grechetto, this opens with pressed Spanish broom, yellow stone fruit, ripe citrus zest and toasted oak aromas. On the round, full-bodied palate, toasted hazelnut accents underscore Golden Delicious apple and nectarine flavors while a saline note backs up the finish.
Name: Sergio Mottura 2015 Latour a Civitella  (Civitella d'Agliano)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This wine's enticing aromas of jasmine, Granny Smith apple and white peach float from the glass. The medium-bodied, concentrated palate doles out Bartlett pear, ripe grapefruit, ginger and sage touches alongside bright acidity and energizing mineral sensations. Drink through 2023.
Name: Umani Ronchi 2017 CaSal di Serra  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Delicately fragrant, this offers alluring white flower, ripe orchard fruit and Mediterranean brush scents. The elegant, savory palate delivers yellow apple, Anjou pear, tangerine and aromatic herb flavors. A bitter almond note backs up the tangy finish.
Name: Alessandro Tofanari 2015 Ciprea  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Albana di Romagna, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Made from superripe Albana grapes affected by noble rot, this opens with saffron, chamomile and dried apricot aromas. The structured palate offers acacia honey, dried fig and toasted hazelnut flavors while fresh acidity lends balance and brightness.
Name: Bissoni 2012 Passito  (Albana di Romagna)

Description: Jadis, a word reflecting a return to a distant past, is a wine that comes from organically grown grapes. It has richness and piles of spice, tangy acidity and intense fruit flavors. Vanilla and pepper show strongly along with the apple, green-plum and quince flavors. Drink this ripe, full-bodied wine from 2019.
Name: Château Grand Boise 2016 Jadis Vermentino (Côtes de Provence)

Description: This wine's jasmine, Spanish broom and white stone fruit aromas waft out of the glass. The juicy palate delivers Bartlett pear, white peach and lemon zest flavors alongside bright acidity. An almond note marks the close.
Name: Tenuta Cocci Grifoni 2014 Colle Vecchio  (Offida Pecorino)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with Spanish broom, citrus and linden blossom aormas. The structured palate delivers lemon peel, grapefruit and almond notes alongside bright acidity. A little more bottle age will result in even more depth and complexity. Drink through 2022.
Name: Lucchetti 2016 Vittoria  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Description: Acacia, yellow stone fruit and herb are some of the aromas you'll find in this savory white. The crisp, linear palate offers yellow peach, Golden Delicious apple and bitter almond flavors alongside bright acidity.
Name: Palazzone 2016 Grek Grechetto (Umbria)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Made from biodynamically grown grapes, this bright, elegant white offers delicate scents of spring wildflowers, orchard fruit and toasted nuts. The fresh, tangy palate offers white peach and tangerine flavors while a hint of almond-like bitterness backs up the finish.
Name: Pievalta 2016  Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Description: Orange-hued, this opens with mature yellow stone fruit, baked biscuit and toasted nut aromas. On the smooth palate, fresh acidity lifts dried apricot, orange rind and bitter almond flavors. A mineral note adds depth. It's unusual but intriguing.
Name: Primosic 2012 Oslavia Ribolla Gialla (Collio)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Made from biodynamically grown grapes, this bright, elegant white offers delicate scents of spring wildflowers, orchard fruit and toasted nuts. The fresh, tangy palate offers white peach and tangerine flavors while a hint of almond-like bitterness backs up the finish.
Name: Pievalta 2016  Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Description: Orange-hued, this opens with mature yellow stone fruit, baked biscuit and toasted nut aromas. On the smooth palate, fresh acidity lifts dried apricot, orange rind and bitter almond flavors. A mineral note adds depth. It's unusual but intriguing.
Name: Primosic 2012 Oslavia Ribolla Gialla (Collio)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with enticing grapefruit, hawthorn and Bartlett pear aromas that carry over to the savory palate, along with an almondy finish and bright acidity. Drink through 2024.
Name: Tenute Pieralisi 2016 Villaia  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Enticing scents of fragrant spring flower, wild herbs, mature yellow stone fruit and wet rock lead the nose of this wine. The ripe palate offers dried peach, mature yellow apple and beeswax hints while a saline note wraps up the finish.
Name: Cesani 2015 Clamys  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Description: Enticing field flower, citrus and yellow stone fruit scents come together in this vibrant white. The bright palate offers juicy tangerine, creamy nectarine and apple flavors, along with a tangy saline hint. Crisp acidity gives it a clean, refreshing finish.
Name: Jermann 2016 Vinnae Ribolla Gialla (Venezia Giulia)

Appellation: Verdicchio di Matelica, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This wine's heady Spanish broom, acacia and yellow stone fruit scents lift out of the glass. The palate mirrors the nose, offering creamy peach, yellow apple and juicy citrus flavors alongside bright acidity. An almond note caps off the finish.
Name: La Monacesca 2016  Verdicchio di Matelica

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This wine's wild herb, spring blossom and citrus aromas follow through to the savory palate, along with white peach, pear, green melon and citrus flavors. A white almond note closes the clean, tangy finish.
Name: Montecappone 2016  Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

Description: Enticing scents of citrus blossoms, ripe yellow stone fruit and crushed stones mingle together in this wine. The aromas carry over to the round, medium-bodied palate, along with peach, pear and bitter almond flavors. A saline note lingers on the finish.
Name: Sergio Mottura 2016 Poggio della Costa  (Civitella d'Agliano)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This structured Verdicchio opens with subtle citrus, yellow flower and cedar aromas. The full-bodied palate delivers Golden Delicious apple, lemon zest and ginger flavors alongside bright acidity. A toasted almond note wraps up the finish. Drink through 2025.
Name: Umani Ronchi 2015 Plenio Riserva  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This wine's chamomile, acacia flower, yellow stone fruit and honey aromas lift out of the glass. The round, medium-bodied palate delivers ripe apricot, yellow peach and nectarine flavors while an almond note lingers on the tangy finish.
Name: Bucci 2016  Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with delicate, alluring aromas of white spring flowers and citrus. The structured, juicy palate offers white peach, grapefruit and bitter almond notes framed by crisp acidity. Enjoy now or hold for more complexity. Drink through 2024.
Name: Montecappone 2014 Utopia Riserva  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Delicate lemon and white spring flower aromas take shape in this wine. The savory, structured palate offers ripe tropical fruit, creamy yellow peach, ginger and toasted almond notes alongside bright acidity. Drink through 2022.
Name: Tenuta di Tavignano 2015 Misco Riserva  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Bartlett pear and Spanish broom aromas emerge from this wine. The savory palate delivers pink grapefruit, yellow peach and pineapple flavors set against crisp acidity. It closes on an almond note. Drink through 2023.
Name: Tenuta di Tavignano 2016 Villa Torre  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with grapefruit and apricot aromas that carry over to the palate, alongside a juicy lemon note. It's bright, with fresh acidity. Drink through 2021.
Name: Filodivino 2016 Serra 46  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This delicately scented wine opens with white spring flower and wild herb aromas. The juicy palate offers white peach, ripe pear and citrus flavors while a bitter almond note signals the close.
Name: Poggio Alloro 2016 Il Nicchiaio  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Friuli Colli Orientali, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Round and structured, this opens with yellow apple, hazelnut and graphite aromas. On the ripe, full-bodied palate, a hint of bitter almond underscores mature yellow pear and citrus-zest flavors. A salty note marks the finish.
Name: Tenuta di Angoris 2015 Friulano (Friuli Colli Orientali)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This wine's yellow flower, citrus and orange zest aromas waft from the glass. The juicy, enveloping palate offers chamomile, pineapple and lime flavors alongside bright acidity.
Name: Tenuta di Tavignano 2016 Misco  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This organically farmed wine's Spanish broom, acacia, and yellow stone fruit scents waft out of the glass. The medium-bodied palate delivers mature apricot, ripe yellow apple and vanilla hints. A bitter almond note underscores the close.
Name: Cesani 2015 Sanice Riserva  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This wine's honeysuckle and tropical fruit aromas carry over to the juicy, linear palate, along with citrus zest, pear and mineral hints. Fennel and bitter almond notes mark the close.
Name: Fattoria Poggio Alloro 2016  Vernaccia di San Gimignano

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Spanish broom, ripe orchard fruit and toasted nut aromas lead the nose of this wine. The medium-bodied, structured palate offers yellow apple, dried apricot and pineapple hints while a honeyed almond note closes the finish.
Name: Il Palagione 2015 Lyra  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Aged for eight months in French casks, this opens with subtle oak and toasted nut aromas. They carry over to the medium-bodied palate, along with baked apple, butterscotch and vanilla hints while a coffee note lingers on the finish.
Name: La Mormoraia 2015 Antalis Riserva  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This leads with grapefruit, hawthorn and thyme aromas. The juicy palate offers Williams pear, citrus and bitter almond notes alongside fresh acidity. Drink through 2020.
Name: Vignamato 2017 Versiano  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Appellation: Verdicchio di Matelica, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Made from organic grapes, this has delicate citrus and hawthorn aromas. The bright palate offers chamomile, white peach and grapefruit hints alongside vibrant acidity.
Name: Borgo Paglianetto 2016 Terravignata  (Verdicchio di Matelica)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This wine's Spanish broom, yellow stone fruit and citrus aromas float out of the glass. On the savory, medium-bodied palate, bright acidity lifts ripe yellow peach, pear and nectarine zest flavors.
Name: Cantina Politi 2016 Loretello  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This wine's acacia, baked apple, citrus rind and baking spice aromas follow through to the ripe, round palate. It closes on mineral and bitter almond hints.
Name: Guicciardini Strozzi 2017 Titolato Strozzi  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This wine's citrus, yellow flower and sage aromas merge together in the glass. The lively palate offers Bartlett pear and grapefruit flavors, with an almondy finish carried by crisp acidity. Drink through 2020.
Name: Boccafosca 2015 Oinochoe  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Made from organically farmed grapes, this offers alluring scents of white spring flower, orchard fruit and vineyard dust. The rounded, juicy palate doles out succulent tropical fruit, honeydew melon and citrus flavors while a crushed oyster shell note gives it a tangy close.
Name: Fattoria San Donato 2016 Angelica  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This wine's delicate but enticing scents of white spring flower, citrus and pear drift out of the glass. The bright palate offers honeydew melon, lemon zest and white peach notes set against tangy acidity.
Name: Guicciardini Strozzi 2016 Titolato Strozzi  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This wine's delicate chamomile, cedar and yellow spring flower aromas waft out of the glass. The structured palate delivers apricot, lemon rind and marzipan touches. Drink through 2021.
Name: Moncaro 2013 Vigna Novali Riserva  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Made from organically grown grapes fermented in terracotta amphoras, this unusual wine opens with chamomile, candied citrus zest, dried apricot and herb aromas. They carry over to the somewhat lean, vibrant palate, along with balsam, acacia honey and bitter almond notes.
Name: Cappella Sant'Andrea 2014 Prima Luce  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This wine's delicate aromas evoke spring blossom and citrus. On the savory palate, an almond-like bitterness backs up ripe apricot, mature yellow apple, tangerine zest and fennel flavors.
Name: Cappella Sant'Andrea 2016 Clara Stella  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: White spring flower, lemon zest and crushed herb aromas lead the way in this wine. The medium-bodied palate offers ripe yellow pear, marzipan and toasted almond hints.
Name: Massimo Daldin 2016 Vigna in Fiore  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Spanish broom, pink grapefruit and sea breeze aromas emerge from this wine. The lively palate delivers white peach and juicy pineapple flavors, with a touch of citrus and fresh acidity. Drink through 2021.
Name: Filodivino 2016 Matto  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Broom, acacia, beeswax and ripe yellow stone fruit aromas lead the nose of this wine. The juicy, structured palate offers baked yellow apple, orange zest and toasted almond flavors while a tangy saline note backs up the finish.
Name: Il Colombaio di Santa Chiara 2015 Campo della Pieve  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Delicate but pretty citrus blossom, ripe orchard fruit and wet stone scents lead the nose of this wine. The bright, savory palate doles out yellow pear, green melon, nectarine and saline hints alongside tangy acidity.
Name: Fattoria San Donato 2016  Vernaccia di San Gimignano

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This wine's citrus, spring flower, ripe orchard fruit and cut grass aromas delicately lift out of the glass. The linear palate offers lemon, mature apple and steely mineral notes alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Guicciardini Strozzi 2016 Principe Strozzi  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: French oak, coffee, butterscotch and citrus zest aromas lead the nose of this wine. The medium-bodied palate offers tropical fruit, grapefruit, dried sage and toasted notes, alongside bright acidity.
Name: Panizzi 2013 Riserva  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This wine's yellow flower, honey and toasted oak aromas appear in the glass. The structured, medium-bodied palate offers dried yellow apple, dried pineapple and saline flavors alongside a bitter almond note.
Name: Poderi Arcangelo 2015 Per Bruno  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Description: Honeysuckle and yellow stone fruit aromas lead the nose of this wine. On the fresh, medium-bodied palate, white almond accents back up ripe peach and apple flavors while a salty mineral note marks the close.
Name: Argillae 2016 Grechetto (Umbria)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with subtle citrus and white spring flower aromas while the palate offers white peach and apricot notes. It's bright and crisp on the close.
Name: Boccafosca 2016 Stellaria  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with tropical fruit and white spring flower aormas. The creamy, forward palate delivers pineapple, ripe Bartlett pear and acacia honey flavors. Drink through 2019.
Name: Casalfarneto 2015 Grancasale  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This opens with baked peach and citrus zest aromas that follow through to the ripe palate, along with mature apple and tangy oyster shell notes. Bitter almond marks the close.
Name: Guicciardini Strozzi 2017 Principe Strozzi  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Made from organically farmed grapes, this offers acacia, broom, exotic fruit and toasted nut aromas. The bright, lean palate offers honey, bitter almond and citrus zest flavors framed with tangy acidity.
Name: Il Colombaio di Santa Chiara 2014 L'Albereta Riserva  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Unusual but intriguing aromas reminiscent of toasted nuts, paraffin and eucalyptus appear in the glass. The linear palate delivers citrus zest, yellow apple and saline flavors while a bitter almond note marks the finish.
Name: San Quirico 2016  Vernaccia di San Gimignano

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with delicate hawthorn and citrus aromas. The bright palate offers Granny Smith apple and Concorde pear flavors, crisp acidity and an almondy finish.
Name: Brunori 2016 Le Gemme  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with banana, tangerine zest and pineapple aromas that carry over to the savory palate. Fresh acidity gives it a quenching finish. Drink through 2020.
Name: Brunori 2016 San Nicolò  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Appellation: Vin de France, France Other, France
Description: From the east coast of Corsica, this wine is rich, ripe and full of tropical fruit flavors. It has fine acidity to balance the delicious, creaminess. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Poli 2015 Bianco Gentile Vermentino (Vin de France)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This wine's yellow spring flower, citrus and ripe orchard fruit aromas carry over to the tangy palate, along with a juicy hint of tangerine. A pleasantly bitter almond note signals the close.
Name: Cesani 2016 Pancole  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Aromas reminiscent of mature yellow stone fruit and yellow spring flowers lead the way in this. The tangy palate evokes apricot, citrus and yellow apple. A bitter almond hint signals the close.
Name: Falchini 2016 Vigna a Solatio  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This has a shy nose that eventually reveals pressed acacia, Spanish broom and beeswax aromas. On the ripe, round palate, bitter almond underscores mature yellow apple and citrus rind flavors.
Name: Guicciardini Strozzi 2015 Titolato Strozzi Riserva  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Alluring scents of Spanish broom, beeswax and wild herbs mingle with orchard fruit aromas in this wine. On the round palate, a honeyed note underscores mature yellow apple and citrus rind flavors. A bitter almond note signals the close.
Name: Guicciardini Strozzi 2017 Villa Cusona  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This organically grown wine's white spring flower and orchard fruit aromas form in the glass. The bright palate offers yellow apple, Anjou pear and nectarine flavors alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Il Colombaio di Santa Chiara 2016 Selvabianca  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Jasmine, white peach and chamomile hints merge together in this. The linear palate offers grapefruit and Bosc pear notes alongside bright acidity that leaves a refreshing finish.
Name: Lucchetti 2016  Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Shy at first, this reveals acacia, dried herb and white stone fruit aromas as it opens. They carry over to the palate, along with white peach and ginger notes. A hint of bitter almond backs up the finish.
Name: Palagetto 2015 Arianna Ventanni  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This wine's delicate spring flower, citrus and yellow stone fruit scents lift out of the glass. On the medium-bodied palate, a white almond note underscores yellow peach and juicy pineapple flavors.
Name: Palagetto 2016 Santa Chiara  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This wine's subtle white flower and orchard fruit scents float out of the glass. On the juicy, rounded palate, a bitter almond note underscores yellow pear and ripe apple flavors.
Name: Signano 2016  Vernaccia di San Gimignano

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Subtle yellow flower and citrus aromas emerge from this wine. The rich palate shows ripe white peach, juicy pineapple and chamomile notes. Enjoy over the next few years.
Name: Moncaro 2016 Cà Ruptae  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This wine's oak and butterscotch aromas carry over to the full-bodied palate, along with coffee, dried apricot and dried pineapple notes. The warmth of alcohol marks the close. Drink soon to capture the remaining fruit richness.
Name: Monte Schiavo 2015 Le Giuncare Riserva  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with white peach, chamomile and sage hints. The juicy palate doles out yellow peach, apricot and tangerine zest notes alongside bright acidity. Drink through 2021.
Name: Monte Schiavo 2016 Pallio di San Floriano  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This wine's pear, bread crust and citrus rind aromas slowly appear in the glass and follow through to the round, full-bodied palate, along with a hint of marzipan. Evident warmth from alcohol on the finish pushes it to the limit of freshness and balance.
Name: Vigna degli Estensi 2016 Soteria  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This wine's subtle peach jam and acacia honey aromas carry over to savory palate, along with candied ginger notes. A toasted almond note marks the close.
Name: Vignamato 2013 Riserva  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Description: This balanced, creamy and fruity wine from 50-year-old vines is still young but already delicious. It's succulent and juicy, with apple flavors and zesty acidity at the end. Drink from late 2018.
Name: Clos Alivu 2017 Vermentino (Patrimonio)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Acacia, Spanish broom, apricot and toasted nut aromas set the tone in this wine. Mirroring the nose, the rounded palate offers ripe peach, yellow apple, orange zest and honey hints while an almond note gives it a pleasantly bitter close.
Name: Fattoria il Palagio 2016  Vernaccia di San Gimignano

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This opens with subdued aromas suggesting oak, paraffin and thyme. The palate is more expressive, offering dried apricot, citrus zest, grilled herb and bitter almond flavors.
Name: Fattoria San Donato 2015 Benedetta Riserva  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Spanish broom, acacia and ripe orchard fruit aromas slowly emerge from this wine. On the bright palate, a bitter almond note underscores nectarine and yellow apple flavors. Fresh acidity lifts the finish.
Name: Massimo Daldin 2016  Vernaccia di San Gimignano

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This wine's Spanish broom and apricot aromas follow over to the rounded palate, together with yellow peach and citrus notes. A hint of bitter almond marks the close.
Name: Poderi Arcangelo 2016  Vernaccia di San Gimignano

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Subtle white flower, nut and orchard fruit aromas lead the way in this wine. On the enjoyable palate, fresh acidity accompanies green apple, citrus and bitter almond notes.
Name: Abbazia Monte Oliveto 2016  Vernaccia di San Gimignano

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This wine's spring wildflower and orchard fruit scents delicately lift from the glass. The straightforward palate offers nectarine, apple and tangy citrus flavors while bitter almond marks the close.
Name: Casalfarneto 2016 Fontevecchia  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Description: Named after two grandmothers, one Italian and one Spanish, this yellow and citrus-fruit-flavored wine is ripe while also crisp. Its acidity is embedded in the mineral, tangy texture, giving the wine both freshness and rich fruitiness. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Terre de Mistral 2017 Anna Vermentino (Côtes de Provence)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with toast, oak and grilled herb hints. The aromas carry over to the subdued palate, along with roasted almond, grapefruit and butterscotch notes. Drink soon to enjoy the remaining fruit and freshness.
Name: Stefano Antonucci 2015  Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Description: This leads with Spanish broom, acacia honey and dried yellow stone fruit aromas. The honeyed note carries over to the palate, together with mature apricot, pineapple and citrus hints.
Name: Roccafiore 2017 Fiordaliso Grechetto (Umbria)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This wine's delicate scents reminiscent of wild flowers and orchard fruit lift out of the glass. The rounded, straightforward palate offers white peach, yellow pear and light bitter almond notes.
Name: Tenuta Torciano 2016 Poggioaicieli  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with yellow wildflower, citrus and white stone fruit aromas. The fresh palate offers juicy yellow peach, yellow apple and bitter walnut hints alongside crisp acidity.
Name: Colognola 2016 Via Condotto  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This mature white has a rather shy nose, but the medium-bodied palate offers toasted almond, pineapple and dried yellow stone fruit flavors. An almond note and a hint of dried sage give it a bitter finish.
Name: Casa alle Vacche 2015 Crocus Riserva  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Aromas evoking pressed spring flowers and exotic fruit lead the nose of this wine. The lean, racy palate delivers pineapple, citrus, bitter almond and toast notes, alongside brisk acidity.
Name: Falchini 2014 Vigna a Solatio Riserva  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This offers pretty yellow flower and beeswax aromas while the rounded palate doles out ripe apricot, mature yellow apple and orange zest flavors. A tangy mineral note suggesting oyster shells lifts the finish.
Name: Guicciardini Strozzi 2016 Villa Cusona  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This wine's subtle grapefruit and white spring flower aromas lift out of the glass. The ripe, straightforward palate offers Concorde pear, white peach and citrus touches.
Name: Monte Schiavo 2016 Coste del Molino  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This wine's citrus zest, cut grass and crushed herb aromas carry over to the bright, refreshing palate, along with a juicy nectarine note. Tangy acidity gives it a crisp, mouthwatering finish.
Name: Stefano Antonucci 2016 Le Vaglie  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This wine's Spanish broom, yellow stone fruit and nut aromas carry over to the bright, tangy palate, along with a citrusy flavor. A bitter almond note closes the finish.
Name: Tenuta dell'Ugolino 2016 Le Paiole  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This wine's subdued yellow stone fruit and Spanish broom aromas carry over to the straightforward, tangy palate, along with lemony zestiness. An almond note closes the finish.
Name: Boccafosca 2016 Raggi d'Uva  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This opens with oak, butterscotch and citrus peel aromas, with a whiff of resin. On the rather lean palate, fresh acidity supports toast, coconut and dried apricot flavors. It shows elegance but lacks the fruit richness to stand up to the oak.
Name: Panizzi 2014 Vigna Santa Margherita  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Toasted oak, eucalyptus and coconut aromas come together in this. The firm palate offers bitter almond, oak and yellow apple skin flavors. Sage and saline notes close the rather lean finish.
