Name: Il Palagione 2016 Ori Riserva  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This wine's aromas suggest medicinal herbs and acacia. They carry over to the simple palate, along with bitter almond and yellow apple skin notes.
Name: La Mormoraia 2016 Suavis  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with delicate acacia flower and citrus aromas. The simple, linear palate offers salty white peach and Bartlett pear flavors set against crisp acidity.
Name: Monte Schiavo 2016 Ruviano  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Fresh and fruity, this fun, simple white has tropical fruit, peach and citrus flavors. Bright acidity gives it a tangy finish.
Name: Piersanti 2017  Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

Description: This featherlight, perfumed wine is soft, fruity and very ready to drink. Its acidity and lightly mineral texture are immediately attractive, filled out with fine, final fruitiness. Drink now.
Name: UVAL 2017 Terra Nostra Blanc Vermentino (Corse)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with subtle white spring flower and citrus aromas. The simple palate offers lemon zest and ginger touches alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Marchetti 2017  Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This informal white offers yellow apple and peach flavors, along with a hint of white almond. It's simple but well made.
Name: Pietrafitta 2016  Vernaccia di San Gimignano

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This has subdued tropical fruit and yellow wildflower scents. The light-bodied, forward palate offers yellow peach and pineapple flavors, with an almond-inflected finish. Drink soon.
Name: Moncaro 2017 Le Vele  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Whiffs of oak, toasted nut and vanilla follow over to the palate, along with mature yellow apple skin and bitter almond notes. Roasted coffee flavors briefly appear before the lean, austere finish.
Name: Guidi 1929 2015 Aurea Riserva  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This wine's shy nose suggests lemon. Straightforward and light-bodied, it evokes tangerine zest and bitter almond on the palate.
Name: Tenuta Torciano 2015 Crete Nere  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This wine evokes citrus blossoms and wild herbs on the nose. The fresh, tangy palate doles out yellow apple and citrus hints alongside crisp acidity. It's simple but well made and extremely refreshing.
Name: Vignedileo - Tre Castelli 2016  Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This wine's pressed yellow flower and toasted nut aromas follow through to the somewhat evolved palate, along with a bitter yellow apple skin note. The finish is abrupt, and the fruit is drying out, so drink soon.
Name: Colognola 2015 Ghiffa  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Made from late-harvested grapes, this has seen better days. While it barely expresses aroma, the hefty palate offers faint suggestions of toasted almond, kerosene and dried yellow stone fruit. Despite its tangy acidity, the fruit has largely dried up, leaving an abrupt finish and the heat of evident alcohol, further throwing it off balance.
Name: Colognola 2013 Labieno Riserva  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Spring blossom and white stone fruit aromas lead the nose of this simple but well made wine. On the bright palate, lively acidity underscores a zesty lemon flavor.
Name: Stefano Antonucci 2016  Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This has restrained aromas suggesting pears and citrus. The simple, easygoing palate offers yellow peach and light almond notes alongside bright acidity.
Name: Umani Ronchi 2017 Villa Bianchi  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This has a shy nose that reveals whiffs of spring wildflowers as it opens. The extremely simple palate offers citrus, pear and white almond notes alongside bright acidity.
Name: Buscareto 2016  Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This extremely simple white has subdued yellow apple and citrus notions alongside crisp acidity. Pour at large parties and informal gatherings.
Name: Stefano Antonucci 2016 Pignocco  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Enticing scents of smoke, Spanish broom, acacia, chopped herb and ripe stone fruit slowly take shape on this elegant, compelling white. Savory, structured yet understated, the palate is all about extreme finesse, delivering nectarine, wild herb, tangerine zest and honey alongside bright acidity. A vein of flinty smoky mineral throughout adds depth while toasted hazelnut accents the lingering finish. Wonderful now but will age and evolve for years. Drink through 2025.
Name: Villa Raiano 2015 Alimata  (Fiano di Avellino)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Citrus, wild herb and yellow field-flower aromas delicately rise from the glass. Elegant, savory and enveloping, the palate boasts understated finesse, delivering golden apple, lemon zest and a hint of honeyed almond alongside tangy acidity. A flinty note wraps up the finish. Drink through 2025.
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2015 Studi Arianello  (Fiano di Avellino)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Intriguing scents of underbrush, grilled Mediterranean herb, honey and lemon zest carry over to the palate along with ripe yellow pear and almond. A tangy saline note closes the finish. Fresh acidity provides support throughout and gives it an elegant, age-worthy structure. Drink through 2025.
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2015 Studi Fraedane  (Greco di Tufo)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas suggesting pressed acacia, citrus blossom and mature yellow stone fruit lift out of the glass along with a whiff of Mediterranean scrub. The enveloping palate delivers dried apricot, tangerine drop, fennel and tangy mineral while a hint of bitter almond wraps around the finish. Drink through 2025.
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2015 Studi Laura  (Greco di Tufo)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Fragrant white flower, citrus and crushed stone aromas lift out of the glass. The bright delicious palate delivers juicy pear, nectarine, pineapple and a savory saline note alongside tangy acidity.
Name: Cantine di Marzo 2016  Greco di Tufo

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Flint, Mediterranean brush, yellow spring flower, ripe orchard fruit and a whiff of honey all take shape on this elegant white. The honey aroma carries over to the bright, structured palate along with yellow apple, pear, tangy, unsweetened lemon drop and toasted hazelnut. A mineral note lends depth. Drink through 2023.
Name: Villa Raiano 2015 Ventidue  (Fiano di Avellino)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Fragrant white spring flower, ripe orchard fruit and crushed stone aromas lead the way on this vibrant white. The tangy savory palate delivers tangerine, white grapefruit, pear and white peach set against bright acidity. A savory mineral note suggesting flint lingers on the quenching finish. It's already delicious and will continue evolve for years. Drink through 2025.
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2015 Studi Bussi  (Greco di Tufo)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Savory and structured, this opens with enticing scents suggesting ripe yellow stone fruit, Spanish broom and a whiff of cake spice. On the round enveloping palate, fresh acidity lifts juicy apricot, yellow apple and ginger while a mineral note wraps up the finish.
Name: Quintodecimo 2016 Giallo d'Arles  (Greco di Tufo)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Chopped herb, Mediterranean brush, white spring blossom and ripe citrus aromas take the lead. The bright elegantly structured palate offers yellow pear, tangerine and energizing mineral notes set against refreshing acidity.
Name: Villa Raiano 2015 Marotta  (Greco di Tufo)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Toasted pistachio nut, acacia honey and ripe orchard fruit aromas follow over to the savory, enveloping palate along with juicy tangerine and creamy pear. A smoky mineral note lingers on the finish.
Name: Cantine di Marzo 2016  Fiano di Avellino

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Smoke, ripe orchard fruit, acacia and honey are just some of the enticing scents you'll find on this stunning mineral-driven white. The elegant palate is equally compelling, offering mature yellow apple, dried herb, citrus zest and hazelnut alongside fresh acidity. Drink through 2025.
Name: Mastroberardino 2016 Radici  (Fiano di Avellino)

Description: Intriguing aromas evoking sea brine, Mediterranean scrub, mature citrus zest and a hint of pineapple follow over to the racy palate along with yellow apple and a hint of hazelnut. Vibrant acidity and a tangy saline note give it a crisp, savory finish.
Name: San Salvatore 1988 2016 Calpazio Greco (Paestum)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of pressed acacia flower, mature orange rind and Bartlett pear lead the way on this fragrant white. The medium-bodied palate offers ripe yellow-apple skin, toasted hazelnut and citrus alongside a flinty mineral note.
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2015 Studi Arielle  (Greco di Tufo)

Description: Enticing aromas of acacia flower, beeswax, Mediterranean herb and orchard fruit aromas lift out of the glass. It's crisp and linear, with green-pear, lemon zest, fennel and thyme flavors. Fresh acidity gives it a clean finish while a beeswax note lingers on the close.
Name: Fattoria La Rivolta 2016 Taburno Coda di Volpe (Sannio)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of smoke, Mediterranean brush, ripe orchard fruit and a whiff nut drift out of the glass. The medium-bodied palate doles out yellow pear, Golden Delicious apple, thyme and lemon zest while hint of bitter almond closes the finish.
Name: Villa Raiano 2016  Fiano di Avellino

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Compelling aromas of pressed yellow flower, Mediterranean brush, citrus zest and smoke prove this wine's Fiano pedigree. The aromas carry over to the elegant structured palate along with yellow apple, lemon, toasted hazelnut and a drop of honey. Fresh acidity provides balance.
Name: Antonio Caggiano 2016 Béchar  (Fiano di Avellino)

Description: This delicious, elegant white opens with aromas of ripe white stone fruit, fragrant yellow flower, Mediterranean brush and a whiff of honey. The tangy juicy palate delivers yellow pear, nectarine, ginger and toasted hazelnut alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Fattoria La Rivolta 2016 Taburno Fiano (Sannio)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Enticing scents of Spanish broom, acacia and honey follow over to the subtle, restrained palate along with ripe yellow-apple skin, dried herb and unsweetened lemon drop. A hint of nut closes the finish. It's still a bit austere and needs a few more years to fully develop.
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2015 Studi Campo Aperto  (Fiano di Avellino)

Appellation: Falanghina del Sannio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Honeysuckle, orange blossom, pear, wild herb and apple aromas follow over to the palate along with tangy nectarine and beeswax. It's refreshingly crisp in bright acidity, with a savory mineral note that lingers on the close.
Name: Fattoria La Rivolta 2016 Taburno  (Falanghina del Sannio)

Appellation: Terre del Volturno, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of orange rind, dried apricot and acacia honey follow over to the deeply colored full-bodied palate along with toasted hazelnut and thyme. It's unusual but also intriguing and savory.
Name: Alepa 2013 Riccio Bianco Pallagrello Bianco (Terre del Volturno)

Appellation: Falanghina del Sannio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Spring flower, citrus blossom orchard fruit aromas drift out of the glass along with an enticing whiff of vineyard dust. It's juicy and savory, doling out ripe yellow pear, nectarine and white almond alongside fresh acidity. A hint of chopped herb enhances the finish.
Name: Mustilli 2016 Sant'Agata dei Goti  (Falanghina del Sannio)

Description: Made entirely with Fiano, this has aromas of hazelnut, acacia, dried herb and wet rock. The bright elegant palate delivers yellow apple, golden pear, toasted almond and flinty mineral set against bright acidity. It closes on a honeyed note.
Name: San Giovanni 2016 Tresinus Fiano (Paestum)

Appellation: Terre del Volturno, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of orange rind, dried apricot and acacia honey follow over to the deeply colored full-bodied palate along with toasted hazelnut and thyme. It's unusual but also intriguing and savory.
Name: Alepa 2013 Riccio Bianco Pallagrello Bianco (Terre del Volturno)

Description: Enticing scents of hawthorn, Spanish broom, Mediterranean brush and a whiff of the sea escape out of the glass. On the palate, flinty mineral accents yellow pear, citrus and a honey note while toasted hazelnut graces the close.
Name: San Giovanni 2015 Fiano (Paestum)

Description: Delicate aromas of toasted hazelnut, citrus peel and wild flower lift out of the glass. The linear elegant palate delivers crushed herb, yellow apple, almond and savory mineral set against crisp acidity.
Name: San Salvatore 1988 2016 Pian di Stio Fiano (Paestum)

Appellation: Lacryma Christi del Vesuvio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with aromas of Mediterranean scrub, sea breeze and citrus peel. The vibrant savory palate doles out lemon, pineapple, wild fennel and saline set against vibrant acidity.
Name: Casa Setaro 2016 Munazei Caprettone (Lacryma Christi del Vesuvio)

Appellation: Falanghina del Sannio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Deeply yellow colored, this opens with aromas of Spanish broom, bread crust and mature tropical fruit. On the savory palate, tangy acidity lifts ripe peach, yellow pear, orange peel and wild herb. A smoky mineral note graces the finish.
Name: Rossovermiglio 2016  Falanghina del Sannio

Description: Planted on original rootstocks, this vibrant linear white shows flair and finesse. It opens with aromas of sea breeze, wet stone and orchard fruit that carry over to the racy palate along with pear and lemon. Crisp acidity provides the backbone while a tangy saline note backs up the finish.
Name: Salvatore Martusciello 2016 Sette Vulcani Falanghina (Campi Flegrei)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Smoke, yellow stone fruit and a whiff of Spanish broom lead the nose. Bright and savory, the enveloping juicy palate delivers yellow apple, lemon and toasted hazelnut alongside fresh acidity and a flinty note.
Name: Torricino 2016  Fiano di Avellino

Description: Citrus blossom, peach and white stone fruit aromas lift out of the glass. The juicy savory palate doles out yellow pear, apple, crushed herb and white almond alongside crisp acidity.
Name: Di Meo 2017 G  (Greco di Tufo)

Description: Inviting aromas of Mediterranean brush, yellow peach and pineapple follow over to the tangy palate along with lemon and crushed fennel. It's fresh, with bright acidity while a savory saline note backs up the crisp finish.
Name: La Sibilla 2016 Falanghina (Campi Flegrei)

Appellation: Falanghina del Sannio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Honeysuckle and tropical fruit aromas leap out of the glass. On the tangy medium-bodied palate, bright acidity balances yellow peach, pineapple and yellow pear while a hint of white almond backs up the close.
Name: Fontanavecchia 2016 Taburno  (Falanghina del Sannio)

Description: Packaged in an extremely heavy bottle, this offers subtle aromas of banana, pineapple, wild herb and a whiff of toast. The aromas follow over to the rounded palate along with a hint of bitter almond while a saline note marks the finish.
Name: Quintodecimo 2016 Via del Campo Falanghina (Irpinia)

Description: You'll find delicate scents of acacia, honey and hazelnut on this savory medium-bodied white. The elegant rounded palate offers ripe yellow pear, tangy tangerine and white almond alongside fresh acidity. A mineral note reminiscent of crushed oyster shell graces the finish.
Name: San Salvatore 1988 2016 Trentenare Fiano (Paestum)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Yellow spring flower, citrus blossom and white stone-fruit aromas lead the way. On the elegant linear palate, fresh acidity lifts yellow pear, golden apple and a hint of honey. A hazelnut note signals the close.
Name: Tenuta Sarno 1860 2016  Fiano di Avellino

Appellation: Falanghina del Beneventano, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Enticing aromas suggesting white spring flower, yellow stone fruit and pineapple lead the way. The savory tangy palate delivers white peach, yellow apple, almond and citrus alongside bright acidity. A white almond note marks the close.
Name: Villa Raiano 2016  Falanghina del Beneventano

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Delicate scents of white flower, yellow stone fruit and citrus drift out of the glass. The bright, linear palate offers white peach, yellow apple and a lemon note alongside tangy acidity.
Name: Villa Raiano 2016  Greco di Tufo

Description: Delicate scents evoking smoke, toast, Mediterranean brush and citrus zest slowly take shape in the glass. On the lean but elegantly structured palate, a bitter-almond note underscores acacia honey, lemon and fennel while a sea brine note closes the finish.
Name: Tempa di Zoè 2016 Asterias Fiano (Campania)

Appellation: Terre del Volturno, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of toasted nut, dried herb, oak and a whiff of orchard fruit lead the way. The aromas follow through to the vibrant medium-bodied palate along with citrus zest and fresh acidity. A bitter-almond note signals the close.
Name: Terre del Principe 2016 Le Sèrole Pallagrello Bianco (Terre del Volturno)

Appellation: Falanghina del Sannio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Tropical fruit, honeysuckle and yellow stone-fruit aromas drift out of the glass. The full-bodied, almost syrupy palate delivers juicy yellow peach, nectarine zest and pineapple. Fresh acidity brightens the rich flavors while a honeyed almond note marks the close.
Name: Torre a Oriente 2016 Siriana  (Falanghina del Sannio)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of fragrant white flower, wild herb and a whiff of tropical fruit lead the nose. The juicy palate doles out yellow pear, white peach and nectarine set against bright acidity. A tangy hint of saline caps the finish.
Name: Agricola Bellaria 2016 Oltre  (Greco di Tufo)

Description: Aromas of fragrant white flower, wild herb and a whiff of tropical fruit lead the nose. The juicy palate doles out yellow pear, white peach and nectarine set against bright acidity. A tangy hint of saline caps the finish.
Name: Capolino Perlingieri 2015 Vento Greco (Campania)

Appellation: Falanghina del Sannio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Tropical fruit, honeysuckle and yellow stone-fruit aromas drift out of the glass. The full-bodied, almost syrupy palate delivers juicy yellow peach, nectarine zest and pineapple. Fresh acidity brightens the rich flavors while a honeyed almond note marks the close.
Name: Torre a Oriente 2016 Siriana  (Falanghina del Sannio)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Delicate scents of white flower, yellow stone fruit and citrus drift out of the glass. The bright, linear palate offers white peach, yellow apple and a lemon note alongside tangy acidity.
Name: Villa Raiano 2016  Greco di Tufo

Description: Delicate scents of citrus blossom and white stone fruit float out of the glass. The juicy palate doles out white peach, green apple and a hint of citrus zest alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Capolino Perlingieri 2016 Preta Falanghina (Campania)

Description: Toasted hazelnut aromas follow over to the lean, linear palate along with mature yellow apple, lemon peel and honey. A smoky note lingers on the finish. It's unusual but intriguing.
Name: Cautiero 2016 Erba Bianca Fiano (Campania)

Appellation: Falanghina del Sannio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Enticing scents evoking white spring flower, Spanish broom and yellow stone fruit lead the way. On the fresh savory palate, a hint of honeyed almond backs up ripe pear and citrus while a saline-like mineral note marks the close.
Name: Mustilli 2016 Sant'Agata dei Goti Vigna Segreta  (Falanghina del Sannio)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with heady aromas of honeysuckle, jasmine and tropical fruit. On the bright elegant palate, fresh acidity lifts yellow pear, grapefruit and a hint of honey while a hazelnut note closes the finish.
Name: Villa Matilde 2017 Tenute di Altavilla  (Fiano di Avellino)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of citrus, Mediterranean scrub and orchard fruit waft from the glass. The tangy linear palate offers juicy grapefruit, yellow apple, sage and a hint of saline set against crisp acidity.
Name: Peppe Buio 2016 Astreo  (Greco di Tufo)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This has a subdued nose that eventually reveals subtle whiffs of Mediterranean herb and acacia flower. The medium-bodied palate offers toasted hazelnut, citrus zest, pineapple and honey alongside tangy acidity.
Name: Quintodecimo 2016 Exultet  (Fiano di Avellino)

Appellation: Asprinio di Aversa, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: White spring flower, orchard fruit and citrus aromas lead the nose on this bright wine. The zesty palate presents lemon zest, pear and a hint of mineral alongside bright acidity. It closes crisp and clean.
Name: Tenuta Fontana 2016 Civico  (Asprinio di Aversa)

Appellation: Falanghina del Sannio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Honeysuckle and yellow stone fruit aromas meld with a whiff of Mediterranean herb. The bright palate doles out ripe yellow peach, pineapple and crushed sage alongside bright acidity.
Name: Terre Stregate 2016 Svelato  (Falanghina del Sannio)

Description: Made entirely with Caprettone, this has delicate aromas of acacia honey, beeswax and Mediterranean herb that follow over to the bright palate along with juicy tangerine zest and yellow apple. Vibrant acidity brightens the rich flavors.
Name: Cantine Olivella 2016 Bianco Emblema Caprettone (Vesuvio)

Appellation: Catalanesca del Monte Somma, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Made with 100% Catalanesca, this offers delightful aromas of acacia flower, Spanish broom and beeswax. The lively palate doles out mature apricot, tangerine zest, white pepper alongside vibrant acidity. A tangy mineral note wraps up the close.
Name: Cantine Olivella 2016 Katà Catalanesca (Catalanesca del Monte Somma)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: White spring flower, citrus blossom, Mediterranean brush and white stone-fruit aromas lead the nose. Bright and linear, the crisp palate offers Anjou pear, lemon zest, smoky flint and saline set against vibrant acidity.
Name: Le Masciare 2016  Greco di Tufo

Description: Delicate scents of honey and ripe citrus rind meander over to the ripe rounded palate along with dried yellow peach. A nutty note signals the close. Drink soon to capture the remaining fruit and freshness.
Name: Cautiero 2015 Erba Bianca Fiano (Campania)

Description: Aromas of orchard fruit, Spanish broom and a whiff of toast lead the nose on this vibrant white. On the linear palate, bright acidity lifts pineapple, citrus zest and white peach.
Name: Cautiero 2016 Trois Greco (Sannio)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of tropical fruit, banana and peach follow through to the palate together with citrus zest. Tangy mineral and bright acidity energize the finish.
Name: Donnachiara 2016  Greco di Tufo

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Smoke, dried aromatic herb, Mediterranean scrub, yellow stone fruit and a whiff of toasted hazelnut aromas carry over to the linear palate along with a note of acacia honey. Fresh acidity balances the flavors while a bitter almond note marks the close.
Name: Vigne Guadagno 2014  Fiano di Avellino

Description: White spring flower, white stone-fruit, banana and tropical fruit aromas leap out of the glass. Reflecting the nose, the palate offers white peach, pineapple and green melon alongside bright acidity.
Name: Villa Matilde 2017 Rocca dei Leoni Falanghina (Roccamonfina)

Description: Aromas of honeysuckle and tropical fruit leap out of the glass on this fragrant white. The generous palate doles out green apple, honeydew melon and white almond alongside bright acidity.
Name: Mustilli 2016 Sant'Agata dei Goti Greco (Sannio)

Description: Aromas of Mediterranean scrub, spring wild flower and a hint of citrus rind delicately waft out of the glass. On the palate, fresh acidity accompanies yellow apple, white almond and a drop of acacia honey.
Name: Capolino Perlingieri 2016 Nembo Fiano (Campania)

Description: This opens with aromas of honeysuckle, exotic fruit and ripe pear. The bright, palate offers Gala apple, white almond, and lemon zest set against fresh acidity. A mineral note closes on the crisp clean finish.
Name: Casa Setaro 2016 Fontanelle Falanghina (Campania)

Description: Exotic fruit, yellow stone-fruit and white spring flower aromas lead the nose on this young, fruity white. On the light-bodied juicy palate, fresh acidity lifts ripe white peach and pineapple.
Name: Di Meo 2017 S Falanghina (Campania)

Description: Aromas of fragrant white flower and tropical fruit practically leap out of the glass. The rounded palate doles out pineapple, candied nectarine zest and apricot alongside tangy acidity.
Name: Donnachiara 2016 Resilienza Falanghina (Beneventano)

Description: Delicately scented, this offers aromas of Spanish broom, Mediterranean scrub and yellow stone fruit. On the medium-bodied palate, tangy acidity supports mature yellow apple, lemon zest and a hint of toasted hazelnut.
Name: Antonio Caggiano 2016 Falanghina (Campania)

Description: Aromas of sea brine, brimstone, crushed rock and citrus lead the nose. Light bodied and linear, the fresh palate offers lemon-lime, yellow pear and a savory hint of saline alongside bright acidity.
Name: Cantine Astroni 2016 Colle Imperatrice Falanghina (Campi Flegrei)

Appellation: Catalanesca del Monte Somma, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Made with 100% Catalanesca, this opens with heady aromas of fragrant yellow flower, exotic fruit and citrus. The vibrant light-bodied palate offers white grapefruit, pineapple and saline. It closes on a bitter-almond note.
Name: Cantine Olivella 2016 Summa Catalanesca (Catalanesca del Monte Somma)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with aromas of white flower, white stone fruit and a whiff of ripe citrus peel. The crisp palate offers yellow apple and tangy lemon alongside vibrant acidity.
Name: Tenuta Cavalier Pepe 2016  Greco di Tufo

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of hawthorn and tropical fruit leap from the glass. On the tangy palate, bright acidity lifts ripe white peach, yellow pear and tangerine while a white-almond note marks the close.
Name: Villa Matilde 2017 Tenute di Altavilla  (Greco di Tufo)

Description: Spanish broom, hazelnut and citrus aromas lead the nose. On the vibrant linear palate, a bitter-almond note underscores lemon zest, pineapple and a hint of yellow apple.
Name: La Fortezza 2016 Fiano (Sannio)

Description: White spring flower, ripe orchard fruit and Mediterranean brush aromas lead the nose on this fragrant white. The vibrant palate doles out ripe peach, green apple and juicy citrus alongside crisp acidity.
Name: La Fortezza 2016 Greco (Sannio)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Spanish broom, citrus and yellow stone-fruit aromas lead the nose. On the linear, rather light-bodied palate, a honeyed mineral note underscores yellow pear and grapefruit while a hint of hazelnut backs up the finish.
Name: Di Meo 2017  Fiano di Avellino

Appellation: Falanghina del Sannio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Fragrant wild flower, yellow stone-fruit and wild herb aromas come together on this. The medium-bodied palate offers dried apricot, orange peel and a hint of bitter almond alongside tangy acidity.
Name: Torre a Oriente 2015 Biancuzita  (Falanghina del Sannio)

Description: Aromas of tropical fruit and honeysuckle lead the nose. The fruity palate doles out pineapple, honeydew melon and yellow apple set against tangy acidity.
Name: Villa Matilde 2017 Falanghina (Roccamonfina)

Description: Linear and bright, this has delicate aromas of pineapple and yellow stone fruit that follow over to the palate. Fresh acidity gives it a clean finish.
Name: Tenuta Cavalier Pepe 2016 Bianco di Bellona Coda di Volpe (Irpinia)

Description: Aromas of chamomile flower and a whiff of toasted hazelnut follow over to the palate along with baked apple and citrus. It closes on a pleasantly bitter note.
Name: Agricola Bellaria 2016 Ottant'anni Coda di Volpe (Irpinia)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This has a rather subdued nose offering hints of wild flower and citrus. On the palate, bright acidity underscores yellow apple, lemon zest and a hint of green melon while a suggestion of white almond adds interest before the quick finish.
Name: I Capitani 2017 Serum  (Greco di Tufo)

Description: Aromas of Spanish broom and yellow stone fruit lift out of the glass. The bright straightforward palate offers yellow pear, and a hint of lime alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Agricola Bellaria 2016 Falanghina (Irpinia)

Description: Delicate scents of yellow spring flower and yellow peach lift out of the glass. The rounded, rather mature palate offers dried apricot and tangy lemon zest alongside a hint of bitter almond.
Name: Alois 2016 Caulino Falanghina (Campania)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Subdued aromas of acacia and yellow stone fruit follow over to the linear, slightly lean palate along with hints of pineapple and chestnut honey. It closes quickly on a bitter almond note.
Name: Manimurci 2017 Nepente  (Fiano di Avellino)

Description: Lightly scented, this has fruity aromas suggesting citrus and a whiff of orchard fruit. The palate offers ripe white peach and tangerine zest alongside bright acidity.
Name: Masseria Frattasi 2016 Greco (Beneventano)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This has delicate aromas of white spring flower and a whiff of white stone fruit. The fresh light-bodied palate offers Bartlett pear and a hint of lemon zest alongside bright acidity.
Name: Tenuta Cavalier Pepe 2016 Refiano  (Fiano di Avellino)

Description: The shy nose eventually reveals whiffs of spring flower and white stone fruit. On the palate, fresh acidity brightens pineapple, grapefruit and a hint of bitter almond.
Name: Antica Masseria del Sigillo 2016 Sigillo Apio Fiano (Campania)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Subtle whiffs of stone fruit and citrus waft out of the glass. The light-bodied tangy palate offers pineapple, citrus and a hint of yellow pear alongside bright acidity.
Name: Torricino 2016  Greco di Tufo

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: The nose is quite shy but eventually reveals subtle whiffs suggesting orchard fruit and crushed rock. The medium-bodied palate is straightforward, offering peach and a saline note accompanied by fresh acidity.
Name: Amarano 2015 Cardenio  (Greco di Tufo)

Appellation: Lacryma Christi del Vesuvio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Made with Caprettone, this opens with aromas of white flower, citrus and honey that carry over to the palate along with a bitter-almond note. It's lean but graceful, with vibrant acidity.
Name: Cantine Olivella 2016 Bianco Caprettone (Lacryma Christi del Vesuvio)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with subtle scents of Spanish broom, yellow pear and a whiff of hazelnut. It's vibrant and linear, with bright acidity that supports yellow apple and lemon.
Name: Amarano 2016 Dulcinea  (Fiano di Avellino)

Description: Aromas of sea brine and citrus lead the nose. The linear light-bodied palate shows bitter almond, ripe yellow apple skin, thyme and saline.
Name: Contrada Salandra 2015 Falanghina (Campi Flegrei)

Appellation: Falanghina del Sannio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of banana, exotic fruit and honeysuckle follow over to the juicy easygoing palate along with yellow apple and citrus. Fresh acidity lifts the fruity flavors.
Name: La Fortezza 2016 Taburno  (Falanghina del Sannio)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This has a shy nose but the palate offers ripe orchard fruit, citrus and a hint of honey in a glycerin-like texture. Tangy acidity provides freshness.
Name: Manimurci 2017 Zagreo  (Greco di Tufo)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of toasted hazelnut, white stone fruit and spring wild flower lead the nose. The lean fresh palate offers suggestions of yellow apple skin, smoky flint and a hint of acacia honey.
Name: Agricola Bellaria 2016  Fiano di Avellino

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This has subdued aromas evoking spring flower and orchard fruit. The ripe palate offers suggestions of yellow apple and pineapple alongside fresh acidity. A note of bitter almond marks the close.
Name: Amarano 2016 Cardenio  (Greco di Tufo)

Appellation: Falanghina del Sannio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromatic herb, yellow flower and a whiff of stone fruit aromas take shape on this golden-colored wine. It's full bodied but not overly expressive, evoking suggestions of pear, peach and tangerine rind alongside fresh acidity. A salty note marks the finish.
Name: Cautiero 2016 Fois  (Falanghina del Sannio)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Acacia, chamomile, tropical fruit and a whiff of roasted nut aromas lead the nose. On the linear palate, fresh acidity brightens pear, pineapple and hints of bitter almond.
Name: Le Masciare 2016  Fiano di Avellino

Appellation: Falanghina del Sannio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This simple white wine offers flavors suggesting nectarine, pineapple and candied citrus slice. It's bright, with fresh acidity.
Name: Masseria Frattasi 2016 Bonea  (Falanghina del Sannio)

Appellation: Falanghina del Sannio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Subdued aromas of grapefruit, pineapple and a whiff of toast lead the nose. On the rounded, rather syrupy palate, fresh acidity lifts flavors reminiscent of candied orange slice.
Name: Masseria Frattasi 2016 Donna Laura  (Falanghina del Sannio)

Description: Aromas of exotic fruit, banana and a whiff of wild herb lead the nose. The round ripe palate offers candied notes, passion fruit and vanilla.
Name: I Capitani 2017 Clarum Falanghina (Irpinia)

Appellation: Colli di Salerno, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Delicate aromas of acacia and honey lead the nose. The simple light palate offers yellow apple skin and lemon alongside brisk acidity.
Name: Borgo Giulia 2016 Cruàra Fiano (Colli di Salerno)

Description: Subdued aromas suggesting brimstone, flint and a whiff of paraffin slowly emerge in the glass. The lean evolved palate evokes hints of dried yellow stone fruit and orange rind while a saline note marks the close. Drink soon to capture the remaining fruit sensations.
Name: Cantine Astroni 2012 Strione Falanghina (Campania)

Description: Aromas of citrus, vanilla and a hint of Mediterranean brush carry over to the palate alongside fresh acidity. Candied sensations weigh down the close.
Name: Masseria Frattasi 2016 Nymphis Sacrae Coda di Volpe (Beneventano)

Appellation: Falanghina del Sannio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This simple white is shy on aromas, eventually revealing a whiff of spring flower. It's extremely simple, offering suggestions vanilla and a hint of candied fruit.
Name: Masseria Frattasi 2016 Taburno  (Falanghina del Sannio)

Description: This has subtle aromas of white and yellow stone fruit that follow over to the simple, dilute palate. Fresh acidity gives it a slightly tangy sensation before a quick close.
Name: Amarano 2016 Lucinda Coda di Volpe (Irpinia)

Description: Subdued aromas suggesting white stone fruit and citrus take shape on this. The scents reappear briefly on the palate along with notes of bitter almond and acacia honey before an abrupt close.
Name: Amarano 2015 Coda di Volpe (Irpinia)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Subdued aromas of toasted nut and honey follow through to the lean racy palate along with tart citrus and firm acidity. It closes on a bitter almond note.
Name: Case d'Alto 2016  Fiano di Avellino

Appellation: Falanghina del Sannio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Light aromas of white spring flower and a whiff of tropical fruit lead the nose while the simple palate offers candied lemon and canned pineapple packed in syrup. A bitter note marks the close.
Name: Manimurci 2017 Falange  (Falanghina del Sannio)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of vanilla and tropical fruit lead the nose. The saccharine palate offers an unusual and rather cloying combination evoking vanilla frosting and orange-flavored children's aspirin.
Name: I Capitani 2017 Gaudium  (Fiano di Avellino)

Description: This opens with aromas of ripe citrus, powdered sage, vanilla and a whiff of plastic. The muddled aromas carry over to the lean bitter palate along with an almond note.
Name: Masseria Frattasi 2016 Fiano (Beneventano)

Description: This has pungent aromas suggesting overripe citrus rind and a funky whiff of cut flowers past their prime. The thin diluted palate shows lemon and yellow apple skin alongside bitter undertones.
Name: Case d'Alto 2016 Bianco d'Alto Fiano (Campania)

Description: Deeply colored yellow, this has seen better days for sure. It opens with a nose suggesting graphite, smoke and tar that carry over to the palate along with the barest hint of nectarine zest and mineral. Way past its prime, it's still standing, but barely.
Name: Cantine Astroni 2011 Strione Falanghina (Campania)

Description: Made with the native grape of the same name, this enticing sparkler from Campania opens with delicate, intriguing scents of spring wild flower, citrus and white stone fruit. Mirroring the nose, the vibrant palate doles out ripe pear, apple, candied nectarine peel and bread crust framed in bright acidity and small elegant bubbles. Lemon and mineral notes linger on the close.
Name: Casa Setaro 2014 Metodo Classico Caprettone (Vino Spumante)

Description: Delicately scented, this offers scents of white wild flower, citrus blossom, acacia and a whiff of bread crust. Made with organically farmed Durella grapes, the vibrant, elegantly sparkling palate evokes tangerine, mineral and a light hint of honey before a bone-dry finish. Tangy acidity and a refined mousse provide finesse and energy.
Name: Fongaro 2012 Pas Dosé Metodo Classico Durella (Vino Spumante)

Description: Delicate scents of wild flower and beeswax waft out of the glass. The dry, foaming palate offers ripe pear, yellow apple, white almond and a hint of mineral alongside crisp acidity. It finishes bone dry.
Name: Bisson 2015 Glera (Vino Spumante)

Appellation: Vino Bianco d'Italia, Italy Other, Italy
Description: Made with Incrocio Manzoni grapes, this has heady aromas of white rose, ground clove and citrus. The vibrant rounded palate doles out grapefruit, candied lemon drop and a hint of nutmeg alongside tangy acidity. It's an unusual and enjoyable wine.
Name: Pratello 2015 Lieti Conversari Incrocio Manzoni (Vino Bianco d'Italia)

Description: This sparkling Arneis has aromas of mature yellow apple skin, acacia and dried apricot. The aromas carry over to the brisk palate along with an orange zest note.
Name: Malvirà NV Rive Gauche Metodo Charmat Arneis (Vino Spumante)

Description: Citrus blossom and yellow stone-fruit aromas lead the way on this bright white. On the straightforward palate, tangy acidity brightens juicy peach and nectarine.
Name: Poggio al Tufo 2016 Vermentino (Toscana)

Appellation: Ribbon Ridge, Willamette Valley, Oregon, US
Description: Just a handful of Oregon wineries produce this varietal wine, and one hopes more will follow. Fresh, leesy and rich, with mineral-soaked flavors, this broadens out in the mouth with apple-flavored fruit. There's an appealing note of toasted cracker, peanut shells and a whiff of sea breeze. It's a fascinating wine.
Name: Helioterra 2016 Redman Vineyard Arneis (Ribbon Ridge)

Description: Delicately enticing scents of spring blossom and white stone fruit drift out of the glass. The bright, rounded palate offers white peach, yellow apple and tangerine while fresh acidity lifts the creamy flavors.
Name: Zeni 2016 Marogne  (Lugana)

Description: Tropical fruit and orange blossom aromas lead the nose. The round palate doles out white peach, citrus and honeydew melon alongside fresh acidity. A hint of bitter almond marks the finish.
Name: Feliciana 2016 Felugan  (Lugana)

Description: Made entirely with organically grown Ciliegiolo grapes, this opens with aromas of violet, raspberry and baking spice. On the vibrant palate, velvety tannins support red cherry, cinnamon and vanilla.
Name: La Selva 2014  Maremma Toscana

Description: This opens with enticing aromas of Bartlett pear, chamomile and Spanish broom. The structured savory palate offers white peach, nectarine and a touch of ginger alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Fattoria San Felo 2016 Le Stoppie Vermentino (Maremma Toscana)

Description: Delicate aromas of yellow stone fruit and a yeasty whiff of baked bread lift out of the glass. On the palate, a light almond note underscores yellow peach, candied tangerine zest and white grapefruit. Bright acidity gives it a refreshing finish.
Name: Ancilla 2016 Ella  (Lugana)

Description: Made with organically farmed Vermentino grapes, this offers aromas of nectarine, yellow peach and a whiff of Mediterranean scrub. The aromas carry over to the crisp palate alongside firm acidity.
Name: Fattoria di Magliano 2016 Pagliatura Vermentino (Maremma Toscana)

Description: Made entirely from Verdeca, a white grape of unknown origins which finds its home in parts of Southern Italy, this wine is delicately floral on the nose in notes of orchard blossoms and sweet dried hay. Pithy green apple and pear take center stage on the palate, which shows some textural weight and vibrant acidity.
Name: I Pastini 2016 Faraone Verdeca (Valle d'Itria)

Description: There's a nice vitality to the nose of this wine, with aromas of lemon and grapefruit rinds alongside ripe tones of pear and apple. The palate shows the same verve in ripe yellow apple flavors struck against a core of tangerine and chalk.
Name: Villa Schinosa 2016 Fiano (Puglia)

Description: This opens with aromas of citrus, yellow peach and a whiff of pineapple. The linear, slightly lean palate offers grapefruit, tangerine and a touch of bitter almond.
Name: Rocca delle Macìe 2016 Campo Maccione Vermentino (Maremma Toscana)

Description: Here's a refreshing wine with heady scents of white spring flower and ripe orchard fruit. It has a bright palate, offering white peach, yellow apple and a hint of crushed herb alongside tangy acidity.
Name: Villabella 2016  Lugana

Description: Made from the regional grape of unknown origins, Minutolo, this wine is not bashful with its heady floral and fruity nature. Ripe tropical fruit, grapefruit and white flower tones carry the nose and palate. This is medium in weight with a delightfully astringent texture that helps maintain balance.
Name: Polvanera 2016 Bianco Minutolo (Puglia)

Description: Aromas of toasted nut, bread crust and a whiff of grilled rosemary lead the nose. The aromas carry over to the palate along with yellow apple skin and a hint of coffee while brisk acidity gives it a rather lean finish.
Name: Olivini 2011 Brut Metodo Classico  (Lugana)

Description: Shy aromas of citrus blossom and hay evolve into a round palate of pear juice, grapefruit and more hay tones. Medium acidity counters the weight, giving an overall soft and silken feel to the wine.
Name: Tenute Chiaromonte 2016 Kimia Fiano (Puglia)

Description: Aromas of ripe pear, yellow peach and medicinal herb follow over to the vibrant palate along with yellow apple and tangerine zest. Bright acidity gives it a crisp clean finish.
Name: Monte del Frà 2016  Lugana

Description: Apple peel, grapefruit and riper tropical fruit notions meld with a floral background in this light-bodied, crisp wine. The concentration is light, yet what's there is quite enjoyable.
Name: Masseria Altemura 2016 Falanghina (Salento)

Description: Made entirely from the native grape Ciliegiolo, this opens with aromas of red-skinned berry and cooking spice. The straightforward palate offers raspberry, clove and a hint of white pepper alongside smooth tannins.
Name: Mocali 2016  Maremma Toscana

Description: Aromas of honeysuckle and peach blossom lead the nose. Made with organically farmed Vermentino grapes, the lively palate offers yellow peach and lemon alongside bright acidity.
Name: La Selva 2016 Vermentino (Maremma Toscana)

Description: Lemon balm, herbs and citrus blossom aromas show a nice, clean intensity on the nose. Bright on the palate, with a bit of weight and roundness, citrus pith and fleshy yellow apple flavors meld with more balmy, herbal notes.
Name: Leone de Castris 2016 Messapia Verdeca (Salento)

Description: Lemon and hay aromas carry delicate pollen and floral tones on the nose. Medium in weight and acidity, the palate is yellow-fruit driven, with a grapefruit zest vein of acidity.
Name: Masseria Altemura 2016 Fiano (Salento)

Description: The nose is rather subdued but eventually reveals suggestions of citrus peel, toast and a whiff of medicinal herb. On the lean palate, an unusual sensation of adhesive bandage underscores yellow-apple peel and bitter walnut.
Name: Cà Maiol 2015 Contato  (Lugana)

Description: Subdued aromas of nut, dried apricot and overripe nectarine zest all follow over to the straightforward palate along with a hint of yellow apple. A light touch of almond marks the close.
Name: Tommasi 2016 Le Fornaci  (Lugana)

Description: White peach and citrus blossom aromas take center stage. On the ripe simple palate, a light note of bitter almond underscores mature yellow apple while a note of candied orange drop marks the finish.
Name: Malavasi Daniele 2016  Lugana

Description: Soft aromas of lemon oil, dried hay and crushed stone carry the nose. The palate shows a bit more ripeness in yellow apple and grapefruit flavors, with a mild vein of acidity offering some balance.
Name: Cantina Le Grotte 2015 Selva Della Rocca Falanghina (Puglia)

Description: Aromas of exotic fruit and citrus lead the nose on this soft white. The aromas follow over to the round simple palate along with banana.
Name: Santa Sofia 2016  Lugana

Appellation: Castel del Monte, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Canned peas taking center stage over grapefruit and white flowers in an interesting mix of aromas. There's decent weight to the palate, with bright acidity to boot, yet the flavors are subdued and focus on the citrus and herbal elements.
Name: Giancarlo Ceci 2016 Panascio Bombino Bianco (Castel del Monte)

Description: Reticent on the nose in aromas of struck flint, citrus and pollen, these notes carry to a astringent palate of apple and citrus. Medium in weight, there's just enough mouthwatering acidity to maintain freshness.
Name: Castello Monaci 2016 Acante Fiano (Salento)

Description: Lightly scented, this has subdued whiffs of ripe yellow stone fruit. The simple palate, offers ripe yellow pear and nectarine zest.
Name: Borgo La Caccia 2015  Lugana

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: An exotic treat, this dry wine overflows with mango and marshmallow aromas, has tasty lemon meringue flavors and a soothing, viscous texture that coats the palate. Winemaker Shauna Rosenblum kept the juice on the skins for four days during fermentation, adding to the wine's concentration, layering and complexity as well as a lingering, honeyed finish.
Name: Rock Wall 2016 Del Arroyo Vineyard Malvasia Bianca (Livermore Valley)

Appellation: Sutter County, North Coast, California, US
Description: This is a great change-of-pace wine, rather full in body and rich in texture, but with zesty grapefruit and rose petal aromas and buttery almond-like flavors that are more savory than simply fruity. As if Italian native Fiano wasn't a rare enough grape variety, the winemaker blended in 15% of Coda di Volpe, an even lesser known Italian variety.
Name: Rock Wall 2016 Sicilia Vineyard Fiano (Sutter County)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Almost as pale as water in color, this is a fascinating wine. It starts with aromas of sweet peach blossom, candied tangerine rinds, honeysuckle and white rocks. There is a flash of sweetness on the zippy palate, but it quickly dissipates into a floral Asian pear-laced flavor profile. It is a perfect pairing for sushi.
Name: Di Bruno 2016 Vermentino (Santa Barbara County)

Description: This is a tasty dry wine with effusive flower and honey aromas and mouth-filling mango and banana flavors, all supported by tangy acidity for good balance. It has interesting pairing options, from tapas to shellfish to cheese.
Name: Karine 2013 Laurie's Vineyard Malvasia Bianca (Madera)

Appellation: San Joaquin County, Central Valley, California, US
Description: Wonderfully expressive aromas of rose petals, litchis and yellow peach meet vivid, slightly sweet fruit-basket flavors in this rather full-bodied mouth-filling wine. It has great concentration and keeps the fruit notes humming through the finish.
Name: Deaver 2016 Malvasia Bianca (San Joaquin County)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This dry wine has a vivid gold color and smells earthy at first, but it soon opens up to rich peanut and honey aromas, soothing almond and marzipan flavors and a mouth-clinging texture.
Name: La Folia Winery 2014 Fiano (Sierra Foothills)

Description: Aromas of ripe stone fruit, hazelnut and tropical fruit emerge on this savory, structured white. Refined and full of flavor, the palate doles out juicy yellow peach, apricot and a hint of ginger, while almond lingers on the long finish.
Name: Pieropan 2015 La Rocca  (Soave Classico)

Description: Aromas of citrus zest, yellow stone fruit and crushed rock follow over to the vibrant palate along with Golden Delicious apple, white peach, white cherry and nectarine. A honeyed almond note closes the finish while bright acidity and a refined perlage provide the vibrant, elegant backdrop.
Name: Corte Moschina 2013 Brut  (Lessini Durello)

Description: Alluring scents of white and yellow flower, stone fruit and a whiff of Mediterranean herb take center stage on this silky, savory wine. The luminous palate mirrors the nose, offering ripe apricot, crushed herbs and lemon drop flavors accompanied by a mineral vein and fresh acidity.
Name: Planeta 2016 Cometa Fiano (Sicilia)

Description: Alluring scents of yellow peach, apricot and Mediterranean brush continue to the savory, mouthwatering palate along with chopped herb and nectarine drop. Tangy acidity gives it a bright, refreshing finish while a saline note lingers on the close.
Name: Planeta 2016 Carricante (Sicilia)

Description: Bread crust, dried fruit, crushed herb and acacia aromas carry over to the enveloping, savory palate along with creamy yellow peach, tangerine zest and a hint of toasted almond. Vibrant acidity and an elegant perlage provide energy and finesse. A honeyed nut note and a touch of salt wrap up the dry, lingering finish.
Name: Fattori 2011 Roncà 60 Non Dosato Metodo Classico  (Lessini Durello)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This white opens with heady aromas of white spring flower, orchard fruit and pastry cream. On the medium-bodied palate, notes of white pepper and ginger underscore apple and citrus while mineral and almond wrap up the close.
Name: Rocca del Principe 2014 Tognano  (Fiano di Avellino)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Scents of yellow flower, ripe orchard fruit and aromatic herb lead the way on this round, medium-bodied white. On the savory palate, an underlying mineral note reminiscent of oyster shell underscores mature pear, yellow apple, fennel and a hint of honey. A hazelnut note marks the close.
Name: Villa Diamante 2015 Vigna della Congregazione  (Fiano di Avellino)

Description: Made with native grape Durella and re-fermented in the bottle, this slightly sparkling, savory wine opens with yeasty aromas of bread dough, orchard fruit, citrus and a whiff of crushed stone. Bright and savory, the linear, fizzy palate doles out ripe yellow apple, bread crust and tangerine zest alongside tangy acidity. A bitter almond note softens the bone-dry finish. It's incredibly fun and refreshing.
Name: Corte Moschina NV PuroCaso Sui Lieviti Durella (Veneto)

Description: Made with selected grapes from a single vineyard, this opens with alluring aromas of white stone fruit, tropical fruit, pressed wildflower and a hint of toasted almond. The fresh, tangy palate offers white peach, citrus and green melon alongside crisp acidity.
Name: Mastroberardino 2016 Morabianca Falanghina (Irpinia)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of white stone fruit and spring flower lead the nose while the bright palate delivers green apple, Bartlett pear and citrus alongside a steely mineral note. It finishes clean and crisp.
Name: Mastroberardino 2016 NovaSerra  (Greco di Tufo)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Co-fermentation with 10% Marsanne has added flesh and white peach flavors to the green fruit of this Vermentino. Despite its youth, it's smooth and well-integrated, with a touch of vanilla cream on the finish.
Name: Troon 2016 Cuvée Rolle Vermentino (Applegate Valley)

Description: Extremely light in the glass, this bottling explodes with orange blossom, lemon oil and beeswax on the nose. It's very dry and tight on the palate, where jasmine and apple blossoms dominate.
Name: Birichino 2015 Malvasia Bianca (Monterey)

Description: Cloudy in the glass, Pétulant is redolent with yellow grapefruit aromas, as well as some cut pear. The foam is very aggressive upon sipping, with lots of creamy qualities that are soft rather than sharp. Flavors of sour grapefruit and lemon rind are fun rather than funky.
Name: Birichino 2016 Pétulant Naturel Malvasia Bianca (Monterey)

Description: This crisp, delightful sparkler offers crunchy McIntosh apple, Bartlett pear and candied citrus-peel flavors. Vibrant acidity gives it a clean, quenching finish while small, continuous bubbles lend finesse.
Name: Montesole 2015 Spumante Brut Greco (Irpinia)

Appellation: Falanghina del Sannio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Delicate scents of spring flower and white stone fruit drift out of the glass. The racy, linear palate offers citrus, pear, Mediterranean herb and a saline note alongside crisp acidity.
Name: Montesole 2015  Falanghina del Sannio

Description: Unusual scents of brimstone and smoke combine with Mediterranean brush and ripe citrus zest. The aromas carry over to the palate along with a saline note and bright acidity.
Name: Patria 2014 Stella di Corleone Catarratto (Sicilia)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of citrus, pineapple and orchard fruit lead the nose. The aromas follow over to the fresh palate along with green apple, lime and an almond note. It finishes with a hint of acacia honey and a saline note.
Name: Manimurci 2016 Nepente  (Fiano di Avellino)

Description: Made with Roviello Bianco and vinified in both steel and tonneaux, this deeply colored white wine has aromas of toasted oak, nut and a whiff of citrus peel that carry over to the palate. It's lean in terms of fruit richness, offering tangy sensations of just-squeezed lemon, saline, and a hint of yellow apple skin alongside firm acidity. An almond note closes the bitter finish.
Name: Contrade di Taurasi–Lonardo 2014 Greco Musc' Burlesque Roviello (Campania)

Description: Aromas of orchard fruit and white flower lift out of the glass while the tangy palate offers citrus, yellow apple, saline and a hint of bitter almond. It's racy, with vibrant acidity.
Name: Planeta 2016 Grillo (Sicilia)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: Troon makes a pair of Vermentinos; this is the one with the red label. It's a spicy, peppery white with a funky kick to the finish. A mix of cucumber, lime and apple fruit, it carries a rather surprising leathery scent and flavor. Some tasters will consider that a plus.
Name: Troon 2016 Vermentino (Applegate Valley)

Description: Deep gold in color, this opens with aromas of beeswax, chamomile, acacia and mature yellow stone fruit. The lean palate offers dried yellow apple, lemon and saline alongside bright acidity.
Name: La Sibilla 2014 Cruna Delago Falanghina (Campi Flegrei)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Delicate aromas of apple, nut and a whiff of acacia mingle together while the rather subdued, light-bodied palate shows suggestions of pear and citrus. An almond note gives it a pleasantly bitter close.
Name: Montesole 2015  Fiano di Avellino

Description: Aromas of yellow apple, wet stone and baked bread lead the nose and carry over to the bright, light-bodied palate along with hints of dried herb and lemon drop. A saline note fills in the finish.
Name: Cantine Astroni 2014 Vigna Astroni Falanghina (Campi Flegrei)

Description: Simple and fresh, this informal white has aromas and flavors suggesting tropical fruit and candied citrus zest. A hint of white almond marks the close.
Name: Tenuta Casaletti 2016  Soave

Description: This Malvasia shows a narrow palate of salty, oxidized flavors. On the finish, this is bone-dry in feel.
Name: Covila 2016 Adivino Malvasia (Rioja)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Alluring aromas of beeswax, white spring flower and acacia float from the glass. On the vibrant palate, crisp acidity offsets yellow apple, Anjou pear and nectarine while the slightest hint of paraffin graces the dry finish.
Name: Bucci 2014 Villa Bucci Riserva  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Great balance and a charming lighter character make this lightly floral wine especially enjoyable. The orange blossom aromas and ripe melon flavors are vivid but not heavy as they weave through a smooth yet crisp texture and linger on the finish.
Name: Briceland 2016 Spirit Canyon Vineyard Arneis (Mendocino County)

Description: This wine is smooth, floral and lightly honeyed. With tangy acidity that balances its creamy texture, it's also full, rich and stylish. Produced from the Vermentino grape (Vermentinu in the local dialect), it's generous and ready to drink.
Name: Clos Alivu 2016 Vermentino (Patrimonio)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas suggesting Spanish broom and toasted nut lead the way while the ripe palate shows juicy yellow peach and chamomile. A note of bitter almond wraps up the finish.
Name: Bucci 2015  Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Description: This generous, ripe wine, with its rich apple flavors, is crisp, perfumed and well balanced between acidity and ripeness. Delicious and full bodied, it's ready to drink now.
Name: Clos Venturi 2016 1769 Vermentino (Corse)

Description: This deliciously crisp and tangy wine is bright with acidity. It has a light touch, citrus and pear fruit and lively acidity. Drink this poised, stylish wine now.
Name: Domaine Petroni 2016 Vermentino (Corse)

Description: This ripe Vermentino is warm yet also has attractive, crisp fruit. Apple, pear and apricot notes give it richness, while a shot of citrus adds fine acidity. It's full bodied and will be ready to drink from 2018.
Name: Clos Teddi 2016 Vermentino (Patrimonio)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: More earthy and herbal than fruity, this medium-bodied wine from Calaveras County tastes rich and round on the palate and has a subtle savory character. With two-and-a-half years of aging before release, it shows the nicely mellowing effect of time.
Name: Tanner 2014 Estate Grown Vermentino (Sierra Foothills)

Description: This fruity wine is light with apple flavors and a touch of honey. Its acidity and floral character bring out a crisp texture, and its ripe fruitiness is refreshingly attractive. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Torraccia 2016 Vermentino (Corse Porto Vecchio)

Description: This deliciously crisp wine is full of lemon and grapefruit flavors. It's light, poised and tangy, with a fine burst of acidity that goes right through it. Drink now.
Name: Domaine Vico 2016 Vermentino (Corse)

Description: Somehow, winemaker Luca Paschina manages to make a Vermentino that will make you feel like you are sitting at a café in Liguria. Lush aromatics of pear drop and canteloupe lead into flavors of lemon, green pear, snap pea, button mushroom and sea spray. Well-balanced, this is smooth and fresh, with hints of nuts on the long finish.
Name: Barboursville Vineyards 2015 Reserve Vermentino (Virginia)

Description: Alluring scents of hawthorn, citrus blossom and ripe orchard fruit come together on this lovely sparkler. On the dry palate, nectarine zest and crushed herbs underscore a core of yellow apple and Bartlett pear. It's well balanced, with vibrant acidity and a creamy mousse that lends finesse.
Designation: Cuvée del Fondatore Rive di Col San Martino Brut
Name: Graziano Merotto 2016 Cuvée del Fondatore Rive di Col San Martino Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Appellation: Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze, Veneto, Italy
Description: This gorgeous sparkler offers enticing scents of white stone fruit and spring flower. Vibrant and silky, the smooth elegant, palate delivers crisp apple, creamy white peach and juicy nectarine set against bright acidity and an ultrarefined perlage.
Name: Villa Sandi 2016 Vigna La Rivetta Brut  (Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze)

Appellation: Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore, Veneto, Italy
Description: Delicate scents of white spring flower and white stone fruit curl out of the glass. This is loaded with finesse, delivering creamy white peach, green apple, pear and citrus. Vibrant acidity lends balance while an elegant perlage gives it an irresistibly silky texture.
Name: BiancaVigna 2016 Rive di Soligo Dosaggio Zero  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Appellation: Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze, Veneto, Italy
Description: Fermented in the bottle, this beautiful wine opens with delicate scents of citrus blossom, white stone fruit and a whisper of thyme. Loaded with finesse, the bright silky palate displays Anjou pear, Rennet apple and lemon zest alongside an elegant perlage. Crisp acidity gives it a pristine refreshing finish.
Name: Bisol 2014 Private  (Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze)

Description: This lightly sparkling, terroir-driven wine is loaded with soul and finesse. It's ethereal and bone dry, with delicately alluring aromas and flavors of white spring flower, ripe apple, Bartlett pear, citrus and Alpine herb. Crisp acidity and a silky mousse provide balance and finesse while a mineral note energizes the focused finish. The sediment at the bottom of the bottle adds even more flavor to the last glass.
Name: Ca' dei Zago 2016 Col Fondo  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco)

Description: Fresh, elegant and well structured, this gorgeous white offers heady aromas of spring wild flower, white stone fruit, citrus and an inviting whiff of toasted nut. It's bright and savory, delivering yellow apple, nectarine drop and almond while a saline note wraps around the lingering finish.
Name: Raccaro 2015 Rolat Friulano (Collio)

Description: Citrus, apple, crushed herb and wild flower aromas take center stage on this elegant sparkler. It's bright and silky, with savory Bartlett pear, nectarine zest and hints of thyme balanced by a creamy mousse and vibrant acidity. Thanks to its depth of flavors, finesse and crisp dry finish, it beautifully demonstrates Prosecco's serious side.
Designation: Vigneto della Riva di San Floriano Brut
Name: Nino Franco 2016 Vigneto della Riva di San Floriano Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Here's a smooth, delicious Prosecco that will satisfy both the novice and the sophisticated wine lover. It opens with lovely aromas of pressed wild flower, apple and a whiff of pastry dough that follow through to the palate along with pear, tangerine zest and a hint of almond. An elegant mousse and crisp acidity offset the creamy flavors. It has lingering bone-dry finish.
Name: Mongarda 2013 Dosaggio Zero  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Delicate, compelling aromas of ripe pear, lily of the valley and pressed acacia flower mingle with a whiff of aromatic herbs. The smooth, silky palate delivers yellow apple and white peach alongside a creamy mousse and fresh acidity. A lovely sparker of pedigree and finesse.
Name: Nino Franco 2015 Nodi Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Enticing scents of white flowers and citrus blossom lead the nose of this elegant wine. Silky and crisp, the bright palate delivers yellow apple, pear and a tangy hint of tangerine, framed in vibrant acidity and a polished perlage.
Name: Bisol 2016 Crede Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Heady aromas of white spring flower and mature apple carry through to the creamy palate along with ripe pear and citrus notes. It's balanced, with vibrant acidity and an elegant perlage that lead into the dry, refreshing finish.
Name: Nino Franco NV Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Appellation: Isonzo del Friuli, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Vibrant and loaded with finesse, this delicious linear white boasts alluring scents of white wild flower, citrus and apple. The fresh medium-bodied palate delivers nectarine, lemon drop, pear and a hint of ginger. A savory mineral note reminiscent of saline energizes the lingering finish.
Name: Borgo San Daniele 2015 Malvasia (Isonzo del Friuli)

Appellation: Recioto di Soave Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: Made with dried Garganega grapes, this opens with heady aromas of passion fruit, dried nectarine slices and candied lemon. Concentrated and juicy, the delicious palate doles out peach jam, acacia honey and pastry alongside bright acidity that adds freshness.
Name: Gini 2011 Col Foscarin  (Recioto di Soave Classico)

Appellation: Prosecco Superiore di Cartizze, Veneto, Italy
Description: Creamy and delicious, this elegant off-dry sparkler doles out layers of sweet white peach, yellow apple, pear and a tangy note of candied lemon drop. A silky perlage gives it a smooth polished texture while bright acidity lifts the rich flavors.
Name: Nino Franco 2016  Prosecco Superiore di Cartizze

Description: Slightly fizzy and incredibly fragrant, this radiant sparkler boasts heady scents of honeysuckle, lemon blossom and white stone fruit. The crisp dry palate delivers green apple, Bartlett pear, citrus zest and a saline note alongside vibrant acidity and lightly foaming bubbles. Fermented in the bottle, it has some sediment at the bottom that adds flavor and complexity.
Name: Case Paolin NV Col Fondo  (Asolo Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Fresh and balanced, this bright savory sparkler delivers mouthfuls of green apple, white peach and lemon peel. Crisp acidity keeps it refreshing while a soft mousse gives it plenty of finesse. It has a dry juicy finish.
Name: Andreola 2016 Dirupo Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Enticing scents of honeysuckle, jasmine and orchard fruit mingle together while the bone-dry savory palate offers apple, pear and tangerine. An elegant perlage and vibrant acidity lend finesse and freshness while a hint of thyme closes the crisp finish.
Name: La Tordera 2016 Oltreval Rive di Guia Zero  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: One of the denomination's benchmark bottlings, this fresh yet creamy off-dry sparkler opens with alluring scents of apple, exotic fruit and white peach that carry over to the silky palate along with candied citrus zest. Crisp acidity brightens the rich flavors and creates a refreshing finish.
Name: Nino Franco 2016 Primo Franco Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Appellation: Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore, Veneto, Italy
Description: Enticing aromas of citrus, spring blossom and white stone fruit set the tone on this elegant sparkler. Bright and polished, the silky palate offers Bartlett pear and green apple alongside vibrant acidity and a silky perlage.
Name: BiancaVigna 2015 Organic  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Appellation: Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze, Veneto, Italy
Description: Enticing scents of wild spring flowers and ripe orchard fruits take center stage on this fragrant sparkler. It's loaded with finesse, boasting creamy apple, ripe white peach and yellow pear alongside a silky mousse, all lifted by fresh acidity.
Name: Bisol 2016 Dry  (Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze)

Description: Citrus, Alpine herb and green-apple aromas carry through to the vibrant linear palate along with lemon zest, Anjou pear and a yeasty hint of bread crust. It's extremely refreshing, with crisp acidity a dry finish.
Name: Mongarda NV Col Fondo Glera (Colli Trevigiani)

Description: Fragrant scents of spring blossom, wild flower and orchard fruit escape from the glass. Silky and elegant, the tangy palate doles out white peach, green apple and lemon drop alongside a refined perlage and refreshing acidity.
Name: Cà di Rajo 2016 Cuvée del Fondatore Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Appellation: Recioto di Soave Classico, Veneto, Italy
Description: This opens with aromas of dried yellow peach, white flower and ripe pear. Made with dried Garganega grapes, the savory palate delivers dried tangerine, apricot jam and a touch of caramel. It has good length and fresh acidity.
Name: Coffele 2015 Le Sponde  (Recioto di Soave Classico)

Description: Fragrant yellow flower, crushed thyme, Bartlett pear and citrus aromas carry over to the dry vibrant palate together with green apple and crisp acidity. Small, continuous bubbles lend finesse.
Name: Case Paolin NV Organic Brut  (Asolo Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Yeasty aromas of bread dough, toasted hazelnut, pressed wild flower and an earthy whiff of brimstone follow over to the crisp palate along with citrus and yellow apple. Made with grapes cultivated according to biodynamic farming practices and fermented with wild yeasts, it's a fascinating expression of Prosecco.
Name: Albino Armani NV Casa Belfi Col Fondo  (Prosecco)

Appellation: Isonzo del Friuli, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Heady scents of elderflower, ripe stone fruit and dried chamomile lift out of the glass. The medium-bodied savory palate delivers creamy white peach, mature apple, citrus and mineral. A nutty note wraps up the lingering finish.
Name: Borgo San Daniele 2015 Rive Alte Friulano (Isonzo del Friuli)

Appellation: Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore, Veneto, Italy
Description: Fermented in the bottle, this opens with inviting aromas of baked bread, citrus and orchard fruit. The dry linear palate delivers lime, green apple and mineral alongside refreshing acidity and a refined perlage. It closes crisp and clean.
Name: Bellenda 2015 Rive di Carpesica Brut  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Made with organically farmed grapes, this opens with alluring scents of honeysuckle, hawthorn and white stone fruit. The silky palate delivers white peach, nectarine and green apple framed in bright acidity and a delicately foaming mousse.
Name: Perlage 2016 Col di Manza Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Delicate, enticing scents of white stone fruit and spring flower drift out of the glass. Bright and creamy, the refreshing palate doles out green apple, white peach and lemon zest set against lively acidity and a silky mousse.
Name: Spagnol 2016 Col de Sas Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Appellation: Prosecco Superiore di Cartizze, Veneto, Italy
Description: Aromas of ripe pear and green apple follow over to the rich creamy palate along with notes of nectarine and glazed lemon drop. Bright acidity provides freshness while a soft mousse lends finesse.
Name: Mionetto NV Luxury Dry  (Prosecco Superiore di Cartizze)

Appellation: Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze, Veneto, Italy
Description: Heady aromas of honeysuckle, jasmine and white stone fruit lead the way on this round semisweet sparkler. On the silky palate, tangy acidity brightens ripe white peach, green apple and candied tangerine slice. A creamy mousse provides the polished backdrop.
Name: Le Colture NV Dry  (Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze)

Description: Fragrant and refined, this elegant sparkler offers enticing scents of hawthorn, wild flower and sliced pear. The vibrant balanced palate doles out citrus, crisp apple and a hint of ginger set against firm acidity and a soft, foaming mousse. It has clean dry finish.
Name: Mongarda 2016 Vigneto Rive Alte Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Delicate scents of wisteria, acacia, herb and beeswax lift out of the glass. It's both lively and ethereal, offering yellow apple, Bartlett pear and a citrus note framed in crisp acidity and silky perlage.
Name: Borgoluce 2016 Rive di Collalto  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Hawthorn, acacia and stone fruit aromas mingle together on this lovely sparkler. Refreshing and refined, the vibrant foaming palate doles out citrus zest and yellow apple offset by crisp acidity and elegant mousse.
Designation: Rive di Colbertaldo Vigneto Giardino Asciutto
Name: Adami 2016 Rive di Colbertaldo Vigneto Giardino Asciutto  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Aromas of white spring flower, mint and orchard fruit lead the way. Bright and silky, the refined palate delivers yellow apple, peach and Bartlett pear set against crisp acidity and a refined perlage.
Name: Ruggeri & C. 2016 Vecchie Viti Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Smooth and fresh, this has delicate scents of wild flower, lemon and a whiff of crushed herb. On the bright, creamy palate, crisp acidity and a polished, foaming mousse offset green apple, white peach and citrus zest.
Name: Terre di San Venanzio Fortunato NV Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Appellation: Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze, Veneto, Italy
Description: Soft and creamy, this polished off-dry sparkler doles out juicy white peach, ripe Granny Smith apple and candied lemon peel. Bright acidity gives it freshness and balance while a silky mousse lends finesse.
Name: Andreola 2016 Dry  (Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze)

Description: Delicate, enticing aromas of fragrant spring flower, crushed herb and white stone fruit float out of the glass. Silky but vibrant, the palate doles out white peach, nectarine zest and ripe apple alongside racy acidity and a continuous perlage.
Name: Bortolomiol 2016 Bandarossa  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Appellation: Prosecco Superiore di Cartizze, Veneto, Italy
Description: Citrus blossom, honeysuckle and acacia honey aromas mingle together on this off-dry silky sparkler. It's bright, creamy and refined, doling out sweet white peach, glazed almond and candied lemon peel alongside a lively polished perlage.
Name: Althéa NV Dry  (Prosecco Superiore di Cartizze)

Description: Creamy and refreshing, this opens with heady scents of honeysuckle, jasmine and mature pear. The bright silky palate doles out honeydew melon, green apple and candied nectarine set against a foaming mousse. Vibrant acidity gives it a clean, crisp finish.
Name: Andreola 2016 Dirup Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: In honor of the firm's 130th anniversary and made in limited quantities, this enticing sparkler offers ethereal scents of fragrant wild flower, apple and pear that follow through to the vibrant, focused palate, alongside a lemony note. It's clean and crisp, with a pristine bone-dry finish.
Name: Mionetto NV Cuvée Anniversario Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Loaded with finesse, this bright creamy wine hits all the right buttons. It opens with lovely scents of acacia flower and white stone fruit while the polished silky palate delivers yellow apple, ripe pear and lemon zest alongside fresh acidity. An elegant mousse lends suppleness.
Name: Montelvini 2015 Montellini Extra Brut  (Asolo Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Citrus blossom, pear and a whiff of wild herb aromas carry over to the palate along with white peach and a hint of lemon drop. It's bright and creamy, with lively acidity and a soft mousse.
Name: Case Paolin NV Extra Dry  (Prosecco Treviso)

Description: Enticing scents of white stone fruit and wild flower guide the nose. Delicately foaming, the linear palate delivers mature yellow pear and Golden Delicious apple alongside vibrant acidity. It closes dry and crisp.
