Designation: Credas Rive di Farra di Soligo Brut
Name: Adami 2016 Credas Rive di Farra di Soligo Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: This has delicate scents of white stone fruit and white flowers. On the palate, bright acidity and lively bubbles provide a backdrop for yellow apple and white peach. A lemon-drop note closes the finish.
Name: Perlage NV Canah Bio Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Aromas suggesting white spring flower, yellow stone fruit and a whiff of thyme lead the way. The bright juicy palate offers ripe peach, Bartlett pear and lemon zest alongside crisp acidity and a softly sparkling perlage. It has a clean, dry finish.
Name: Spagnol 2015 Rive di Solighetto Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Lemon blossom, citrus and white stone fruit aromas delicately lift out of the glass. The bright polished palate doles out yellow apple, creamy white peach, nectarine drop and a hint of crushed herb alongside crisp acidity and a silky mousse.
Name: Loredan Gasparini NV Brut  (Asolo Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Honeysuckle, wisteria and stone-fruit aromas mingle together in the glass while the silky, semisweet palate doles out creamy yellow apple, white peach and a confectionery note. A hint of glazed hazelnut signals the close while the foaming mousse lends finesse.
Name: Merotto 2016 La Primavera di Barbara  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Fragrant white flower and white stone fruit aromas leap out of the glass. On the creamy palate, a hint of crushed herb adds depth to white peach and golden apple. Fresh acidity and a foamy mousse set off the rich flavors while a suggestion of lemon drop marks the close.
Name: Loredan Gasparini 2016  Asolo Prosecco Superiore

Appellation: Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore, Veneto, Italy
Description: Floral scents of honeysuckle and citrus blossom mingle with white stone fruit aromas. The lively weightless palate doles out white peach and green apple framed in bright acidity and a polished perlage. It has a clean, refreshing finish.
Name: Sommariva NV Brut  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Toasted nut and yellow apple aromas segue over to the ripe structured palate along with citrus peel and graphite. A hazelnut note closes the lingering finish.
Name: Ronco Blanchis 2015 Friulano (Collio)

Appellation: Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore, Veneto, Italy
Description: Aromas of crushed thyme and pressed wild flower lead the way on this linear sparkler. Crisp and bone dry, the racy palate offers pear and lime zest set against vibrant acidity and an elegant perlage.
Name: BiancaVigna 2016 Rive di Ogliano Brut Nature  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Silky and fresh, this bright sparkler delivers aromas and flavors of ripe apple, Bartlett pear and creamy white peach. Tangy acidity and a foaming perlage provide the polished backdrop.
Name: Nino Franco NV Rustico Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Fruity aromas of ripe orchard fruit and citrus zest mingle with fragrant spring blossom. The rather sweet palate doles out ripe peach, green apple and a confectionery note. A foaming mousse lends finesse while bright acidity lifts the finish.
Name: Foss Marai 2015 Nadin Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Scents of Rennet apple and white wild flower float out of the glass. Bright and creamy, the palate doles out white peach, Bartlett pear and nectarine alongside vibrant acidity and a silky mousse. It closes crisp and clean.
Name: Villa Sandi 2016 Brut Millesimato  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Citrus, yellow apple and crushed herb aromas lead the way. The vibrant silky palate offers white peach and a hint of nectarine drop alongside lively acidity and a polished perlage.
Name: Case Bianche NV Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Delicate scents of spring blossom and white stone fruit lead the way. The slightly off-dry linear palate shows finesse and freshness, offering white peach, pear and green apple set against crisp acidity and a refined perlage.
Name: Andreola 2016 6° Senso Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Aromas of acacia flower, toasted nut and graphite lead the nose on this serious white. The structured palate offers mature yellow apple, honey, orange zest and almond alongside soft acidity. It closes on a lemon drop note.
Name: Alessio Komjanc 2015 Friulano (Collio)

Description: Aromas of white flower, crushed rock and pear lift out of the glass. Dry and refreshing, the palate offers yellow apple, acacia and a hint of citrus alongside crisp acidity.
Designation: Grand Cuvée del Fondatore Motus Vitae Rive San Pietro di Barbozza Brut Nature
Name: Bortolomiol 2015 Grand Cuvée del Fondatore Motus Vitae Rive San Pietro di Barbozza Brut Nature  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Delicate scents evoking jasmine, citrus and exotic fruit mingle together on this creamy sparkler. On the off-dry palate, crisp acidity and persistent bubbles lift white peach, yellow pear and candied nectarine.
Name: Bellenda 2016 Miravel Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Lovely and fresh, this wine opens with heady scents of beeswax, wild flower and apple. The bright palate offers ripe pear, creamy peach and citrus alongside bright acidity and light mineral note.
Name: Guerrieri Rizzardi 2015  Soave Classico

Description: Creamy and crisp, this boasts enticing scents of hawthorn and black locust flower while the tangy palate evokes tangerine, white peach and green apple. Vibrant acidity brightens the fruit flavors.
Name: Le Colture NV Fagher Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: This opens with aromas of candied ginger, mature yellow peach and toast. Made with dried Garganega grapes, the dense palate delivers dried apricot, acacia honey and a touch of toasted almond.
Name: Trabucchi d'Illasi 2007  Recioto di Soave

Description: Green apple and honeysuckle aromas follow through to the fresh polished palate along with nectarine drop and white peach. Bright acidity lifts the rich flavors while a creamy mousse lends finesse.
Name: Terre di San Venanzio Fortunato NV Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Appellation: Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze, Veneto, Italy
Description: Delicate scents of ripe orchard fruit and spring blossom drift out of the glass. Polished and vibrant, the racy linear palate offers green pear, yellow apple, candied lemon slice and a suggestion of thyme set against crisp acidity and a persistent perlage.
Name: Drusian NV Dry  (Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze)

Description: Aromas of ripe orchard fruit and pressed acacia flower waft out of the glass. On the bright palate, racy acidity underscores yellow apple and Bartlett pear alongside a lively polished perlage.
Name: Santa Margherita 2016 Rive di Refrontolo Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Floral aromas of honeysuckle and jasmine take center stage on this polished off-dry sparkler. On the silky palate, fresh acidity enlivens rich flavors of creamy white peach, candied citrus drop and ripe yellow apple while a refined bead lends elegance.
Name: Le Colture NV Cruner Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Aromas of pressed spring flower, peach blossom and yellow stone fruit take center stage. The dense full-bodied palate offers ripe yellow plum, dried apricot and rosemary honey.
Name: La Cappuccina 2013 Arzimo  (Recioto di Soave)

Appellation: Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze, Veneto, Italy
Description: Aromas suggesting yellow stone fruit and acacia flower drift out of the glass. On the creamy palate, delicate hints of beeswax and almond underscore ripe apricot, apple and candied nectarine. Bright acidity lifts the rich flavors.
Name: Adami NV Dry  (Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze)

Description: Honeysuckle and green apple aromas follow over to the lively palate along with pear and a hint of lime. Vibrant acidity and a lively perlage give it a clean energized finish.
Name: Mongarda 2016 Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Appellation: Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore, Veneto, Italy
Description: Delicate scents of honeysuckle and white stone fruit mingle together on this. It's fresh and polished, with green-apple, white-peach and nectarine flavors balanced by crisp acidity and a silky perlage.
Name: Masottina NV Brut  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Appellation: Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore, Veneto, Italy
Description: Aromas of honeysuckle and green apple continue over to the foaming palate along with creamy white peach and candied lemon slice. Bright acidity lifts the rich flavors while the wine's silky mousse lends elegance.
Name: BiancaVigna NV Extra Dry  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: This opens with subtle aromas suggesting wild flower and orchard fruit. Round and ripe, the palate shows tropical fruit, pineapple and citrus peel alongside a saline note.
Name: Cantina del Castello 2015  Soave Classico

Description: Delicate but enticing scents of white spring flower and pear waft out of the glass. On the refreshing palate, vibrant acidity and small continuous beads underscore yellow apple, lemon zest and a hint of white pear.
Name: Bortolomiol 2016 Prior  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Jasmine, wisteria and white stone fruit aromas lead the nose, while the bright silky palate offers green apple, juicy white peach and citrus. Crisp acidity and a lively refined perlage provide balance.
Designation: Col del Forno Rive di Refrontolo Brut
Name: Andreola 2016 Col del Forno Rive di Refrontolo Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Enticing aromas of wisteria and white spring flower rise from the glass on this fragrant sparkler. The crisp dry palate is more restrained, offering yellow apple and lemon zest alongside racy acidity and a vibrant perlage.
Name: Foss Marai 2016 Guia Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Citrus blossom, wisteria and orchard fruit aromas lift out of the glass. Fresh and creamy, the palate offers white peach, candied nectarine slice and ripe Bartlett pear. Fresh acidity brightens the rich flavors while a silky mousse lends finesse.
Name: Foss Marai NV Strada di Guia 109 Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Made with organically farmed grapes, this boasts alluring aromas of white stone fruit, citrus blossom and a whiff of bread crust. The aromas carry over to the crisp palate along with yellow apple, white peach, lemon and toasted hazelnut. It has bright acidity and pleasantly bitter finish.
Name: Pizzolato NV No Sulfites Added  (Prosecco)

Description: Honeysuckle and green apple aromas follow over to the foaming palate along with white peach and grapefruit. A candied lemon drop note caps off the finish while bright acidity lifts the rich flavors.
Name: Villa Sandi NV Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Alluring scents of wisteria and citrus blossom drift out of the glass. On the palate, fresh acidity brightens green apple, white peach and nectarine while an elegant mousse lends finesse. It has a crisp lingering finish.
Name: Spagnol 2016 Col de Sas Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Floral scents of wisteria and hawthorn mingle with white stone-fruit aromas. On the creamy, rather sweet palate, bright acidity lifts green apple, white peach and candied lemon peel while a confectionery note wraps around the finish. It's polished, with a silky mousse.
Name: Spagnol 2016 Domus-Picta Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Aromas evoking spring wild flower and ripe orchard fruit open on the nose while the vibrant straightforward palate offers green apple and a citrusy note. Bright acidity and a soft persistent perlage provide the backdrop.
Name: Case Bianche 2016 Vigna del Cuc Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Yeasty aromas of bread crust and mature white stone fruit lift out of the glass. Rounded and refreshing, the vivacious palate shows ripe yellow apple and Bartlett pear alongside bright acidity and a firm perlage.
Name: Canevel 2016 Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Citrus, orchard-fruit and spring-blossom aromas float out of the glass. Mirroring the nose, the slightly sweet, creamy palate tastes of white peach, apple and candied citrus peel offset by fresh acidity and a foaming perlage.
Name: Drusian 2016 Millesimato Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: This opens with delicate scents of field flower and white stone fruit. On the creamy off-dry palate, a soft mousse backs up sweet white peach, green apple and a candied citrus note while bright acidity lends freshness.
Name: Andreola 2016 Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Appellation: Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze, Veneto, Italy
Description: Delicate honeysuckle and white stone fruit aromas lead the way on this silky sparkler. The semisweet palate offers ripe white peach, green apple and candied citrus peel alongside a silky mousse.
Name: Marsuret NV Dry  (Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze)

Description: Honeysuckle, lily of the valley and a whiff of exotic fruit aromas take center stage. The silky palate offers sweet white peach, candied nectarine slice and banana alongside a soft mousse.
Name: Terre di San Venanzio Fortunato NV Brut Demi Long  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Here's a lively sparkler loaded with scents of apple and pear. The aromas carry over to the vibrant palate along with lemon and lime. Crisp acidity and a continuous perlage lead into a dry refreshing close.
Name: Tenuta Cà Bolani NV Brut  (Prosecco)

Description: Made entirely with Ribolla Gialla, this has aromas of Abate Fetel pear and white spring flower. The fresh savory palate offers yellow peach, lemon zest and a pleasant note of bitter almond alongside bright acidity.
Name: Ferruccio Sgubin 2015 Ribolla Gialla (Collio)

Description: Entirely stainless-steel fermented and aged, this crisp white for immediate drinking is from a great vineyard site considered ground zero for the variety. Grass, pea shoot and corn aromas lead the way, as its tart, dry apricot and melon flavors beg for oysters.
Name: Via Giusti 2016 Las Brisas Vineyard Vermentino (Carneros)

Description: Made with dried Garganega grapes, this has delicate aromas suggesting dried white flowers, ripe fig and a whiff of cake spice. The rounded palate offers mature apricot, acacia honey and light touch of cinnamon.
Name: Ca' Rugate 2014 La Perlara  (Recioto di Soave)

Description: Delicate aromas of white spring blossom and white stone fruit rise from the glass. On the vibrant palate, a hint of almond adds interest to yellow pear and a citrus zest note. It closes crisp and clean.
Name: Canevel 2016  Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore

Description: Made without added sulfites and with no dosage, this opens on aromas of acacia and honey that lead to the lean palate, along with yellow apple and citrus zest. Racy acidity provides the backbone while a hazelnut note claims the finish.
Name: Bisol 2014 Noso Dosaggio Zero  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Aromas of ripe orchard fruit and citrus zest carry on to the lively palate along with a hint of ginger. Crisp acidity and small continuous bubbles provide a fresh elegant backdrop.
Name: Adami NV Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Honeysuckle and white stone-fruit aromas waft out of the glass. On the bright, creamy palate, a lemon drop note underscores yellow apple and pear alongside vibrant acidity.
Designation: Millesimato Cuvée Tenuta Val de Brun Extra Dry
Name: Astoria 2016 Millesimato Cuvée Tenuta Val de Brun Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Appellation: Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore, Veneto, Italy
Description: Fragrant spring flower, citrus blossom and orchard fruit aromas leap from the glass. The slightly off-dry tangy palate presents ripe green apple, white peach and a juicy note of candied lemon drop offset by crisp acidity and a lively perlage.
Name: Masottina NV Extra Dry  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Spring wild flower and green apple aromas lead the nose. The apple note follows over to the racy palate, joining white peach and citrus peel. Brisk acidity and a vivacious perlage offset the fruity flavors.
Name: Sorelle Bronca NV Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco)

Description: Delicate aromas of white spring blossom and white stone fruit rise from the glass. On the vibrant palate, a hint of almond adds interest to yellow pear and a citrus zest note. It closes crisp and clean.
Name: Canevel 2016  Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore

Description: Made without added sulfites and with no dosage, this opens on aromas of acacia and honey that lead to the lean palate, along with yellow apple and citrus zest. Racy acidity provides the backbone while a hazelnut note claims the finish.
Name: Bisol 2014 Noso Dosaggio Zero  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Floral scents of honeysuckle meld with fruity aromas of white stone fruit and citrus. Mirroring the nose, the vibrant palate evokes green apple, candied lemon drop and a hint of almond alongside a persistent perlage. Bright acidity gives the flavors a nice lift.
Name: Merotto NV Colbelo Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Appellation: Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze, Veneto, Italy
Description: Aromas of honeysuckle and exotic fruit lead the way. The aromas flow over to the rather sweet supple palate along with mature white peach, candied lemon peel and a confectionery note. A soft mousse backs up the rich flavors.
Name: Col Vetoraz 2016 Dry  (Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze)

Description: Aromas of ripe white stone fruit and a whiff of toasted nut lift out of the glass. Mirroring the nose, the lively foaming palate doles out white peach, pear, glazed almond and citrus zest. Bright acidity lifts the rich flavors.
Name: Pizzolato NV Stefany Extra Dry  (Prosecco)

Description: Delicately scented, this inviting sparkler offers light aromas of white and yellow stone fruit along with a whiff of bread crust. The creamy, slightly sweet palate tastes of white peach, candied citrus peel and ripe apple set against a soft, frothy mousse. Bright acidity refreshes the rich flavors while a glazed-almond note graces the close.
Name: Villa Sandi NV Cuvée Oris Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: This opens with delicate aromas of white flower and orchard fruit. The silky, slightly sweet palate offers ripe yellow peach, green apple and a candied note of glazed tangerine slice. Tangy acidity and a soft mousse provide backup.
Name: La Tordera 2016 Rive di Vidor Tittoni Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Heady aromas of honeysuckle, white peach and green apple carry through to the vibrant palate along with lemon zest. It boasts crisp acidity and a lively perlage that lead to a dry refreshing close.
Name: Le Contesse NV Single Frementation  (Prosecco)

Description: Honeycomb, spring flower and citrus-zest aromas guide the nose while the bright polished palate offers sweet white peach, soft apple and candied lemon drop. A creamy perlage provides the soft easy-drinking texture.
Name: Althéa NV Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Aromas of white spring flower and orchard fruit waft out of the glass. On the slightly off-dry palate, crisp acidity brightens white peach, green apple and candied citrus drop, all backed by a continuous perlage.
Designation: Rive di Soligo Mas de Fer Extra Dry
Name: Andreola 2016 Rive di Soligo Mas de Fer Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Appellation: Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze, Veneto, Italy
Description: Aromas of white peach, banana, yellow apple and candied lemon peel carry over to the creamy, rather sweet palate along with a confectionery note. Fresh acidity lifts the rich flavors while a hint of almond gives it a slightly bitter finish.
Name: Astoria NV Arzanà Dry  (Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze)

Description: Aromas of orange peel, ripe stone fruit and a leesy whiff of yeast lead the nose. Refermented in the bottle, the semisparkling palate offers yellow apple, citrus and a drop of acacia honey alongside bright acidity. It finishes dry and crisp.
Name: Adami 2016 Sul Lievito  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco)

Appellation: Suisun Valley, North Coast, California, US
Description: This crisp, dry and elegant wine is light-bodied, with delicate bread dough and flower aromas, citrus flavors and gentle effervescence. It's smooth, clean and delicious.
Name: Onward 2016 Capp-Inn Ranch Pétillant Naturel Malvasia Bianca (Suisun Valley)

Description: Delicate aromas of ripe orchard fruit and bread dough carry over to the dry but lightly effervescent palate along with Anjou pear and citrus. Crisp acidity gives it a clean finish.
Name: Borgoluce NV Gaiante  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco)

Description: Fragrant and refreshing, this opens with heady scents of white spring flower, white stone fruit and a whiff of crushed herb. The bright palate doles out ripe yellow apple, acacia and a hint of almond alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Bortomiol 2016 Ius Naturae Organic Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Acacia, beeswax and ripe orchard-fruit aromas lead the nose. On the palate, a foaming mousse backs up apple, white peach and candied lemon drop while bright acidity lifts the creamy flavors.
Name: Bisol NV Molera Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Creamy and refined, this offers aromas of fragrant wild flower, spring blossom and white stone fruit. The silky palate doles out white peach, yellow apple and candied lemon drop alongside a foaming mousse and fresh acidity.
Name: La Tordera 2016 Alnè Extra Dry  (Prosecco Treviso)

Description: Subdued aromas of ripe orchard fruit and pressed yellow flower slowly take shape on this. The big soft palate shows ripe apricot, candied lemon drop and a buttery note.
Name: Inama 2015 Vigneti di Foscarino  (Soave Classico)

Description: Spring flower, pear and citrus aromas lead the way on this vibrant sparkler. The fruity scents carry over to the linear racy palate along with a hint of yellow apple and crisp acidity.
Name: Foss Marai NV Strada di Guia 109 Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Aromas of spring blossom, pear and a whiff of bread crust eventually emerge on this delicately scented wine. Crisp and clean, the effervescent palate evokes ripe yellow apple, white peach and a citrus note alongside vibrant acidity. Elegant, continuous bubbles dance through to the dry finish.
Name: Giol 2016 Brut  (Prosecco Treviso)

Description: Aromas of wisteria, wild flower and citrus lead the way while the dry refreshing palate doles out yellow apple, Bartlett pear and lemon peel. It has a lively perlage while crisp gives it clean, bright finish.
Name: Masottina NV Brut  (Prosecco Treviso)

Description: This opens with aromas of toasted oak, citrus peel and a whiff of chopped dill. The aromas carry over to the round full-bodied palate along with yellow apple and a hint of ginger while a saline note lifts the close.
Name: Livon 2015 Soluna Malvasia (Collio)

Description: Hawthorn, peach blossom and exotic fruit aromas take center stage. The rich vibrant palate doles out banana, melon, white peach and candied lemon drop. A foaming mousse provides softness while bright acidity refreshes the finish.
Name: Ruggeri & C. 2016 Giustino B Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Refreshing, fun and refined, this crowd-pleasing sparkler offers ripe Bartlett pear, green apple and a hint of nectarine drop. Crisp acidity and a lively perlage give it a vibrant edge.
Name: BiancaVigna NV Brut  (Prosecco)

Description: Aromas of bread crust and lime follow over to the lean bone-dry palate along with a suggestion of pear. It's lightly sparkling and crisp, with some brisk acidity.
Name: De Stefani 2016 Col Fondo  (Prosecco)

Description: Lively and fresh, this off-dry wine doles out ripe green apple, candied lemon slice and peach flavors alongside a frothy mousse. Bright acidity lifts the rich flavors.
Name: Albino Armani NV 1607 Extra Dry  (Prosecco)

Description: Aromas of pring flower, gold apple and Anjou pear lead into the crisp refreshing palate along with a hint of nectarine. Tart acidity gives it a bright, juicy finish.
Name: Ornella Molon NV Brut  (Prosecco Treviso)

Description: Deep-amber colored, this orange wine has aromas of sunbaked earth, brimstone, overripe orange zest and pressed wild flower. The lean but lively palate offers dried nectarine slices, toasted almond and a hint of dried apricot alongside bright acidity. A salty note closes the finish. While lovers of orange wine might embrace this, it's definitely not for everyone.
Name: Miklus 2011 Natural Art Ribolla Gialla (Delle Venezie)

Description: This invigorating sparkler opens with heady aromas of white peach and spring wild flower while the enjoyable palate offers green apple and candied lemon drop. Tangy acidity gives it a crisp finish.
Name: Marsuret NV San Boldo Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Honeysuckle and tropical fruit aromas lead the nose while the vivacious palate offers honeydew melon, white peach and pineapple. Crisp acidity and a lively perlage invigorate the finish.
Name: Maschio dei Cavalieri 2016 Rive di Colbertaldo  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Pretty scents of white spring flower and orchard fruit rise from the glass. The off-dry refreshing palate offers sweet white peach and candied citrus peel alongside bright acidity and a soft mousse.
Name: Masottina NV Extra Dry  (Prosecco Treviso)

Description: Floral aromas of wisteria and jasmine mingle with ripe orchard fruit. On the palate, bright acidity lifts white peach, ripe pear and candied lemon drop. A silky mousse adds softness.
Name: Spagnol NV Extra Dry  (Prosecco Treviso)

Appellation: Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore, Veneto, Italy
Description: Aromas of fragrant spring flower, white peach and a whiff of banana take center stage. Reflecting the nose, the bright palate offers golden apple and hint of candied citrus drop alongside fresh acidity.
Name: De Stefani 2016 Brut  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Honeysuckle and exotic fruit aromas leap from the glass while the somewhat sweet palate offers banana, white peach and a confectionery note of candied lemon slice. It's easygoing, with a frothy mousse.
Name: Col Vetoraz 2016 Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Aromas of yellow apple and a yeasty whiff of bread crust lead the nose on this lightly sparkling, bottle-fermented wine. The aromas carry over to the crisp straightforward palate along with lime, a hint of almond and racy acidity.
Name: Drusian NV Col Fondo  (Prosecco Treviso)

Description: This opens with aromas of ripe orchard fruit and pressed acacia flower. Made with organically grown grapes, the off-dry palate shows candied nectarine drop and mature yellow apple alongside bright acidity.
Name: Mionetto NV Prestige Organic Extra Dry  (Prosecco)

Description: Aromas of beeswax, pressed flower and yellow stone fruit take center stage. The off-dry silky palate doles out mature pear, yellow apple and candied nectarine zest framed in a soft mousse. It closes on a pleasantly bitter note.
Name: Perlage NV Sgàjo Extra Dry  (Prosecco Treviso)

Description: Scents of yellow stone fruit and white spring flower mingle in the glass. The vibrant palate offers crisp apple, yellow peach and citrus drop framed in firm acidity and a lively perlage.
Name: Astoria NV Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: White spring flower and apple aromas lift out of the glass. On the palate, bracing acidity and brisk bubbles offset ripe pear and a hint of thyme.
Name: Althéa 2016 Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Aromas of ripe pear, yellow apple and a hint of almond follow over to the linear bone-dry palate. It's exceedingly fresh, with brisk acidity and a vigorous perlage.
Designation: Rive di Col San Martino Brut 26° Primo
Name: Andreola 2016 Rive di Col San Martino Brut 26° Primo  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: This soft sparkler offers sensations of green apple, white peach and a hint of lemon drop. Bright acidity gives it a refreshing finish.
Name: Borgoluce NV Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Appellation: Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore, Veneto, Italy
Description: Bright and crisp, this bright sparkler has aromas of lime and apple that follow through to the lively palate. Vibrant acidity gives it a refreshing finish.
Name: Bellenda 2016 San Fermo Brut  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Appellation: Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore, Veneto, Italy
Description: Pressed acacia flower, orchard fruit and yeasty bread-dough aromas waft out of the glass. On the lean racy palate, tangy acidity underscores yellow apple, tangerine and bitter almond before a crisp close.
Name: Bellenda NV Cosmo E' Col Fondo  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Honeysuckle and orchard-fruit aromas lead the nose while the bright enjoyable palate offers ripe pear, green apple and candied citrus peel. It's easygoing, with fresh acidity and soft continuous bubbles.
Name: Tasi 2016 Brut  (Prosecco)

Description: Deeply gold-colored, this opens with aromas of oak, bread crust and toasted nut. The scents carry over to the lean palate along with hints of overripe orange peel, a suggestion of dried apricot and a dollop of vanilla. Drink now to capture the remaining fruit and freshness.
Name: Miklus 2014 Malvasia (Collio)

Description: Aromas and flavors of green apple, pear and a hint of citrus drop come together on this bright easygoing sparkler. Lively acidity keeps it fresh.
Name: La Tordera 2016 Saomì Brut  (Prosecco Treviso)

Description: Grassy, floral and herbal, this nice white comes from a well-regarded site devoted to the variety. Melon and fuzzy peach flavors highlight its dry, diluted palate, with moderate acidity.
Name: Portalupi 2016 Las Brisas Vineyard Vermentino (Carneros)

Description: Honeysuckle, almond and orchard-fruit aromas take center stage. On the off-dry palate, fresh acidity brightens green apple, white peach and a citrusy note backed by a soft perlage.
Name: De Stefani 2016 Extra Dry  (Prosecco)

Description: Aromas of wisteria and white stone fruit lead the nose. On the bright palate, brisk acidity and a lively perlage provide a racy backdrop for yellow apple and citrusy notes. A hint of bitter almond marks the close.
Name: Drusian NV Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Floral notes of honeysuckle and acacia lead the nose. On the racy palate, brisk acidity and vigorous bubbles offset ripe white peach, candied citrus and green apple.
Name: Drusian NV Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Delicate scents of spring flower and white peach follow through to the soft foaming palate along with green apple and a hint of candied nectarine drop. Bright acidity gives it a fresh finish.
Name: Val d'Oca 2016 Millesimato Extra Dry  (Prosecco)

Description: Aromas of fragrant spring flower and a whiff of pear emerge on this lively sparkler. The invigorating palate shows Rennet apple and citrus alongside crisp acidity and bracing bubbles.
Name: Soligo NV Col de Mez Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: White flower and ripe pear aromas segue over to the racy palate along with tart apple and a hint of medicinal herb. It's crisp, with brisk acidity, while a note of bitter almond marks the close.
Name: Mionetto NV Luxury Collection  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Green apple and ripe pear aromas follow over to the silky off-dry palate along with creamy white peach and a hint of candied nectarine peel. Fresh acidity enlivens the rich flavors.
Name: Marsuret NV Extra Dry  (Prosecco Treviso)

Description: Aromas of spring wildflower and white stone fruit lead the nose while the foaming, off-dry palate doles out creamy yellow pear and candied citrus peel. Bright acidity lifts the rich flavors.
Name: Brancher 2016 Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Appellation: Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze, Veneto, Italy
Description: Soft and slightly sweet, this straightforward sparkler offers green apple, white peach and candied-citrus-peel flavors. It's bright, with tangy acidity.
Name: Canevel 2016 Dry  (Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze)

Description: Green apple and fragrant spring-blossom aromas leap out of the glass while the enjoyable palate delivers creamy white peach, citrus and pear. It's bright and charming, with crisp acidity and a foaming mousse.
Name: Bisol NV Jeio  (Prosecco)

Description: Easygoing and fresh, this delightful sparkler has white flower and orchard-fruit aromas. The soft, enjoyable palate offers suggestions of apple and pear alongside a foaming mousse.
Name: La Tordera NV Brunei Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco)

Description: Aromas of spring flower, sage and yellow stone fruit lead the nose while the lively palate offers peach, apple and citrus. Racy acidity and lively bubbles provide the refreshing backdrop.
Name: Astoria 2016 Rive di Refrontolo Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: This opens with pretty scents of spring blossom and white stone fruit while the lively foaming palate doles out green apple and lemon drop. It's fresh, with bright acidity.
Name: Adami NV Bosco di Gica Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: White peach, honeysuckle and banana aromas carry over to the bright palate along with a citrusy note. It's fresh and soft, with a foaming mousse.
Name: Col Vetoraz 2016 Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: This straightforward white opens with aromas of chamomile flower and mature orchard fruit that carry over to the ripe simple palate along with yellow apple. A hint of dried herb marks the close.
Name: Monte del Frà 2015  Soave Classico

Description: Bright and savory, this wine opens with heady scents of white spring flower and yellow stone fruit. The light and refreshing palate offers white peach and lemon zest alongside crisp acidity.
Name: Masut da Rive 2016 Ribolla Gialla (Collio)

Description: Honeysuckle, honeydew melon and white-peach aromas follow through to the somewhat sweet palate along with a note of glazed orange zest. Fresh acidity lifts the rich candied flavors.
Name: Sorelle Bronca NV Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: This vivacious sparkler has aromas of honeysuckle and exotic fruit. The bright simple palate offers white peach and green apple set against brisk bubbles and lively acidity.
Name: Cà di Rajo NV  Prosecco Treviso

Appellation: Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore, Veneto, Italy
Description: Here's a lively, informal sparkler with aromas and flavors suggesting green apple, white peach and lemon peel. Crisp acidity gives it a clean invigorating finish.
Name: Baldi NV Brut  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: This easygoing sparkler opens with delicate scents of spring flower and a whiff of ripe orchard fruit. The lively palate shows peach, banana and pineapple alongside brisk acidity and a vigorous perlage.
Name: Cantina Progettidivini NV Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Fun and fresh, this easygoing sparkler offers aromas and flavors suggesting pineapple, green apple and grapefruit. It's crisp, dry and refreshing, with racy acidity.
Name: De Stefani 2016 Brut Nature  (Prosecco)

Description: Stone fruit and citrus aromas jump out of the glass. Reflecting the nose, the lively palate offers green apple, candied lemon peel and a confectionery note alongside brisk acidity and invigorating bubbles. It's simple but well made.
Name: Piera Martellozzo 2016 075 Carati Brut  (Prosecco)

Description: Aromas of spring wild flower and white stone fruit lead the nose on this straightforward offering. The simple palate offers yellow apple and pear alongside brisk bubbles and crisp acidity.
Name: Gino Fasoli 2016 La Corte del Pozzo Brut  (Prosecco)

Description: Citrus and orchard-fruit aromas lead the way. Reflecting the nose, the simple off-dry palate offers ripe pear and nectarine drop alongside bright acidity.
Name: Ruggeri & C. NV Giall'oro Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: This easygoing sparkler has aromas of honeysuckle and apple that carry on to the off-dry palate along with mature yellow peach and candied lemon drop. It's simple but well made.
Name: Biasotto NV  Prosecco

Description: Opening with aromas of ripe orchard fruit, this delightful, informal sparkler offers yellow apple, Bartlett pear and just a hint of beeswax. It's fun and fresh, with brisk acidity and a lively perlage.
Name: Adami NV Garbèl Brut  (Prosecco Treviso)

Description: Citrus, spring blossom and apple aromas follow over to the straightforward easygoing palate along with peach and a candied note. Lively acidity provides the backdrop.
Name: Avissi NV  Prosecco

Appellation: Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore, Veneto, Italy
Description: Aromas of medicinal herb carry over to the slightly sweet, rather simple palate along with ripe peach, green apple, candied orange peel and a confectionary note. Fresh acidity lifts the finish.
Name: Baldi NV Extra Dry  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Aromas of yellow wild flower, pear and grapefruit follow over to the simple off-dry palate along with apple and a candied lemon note. Racy acidity refreshes the rich flavors.
Name: Ornella Molon NV Extra Dry  (Prosecco Treviso)

Description: Fun and refreshing, this vivacious sparkler boasts white peach, banana and pineapple flavors alongside invigorating bubbles. Vibrant acidity gives it a crisp finish.
Name: Cavit NV Lunetta  (Prosecco)

Description: Here's a fun, informal sparkler with green apple and lemon zest flavors. Crisp acidity and a lively perlage give it a crisp refreshing finish.
Name: Tommasi NV Filo Dora  (Prosecco)

Description: Here's a light, refreshing sparkler that evokes ripe pear, white peach and a confectionery note. It's easygoing, with bright acidity and a foaming mousse.
Name: LaLuca NV Extra Dry  (Prosecco Treviso)

Description: Fun and informal, this simple, lightly scented sparker has subtle aromas of apple that carry over to the racy palate along with a citrusy note. Brisk acidity gives it a crisp finish.
Name: Mionetto NV Brut Prestige  (Prosecco Treviso)

Description: Intensely floral aromas of white and yellow spring flower lead the way on this light and fragrant sparkler. The rather lean racy palate isn't quite as expressive as the nose but still offers green pear and tart apple alongside firm acidity.
Name: Bisol NV Belstar Brut  (Prosecco)

Description: Heady aromas of peach and exotic fruit carry over to the refreshing palate along with a citrusy note. It has a lively perlage while crisp acidity gives it a clean refreshing finish.
Name: Zonin NV Cuvée 1821 Brut  (Prosecco)

Description: The nose isn't very expressive but eventually yields subdued whiffs of toasted oak and honey. On the shy palate, suggestions of mature apple, lemon drop and a briny note come through before a rather abrupt finish.
Name: La Cappuccina 2015 San Brizio  (Soave)

Description: This fresh simple sparkler opens with aromas of jasmine and a whiff of citrus. On the soft palate, tangy acidity lifts apple, white peach and a hint of glazed lemon peel.
Name: Bocelli NV Terre Gaie Extra Dry  (Prosecco)

Description: Aromas of exotic fruit carry over to the off-dry palate along with white stone fruit, candied citrus peel and a note of glazed pastry. Fresh acidity lifts the rich flavors.
Name: Andreola NV Vérv Extra Dry  (Prosecco)

Description: Aromas of acacia, bitter almond and mature yellow apple carry over to the easygoing off-dry palate along with a candied lemon drop note. It's soft and simple, with a light mousse.
Name: Canella NV Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Aromas of green apple and Bartlett pear take center stage on this soft easygoing sparkler. The foaming off-dry palate mirrors the nose, offering white orchard fruit and a hint of citrus drop.
Name: Col di Rocca NV Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Opening with subtle aromas of white flower, this lively straightforward sparkler doles out yellow apple and citrus zest. Crisp acidity gives it a refreshing finish.
Name: Caposaldo NV Brut  (Prosecco)

Description: Here's a fun bubbly with delicate aromas of white flower and a suggestion of rosemary. Simple but well made, the refreshing palate offers creamy yellow apple and a candied hint of lemon drop.
Name: Ménage à Trois NV Dry  (Prosecco)

Description: Here's a crisp, no-frills sparkler that offers yellow apple and pear flavors. It's invigorating, with brisk acidity and vivacious bubbles.
Name: Ruggeri & C. NV Argeo Brut  (Prosecco Treviso)

Description: Fun and quenching, this crisp, informal sparkler delivers ripe green apple and pear flavors. Vibrant acidity gives it a clean finish.
Name: Villa Sandi NV Il Fresco Brut  (Prosecco Treviso)

Description: Refreshing and fun, this simple informal sparkler has aromas and flavors suggesting green apple, Anjou pear and a hint of lemon zest. It's brisk and bright, with invigorating bubbles.
Importer: Arel Group Wine and Spirits Inc
Name: Candoni NV Brut  (Prosecco)

Description: Simple and fresh, this informal sparkler has light aromas of citrus and apple. The aromas carry over to the crisp palate along with brisk bubbles.
Name: Voga NV  Prosecco

Description: This offers aromas of yellow stone fruit and pressed acacia flower. On the lean palate, racy acidity frames suggestions of yellow apple skin, lime and salty mineral while a bitter almond note marks the close.
Name: Pagani 2014  Soave Classico

Description: This light simple sparkler offers aromas and flavors of apple, pear and candied citrus zest. Bright acidity refreshes the finish.
Name: Piera Martellozzo NV Blu Giovello Extra Dry  (Prosecco)

Description: Aromas of mature apple and acacia carry through to the simple palate along with a hint of pineapple. It's fresh and informal, with bright acidity.
Name: Piera Martellozzo NV Giade Extra Dry  (Prosecco)

Description: Here's an informal off-dry sparkler offering suggestions of apple and pear. It's fresh and simple, with crisp acidity.
Name: Bolla NV Extra Dry  (Prosecco)

Description: Stone fruit and honeysuckle aromas lead the nose while the simple off-dry palate doles out green apple, peach and candied citrus peel. It's fresh and informal, with bright acidity.
Name: Acinum NV Extra Dry  (Prosecco)

Description: Fun and informal, this extremely simple sparkler offers flavors of white peach, citrus and confectionery note. It's bright and foamy, with fresh acidity.
Name: Alberto Nani NV Organic Extra Dry  (Prosecco)

Description: Simple and refreshing, this slightly sweet wine has aromas and flavors of banana, green apple and candied citrus peel. A soft mousse backs up the rich fruit.
Name: Astoria NV Extra Dry  (Prosecco Treviso)

Description: Aromas of toasted almond and yellow apple follow over to the lean vivacious palate along with citrus zest. It's simple and refreshing, with crisp acidity and a vigorous perlage.
Name: Canella NV Brut  (Prosecco)

Description: On this brisk informal wine, a hint of medicinal herb joins apple and citrus-peel flavors. It's vigorous, with firm acidity and bracing bubbles.
Name: Vinopera Bervini 2016 1955 Extra Dry  (Prosecco)

Description: Fun and refreshing, this über-simple sparkler offers green apple and grapefruit sensations. Racy acidity and vivacious bubbles keep it crisp and informal.
Name: The Vinum NV Le Bollicine  (Prosecco Treviso)

Description: This easygoing sparkler offers subdued aromas suggesting white flower and a whiff of white stone fruit. The simple lively palate offers yellow apple and a slightly candied citrusy note alongside firm acidity and vivacious steely bubbles.
Importer: Arel Group Wine and Spirits Inc
Name: Tenuta Polvaro NV Extra Dry  (Prosecco)

Description: Light and informal, this simple sparkler offers suggestions of candied citrus peel and yellow apple. Bright acidity refreshes the finish.
Name: Lamberti NV Extra Dry  (Prosecco)

Description: Fresh and simple, this slightly fizzy wine offers suggestions of yellow apple and citrus. It's dry, lean and brisk, with firm acidity.
Name: Le Vigne di Alice NV Fondo  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco)

Description: Aromas of white spring flower and citrus zest rise out of the glass while the palate offers ripe yellow apple and a note of candied lemon drop. Foaming bubbles provide a soft backdrop.
Name: Lovo 2016  Prosecco

Description: Delicate scents of Rennet apple and Bartlett pear lead to the lively, somewhat lean palate. It's simple but also crisp and clean.
Name: Montelvini NV Brut  (Prosecco Treviso)

Description: Aromas of hazelnut and mature yellow apple follow over to the no-frills off-dry palate along with a confectionery note. Crisp acidity and brisk bubbles provide a zesty backdrop.
Name: Canella 2016 Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: This opens with aromas of honeysuckle and yellow stone fruit. On the simple off-dry palate, fresh acidity backs up ripe apricot and sweet white peach.
Name: Cantine Maschio NV Extra Dry  (Prosecco)

Description: Aromas of ripe orchard fruit lead the nose on this easygoing sparkler. The bright simple palate offers green apple and lemon zest alongside fresh acidity and lively bubbles.
Name: Casa Girelli NV Canaletto Brut  (Prosecco)

Description: Here's an extremely simple sparkler with a shy nose and flavors suggesting acacia, apple and a hint of green melon. Brisk acidity provides the backdrop.
Name: Cavazza NV Brut  (Prosecco)

Appellation: Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore, Veneto, Italy
Description: Aromas of mature citrus zest and a whiff of medicinal herb carry over to the extremely informal but brisk palate along with bitter yellow-apple skin. It's simple and vivacious, with vigorous bubbles.
Name: Biancariva NV Rive di Collalto Brut  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Appellation: Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore, Veneto, Italy
Description: This extremely informal sparkler doesn't reveal any aromas while the shy simple palate offers suggestions of yellow apple skin and citrus. It's brisk, with firm acidity and vigorous bubbles.
Name: Baldi NV Rive di Ogliano  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: This extremely simple off-dry sparkler has light floral scents and flavors of mature yellow apple and canned pineapple. Brisk acidity and vigorous bubbles offer an edgy backdrop.
Name: Nobilissima NV Extra Dry  (Prosecco)

Description: Aromas of green apple, toasted almond and adhesive bandage carry over to the palate. It's vigorous, with brisk acidity and a bitter finish.
Name: Le Vigne di Alice 2016 Doro Nature  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Acacia flower, almond and yellow apple aromas carry through to the lean, simple palate along with a confectionery note. Pour this at informal get-togethers.
Name: Cavazza NV  Prosecco

Description: Here's an extremely simple, slightly sweet sparkler that offers suggestions of white peach, pear and a candied note. Fresh acidity gives the finish a slight boost.
Name: Amore di Amanti NV Extra Dry  (Prosecco)

Description: Aromas of nut and yellow apple skin follow over to the lean palate along with brisk acidity. It's vigorous, with steely bubbles.
Name: Adria Vini NV Mirabello  (Prosecco)

Description: This informal, slightly sweet sparkler offers yellow pear, glazed almond and candied-citrus flavors. Vigorous bubbles and brisk acidity make up the bracing backdrop.
Name: Bellenda NV Prima Cuvée Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: The nose doesn't give much away but with effort you can detect a subdued hint of yellow-apple skin and dried thyme. The lean palate is diluted, offering suggestions of lemon rind and saline.
Name: La Bellanotte 2015 Lis Surs Turbiana (Collio)

Description: This simple off-dry sparkler has sweet peach, green apple and candied nectarine flavors. It's vigorous, with zesty acidity and brisk bubbles.
Name: Le Vigne di Alice 2016 Damàn Extra Dry  (Prosecco)

Description: This über-simple sparkler has an extremely shy nose while the diluted off-dry palate offers mere suggestions of tropical fruit and a confectionery note. Brisk bubbles provide the backdrop.
Name: Cavicchioli NV Extra Dry  (Prosecco)

Description: This extremely simple sparkler has subdued aromas suggesting adhesive bandage that carry over to the lean, brisk palate along with freshly squeezed lemon and a candied note. It's tart, with bracing acidity and vigorous bubbles.
Importer: Arel Group Wine and Spirits Inc
Name: Carletto NV Extra Dry  (Prosecco)

Description: Made from dried Albana grapes, this dessert wine opens with ripe yellow peach and apricot aromas that carry over to the savory palate together with acacia honey and toasted hazelnut notes. Fresh acidity balances the sweet flavors.
Name: Tre Monti 2012 Thea Passito Albana (Romagna)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Subtle flavors and a great sense of balance will make this low-alcohol but medium-bodied wine versatile before or during a meal. The aroma is quietly fruity and the flavors take on more shape and a little weight, showing white peach and jicama as the texture broadens from a sharp first impression to more fullness on the finish.
Name: Bella Grace 2016 Vermentino (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Description: Acacia, ripe yellow stone fruit and honey aromas lead the way in this wine. The bright palate evokes dried apricot, juicy nectarine and toasted hazelnut alongside lively acidity.
Name: Giovanna Madonia 2015 Neblina Albana (Romagna)

Appellation: Hudson River Region, New York Other, New York, US
Description: While earthy on the nose, the palate of this stainless-steel fermented Tocai offers pretty, primary flavors of apricot, tangerine and rose-petal jam. Luscious in body and texture, it's soft in acidity and finishes with a touch of warmth on the finish.
Name: Millbrook 2016 Proprietor's Special Reserve Tocai Friulano (Hudson River Region)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This dry light-bodied wine smells very fresh—even green—and tastes like tart green apples, white pepper and fresh parsley. It has very crisp acidity and a mouth-puckering texture that will make it a good pairing with raw oysters.
Name: Wilderotter 2016 Vermentino (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Hudson River Region, New York Other, New York, US
Description: The Lollipop Hill designation seems rounder and fuller on the palate than the producer's Special Reserve Tocai. It's not deeply concentrated, but offers shades of ripe yellow apple, plum and lemon flavors. Soft tangerine acidity brightens the midpalate. Drink now through 2019.
Name: Millbrook 2016 Lollipop Hill Estate Bottled Tocai Friulano (Hudson River Region)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: This wine is sweet and syrupy, smelling like honeydew melon and bananas, and tasting a bit like peach nectar. It could be good after dinner with cheeses or a not-so-sweet dessert.
Name: Bella Grace 2016 Bellisimo Vermentino (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Appellation: Finger Lakes, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Swirls of cream, vanilla and caramel enrobe more delicate notes of pressed apple and tangerine peel in this bold, ripe Tocai Friulano. It's a dense, mouth filling wine with a warming, slightly lactic finish.
Name: Ventosa 2016 Tocai Friulano (Finger Lakes)

Appellation: Santa Ynez Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This Italian grape offers extremely consistent hallmarks, and this bottling upholds them with glee, starting with the strong orange blossom kick to the nose, enhanced by lime, honeydew, honeysuckle and slight chamomile. Then the sip is bone dry and extremely racy in texture, with laser-sharp flavors of lime and tangerine cream, leading into a zippy finish.
Name: Refugio Ranch 2016 Malvasia Bianca (Santa Ynez Valley)

Description: From vineyards on the east coast of Corsica, near Lake Diana, this bright Vermentino has a delicate perfume and a tangy edge. Pear and crisp apple flavors dominate the palate. Drink now.
Name: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté 2016 Domaine Petroni Vermentino (Corse)
Winery: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté

Description: This balanced wine shows a delicate flora, white flower character as well as a crisp, tight acidity. Citrus flavors combine with white fruits and refreshing acidity. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté 2016 Domaine Vetriccie Vermentino (Corse)
Winery: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté

Description: This delicious, refreshing wine has crisp acidity and bright red apple fruit. Shot through with with zesty lemon character, it finishes with a waft of white floral perfume. Drink now.
Name: Clos Poggiale 2016 Vermentino (Corse)

Description: This fine Vermentino recalls fresh sea air. With its salty tang, lively acidity and great fruitiness, it is ready to drink.
Name: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté 2016 Domaine Santa Guiletta Vermentino (Corse)
Winery: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté

Description: Peaches, white flowers, white pepper and a hint of crushed walnuts waft on the nose. The palate is shows underripe pear, gummy peach rings and honeydew melon, yet the weight and intensity is a bit restrained. This would be a lovely accompaniment to a mild cheese or soft-shelled crab over crisp greens.
Name: Barboursville Vineyards 2014 Reserve Vermentino (Virginia)

Description: This light, lively and spicy wine has ginger and nutmeg flavors backed by a mineral texture and crisp, citrusy acidity. It's ready to drink.
Name: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté 2016 Domaine Barcelo Vermentino (Ile de Beauté)
Winery: Union de Vignerons de l'Île de Beauté

Description: Overall this Tocai is fairly good from start to finish. Apple and matchstick aromas lead to a wide palate. Apple, peach and persimmon flavors show a bit of salt and finish short.
Name: Alfredo Roca 2016 Fincas Tocai (Mendoza)

Description: Herbaceous aromas and bright citrus flavors give an almost-electric charge to this light-bodied, crisp and appetizing wine. Aromas of snap peas, parsley and fresh-cut grass lead to lemon and grapefruit flavors and a tingly mouthfeel. It's a perfect summer-to-fall drink.
Name: Uvaggio 2016 Vermentino (Lodi)

Description: Made entirely with the native grape Timorasso, this structured elegant white opens with aromas of acacia flower and hay. The bright palate delivers apricot, lemon zest, hazelnut and a touch of ginger while a mineral vein energizes the finish. Enjoy through 2025.
Name: I Carpini 2010 Brezza d'Estate Timorasso (Colli Tortonesi)

Description: Made entirely with Timorasso, this opens with aromas of acacia flower, lemon peel and a whiff of hazelnut. The vibrant palate offers citrus zest, McIntosh apple and a touch of raw almond alongside bright acidity. Drink 2016 through 2022.
Name: I Carpini 2013 Timorasso (Colli Tortonesi)

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: A touch of smoky petrol in the aroma and flavor adds intrigue to this full-bodied, creamy-textured wine. A lot of effort in the winery, including native fermentation, 33% new French barrels and lees stirring helped it have a good sense of depth and richness without being overripe, contributing a mouthflling sensation and lingering finish.
Name: La Folia Winery 2015 Vermentino (Sierra Foothills)

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Fairly light aromas of fresh lemon, nectarine, scratched grapefruit skin and a little chalk show on the nose of this crisp bottling. The palate is all about tension and acid-driven freshness, with pear peels and lime rinds making for a slightly sour sip.
Name: Tablas Creek 2016 Vermentino (Adelaida District)

Description: Made with 100% native grape Cortese, this opens with aromas of apricot, white spring flower and a hint of beeswax. The medium-bodied palate delivers white peach, honeydew melon and a hint of white almond alongside bright acidity.
Name: Fontanafredda 2015 del Comune di Gavi  (Gavi)

Appellation: Vino da Tavola, Italy Other, Italy
Description: Now here's a fun sparkler made with Glera—the grape behind Prosecco—and vinified in amphora. Fermented on its lees that remain on the bottom of the bottle, it delivers lemon peel, lime, smoke and mineral notes alongside vibrant acidity. A saline note backs up the finish.
Name: Casa Belfi NV Colfondo Anfora Glera (Vino da Tavola)

Appellation: Santa Barbara County, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Bright and fresh aromas of Key lime, cantaloupe, light honey and crushed chalk show on the nose of this rarely planted variety, which was bottled by star sommelier Diego Barbieri. It's very dry and tight on the sip, with apple and Asian-pear flavors upheld by a riverstone minerality.
Name: Barbieri 2016 Vermentino (Santa Barbara County)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Golden-yellow in color, this bottling of a rarely planted grape from Italy's Campania region shows soft chamomile and sliced yellow apples on the pleasant nose. Squeezed lemon, light mandarin juice and a touch of walnut oil show on the sip, where the acid rises late and lasts long.
Name: Castoro Cellars 2015 Oakenshield Vineyard Falanghina (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Vino Bianco d'Italia, Italy Other, Italy
Description: Made with 100% native grape Erbaluce, this offers delicate aromas and flavors of ripe pear, green apple and citrus. A salty mineral note closes the crisp, clean finish.
Name: Centovigne 2015 Miranda Erbaluce (Vino Bianco d'Italia)

Description: Fun and refreshing, this opens with aromas of spring wild flower, white stone fruit and a hint of citrus. The vibrant palate doles out white peach, green apple and lemon zest alongside bright acidity and persistent bubbles. It closes crisp and clean.
Name: Feudo di Santa Tresa NV Biologico Brut Grillo (Vino Spumante)

Description: Made entirely with native grape Nascetta, this opens with aromas of white spring flower and a whiff of hay. The straightforward, rather lean palate offers tropical fruit, lemon zest and a hint of toasted hazelnut alongside refreshing acidity.
Name: Serra dei Fiori 2015 La Regina Nascetta (Langhe)

Description: Here's a fun delightful sparkler that gives you yellow apple, Bartlett pear and nectarine zest flavors alongside steely, vivacious bubbles. Firm acidity gives it a crisp finish.
Name: Tenuta Stella NV Brut Ribolla Gialla (Vino Spumante)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with subtle aromas of wild flower and a whiff of exotic fruit. The bright fruity palate offers white peach, apple and a hint of honeydew melon. It's straightforward and refreshing.
Name: Villa Raiano 2014 Ventidue  (Fiano di Avellino)

Description: Made from old vines, this stunning wine opens with heady aromas of ripe apple and fragrant white flower. Round and creamy, the palate delivers Bartlett pear, white peach and nectarine zest alongside fresh acidity. A white-almond note graces the persistent finish.
Name: Tenuta Roveglia 2014 Vigne di Catullo Riserva  (Lugana)

Description: A few swirls of the glass release alluring aromas of mature pear, bread crust and a whiff of yellow flower. Elegant and savory, the medium-bodied palate doles out ripe yellow apple, lemon zest and a pleasant note of bitter almond while a mineral note adds energy. It's fresh and understated, but it's also delicious and balanced.
Name: Villa Russiz 2015 Friulano (Collio)

Description: Aromas of grapefruit, tropical fruit, citrus zest, a whiff of graphite and an herbaceous note take center stage on this expressive yet elegant white. The round medium-bodied palate delivers ripe pear, yellow apple, lemon and a quintessential note of bitter almond typical of the variety.
Name: Ronco del Gelso 2015 Toc Bas Friulano (Friuli Isonzo)

Description: Fragrant and refreshing, this savory white opens with delicate scents of white spring flower, orchard fruit and a whisper of crushed herb. The tangy palate delivers white peach, yellow pear and a hint of nectarine that linger on the crisp finish.
Name: Tenuta Roveglia 2016 Limne  (Lugana)

Description: Heady aromas of white spring flower, white stone fruit and crushed herb take center stage on this fragrant white. On the succulent palate, notes of white almond and thyme underscore white peach, lemon drop and yellow apple alongside fresh acidity. A savory mineral note suggesting saline graces the lingering finish.
Name: Selva Capuzza 2016 San Vigilio  (Lugana)

Description: Scents of citrus blossom, honeysuckle and white stone fruit delicately lead the way on this vibrant white. The bright refreshing palate offers Bartlett pear, creamy white peach and a hint of tangerine.
Name: Tenuta Roveglia 2016 Wighel  (Lugana)

Description: Aromas of beeswax, orchard fruit and a whiff of hazelnut lift out of the glass. Made without added sulfites, the bright round palate delivers mature yellow apple, white peach, lemon zest and a hint of white almond alongside fresh acidity. Its understated character will definitely appeal to lovers of reserved elegant whites.
Name: Ancilla 2016 1909  (Lugana)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Intriguing aromas of smoke, beeswax, ripe orchard fruit and a whiff of acacia honey lift out of the glass. The smoky flinty note carries over to the rounded reserved palate, underscoring ripe apple, citrus zest and honey. A hint of hazelnut graces the finish.
Name: Vigne Guadagno 2013 Contrada Sant'Aniello  (Fiano di Avellino)

Description: Intriguing aromas of white spring flower, ripe orchard fruit and a smoky whiff of gunflint lift out of the glass. The polished palate delivers juicy white peach, green apple, white almond a mineral note suggesting wet stone. It's a lovely wine.
Name: Pratello 2016 Catulliano  (Lugana)

Description: This offers aromas suggesting pressed wild flower and ripe orchard fruit. It's medium bodied, doling out ripe yellow apple, peach and a note of bitter almond. Fresh acidity brightens the creamy flavors.
Name: Olivini 2015 Demesse Vecchie  (Lugana)

Description: Beeswax, orchard fruit and white stone-fruit aromas meld together in the glass. The rounded palate offers yellow peach, lemon drop and white almond alongside bright acidity. It closes on a tangy citrus note.
Name: Ca' Lojera 2014  Lugana Superiore

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with aromas of acacia, toast and a whiff of honey. The linear palate offers golden apple, Mediterranean scrub and smoky hint of flint. A note of toasted hazelnut fills in the finish.
Name: Mastroberardino 2013 More Maiorum  (Fiano di Avellino)

Description: Aromas of wild flower, tropical fruit and a whiff of beeswax lift out of the glass. The crisp palate offers citrusy notes of lemon and lime as well as yellow apple. A saline note gives it a savory finish.
Name: Tonnino 2016 Grillo (Terre Siciliane)

Description: White spring flower, yellow stone fruit and a whiff of Mediterranean herb come together on this savory wine. The bright juicy palate offers creamy peach, Bartlett pear and a hint of nectarine while an almond note gives it a pleasantly bitter finish.
Name: Ca' Lojera 2016  Lugana

Description: Aromas of citrus blossom, orchard fruit and sea salt emerge in the glass. The crisp savory palate offers lemon, nectarine and a hint of white almond alongside bright acidity.
Name: Cusumano 2016 Shamaris Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of ripe pear, white peach and tangerine zest carry over to the bright round palate. Energizing mineral notes, suggestive of wet stone, lift the savory finish.
Name: Ronco dei Tassi 2015 Malvasia (Collio)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of mature orchard fruit and a whiff of acacia flower lead the nose, while the bright palate offers ripe yellow apple and a hint of lemon zest. Tangy acidity gives it a fresh clean finish.
Name: Montesole 2015  Greco di Tufo

Description: This isn't overly flashy or pungent on the nose, but does show some Sauvignon-like notes of green onion and white grapefruit. In the mouth, it's crisp and lean, with flavors of grapefruit and underripe pineapple that hint at wet stone on the finish. Drink now.
Name: Wit's End 2016 Lopresti Block 10 Vineyard Vermentino (McLaren Vale)

Description: Aromas of orchard fruit, chopped herb and a whiff of toasted nut emerge on this medium-bodied white. On the bright palate, bitter almond adds interest to Bartlett pear and lemon zest.
Name: Le Morette 2013 Riserva  (Lugana)

Appellation: Isonzo del Friuli, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Acacia, Spanish broom and ripe orchard-fruit aromas emerge in the glass. The medium-bodied palate offers yellow apple and mature pear while a pleasantly bitter almond note wraps up the finish.
Name: Masut da Rive 2015 Friulano (Isonzo del Friuli)

Description: Aromas of acacia, nut and yellow stone fruit lead the nose. It's ripe and round, offering dried apricot, bread crust, golden apple and a note of bitter almond.
Name: Venica & Venica 2015 Ronco delle Cime Friulano (Collio)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Linear and bright, this has aromas suggesting yellow flower, citrus zest and a smoky whiff of flint. On the palate, hints dried herb accent pineapple and lemon alongside a mineral vein.
Name: I Favati 2015 Pietramara  (Fiano di Avellino)

Description: White spring flower, citrus and apple aromas set the tone while the bright palate offers pear, nectarine zest and a hint of bitter almond. Fresh acidity gives it a crisp finish.
Name: Ca' Rugate 2016 San Michele  (Soave Classico)

Description: Aromas of toasted oak, hazelnut and espresso lead the nose. The oak sensations carry over to the firm palate, along with candied citrus zest, butterscotch, yellow-apple skin and a confectionery note.
Name: Feudo Maccari 2015 Family and Friends Grillo (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Citrus zest, toasted nut, Mediterranean scrub and honey aromas follow over to the refined palate along with yellow apple and a hint of ginger. Bright acidity and a saline note give it a fresh, savory finish.
Name: Contrada Salandra 2014 Falanghina (Campi Flegrei)

Description: Aromas of grapefruit and crushed tomato vine lead the nose. The ripe rounded palate offers honeydew melon, lemon drop and a note of crushed dill alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Corte Giacobbe 2016  Soave

Description: Aromas of toasted oak, hazelnut and espresso lead the nose. The oak sensations carry over to the firm palate, along with candied citrus zest, butterscotch, yellow-apple skin and a confectionery note.
Name: Feudo Maccari 2015 Family and Friends Grillo (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Aromas of white wild flower and golden apple waft out of the glass while the juicy palate offers Bartlett pear and a hint of nectarine. Fresh acidity gives it a tangy finish.
Name: Olivini 2016  Lugana

Description: Spring blossom, white stone-fruit and citrus aromas come together on this. The bright fresh palate offers green apple, citrus zest and white peach while a hint of almond gives it a pleasantly bitter finish.
Name: Montonale 2016 Montunal  (Lugana)

Description: Heady aromas suggesting tropical fruit, honeysuckle and citrus zest lead the nose. Bright and refreshing, the lively palate offers mature white stone fruit, tangerine peel and a pleasantly bitter-almond note.
Name: Stemmari 2016 Estate Grown Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Elegant and finely structured, this creamy, fragrant white opens with heady scents of jasmine, honeysuckle and white stone fruit. The smooth, delicious palate delivers green melon, white peach, cantaloupe, grapefruit and orange zest while a saline note lifts the lingering finish.
Designation: Diccianove Marzo Pas Dosé Metodo Classico
Name: Olivini 2010 Diccianove Marzo Pas Dosé Metodo Classico  (Lugana)

Description: Aromas of toasted almond, white flower, dried herb and orchard fruit lead the way. It's round and fresh, with flavors evoking mature yellow apple, candied nectarine and a hint of thyme.
Name: Corte Sermana 2015 Cromalgo  (Lugana)

Description: Aromas of white spring flower and a whiff of tropical fruit lead the nose while the crisp palate offers citrus peel and peach. Bright acidity gives it a clean refreshing finish.
Name: Ceuso 2016 Scurati Grillo (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Aromas of honeysuckle, exotic fruit and a whiff of Mediterranean scrub take center stage. The tangy palate offers grapefruit, peach and pineapple alongside crisp acidity.
Name: Curto 2016 Poiano Inzolia (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Aromas of toast, oak and yellow flower lead the nose. Aged in large casks and barriques, the linear, if somewhat lean, palate offers golden apple and lemon zest alongside tangy acidity.
Name: Ca' Rugate 2015 Monte Alto  (Soave Classico)

Description: Aromas of French oak, butter and a whiff of orchard fruit lead the nose. The oak sensations carry over to the palate along with yellow apple skin, lemon zest and a hint of sage. It closes on a note of bitter almond.
Name: Avanzi 2013 Borghetta  (Lugana)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of tropical fruit and banana lead the nose and carry over to the rounded palate along with pineapple and a hint of candied citrus. A note of bitter nut marks the close.
Name: Donnachiara 2016  Fiano di Avellino

Description: Aromas of exotic fruit and candied citrus zest take center stage on this deeply colored white. Reflecting the scorching vintage, it's ripe and round, offering dried apricot and nectarine drop. Enjoy soon to capture the fruit and freshness.
Name: Fattori 2015 Motto Piane  (Soave)

Description: Yellow wild flower and ripe orchard fruit aromas lead the nose while the bright palate evokes tangerine, golden apple and a juicy hint of pineapple. Fresh acidity gives it a tangy finish.
Name: Feudo Maccari 2016 Grillo (Terre Siciliane)

Description: This opens with subtle aromas of wild flower and a whiff of exotic fruit. The bright fruity palate offers white peach, apple and a hint of honeydew melon. It's straightforward and refreshing.
Name: Villa Canestrari 2016 Vigne di Sande  (Soave)

Description: Aromas of oak, underbrush and a whiff of wet stone lift out of the glass. The aromas carry over to the lean palate along with ripe yellow-apple skin, a hint of citrus zest and a saline note. It closes on a bitter nutty note.
Name: Assuli 2015 Astolfo Grillo (Terre Siciliane)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: The floral aromas in this animated wine give way to fragrant fruit salad flavors that range from orange to pineapple to apple. It has a nicely tart texture and lingering fruity finish.
Name: Enotria 2014 Uvaggio Isabella Arneis (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Delicate aromas of wild flower and orchard fruit come together on this. Bright and enjoyable, the fresh, simple palate offers suggestions of peach, apple and lemon alongside crisp acidity.
Name: Manimurci 2016 Zagreo  (Greco di Tufo)

Description: Picked on the early side, this is a lean, tight expression of what can be a plump endearing variety. Melon and fresh herbs turn grapefruit as the wine progresses across the palate, finishing tart and crisp. Drink now.
Name: Mitolo 2016 Jester Vermentino (McLaren Vale)

Description: Delicate scents of white spring flower and orchard fruit lead the nose while the fresh light-bodied palate offers suggestions of yellow peach and apple. It closes crisp and clean.
Name: Attems 2016 Ribolla Gialla (Venezia Giulia)

Description: Bright and easy drinking, this has delicate aromas of yellow wild flower and a whiff of pear. It's fresh and simple, offering yellow apple and a hint of citrus zest alongside crisp acidity.
Name: Corte Moschina 2016 Roncathe  (Soave)

Description: Made in a crisp linear style, this is picked at a modest level of ripeness. The result is a relatively low alcohol wine, but one that lacks generosity, instead offering one-dimensional notes of tart grapefruit that linger on the finish.
Name: Yalumba 2016 Vermentino (South Australia)

Description: Aromas evoking adhesive bandage and burned plastic carry over to the lean brisk palate.
Name: Le Battistelle 2014 Roccolo del Durlo  (Soave Classico)

Description: This has subdued aromas of toast, weedy underbrush and a medicinal note. It's lean and diluted, with toast, oak and a hint of bitter yellow-apple skin before an abrupt astringent finish.
Name: Feudi del Pisciotto 2015 Grillo (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Elegance, complexity and structure come together in this drop-dead gorgeous winethat ranks among Italy's greatest whites. It opens with sublime yellow spring flower, aromatic herb and orchard fruit scents. The creamy, delicious palate seamlessly combines juicy white peach, ripe pear and citrus flavors while white almond and savory mineral notes grace the lingering finish.
Name: Borgo del Tiglio 2015 Ronco della Chiesa Friulano (Collio)

Description: Elegant and savory, this vibrant white offers enticing Spanish broom, yellow stone fruit, wet stone and crushed thyme aromas. The vibrant, ethereal palate carries subtle, tantalizing layers of yellow peach, tangy tangerine, lemon drop and pineapple with lively acidity. A graphite note closes the lingering finish. Too elegant for some palates, it shows impressive balance and depth, despite the cool, wet vintage.
Name: Gini 2014 Contrada Salvarenza Vecchie Vigne  (Soave Classico)

Description: One of the finest whites of the vintage, this exquisite bottling has an enticing bouquet of almond, orchard fruit, almond and chopped herb. The elegantly structured palate delivers mouthwatering peach, apricot, almond and energizing mineral ntoes that carry over to the long, lingering finish, along with a hint of tangerine.
Name: Borgo del Tiglio 2015 Friulano (Collio)

Description: Hands down one of Italy's best whites, this boasts alluring white flower and yellow stone fruit scents. The enveloping, delicious palate delivers white peach, mature pear, ginger and lemon drop flavors. Fresh acidity brightens the creamy flavors while a mineral note energizes the finish.
Name: Gini 2015 La Froscà  (Soave Classico)

Description: White spring-flower and ripe orchard-fruit aromas lead the way in this lovely white. Its creamy palate doles out juicy pear, ripe apple and honeydew melon flavors, while a blast of tangerine and bright acidity lift the finish.
Name: Le Morette 2016 Mandolara  (Lugana)

Description: Ripe orchard fruit, acacia, Spanish broom and citrus aromas lead the nose of this wine. On the enveloping, structured palate, a honeyed mineral note adds depth to mature pear, lemon drop and hazelnut flavors. Fresh acidity lends balance. It's an amazing achievement for the cool, wet vintage.
Name: Contrade di Taurasi–Lonardo 2014 Grecomusc Roviello (Campania)

Description: Fragrant and fresh, this vibrant wine offers alluring scents field flower and white stone fruit scents. The creamy palate delivers white peach, honeydew melon and citrus flavors, brightened with crisp acidity.
Name: Selva Capuzza 2016 Selva  (Lugana)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: A few swirls of the glass release alluring smoky flint, hazelnut, citrus and dried Mediterranean herb aromas. That savory mineral quality carries over to the bright, tangy palate, underscoring ripe pear, lemon, apple and thyme honey flavors.
Name: Tenuta Sarno 1860 2015  Fiano di Avellino

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Bosc pear, yellow apple and honey scents follow through to the radiant, medium-bodied palate, along with nectarine and Mediterranean herb notes. An energizing mineral tone adds depth.
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2016  Fiano di Avellino

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Ripe orchard fruit, pressed Spanish broom, crushed herb and citrus aromas take shape in the glass. On the palate, candied lemon underscores ripe yellow apple and pear flavors, alongside tangy acidity. A savory mineral note graces the finish. Fantastic wine.
Name: Bambinuto 2013 Picoli  (Greco di Tufo)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This youthful ten-year-old demonstrates the impressive aging potential of well-made Greco di Tufo, opening with compelling dried stone fruit, Spanish broom, herb and smoky aromas. The round, smooth palate doles out creamy peach, mature Bartlett pear and lemon drop flavors. An energizing mineral note lingers on the finish. It's at its peak so drink now.
Name: Di Meo 2007 Vittorio  (Greco di Tufo)

Description: Enticing fragrant wildflower, orchard fruit and aromatic herb aromas waft out of the glass. The round, enveloping palate doles out ripe pear, white cherry, white peach and salty mineral notes. Fresh acidity brightens the almond-laced finish.
Name: Gradis'ciutta 2015 Malvasia (Collio)

Description: Alluring smature orchard fruit, grilled herb, toasted nut and flint scents take center stage in this savory white, accented by a balsamic note. The round, creamy, palate mirrors the nose, offering juicy white peach, baked apple and celery flavors. A blast of candied tangerine closes the lingering finish.
Name: Cà dei Frati 2015 I Frati  (Lugana)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Pressed yellow flower, flint and Mediterranean herb aromas fuse with citrus zest and a balsamic note. The round, savory palate doles out ripe apricot, creamy pear and juicy nectarine flavors, tangy acidity carrying a bitter almond tone long into the finish.
Name: Cantine di Marzo 2015 Franciscus  (Greco di Tufo)

Description: Enticing wildflower, chopped herb and ripe orchard fruit scents abound in this radiant wine. The palate doles out white peach, yellow pear and nectarine notes, with stony mineral accents. Fresh acidity brightens the creamy flavors.
Name: Marangona 2016  Lugana

Description: This elegant wine opens with enticing white spring flower, freshly picked orchard fruit and herb aromas. The vibrant palate offers juicy white peach, nectarine and yellow apple flavors, framed by crisp acidity. An almond note graces the dry, refreshing finish.
Name: Ottella 2016 Le Creete  (Lugana)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This wine's yellow flower, Mediterranean brush and citrus aromas will grab your attention. On the full-bodied palate, a white almond note underscores ripe Bartlett pear, nectarine and candied lemon flavors while a mineral note energizes the finish.
Name: Le Masciare 2015  Fiano di Avellino

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
