Description: Elegant, savory and balanced, this opens with delicate orchard fruit, Mediterranean scrub and wet stone scents. The vibrant, ethereal palate delivers lemon, nectarine and pear fruit, buttressed by crisp acidity. A savory mineral note gives it a mouthwatering finish.
Name: Di Meo 2016  Greco di Tufo

Description: Spanish broom, yellow stone fruit and citrus zest aromas take shape in the glass. Lively acidity carries juicy nectarine, intense lemon, thyme, pineapple and Mediterranean herb flavors into the round, juicy finish.
Name: Feudo Montoni 2016 della Timpa Grillo (Sicilia)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Radiant and elegant, this offers enticing white stone fruit, Mediterranean brush and spring flower scents. The vibrant, balanced palate delivers creamy white peach, pear and tangy nectarine flavors, alongside crisp acidity. A savory mineral note gives it a mouthwatering finish.
Name: Vesevo 2016  Greco di Tufo

Description: Tropical fruit, citrus and Mediterranean scrub aromas take center stage in this lively white. It's bright and savory, doling out juicy grapefruit, white peach and pineapple flavors, with crisp acidity and a mouthwatering saline note.
Name: Donnafugata 2016 Sur Sur Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: This ripe, juicy wine opens with yellow stone fruit, Spanish broom and faint nut aromas. The medium-bodied palate doles out ripe Golden Delicious apple and mature Bartlett pear flavors, while a pleasant bitter almond note backs up the finish.
Name: Gradis'ciutta 2015 Friulano (Collio)

Description: Hawthorne, honeysuckle and orchard fruit aromas carry over to the tangy palate, along with ripe yellow apple, white peach and nectarine notes. Zesty acidity leaves a clean, crisp finish while a hint of white almond marks the close.
Name: Gino Fasoli 2016 Borgoletto  (Soave)

Description: This wine's delicate nose offers white spring flower, Mediterranean herb and wet stone aromas. They carry over to the fresh palate, along with fruity green apple and pineapple notes while a savory mineral note backs up the finish.
Name: La Sibilla 2015 Falanghina (Campi Flegrei)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Banana, honeydew melon and honeysuckle aromas lead the way while the generous palate doles out pineapple and white peach. A candied nectarine note backs up the fruity flavors, alongside tangy acidity.
Name: Vadiaperti 2015 Tornante  (Greco di Tufo)

Description: Orchard fruit and white spring flower aromas drift out of the glass. On the rounded palate, bitter almond accents ripe pear, yellow apple and white peach flavors.
Name: Schiopetto 2015 Malvasia (Collio)

Description: This textbook Friulano opens with alluring chamomile flower, herb, ripe orchard fruit and nut aromas. The rounded palate delivers pear, white almond and sage hints that lead to a tangy finish.
Name: Russiz Superiore 2015 Friulano (Collio)

Description: This wild yeast-fermented wine has Spanish broom, honey, toasted nut and ripe yellow stone fruit aromas. The medium-bodied, linear palate mirrors the nose, doling out candied orange zest, dried apricot and mineral notes, with tangy acidity.
Name: Sansonina 2015 Fermentazione Spontanea  (Lugana)

Description: Pear and honeydew melon aromas lift out of the glass. On the fresh, tangy palate, a saline vein of minerality underscores white peach, yellow apple and juicy citrus flavors.
Name: Tasca d'Almerita 2016 Mozia Fondazione Whitaker Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Bright and refreshing, this opens with white spring flower and yellow stone fruit aromas. The linear palate evokes yellow peach, mature apple and juicy nectarine, brightened with tangy acidity. It finishes clean and crisp.
Name: Gradis'ciutta 2015 Ribolla Gialla (Collio)

Description: This savory white opens with toasted nut, mature apple and citrus zest aromas. Mirroring the nose, the round, juicy palate doles out ripe apple, peach and candied tangerine flavors with moderate freshness. A bitter almond note graces the finish.
Name: Franchetto 2015  Soave

Description: This wine's delicate nose offers white spring flower, Mediterranean herb and wet stone aromas. They carry over to the fresh palate, joining fruity green apple and pineapple notes while a savory mineral tone warms the finish.
Name: Capolino Perlingieri 2015 Preta Falanghina (Sannio)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Yellow stone fruit, citrus and Mediterranean brush aromas float out of the glass. On the bright, tangy palate, mature apricot and nectarine flavors mingle with savory mineral notes and hints of chopped herb.
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2016  Greco di Tufo

Description: Banana, honeydew melon and honeysuckle aromas lead the way while the generous palate doles out pineapple and white peach flavors. A candied nectarine note backs up the fruity flavors, alongside tangy acidity.
Name: Villa Matilde 2015 Rocca dei Leoni Falanghina (Roccamonfina)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with tropical fruit and white flower fragrance while the palate offers honeydew melon, ripe pear and citrus flavors. A hint of white almond leaves a pleasant bitter finish.
Name: Villa Matilde 2016 Altavilla  (Greco di Tufo)

Description: Ripe apple, toast and grilled herb scents lead the nose while the medium-bodied palate offers pear, ripe citrus and toasted almond hints. A mineral note lifts the finish.
Name: Le Morette 2012 Riserva  (Lugana)

Description: Honeysuckle, exotic fruit and herbaceous notes carry over to the racy palate, where they're joined by grapefruit, pineapple and green melon flavors. An almond note closes the crisp finish.
Name: Ottella 2014 Molceo Riserva  (Lugana)

Description: This wine's tropical fruit and fragrant white flower scents lift out of the glass while the lively palate doles out juicy white peach, green apple and grapefruit flavors. It has clean, crisp finish.
Name: Ottella 2016  Lugana

Description: Orchard fruit, citrus and almond aromas follow through to the palate. Fresh acidity enlivens the yellow apple and nectarine flavors while a hint of Mediterranean herb closes the finish.
Name: Paolo Calì 2016 Blues Grillo (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Made from organically farmed grapes, this offers tropical and white stone fruit aromas. On the bright palate, a saline hint underscores yellow apple, Bartlett pear and citrus fruit. It finishes clean and crisp.
Name: Alessandro di Camporeale 2016 Vigna di Mandranova Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Honeysuckle, ripe pear and exotic fruit aromas take center stage. The bright, juicy palate doles out honeydew melon, white peach and nectarine flavors with lively acidity, finishing on an almond note.
Name: Pasini San Giovanni 2016 Vino Biologico  (Lugana)

Description: Enticing yellow wildflower and yellow stone fruit aromas take center stage in this lively white. The bright, linear palate evokes yellow apple, Bartlett pear and citrus zest while an almond note leaves a pleasant bitter aftertaste.
Name: Bortoluzzi 2015 Friulano (Collio)

Description: This cloudy, unfiltered white has delicate grilled herb, wet stone and ripe orchard fruit aromas. The crisp, linear palate delivers saline-inflected white peach and nectarine flavors while a bright almond note closes the finish.
Name: Corte Adami 2015  Soave

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Spanish broom, honeysuckle and exotic fruit aromas carry over to the rounded palate, along with yellow peach and candied lemon drop notes. A bitter almond flavor closes the finish.
Name: I Capitani 2016 Gaudium  (Fiano di Avellino)

Description: This fun and refreshing sparkler offers heady white spring flower and ripe orchard fruit scents. The refreshing palate doles out crunchy green apple, white peach and orange zest flavors, with tangy acidity.
Name: Monte Tondo NV Spumante Brut  (Soave)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Toasted hazelnut, orchard fruit and citrus scents take center stage. On the elegant palate, a flinty mineral note underscores lemon zest and pear flavors while a nutty hint closes the finish.
Name: Torricino 2015  Fiano di Avellino

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Pressed yellow flower, almond and honey notes follow through to the rounded, tangy palate, joining salty mineral, mature yellow peach and citrus flavors. Drink soon to capture the fruit and remaining freshness.
Name: Rocca del Principe 2015  Fiano di Avellino

Description: French oak, coconut and oak-driven spice aromas emerge in the glass. The racy palate is leaner than previous vintages but still offers yellow apple skin and candied citrus zest flavors and firm acidity. It closes on a bitter note of raw almond.
Name: Suavia 2013 Le Rive Garganega (Veronese)

Description: Delicate spring flower and orchard fruit scents lift out of the glass. On the crisp palate, a bitter almond note underscores yellow peach, golden apple and nectarine flavors, with lively acidity.
Name: Coffele 2016 Castel Cerino  (Soave Classico)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Toasted hazelnut, beeswax, chamomile, sea breeze and citrus zest aromas carry over to the bright, medium-bodied palate, along with flinty mineral and pear notes. A warm honey tone anchors the linear finish.
Name: Di Meo 2012 Alessandra  (Fiano di Avellino)

Description: Made with late-harvested Garganega grapes, this opens with aromas of pressed Spanish broom, ripe yellow stone fruit and candied citrus drop. The aromas follow over to the soft, rounded palate along with a toasted almond note.
Name: Corte Moschina 2014 I Tarai  (Soave)

Description: Yellow stone fruit, chopped herb and citrus scents lift out of the glass. On the creamy palate, fresh acidity brightens white peach and zesty nectarine flavors while an almond note leaves a pleasant bitter finish.
Name: Avanzi 2016  Lugana

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This delicate but balanced wine has subtle white orchard fruit, Spanish broom and Mediterranean brush aromas. The racy, ethereal palate offers yellow peach, citrus and savory mineral notes, with lively acidity. It closes on a hint of almond.
Name: Bambinuto 2014  Greco di Tufo

Description: Spanish broom, white flower and mature white stone fruit notes commingle on the nose The round, ripe palate offers white peach, juicy pear and candied nectarine flavors, with a bitter almond-inflected finish.
Name: Cà Maiol 2015 Prestige  (Lugana)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This deeply colored wine has subtle ripe orchard fruit, citrus zest and Mediterranean brush aromas. The bright, medium-bodied palate offers mature pear, nectarine and dried herb flavors while a bitter almond note closes the finish.
Name: I Favati 2015 Terrantica  (Greco di Tufo)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This deeply colored wine has subtle ripe orchard fruit, citrus zest and Mediterranean brush aromas. The bright, medium-bodied palate offers mature pear, nectarine and dried herb flavors while a bitter almond note closes the finish.
Name: I Favati 2015 Terrantica  (Greco di Tufo)

Description: Wildflower and ripe apple aromas lead the nose while the palate offers mature pear fruit and fennel touches. A pleasant bitter almond note signals the close.
Name: La Rajade 2015 Ribolla Gialla (Collio)

Description: Oak, toasted almond and ripe stone fruit aromas lift out of the glass. The ripe—almost syrupy—palate offers butterscotch, vanilla, mature yellow apple and confectionary notes while the almond tone gives it a bitter finish. It retains just enough fresh acidity to keep it from being cloying.
Name: Coffele 2015 Alzari  (Soave Classico)

Description: This wine opens with toasted nut, dried herb and citrus zest aromas. On the linear, lean palate, thyme and mineral notes back up yellow apple flavors, with lively acidity. It closes on a bitter almond note.
Name: Selva Capuzza 2013 Menasasso Riserva  (Lugana)

Description: Yellow stone fruit, pear and tropical fruit aromas lead the nose. On the zesty palate, bright acidity underscores yellow peach and honeydew melon flavors that linger into the crisp finish.
Name: Tasca d'Almerita 2016 Cavallo delle Fate Grillo (Sicilia)

Appellation: Isonzo del Friuli, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Aacacia flower, dried herb, nut and honey aromas carry over to the rounded palate, along with yellow apple skin and toasted almond notes. Tangy acidity brightens the finish.
Name: Tenuta Luisa 2015 Friulano (Isonzo del Friuli)

Description: White flower, orchard fruit and banana aromas lead the nose while the vibrant palate doles out white peach, Bartlett pear, citrus and saline flavors. Tangy acidity provides loads of freshness.
Name: Tenuta Rapitalà 2016 Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Citrus zest, pineapple and oak aromas carry over to the lean, linear palate, joining hints of toasted nut and vanilla. Brisk acidity provides the racy framework.
Name: Zenato 2014 Riserva Sergio Zenato  (Lugana)

Description: Delicate yellow wildflower and yellow stone fruit scents combine. The palate is bright and tangy, with ripe peach and citrus flavors that taper into a delicate hint of almond on the finish.
Name: Castello di Spessa 2015 Friulano (Collio)

Description: This linear, mineral-driven white opens with intriguing sea breeze, herb and field flower scents. The elegant palate offers citrus zest, yellow stone fruit and toasted almond flavors, alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Castelvecchio 2015 Malvasia (Friuli)

Description: Orange blossom, honeysuckle and tropical fruit aromas lead the nose. On the bright palate, tangy acidity carries white peach and citrus flavors while a hint of Mediterranean herb marks the close.
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2016 Falanghina (Sannio)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Delicate smoke, pressed yellow flower and orchard fruit scents waft out of the glass. The vibrant, linear palate shows candied citrus, hazelnut and mineral notes, alongside bright acidity.
Name: Di Meo 2016  Fiano di Avellino

Description: Tropical fruit, citrus and white almond scents lead the nose. On the tangy palate, oak hints underscore grapefruit, juicy yellow peach and dried herb flavors, with a candied note of lemon drop.
Name: Corte Giacobbe 2015  Soave Superiore

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This has a rather subdued nose, while the palate offers citrus, pear and chopped herb notes. It's elegant and linear but a bit lean, with an energizing mineral finish.
Name: Vadiaperti 2015 Aipierti  (Fiano di Avellino)

Description: Honey, chamomile, acacia and toasted oak aromas follow through to the palate, with yellow apple and a citrus drop flavors. A bitter almond note closes the finish. Drink soon to capture the remaining freshness and fruit.
Name: Inama 2015 Vigneto du Lot  (Soave Classico)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Ripe orchard fruit, mature citrus and honey aromas set the tone. On the structured palate, sage and toasted almond notes add interest to mature yellow peach fruit while a hint of lemon drop lends a tangy finish.
Name: Amarano 2015 Dulcinea  (Fiano di Avellino)

Description: Subtle orchard fruit and spring blossom aromas lift from the glass. On the vibrant, mouthwatering palate, fresh acidity underscores white peach, Bartlett pear and juicy citrus notes.
Name: Pasini San Giovanni 2016  Lugana

Description: This creamy, fresh wine opens with orchard fruit, citrus and banana scents. The medium-bodied palate delivers white peach and nectarine flavors, with bright acidity that leaves a tangy finish.
Name: Zenato 2016 San Benedetto  (Lugana)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Alluring citrus, pear, yellow flower and herb aromas lift out of the glass. They carry over to the tangy palate, joining Golden Delicious apple and saline flavors that lend a savory finish.
Name: Le Masciare 2015  Greco di Tufo

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Tropical fruit, hawthorn, and yellow stone fruit aromas lead the way in this lively white. The bright, rounded palate doles out white peach, green melon and tangy lemon zest flavors alongside vibrant acidity.
Name: I Capitani 2016 Serum  (Greco di Tufo)

Description: Honey, mature apple and candied orange peel aromas lead the nose. The rounded palate offers citrus zest, yellow apple and acacia flavors finishing on a round note of hazelnut.
Name: Capolino Perlingieri 2015 Nembo Fiano (Sannio)

Description: Honeysuckle and ripe orchard fruit aromas are front and center in this vibrant white. The lively, linear palate offers honeydew melon, white peach and citrus flavors with tangy acidity before closing on a white almond note.
Name: Corte Mainente 2016 Tovo al Pigno  (Soave Classico)

Description: Aromatic herb, Spanish broom, ripe pear and toasted almond notes take center stage. The almond impression carries over to the firmly structured palate, adding interest to citrus zest and yellow apple flavors.
Name: Ronco dei Tassi 2015 Friulano (Collio)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: You'll find subtle but alluring mature orchard fruit, dried herb, citrus zest and balsamic aromas in this rounded white. They carry over to the bright palate, along with a hint of hazelnut.
Name: Vadiaperti 2015  Greco di Tufo

Description: Made entirely from Garganega, this offers delicate wildflower and white stone fruit scents. On the vibrant palate, a white almond hint underscores yellow apple, Bartlett pear and nectarine flavors.
Name: Suavia 2016  Soave Classico

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This offers Bartlett pear, citrus and of spring flower scents. The tangy palate shows yellow apple and lemon drop notes, with bright acidity that refreshes the ripe flavors.
Name: Agricola Bellaria 2015 Oltre  (Greco di Tufo)

Description: Spanish broom and hawthorn aromas meld with whiffs of orchard fruit. On the zesty palate, a hint of grilled herb adds interest to pear and apple flavors while lively acidity lends freshness.
Name: Le Albare 2016 Monte Majore  (Soave Classico)

Description: Tropical fruit and honeysuckle aromas lead the nose and carry over to the palate, along with hints of banana and yellow pear. The finish is laced with orange zest.
Name: Vesevo 2016 Falanghina (Beneventano)

Description: This opens with white flower, yellow stone fruit and honeydew melon aromas. The fruity sensations carry over to the palate, with a tangerine zest note and tangy acidity that leads to a juicy finish.
Name: Bertaini 2016 Sereole  (Soave Colli Scaligeri)

Description: Mature orchard fruit and toasted nut aromas lead the nose of this wine while the ripe, medium-bodied palate delivers exotic fruit, yellow pear and candied lemon drop flavors. It closes on a confected note.
Name: Montonale 2015 Orestilla  (Lugana)

Description: This wine's golden apple, yellow pear and beeswax aromas carry over to the bright, straightforward palate, along with a hint of citrus. It has a clean, fresh finish.
Name: Castello di Spessa 2015 Ribolla Gialla (Collio)

Description: On the nose, this suggests thyme, toasted nut and ripe orchard fruit. The firm palate offers mature citrus zest and ripe pear flavors while a bitter almond note marks the finish.
Name: CàMaiol 2015  Lugana

Description: Spring blossom and white stone fruit aromas delicately set the tone for this wine. On the straightforward palate, fresh acidity underscores ripe pear and yellow apple flavors while a hint of almond signals the close.
Name: Cantina di Monteforte 2016 Vicario  (Soave Classico)

Description: Orchard fruit and white flower aromas meld together in this pretty white. On the bright palate, fresh acidity underscores white peach, Bartlett pear and juicy nectarine suggestions.
Name: Le Albare 2016 Ca' Bianchi  (Soave)

Description: Toasted oak, citrus and yellow apple aromas lead the nose. They follow through to the medium-bodied palate,. along with a hint of candied lemon. A bitter almond note marks the finish.
Name: Montonale 2014 Orestilla  (Lugana)

Description: Toasted bread crust, pressed yellow flower and yellow stone fruit aromas lead the way while the linear, slightly lean palate offers yellow apple skin and citrus notes. Bright acidity lends freshness while bitter almond colors the finish.
Name: La Rajade 2015 Friulano (Collio)

Description: Spanish broom, acacia and nut aromas lead the nose. They follow through to the straightforward, enjoyable palate, along with peach and tangy tangerine notes.
Name: Collavini 2015 Friulano (Collio)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Delicate toasted hazelnut, honey and pressed yellow flower aromas fill the glass. On the linear palate, a light nutty note accents lemon zest and stony mineral flavors.
Name: Vadiaperti 2015  Fiano di Avellino

Description: Toasted nut, pressed chamomile and citrus aromas follow through to the palate, joining apple skin and yellow pear notes. A saline hint marks the finish.
Name: Tenuta dei Mille 2015 Rosalia Fiano (Terre Siciliane)

Description: This opens with delicate orchard fruit, citrus zest and white spring flower scents. On the bright palate, a bitter almond note accents ripe pear and nectarine flavors that are tangy with acidity.
Name: Inama 2016 Vin Soave  (Soave Classico)

Description: Elderflower, honeydew melon and tropical fruit aromas lift out of the glass in this Soave. It's bright and fruity, offering creamy white peach and tangy pink grapefruit flavors, with a hint of candied tangerine and zesty acidity.
Name: Coffele 2016 Cà Visco  (Soave Classico)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Intensely floral aromas of pressed flower, overripe orchard fruit and Mediterranean brush lead the nose. On the palate, fennel and bitter almond accents back up yellow apple skin and mineral flavors. Drink soon to capture the remaining fruit and freshness.
Name: Dell'Angelo 2015  Greco di Tufo

Description: Pressed Spanish broom, citrus zest and almond aromas lead the nose of this wine. On the lively palate, a lemon drop hint accents pink grapefruit and yellow apple notes. It's vibrant, with racy acidity.
Name: Filippi 2014 Vigne del Brà  (Soave Colli Scaligeri)

Description: This opens with banana, exotic fruit and honeysuckle aromas while the fruity palate offers white peach, green apple and candied tangerine flavors. A hint of white almond marks the close.
Name: Perla del Garda 2016 Bio  (Lugana)

Description: Jasmine, tropical fruit and yellow stone fruit aromas lift out of the glass. On the rounded palate, tangy acidity accompanies banana, white peach and citrus flavors.
Name: Perla del Garda 2016 Perla  (Lugana)

Description: Alluring graphite, apricot and flint aromas jump out of the glass, but the rounded palate is less expressive, evoking mature yellow peach, dried herb and grapefruit. A bitter, nutty note marks the close.
Name: Schiopetto 2015 Friulano (Collio)

Description: This wine's honeydew melon, exotic fruit and white flower aromas follow through to the informal palate, along with a slightly bitter note. It's fresh, with tangy acidity.
Name: Cantine Ermes 2016 Vento di Mare Grillo (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Ripe yellow peach, honeydew melon and exotic fruit scents follow through to the lively palate. Zesty acidity leaves a tangy finish.
Name: Tasca d'Almerita 2016 Sallier de la Tour Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: This straightforward white has subdued aromas suggesting citrus and pear. On the fresh, simple palate, a hint of brine adds interest to apple and lemon zest flavors.
Name: Tenute Orestiadi 2016 Bio Grillo (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Spring flower, yellow stone fruit and tomato vine aromas lead to a linear palate laced with grapefruit and a hint of green melon. Vibrant acidity gives it a refreshing finish.
Name: Monteci 2016  Lugana

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This wine's nose is initially quite shy, releasing a whiff of Mediterranean herb with some air. The simple palate offers citrus and a saline flavors while crisp acidity gives it a fresh finish.
Name: Antica Hirpinia 2015  Fiano di Avellino

Description: This crisp, refreshing wine opens with subtle white flower, orchard fruit and wet stone aromas. The bright, simple palate offers citrus, peach and saline hints.
Name: Valle dell'Acate 2016 Zagrà Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: This wine's delicate pear, apple and beeswax aromas carry over to the simple, enjoyable palate, along with a citrus note. It's refreshing, with bright acidity.
Name: Santa Sofia 2016 Monte Foscarino  (Soave Classico)

Description: This crisp, straightforward white has delicate orchard fruit and white spring flower aromas, while the simple palate offers Bartlett pear and citrus flavors. Bright acidity gives it a clean finish.
Name: Tommasi 2016 Le Volpare  (Soave Classico)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Delicate crushed herb and exotic fruit scents lift from the glass while the fresh, straightforward palate offers pear and citrus flavors and tangy acidity. A saline hint on the close adds interest.
Name: Tre Fiori 2016  Greco di Tufo

Description: White flower and yellow stone fruit aromas lead the way in this straightforward white while the bright palate offers yellow apple, apricot and bitter almond flavors. Zesty acidity gives it a refreshing finish.
Name: Cantina di Gambellara 2016 Monopolio  (Soave Classico)

Description: This bright and simple wine offers citrus, Mediterranean brush and peach aromas and flavors. It closes on a saline touch.
Name: Cantine Ermes 2016 Vento di Mare Vino Biologico Grillo (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Honeysuckle and tropical fruit aromas lead the nose of this wine. They aromas carry over to the easygoing palate, with pineapple fruit and tangy acidity.
Name: Cantine Lenotti 2016  Soave Classico

Description: Subdued acacia flower, toasted nut and dried aromatic herb aromas lead the nose while the palate offers yellow apple skin flavors and a hint of citrus zest. Bitter almond marks the lean finish.
Name: Corte Adami 2015 Vigna della Corte  (Soave)

Description: Exotic fruit, grapefruit and tomato vine scents follow through to the lean, lively palate, along with a hint of green melon. Racy acidity leaves a crisp, clean finish.
Name: Fattori 2016 Runcaris  (Soave)

Description: This vibrant, slender white doles out grapefruit, pineapple and chopped herb aromas and flavors. An orange zest note closes the clean, crisp finish.
Name: Settesoli 2016 Mandrarossa Costa Dune Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Made from 100% Trebbiano di Soave, this has a shy nose that eventually reveals white spring flower and white stone fruit whiffs. The palate is lean and dilute, offering hints of peach, bitter almond and citrus peel, alongside racy acidity.
Name: Suavia 2014 Massifitti Trebbiano (Veronese)

Description: This wine's spring blossom, yellow apple and almond scents carry over to the light, rather diluted palate. Although simple, it's a great utility pour for large, informal gatherings or picnics.
Name: I Campi 2015 Campo Base  (Soave)

Description: Exotic fruit and herbaceous aromas lift out of the glass. On the bright, simple palate, zesty acidity underscores juicy pineapple and grapefruit notes.
Name: Andrero 2016 Grillo (Terre Siciliane)

Description: This opens with faint honeysuckle and white stone fruit aromas. The informal, lively palate offers green apple, peach and citrus hints, alongside bright acidity.
Name: Tenuta Sant'Antonio 2016 Fontana  (Soave)

Description: Tropical fruit aromas meld with a whiff of Mediterranean herb. The bright, simple palate shows hints of banana and citrus, alongside zesty acidity.
Name: Tenute Orestiadi 2016 Molino a Vento Grillo (Terre Siciliane)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This simple sparkler from Campania opens with subdued acacia and honey aromas. They carry over to the palate, joining yellow apple fruit, brisk acidity and sharp, rather aggressive bubbles. An almond note leaves a bitter finish.
Name: Tenuta Sarno 1860 2015 Pas Dosé  (Fiano di Avellino)

Description: Delicate spring wildflower and orchard fruit aromas lift out of the glass. The simple, diluted palate mirrors the nose, offering hints of pear and peach, with zesty acidity.
Name: Fattori 2016  Soave

Description: This fresh, enjoyable white has passion fruit, citrus and saline aromas and flavors. It's simple, with a clean, fresh finish.
Name: Assuli 2015 Fiordiligi Grillo (Terre Siciliane)

Description: This lean, simple white offers yellow flower, citrus zest and grilled herb flavors. It's bright, with a clean finish.
Name: Tenuta Stella 2015 Ribolla Gialla (Collio)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This simple white offers exotic fruit aromas while the bright palate shows banana and pineapple notes. Zesty acidity gives it a refreshing finish.
Name: Antica Hirpinia 2016  Greco di Tufo

Description: This has a shy nose, offering subtle whiffs of white stone fruit and spring wildflower while the simple palate offers orchard fruit, citrus zest and bitter almond flavors. It's fresh, with zesty acidity.
Name: Tenuta dei Mille 2015 Anita Grillo (Terre Siciliane)

Description: This simple, everyday white offers subdued aromas suggesting peach and citrus that carry over to the shy palate. Bright acidity lends a tangy finish.
Name: Vicentini Agostino 2015 Terre Lunghe  (Soave)

Description: This has subdued, somewhat funky leesy aromas that mingle with whiffs of pressed yellow flower, overripe citrus and dried thyme. The palate is oily and prematurely evolved, evoking mature yellow apple skin and toasted almond.
Name: Pagani 2015  Soave Classico

Description: Toasted nut, graphite and medicinal herb scents lead the way in this wine. The lean, diluted palate evokes adhesive bandage, thyme and bitter almond, alongside brisk acidity.
Name: Le Battistelle 2014  Soave Classico

Description: This bright, informal white has light wildflower and tropical fruit scents. The uber simple, diluted palate offers citrus and peach flavors, alongside zesty acidity.
Name: Tenute Orestiadi 2016 Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Light bodied and uber simple, this informal white offers nectarine and bitter nut suggestions. It's brisk, with zesty acidity.
Name: Garganuda 2015  Soave

Description: Spring flower aromas mingle with a hint of orchard fruit. On the lean, extremely simple palate, yellow apple fruit mixes with a lemon zest note.
Name: Sant'Anjelus 2015  Soave

Description: This opens with toasted oak, pressed wild flower and hay aromas. The lean, diluted palate offers butterscotch and tart lemon zest flavors. Although the acidity is brisk, it lacks fruit richness.
Name: Villa Canestrari 2014  Soave Classico Superiore

Description: This extremely simple white offers subdued tropical fruit and citrus aromas that carry over to the light, rather diluted palate. It's lean and racy, with brisk acidity.
Name: Cantine Ermes 2016 Marchese Montefusco Grillo (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Fresh and simple, this lean white has subdued flavors suggesting yellow apple and citrus while bright acidity gives it a crisp if short finish. Pour at informal gatherings or drink as a breezy aperitivo.
Name: Folonari 2015  Soave

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Enticing scents of Spanish broom, acacia, mature orchard fruit and honey set the tone on this delicious white. Boasting depth, complexity and character, the creamy palate delivers layers of ripe yellow apple, vanilla, pear, white almond and a savory note of flinty mineral. Tangy acidity provides balance. It's a great expression of Vernaccia's more serious side and aging potential. Drink through 2019.
Name: Teruzzi & Puthod 2011 Riserva  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Description: Fermented in clay amphora, this fascinating orange wine opens with alluring aromas of dried yellow stone fruit, baking spice, aromatic herb, pressed yellow flower and a balsamic note. Boasting more fruit and flavor than many other wines in this genre, the savory enveloping palate presents apricot, yellow peach, candied nectarine zest, crystallized ginger and a hint of flinty mineral. Tangy acidity provides balance and lift while a honeyed note closes the lingering finish. Simply gorgeous.
Name: Tre Monti 2015 Vitalba in Anfora Albana (Romagna)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Floral and fruity, this opens with aromas of yellow wild flower and ripe orchard fruit. The bright rounded palate offers mature yellow apple, yellow pear and a hint of candied lemon drop alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Tenuta Le Calcinaie 2013 Vigna ai Sassi Riserva  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Thanks to long maceration and fermentation on the skins, this has heady aromas of Spanish broom, acacia, yellow stone fruit, grilled herb and a whiff of baked bread. Round, savory and fresh, the intriguing palate has an impressive depth of flavors including ripe yellow peach, mature yellow apple, lemon drop, toasted almond, flinty mineral and an earthy note of tilled soil. Tangy acidity brightens the finish.
Name: Montenidoli 2014 Tradizionale  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Vermentino di Gallura, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Aromas of apple, exotic fruit and Mediterranean scrub lead the nose while the fresh, savory palate shows juicy white peach, mint and citrus zest. It has lovely balance, structure and finesse.
Name: Vigne Surrau 2015 Branu  (Vermentino di Gallura)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Enticing scents of Spanish broom, citrus blossom, aromatic herb, baked bread and mature orchard fruit emerge on this elegantly structured white. The rounded savory palate shows a nice depth of flavors, including ripe yellow apple, peach, toasted almond and lemon drop. A flinty mineral vein wraps around the lingering finish while bright acidity provides balance.
Name: Montenidoli 2014 Fiore  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Fermented and aged in barrique, this mature structured white offers subtle aromas of pressed yellow flower, dried stone fruit and toast. The round palate offers mature yellow apple, lemon drop, toasted almond and a dollop of honey. This definitely isn't a classic apéritif so pair it with white meats or seasoned cheeses.
Name: Montenidoli 2011 Carato  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Made with organically cultivated grapes, this savory white offers alluring aromas of yellow stone fruit, pear and white spring flower. Juicy and delicious, the creamy palate doles out succulent yellow peach, golden apple, nectarine and a savory saline note. Tangy acidity lifts the creamy flavors while a hint of white almond graces the finish.
Name: Il Colombaio di Santa Chiara 2015 Selvabianca  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Vermentino di Gallura, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: This impressive white from Sardinia opens with aromas of ripe orchard fruit, Mediterranean brush and a whiff of exotic fruit while the juicy palate doles out apricot, pineapple and candied citrus zest. An energizing mineral note brightens the creamy flavors.
Name: Vigne Surrau 2015 Sciala Superiore  (Vermentino di Gallura)

Description: Savory and intriguing, this opens with heady scents suggesting ripe apricot, honeydew melon and Spanish broom. The round enveloping palate doles out juicy peach, ripe pear, bitter almond and a hint of honey. Mouthwatering acidity and a blast of tangerine give it a mouthwatering close.
Name: Tre Monti 2016 Vigna Rocca Albana (Romagna)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Here's a textbook Greco di Tufo that opens with delicate but alluring scents of ripe orchard fruit, orange blossom and a whiff of toasted almond. The crisp yet creamy palate doles out ripe pear, peach and citrus while bright acidity lifts the finish. It closes on a mineral note.
Name: Torricino 2015  Greco di Tufo

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Redolent on the nose, with bright and pungent aromas of lime peel, cut grass and passion fruit, this is an indicator that Vermentino could excel in Temecula. The strong smells tighten on the sip, showing white peach and cherimoya flavors that are restrained by a sharp acidity and wool-like minerality.
Name: Robert Renzoni 2016 Vermentino (Temecula Valley)

Description: Lovely scents of white spring flower, white stone fruit and citrus set the tone on this vibrant savory white. On the mineral-driven palate, notes of saline and Mediterranean herb accent grapefruit, lemon and white peach. It finishes crisp and clean.
Name: Tonnino 2014 Grillo (Terre Siciliane)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Racy and precise, this opens with scents of white spring flower and orchard fruit. The chiseled palate delivers yellow apple, peach, aromatic herb and flinty mineral set against vibrant acidity.
Name: La Lastra 2014 Riserva  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Heady aromas of honeysuckle, jasmine and white peach set the tone on this refreshing savory white. The bright creamy palate doles out green apple, yellow pear and white almond alongside tangy acidity. It finishes clean and fresh.
Name: Tenuta Le Calcinaie 2015  Vernaccia di San Gimignano

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Enticing scents of acacia flower, chopped herb and yellow pear waft out of the glass. The juicy, delicious palate offers ripe apple, succulent white peach and citrus alongside fresh acidity. Almond and a light flinty note back up the lingering finish.
Name: La Lastra 2015  Vernaccia di San Gimignano

Description: Floral aromas of acacia and Spanish broom mingle with yellow stone fruit and toasted nut. On the medium-bodied palate, a note of bitter almond underscores ripe apricot and tangerine zest. Fresh acidity lifts the rich flavors.
Name: Trerè 2015 Arlùs Albana (Romagna)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Floral scents of white and yellow field flowers meld together with aromas of ripe orchard fruit. The juicy palate doles out ripe yellow apple, creamy pear, candied lemon drop and a savory hint of saline. A light mineral note lifts the finish.
Name: Poggio Alloro 2015  Vernaccia di San Gimignano

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Delicate scents of yellow field flower and ripe orchard fruit float from the glass. The savory palate doles out yellow apple, yellow Bartlett pear, tangerine and a hint of stony mineral. Fresh acidity brightens the creamy flavors.
Name: San Benedetto 2015  Vernaccia di San Gimignano

Description: Heady aromas of pressed yellow flower, acacia honey and apricot follow over to the rounded palate along with yellow peach and nectarine. Fresh acidity provides lift while a bitter-almond note backs up the finish.
Name: Fattoria Paradiso 2015 Vigna dell'Ulivo Albana (Romagna)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Heady aromas of acacia flower, pear and yellow stone fruit lift out of the glass. On the ripe medium-bodied palate, tangy citrus notes underscore creamy yellow apple while almond and a hint of mineral signal the close.
Name: Guicciardini Strozzi 2015 Titolato Strozzi  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Hawthorn, honeysuckle and white stone fruit aromas meld together on this mouthwatering white. The rounded medium-bodied palate offers ripe yellow apple, yellow pear and juicy tangerine alongside a hint of bitter almond. Fresh acidity lifts the creamy flavors.
Name: Fornacelle 2015  Vernaccia di San Gimignano

Appellation: Vermentino di Sardegna, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Aromas of spring flower, Mediterranean brush, wild herb and tropical fruit lead the nose on this expressive white. The round juicy palate offers pineapple and yellow stone fruit, while a hint of chopped mint closes the finish.
Name: Argiolas 2015 Costamolino  (Vermentino di Sardegna)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Crisp and elegant, this offers alluring scents of white spring flower and yellow stone fruit. The bright linear palate mirrors the nose, offering yellow pear, crunchy apple, white almond and a citrusy note alongside vibrant acidity.
Name: Alessandro Tofanari 2013 Astrea  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Description: Combining ripe fruit and freshness, this sunny white delivers aromas of yellow flower and yellow stone fruit. Mirroring the aromas, the enveloping palate offers juicy apricot, candied ginger and citrus zest. Bright acidity lifts the rich flavors while a hint of almond closes the finish.
Name: Celli 2015 I Croppi Albana (Romagna)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Delicate aromas suggesting citrus blossom, white stone fruit and a whiff of chopped herb slowly emerge on this medium-bodied white. The fresh rounded palate offers yellow apple, juicy tangerine, lemon drop and a hint of almond alongside bright acidity a salty hint of mineral. A bitter-almond note graces the lingering finish.
Name: Massimo Daldin 2015 Vigna in Fiore  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Description: Aromas of Spanish broom, yellow apple, pear, toast and French oak lead to an elegant if slightly lean palate. A mineral vein adds interest while fresh acidity brightens the finish.
Name: Cottanera 2014 Contrada Calderara Bianco  (Etna)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Delicate aromas suggesting ripe orchard fruit, citrus, vanilla and a whiff of toasted oak lift out of the glass. The bright tangy palate presents candied lemon drop, apricot and yellow apple framed in mouthwatering acidity. An almond note closes the finish.
Name: Il Colombaio di Santa Chiara 2013 L'Albereta Riserva  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Aromas of French oak, vanilla, tropical fruit and a whisper of beeswax make their way over to the tangy palate along with citrus and white almond. It's linear and racy, with a saline finish.
Name: San Benedetto 2013 Riserva  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This has aromas of Abate Fetel pear, lime and white peach. The juicy palate contains nectarine zest, toasted hazelnut and candied lemon while bright acidity lifts the rich flavors.
Name: Tenuta Cavalier Pepe 2015 Refiano  (Fiano di Avellino)

Description: Fresh and lively, this opens with aromas of tropical fruit and fragrant white flower. The bright palate doles out juicy pineapple, ripe apricot and citrus zest alongside tangy acidity that lends a mouthwatering finish.
Name: Barone Sergio 2016 Alègre Grillo (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Made entirely with the native grape Trebbiano Spoletino, this opens with aromas of acacia flower, chamomile and a whiff of tropical fruit. The round medium-bodied palate offers ripe honeydew melon and nectarine zest alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Bocale 2015 Trebbiano Spoletino (Umbria)

Appellation: Vermentino di Gallura, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Made entirely with rare native grape Uvalino, this opens with aromas that recall ripe black plum and vanilla. The dense robust palate delivers prune, clove and a dusting of cocoa alongside assertive tannins. Enjoy through 2018.
Name: Tenute Olbios 2015 Lupus in Fabula  (Vermentino di Gallura)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with delicate aromas suggesting pineapple and papaya. The smooth bright palate delivers white peach, green apple and mint alongside zesty acidity.
Name: Tenuta Cavalier Pepe 2015 Nestor  (Greco di Tufo)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Aromas of French oak, vanilla, toast and grilled herb carry over to the tangy palate along with mature yellow apple and a hint of lemon drop. A note of bitter almond closes the finish.
Name: Panizzi 2012 Riserva  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Made with organically farmed grapes, this appealing white offers aromas of fragrant white flower and ripe orchard fruit. The savory succulent palate delivers white peach, citrus, honeydew melon and a mineral note. Fresh acidity brightens the creamy flavors while a hint of bitter almond adds depth. It's an incredible value.
Name: Il Palagione 2015 Hydra  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Description: Delicate scents of ripe orchard fruit, acacia and a whiff of honey guide the nose while the round palate offers apricot, yellow pear and a hint of pineapple. A light almond note closes the finish.
Name: Fattoria Zerbina 2015 Bianco di Ceparano Albana (Romagna)

Description: Made entirely with Grechetto, this opens with scents of acacia flower, citrus and hay. The savory palate offers yellow peach, cantaloupe and an almond note while crisp acidity gives it a clean finish.
Name: Roccafiore 2014 Fiorfiore Grechetto (Umbria)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Aromas of Spanish broom, ripe pear and a yeasty whiff of toasted bread crust come together in the glass. The savory palate offers mature yellow apple, bitter almond, white pepper and a saline note framed in tangy acidity.
Name: Cesani 2013 Sanice Riserva  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Delicately scented, this has aromas of hawthorn, beeswax and a whiff of white stone fruit. The savory palate doles out white peach, yellow apple and bitter almond while a dollop of honey signals the close.
Name: Cesani 2015 Pancole  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Acacia, honeyed nut and yellow stone fruit aromas lead the nose. The medium-bodied palate shows surprising depth for the cool wet vintage, offering yellow apple, pear and bitter almond alongside zesty acidity. A mouthwatering saline note wraps up the finish.
Name: Fattoria La Vialla 2014 Riserva  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Made with the Verdicchio grape, this vibrant sparkler doles out creamy yellow apple, pear and citrus zest flavors while a hint of walnut closes the finish. A soft mousse and fresh acidity lift the finish.
Name: Colonnara 2014 Liugi Ghislieri Metodo Classico  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This opens with enticing scents of white spring flower and white orchard fruit. On the bright palate, a hint of bitter almond underscores green apple and nectarine while bright acidity and a saline note provide a mouthwatering finish.
Name: Guicciardini Strozzi 2015 Principe Strozzi  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This has an alluring fragrance reminiscent of yellow flower and yellow stone fruit. On the racy, somewhat lean palate, notes of oak-driven spice and coffee accent yellow pear, nectarine zest and toasted almond.
Name: Cappella Sant'Andrea 2013 Prima Luce  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Description: This opens with aromas of tropical fruit, citrus and beeswax. The vibrant palate delivers grapefruit, lemon zest, rosemary and mint alongside lively acidity.
Name: Tenuta Cavalier Pepe 2015 Lila Falanghina (Irpinia)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This offers enticing aromas of peach, yellow flower and a whiff of aromatic herb while the round medium-bodied palate shows juicy apricot, yellow apple and a pleasantly bitter-almond note. Bright acidity lends freshness.
Name: Teruzzi & Puthod 2016  Vernaccia di San Gimignano

Appellation: Vermentino di Gallura, Sicily & Sardinia, Italy
Description: Aromas of tropical fruit, yellow apple and fragrant wild flower lead into a straightforward palate offering dried apricot, citrus, bitter almond and a confectionery note. Fresh acidity brightens the finish.
Name: Contini 2015 Elibaria  (Vermentino di Gallura)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Here's an enjoyable white that has light aromas of orchard fruit and citrus. The ripe palate reflects the nose, doling out yellow apple and tangerine alongside a note of bitter almond.
Name: Guidi 1929 2015  Vernaccia di San Gimignano

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Enticing whiffs suggesting yellow flower, aromatic herb, peach and citrus take center stage on this. The bright, enjoyable palate delivers mature yellow apple and a hint of ginger while a bitter-almond note marks the close.
Name: Il Lebbio 2015 Tropìe  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Description: This offers subdued aromas suggesting pear, acacia, sage and hazelnut that carry onto the ripe palate along with yellow peach. Bitter almond marks the finish.
Name: Morini 2015 Sette Note Secco Albana (Romagna)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Aromas of white spring flower, oak-driven vanilla and a whiff of white stone fruit lead the nose. The oak sensations follow through the somewhat lean palate, along with pear and a confectionery note. It closes on a note of bitter almond.
Name: La Mormoraia 2014 Riserva  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Aromas of toast, French oak, pressed yellow flower and white stone fruit lead the way. The rather lean palate offers yellow apple skin, bitter almond, saline and a honey note.
Name: Palagetto 2013 Riserva  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Description: This opens with subtle aromas evoking yellow pear, Mediterranean brush and a rather unusual whiff suggesting warm hay. The linear rather lean palate shows mature apricot, citrus and a hint of bitter almond alongside bright acidity and a tangy saline note.
Name: Capolino Perlingieri 2014 Vento Greco (Sannio)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Floral and fruity, this opens with aromas of yellow wild flower and orchard fruit. The bright rounded palate offers mature yellow apple, yellow pear and a hint of candied lemon drop alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Tenuta La Vigna 2016  Vernaccia di San Gimignano

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Heady aromas of white spring flower, vineyard dust and white stone fruit lead the way on this delightful white. The juicy palate doles out ripe apple, pear and a hint of honeyed almond alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Poderi Arcangelo 2015  Vernaccia di San Gimignano

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Subdued aromas of French oak, toast, tropical fruit and a whiff of dried herb carry follow over to the palate along with nuances of mature apple and citrus zest. A note of bitter almond closes the rather lean finish.
Name: Palagetto 2014 Arianna Ventanni  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Delicate aromas of Spanish broom, ripe stone fruit and aromatic herb float out of the glass. On the direct enjoyable palate, a note of bitter almond underscores ripe peach and yellow apple.
Name: Melini 2015 Le Grillaie  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Aromas suggesting pressed yellow flower, dried stone fruit and a whiff of toasted nut carry over to the straightforward palate. A hint of almond underscores yellow apple and a citrus note while tangy acidity lends freshness.
Name: Cappella Sant'Andrea 2015  Vernaccia di San Gimignano

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Ripe yellow stone fruit and a floral whiff of pressed Spanish broom lead the nose while the bright round palate offers mature yellow pear and orange zest. It closes on a note of bitter almond.
Name: Tenuta La Vigna 2015  Vernaccia di San Gimignano

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Delicate scents suggesting aromatic herb, citrus blossom and a whiff of orchard fruit come together on this. The palate is round but rather shy, offering notes of mature yellow apple, honey and bitter almond.
Name: San Quirico 2015  Vernaccia di San Gimignano

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Delicate aromas of white spring flower and a whiff of beeswax carry over to the fresh palate along with yellow apple and pear. A lightly bitter-almond note marks the finish.
Name: Sensi 2016 Collegiata  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Aromas of white spring flower, yellow pear and apple follow the straightforward palate along with a hint of citrus. A light touch of almond signals the close.
Name: Toscolo 2015  Vernaccia di San Gimignano

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with aromas of yellow flower, hay and beeswax. The crisp straightforward palate delivers apple, white peach and lemon. Enjoy soon.
Name: Vigna degli Estensi 2013 Soteria  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Delicately scented, this offers whiffs of white stone fruit and white spring flower. On the linear, rather lean palate, a note of bitter almond underscores green apple and citrus alongside racy acidity.
Name: Tenuta Le Calcinaie 2014  Vernaccia di San Gimignano

Description: Mature apricot, Spanish broom and a hint of candied citrus aromas lead to the extremely ripe dense palate along with honey and a confectionery note. A taste of almond backs up the rather bitter finish.
Name: La Sabbiona 2015 Alba della Torre Secco Albana (Romagna)

Description: Subdued aromas of yellow stone fruit and a whiff of acacia honey give way to the round ripe palate, along with notes of apricot and citrus zest. Bitter almond marks the close.
Name: Podere La Berta 2015 Albana (Romagna)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Here's a bright wine that opens with aromas of white field flowers, pears and a hint of nut. The straightforward palate offers yellow apple and a hint of bitter almond alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Massimo Daldin 2015  Vernaccia di San Gimignano

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Subtle aromas suggesting toasted oak, acacia and grapefruit take shape in the glass. On the racy palate, yellow apple, bitter almond and a hint of lemon zest are set against vibrant acidity.
Name: Panizzi 2014 Vigna Santa Margherita  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: A selection of the firm's best Vernaccia grapes, this offers delicate alluring scent of hawthorn and white stone fruit. The bright straightforward palate shows yellow apple and pear alongside fresh acidity while a bitter-almond note marks the finish.
Name: La Mormoraia 2015 Ostrea  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Delicately scented, this has subtle aromas evoking acacia, orchard fruit and a whiff of honeyed nut. The medium-bodied palate offers yellow apple and Bartlett pear that merge with bitter almond. It closes on a saline note.
Name: La Mormoraia 2015  Vernaccia di San Gimignano

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Made with organically farmed grapes, this has aromas suggesting acacia honey and toasted nut. The aromas carry over to the palate along with mature yellow apple and a marked note of bitter almond. Zesty acidity lifts the finish.
Name: Il Colombaio di Santa Chiara 2014 Campo della Pieve  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Aromas of toasted oak, smoke and whiff of dried yellow flower take shape in the glass. The rather lean racy palate shows oak, butterscotch, bitter almond and a hint of citrus zest while tangy acidity provides the framework.
Name: Falchini 2013 Vigna a Solatio Riserva  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Subdued aromas of French oak, toast and acacia waft out of the glass. The rather lean palate offers oak-driven spice, chopped herb and a hint of citrus set against racy acidity. It's rather shy on fruit richness.
Name: Poggio Alloro 2014 Le Mandorle Riserva  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Spanish broom, acacia and yellow stone fruit aromas lead the nose. On the lean racy palate, a bitter-almond note backs up yellow pear while zesty acidity provides the vibrant framework.
Name: Alessandro Tofanari 2014 Ciprea  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Description: Aromas of white wild flower and exotic fruit spring from the glass. The lively fruity palate doles out honeydew melon and juicy grapefruit alongside bright acidity.
Name: Colosi 2016 Grillo (Terre Siciliane)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This has subdued aromas of French oak as well as whiffs of orchard fruit and pressed acacia flower. On the palate, oak-driven spice, toast and bitter almond take center stage while notes of citrus zest and a hint of lemon drop peak through.
Name: Il Palagione 2015 Ori Riserva  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Subdued aromas of mature orchard fruit, honey and toasted nut follow the straightforward, rather evolved palate along with yellow-apple skin. A note of bitter almond closes the rather lean short finish.
Name: Poggio Alloro 2015 Il Nicchiaio  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This simple white has subdued aromas of white spring flower and white stone fruit. The no-fuss, rather diluted palate offers hints of white peach, green apple and a whisper of white almond.
Name: Signano 2015  Vernaccia di San Gimignano

Description: Made entirely with Montonico, this has subdued aromas of white peach, pear and hay. The aromas carry over to the informal, abrupt palate alongside fresh acidity. Drink soon.
Name: Ferrocinto 2015 Pollino Bianco Mantonico (Calabria)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Aromas of ripe yellow stone fruit and a whiff of nut carry over to the pleasant easygoing palate along with a hint of mature apricot. It's simple but well made, closing on a bitter-almond note.
Name: Melini 2015  Vernaccia di San Gimignano

Description: This opens with whiffs of white spring flower while the extremely simple, rather diluted palate offers green apple and white peach. Fresh acidity adds brightness.
Name: Cantine Grasso 2016 Baldovino Grillo (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Linear and mineral driven, this intriguing white opens with aromas of beeswax, acacia, citrus, stone fruit and a yeasty whiff of bread crust. On the expressive palate, a mineral note underscores juicy yellow peach, nectarine and apple. There's a lot going on and a lot to enjoy here.
Name: I Stefanini 2015 Monte di Fice  (Soave Classico)

Description: Spring wild-flower, yellow stone -ruit, aromatic herb and citrus aromas mark the nose of this radiant white. The dazzling palate doles out yellow peach, golden apple, lemon drop and nectarine zest, alongside crisp acidity that gives it a bright clean finish. A mineral note adds depth.
Name: Pieropan 2014 Calvarino  (Soave Classico)

Description: Aromas of passion fruit, hay and a vegetal note lead the nose while the bright fresh palate doles provides juicy nectarine, creamy peach and pear. A hint of mineral and white almond close the lingering finish.
Name: Le Mandolare 2015 Corte Menini  (Soave Classico)

Description: Heady aromas of caramel and toffee lead to a creamy palate full of complex brown sugar, coffee and peanut brittle flavors. This Canary Islands Malvasia finishes with classy flavors of butter and chocolate.
Name: El Grifo NV Canari Malvasia (Lanzarote)

Description: Aromas of yellow wild flower, citrus and sun-ripened orchard fruit lead into a round juicy palate boasting succulent yellow peach, apricot and lime. A mineral vein lifts the rich flavors while a hint of white almond closes the lingering finish. There's a lot to enjoy here.
Name: Pieropan 2015  Soave Classico

Description: Aromas of ripe Granny Smith apple and exotic fruit lead to creamy flavors of apricot, beeswax and a hint of pineapple on this delicious white. Just enough fresh acidity balances the rich flavors.
Name: I Stefanini 2015 Monte de Toni  (Soave Classico)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Kudos to Brian and Stephy Terrizzi for introducing this fascinating grape from southern Italy to Paso Robles. Rich white peach and poached pear aromas are edged with sharper mineral scents and boosted by vanilla undertones. The palate leads with bright acidity then explores red apple, cantaloupe and stone fruit flavors, proving easy to like but also tempered with restraint.
Name: Giornata 2015 Fiano (Paso Robles)

Description: Fresh and refined, this lovely wine boasts enticing scents of white spring flower, orchard fruit and a whiff of roasted herb. The bright palate offers nectarine zest, Bartlett pear and lively acidity while a mineral note closes the finish.
Name: Monte Tondo 2015 Monterotondo  (Soave Classico)

Description: Delicate aromas of orchard fruit, roasted herb and a hint of crushed stone waft out of the glass. The savory palate is more exuberant, doling out mature Bartlett pear, ripe white peach, mineral and white almond. Fresh acidity brightens the creamy flavors.
Name: Mosconi 2015 Corte Paradiso  (Soave)

Description: Mature orchard fruit, white flower and aromatic herb aromas float out of the glass along with a balsamic note. The bright savory palate shows crisp pear, nectarine zest, lemon drop and a hint of mineral alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Nardello 2015 Meridies  (Soave)

Description: Heady aromas of ripe apple, white peach, baking spice and chopped herb lead into a fresh creamy palate. An energizing mineral note brightens the succulent flavors while a hint of pineapple lingers on the finish. There lots to enjoy here.
Name: Guerrieri Rizzardi 2015 Costeggiola  (Soave Classico)

Description: This boasts alluring scents of Spanish broom, lychee and orchard fruit. The creamy elegant palate delivers mature pear and grilled herb while a juicy nectarine note closes the linear finish. Drink through 2020.
Name: Tenuta Solar 2015 Le Bancole  (Soave Classico)

Description: This opens with aromas suggesting grilled herb and ripe orchard fruit. Bright and linear, the palate offers pear, peach and aromatic herb while a hint of citrus zest marks the finish.
Name: Pasqua 2015 Villa Borghetti  (Soave)

Description: Mature orchard fruit, lychee, citrus zest and a balsamic note lead the way. The savory palate shows citrus zest and an unusual salty hint of cured meat alongside fresh acidity. A toasted note marks the finish.
Name: Le Mandolare 2015 Il Roccolo  (Soave Classico)

Description: Scents of beeswax, pressed flower and mature orchard fruit lead the nose while the savory, linear palate doles out pear, white almond and a citrus note. Fresh acidity brightens the creamy flavors.
Name: Vitevis 2015 Monopolio  (Soave Classico)

Description: Aromas of citrus blossom, mature pear and ripe peach follow through to the juicy palate along with apricot, pineapple and a mineral note. A hint of bitter almond closes the finish. It's extremely enjoyable and surprisingly fresh for the hot vintage.
Name: Tirapelle Nicola 2015 I Giaroni  (Soave)

Description: Made entirely with Nosiola, this opens with aromas of dried apricot, crème caramel and a whiff of orange jam. The rounded palate delivers orange blossom honey, fig and a hint of toasted almond.
Name: Pisoni 2002 Vino Santo Nosiola (Trentino)

Description: Apple, pear and aromatic herb aromas come together on this linear white and carry over to the bright palate along with yellow peach, citrus and mineral. It shows surprising freshness for such a hot vintage.
Name: Gino Fasoli 2015 Borgoletto  (Soave)

Description: Intense aromas of ripe apricot and exotic fruit lead to a creamy palate bursting with yellow stone fruit and candied lemon drop. A note of bitter almond lends depth to the finish.
Name: Corte Mainente 2015 Tovo Al Pigno  (Soave Classico)

Description: Alluring aromas of white spring flower and exotic fruit take shape in the glass. The round ripe palate shows mature apricot, creamy white peach and pear while a note of white almond signals the finish. There's a lot to like here.
Name: Prà 2015 Otto  (Soave)

Description: Appealing aromas of mature orchard fruit and chopped herb lead the way. The ripe round palate doles out creamy pear, white peach, candied ginger and a hint of bitter almond while just enough fresh acidity gives it a lift.
Name: Latium di Morini 2015 Campo Le Calle  (Soave)

Description: Aromas of ripe green apple, pear, Spanish broom and tangerine lead to a creamy palate of yellow stone fruit and a hint of white almond. Fresh acidity and a mineral note brighten the finish.
Name: Balestri Valda 2015  Soave Classico

Appellation: Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze, Veneto, Italy
Description: White spring flower and mature orchard fruit aromas lead the nose on this appealing sparkler. On the palate, notes of candied nectarine zest and lemon drop accent ripe green apple and pear.
Name: Zardetto 2015  Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze

Description: Aromas of chamomile flower and ripe orchard fruit lead the nose while the round palate offers mature apple, Bartlett pear, juicy white peach and a hint of mineral. There's a lot to enjoy here.
Name: Cantina di Monteforte 2015 Vicario  (Soave Classico)

Appellation: Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze, Veneto, Italy
Description: Subtle aromas of wild flower and white stone fruit set the tone on this bright sparkler. On the fresh creamy palate, green apple, white peach and a note of candied nectarine zest reign.
Name: Merotto NV Dry  (Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze)

Description: Appealing aromas of mature pear, crushed stone and a hint of grilled herb lift out of the glass. The ripe palate offers juicy nectarine, pineapple and creamy white peach while a hint of bitter almond closes it down. It has just enough freshness to support the rich flavors.
Name: Tamellini 2015  Soave

Description: Ripe aromas of fragrant white flower, tropical fruit and white stone fruit seamlessly follow the appealing palate along with juicy peach, citrus zest and a hint of apricot. A hint of white almond wraps up the finish.
Name: Tessari 2015 Monte Tenda  (Soave Classico)

Description: Aromas of grilled herb, mature orchard fruit and citrus lead the nose while the palate offers Bartlett pear and nectarine zest. Notes of white almond and a hint of mineral signal the close.
Name: Collis 2015 Scaligeri Decanto  (Soave)

Description: Here's a creamy white that delivers aromas and flavors of white peach, pear and white almond. A mineral note and fresh acidity lift the finish.
Name: Corte Moschina 2015 Evaos  (Soave)

Description: Delicate aromas of mature apple, pear and a whiff of aromatic herb lead the nose. On the enjoyable palate, savory notes of grilled herb and a delicate hint of bread crust add depth to honeydew melon and citrus.
Name: Portinari 2015 U. P.  (Soave)

Description: This savory white opens with aromas of acacia flower, crushed stone and citrus zest. The ripe round palate gives pear, chopped herb, baked pineapple and a flinty (almost smoky) note.
Name: Montecrocetta 2015 Santa Giustina  (Soave)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Always a terrific value, this refreshing white has aromas of fragrant white flower, mint and orchard fruit. The straightforward palate offers crunchy Granny Smith apple, a hint of orange zest and a crisp clean finish.
Name: Falchini 2015 Vigna a Solatio  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Description: This savory white opens with aromas of exotic fruit, apricot, hay and a whiff of wild flower that follow through to the palate along with grapefruit and a vegetal note. A mineral accent lifts the finish.
Name: Franchetto 2015 La Capelina  (Soave)

Description: Aromas of mature orchard fruit, dried herb and a whiff of pressed flower lead the nose. The straightforward, enjoyable palate offers ripe pear, nectarine and a mineral note. White almond wraps up the finish.
Name: Fattori 2015 Danieli  (Soave)

Description: Aromas of yellow and white stone fruit lead the nose along with a whiff of cut grass. On the bright fresh palate, notes of chopped herb accent ripe peach, pineapple and grapefruit.
Name: Dal Cero Tenuta di Corte Giacobbe 2015 Corte Giacobbe  (Soave)
Winery: Dal Cero Tenuta di Corte Giacobbe

Description: Pear, white flower and crushed herb aromas jump out of the glass. The fresh savory palate offers creamy white peach, apple and a hint of nectarine zest while a mineral note lends energy.
Name: Corte Moschina 2015 Roncathe  (Soave)

Description: Initially shy, this eventually reveals aromas of citrus blossom, orchard fruit and grilled herb. The aromas carry over to the savory enjoyable palate along with citrusy notes.
Name: Tenuta Grimani 2015 Farinaldo  (Soave)

Description: Spring flower and mature orchard fruit aromas lead the nose. The savory palate doles out juicy nectarine, ripe pear and white almond while a note of toasted herb closes the finish.
Name: Le Albare 2015 Cà Bianchi  (Soave)

Description: Aromas of ripe Granny Smith apple, apricot and tropical fruit give way to juicy white peach and citrus flavors. A bitter almond note on the finish adds interest.
Name: Le Battistelle 2015 Montesei  (Soave Classico)

Description: Aromas of mature orchard fruit and botanical herb lift out of the glass. The aromas repeat on the bright palate along with a juicy hint of nectarine and an almond note.
Name: Corte Adami 2015  Soave

Description: This offers aromas of white spring flower, orchard fruit and almond. On the straightforward palate, a hint of mineral underscores pear and citrus.
Name: Le Albare 2015 Monte Majore  (Soave Classico)

Appellation: Vigneti delle Dolomiti, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Made from native grape Nosiola, this straightforward white has subdued aromas of Alpine flower and citrus. The crisp palate delivers lime, lemon zest and a hint of grapefruit alongside bright acidity.
Name: Pisoni 2015 Nosiola (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

Description: Citrus, pineapple and chopped herb aromas carry over to the ripe enjoyable palate. A note of candied nectarine zest marks the finish.
Name: Tessari 2015  Soave

Description: A bit closed at first, this eventually offers delicate aromas suggesting white spring flower and exotic fruit. On the straightforward palate, juicy citrus and pineapple notes mingle with ripe pear.
Name: Vecentini 2015 Terrelunghe  (Soave)

Description: Aromas of lemon, white flower and white stone fruit lead the nose while the bright, juicy bright palate offers pear, peach and nectarine zest. A note of white almond caps off the finish.
Name: Corte Mainente 2015 Cengelle  (Soave)

Description: Ripe aromas of mature yellow apple and a balsamic note lead the nose along with a hint of candied lemon zest. The aromas follow over to the round, ready palate along with a note of bitter almond.
Name: Marcello Turra 2015 Sassani  (Soave Classico)

Description: Here's an enjoyable straightforward white that offers aromas and flavors of ripe apple, peach and a hint of nectarine zest. A white almond note closes the finish.
Name: I Stefanini 2015 Il Selese  (Soave)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: Aromas of yellow stone fruit and toasted almond lead the nose. The ripe round palate mirrors the nose, offering mature apricot, peach, nut and a honey note.
Name: Fattoria La Vialla 2015  Vernaccia di San Gimignano

Description: This opens with aromas suggesting mature yellow apple, acacia flower and a whiff of lychee. The straightforward enjoyable palate offers ripe Bartlett pear, bitter almond and a hint of mineral. Enjoy soon.
Name: La Cappuccina 2015  Soave

Description: Acacia, beeswax and orchard fruit aromas lead the way on this. The aromas carry over to the ripe round palate along with suggestions of apple and pear.
Name: Sandro de Bruno 2015 Terre di Terrossa  (Soave)

Description: Alluring aromas of white spring flower, orchard fruit and a hint of aromatic herb lead the nose. The fresh palate offers ripe pear and citrus zest while an uplifting hint of thyme signals the close.
Name: Tenuta Santa Maria 2015 Lepia  (Soave)

Description: White spring flower, mature pear and yellow peach aromas lead the nose on this enjoyable white. The ripe round palate offers exotic fruit and a hint of white almond.
Name: Zambon 2015  Soave

Description: Aromas of white spring flower, orchard fruit and citrus spill out of the glass. The fun lively palate delivers ripe yellow peach and green apple alongside a foaming mousse.
Name: De Stefani 2015 Nature  (Prosecco)

Appellation: Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze, Veneto, Italy
Description: Aromas of green apple, Bartlett pear, citrus and sage lead into the lightly sparkling palate. Fresh acidity lifts the rich flavors.
Name: Valdo NV Cuvée Viviana  (Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze)

Description: This fun sparkler opens with aromas of spring flower and white stone fruit. The frothy palate delivers Granny Smith apple and white peach alongside refreshing acidity.
Name: Famiglia Cielo NV  Prosecco

Description: Aromas of mature yellow apple and a whiff of chamomile flower lead the nose. The aromas carry over to the extremely ripe palate along with a hint of acacia and a marked note of bitter almond.
Name: Marcello Turra 2015  Soave

Description: This opens with aromas of resin and a whiff of dried flower that follow through to the lean palate along with hints of citrus and dried stone fruit. But it's cut short by extremely bitter sensations that recall walnut skin.
Name: Cantina di Gambellara 2015 Monopolio  (Soave Classico)

Description: This informal white opens with whiffs of orchard fruit and citrus while the simple palate offers suggestions of pear and pineapple. A hint of bitter almond marks the rather lean abrupt finish.
Name: Tinazzi 2015 Cà de' Rocchi  (Soave)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This opens with pear, Mediterranean herb and yellow flower aromas. The palate is juicy with white peach, Granny Smith apple and toasted almond flavors. It's brushed with crisp acidity to give it a refreshing finish.
Name: Guicciardini Strozzi 2014 Riserva  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Vernaccia di San Gimignano, Tuscany, Italy
Description: This has heady floral aromas of honeysuckle and orange blossom. The palate is medium-bodied and round, delivering yellow apple, citrus zest and candied ginger notes, framed by bright acidity.
Name: Guicciardini Strozzi 2015 Villa Cusona  (Vernaccia di San Gimignano)

Appellation: Temecula Valley, South Coast, California, US
Description: Finding new varietals is always fun, and this take on an ancient grape from Campania, Italy, offers promise in warm Temecula. Crisp Anjou and Asian pears show on the nose, along with salt, Gala apple, white flowers and gravel. Sharp citrus appears on the palate, with lime pith, pink-grapefruit juice and a chalky, seashell component.
Name: Cougar 2015 Falanghina (Temecula Valley)

Description: Lightly floral and shining in medium acidity, this vineyard-designate shows a restrained, stony element of apricot and lemon that remains unfussy on the palate and lengthy finish.
Name: Fleur 2015 Las Brisas Vineyard Vermentino (Carneros)

Description: Made entirely with Ciliegiolo grapes, this opens with fruity aromas of red raspberry and red cherry that carry over to the easy-drinking palate along with hints of vanilla and cinnamon. It's already accessible and enjoyable, with smooth tannins.
Name: Rascioni e Cecconello 2012 Poggio Ciliegio Ciliegiolo (Toscana)

Description: Aromas of mature pear, toast and citrus lead the nose. The round ripe palate offers yellow apple, dried apricot, a confectionery note and a hint of oak. A coffee note closes the finish.
Name: Bruni 2015 Vermentino (Toscana)

Description: Aromas of citrus and yellow stone fruit lead the way along with a whiff of pineapple. The rather lean linear palate offers tangerine, grapefruit and a hint of almond. It closes on a savory saline note.
Name: Nittardi 2015 BEN Vermentino (Toscana)

Description: This opens with aromas of white and yellow wild flower and yellow stone fruit. The bright palate doles out juicy yellow peach, nectarine and a hint of Mediterranean herb alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Poggio al Tesoro 2015 Solosole Vermentino (Toscana)

Description: Aromas of yellow stone fruit, white spring flower and a whiff of citrus lift out of the glass. The soft round palate offers ripe apricot, yellow peach and a hint of candied nectarine zest.
Name: Marchesi de' Frescobaldi 2015 Ammiraglia Massovivo Vermentino (Toscana)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Light aromas of squeezed lime and sliced Anjou pear emerge on the nose of this bottling from a large vineyard on the eastern flanks of the region. The palate is tight and bright if quite restrained, with thinly sliced lime and a chalky grip. The wine would be refreshing in warm weather.
Name: Broken Earth 2015 Vermentino (Paso Robles)

Description: Aromas of yellow wild flower, tropical fruit and a whiff of Mediterranean herb lift out of the glass. The full round palate offers yellow peach, juicy apricot and a candied-citrus note.
Name: Sator 2015 Vermentino (Toscana)

Description: Made entirely with Trebbiano and vinified in oak, this opens with aromas of mature orchard fruit, citrus, chopped herb and a whiff of toast. The linear, rather lean palate offers toasted almond, coffee, oak and green pear.
Name: Pieve de' Pitti 2013 Tribiana Trebbiano (Toscana)

Description: Made with Vermentino, this has typical varietal aromas of white spring flower, yellow stone fruit and citrus. Soft and round, the easygoing palate offers yellow peach and a note of candied tangerine.
Name: Poggio Nicchiaia 2015 Fiore del Borgo Vermentino (Toscana)

Description: Here's a fun informal white that has delicate aromas of yellow stone fruit and a whiff of wild flower. The simple but well-made palate offers yellow peach and a citrusy note. Enjoy as an apéritif or pair it with light first courses.
Name: Poggio al Tufo 2015 Vermentino (Toscana)

Description: Delicately scented, this opens with aromas of white spring flower, orchard fruit and a whiff of Mediterranean herb. On the creamy palate, an energizing mineral vein underscores golden apple, juicy white and peach and nectarine.
Name: Tenuta Roveglia 2015 Wighel  (Lugana)
