Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of ripe orchard fruit and chopped herb jump out of the glass. The savory palate serves up juicy Bartlett pear, green apple, citrus and a mint note while a hint of white almond adds depth. Very appealing.
Name: Moncaro 2015 Le Vele  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

Description: Showing surprising structure for the vintage, this medium-bodied white offers aromas of honey, nut, pressed flower and peach. The flavors follow through to the vibrant palate, along with mineral and tangy acidity.
Name: Vigne Marina Coppi 2014 Marine Favorita (Colli Tortonesi)

Description: Aromas of tropical fruit and white peach carry over to the creamy palate along with ripe Granny Smith apple, candied lemon rind and a ginger note. Fresh acidity lifts the rather rich finish.
Name: Malvirà 2015  Roero

Description: This enjoyable white opens with aromas of pressed white flower and exotic fruit. The aromas follow over to the round palate along with banana and a hint of toast.
Name: Malvirà 2014 Vigna Trinità  (Roero)

Description: While the small coastal appellation of Colares, just north of Lisbon, is better known for its reds, it does produce even smaller quantities of white Malvasia de Colares. This wine is perfumed, ripe with honeyed notes as well as a salty, mineral character. The aftertaste shows the spice from short wood aging. Drink now.
Name: Adega Viuva Gomes 2013 Vinho Branco Malvasia (Colares)

Description: Orchard blossom, green apple and chopped aromatic herb aromas give way to a fresh concentrated palate. A hazelnut note adds interest and signals the close.
Name: Malvirà 2014 Vigna Renesio  (Roero)

Description: Delicate aromas of orchard fruit and citrus lead to a medium-bodied palate showing ripe yellow peach and green apple. A blast of candied tangerine closes the finish.
Name: Montonale 2015  Lugana

Description: This sparkler from Piedmont opens with aromas of toasted oak, walnut and mature yellow apple that carry over to the palate along with a confectionery note. The flavors seem a bit tired so drink soon.
Name: Negro Lorenzo 2010 Metodo Classico  (Roero)

Description: Ripe and creamy, this opens with a heady fragrance white spring flower and exotic fruit. The round expressive palate tastes of peach, pear, lemon drop, grapefruit and wild herb. Hints of white almond and mineral linger on the finish.
Name: Coffele 2015 Ca' Visco  (Soave Classico)

Description: Vines on the eastern coast of Corsica give this attractive wine with a cool character. It is crisp with baked apple and green-plum fruit that are bright with tangy acidity and fresh perfume. The wine is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Vetriccie 2015 Vermentino (Corse)

Description: Eight months on lees before bottling give this wine its rich, concentrated character. Melon and green-plum fruits are poised and stylish, pointed up by a touch of pepper. It is ripe, full bodied, ready to drink in 2017.
Name: Clos Venturi 2015 Vermentino (Corse)

Description: Aromas of white wild flower and chamomile float out of the glass along with a whiff of orchard fruit. The ripe round palate offers juicy Bartlett pear, golden apple and peach. A note of bitter almond wraps up the finish.
Name: Ca' Rugate 2015 San Michele  (Soave Classico)

Description: Aromas of exotic fruit, white spring flower and yellow stone fruit lead the nose while the round creamy palate doles out apricot, mineral, chopped herb and nectarine. A mineral vein lifts the finish.
Name: Cantina del Castello 2015 Castello  (Soave Classico)

Description: Aromas of tropical fruit, pressed wild flower and ripe orchard fruit lead the nose. The round savory palate offers juicy peach, red Bartlett pear and a white almond note. Energizing mineral lifts the creamy flavors.
Name: Gini 2015  Soave Classico

Description: This pure Vermentinu (the local spelling) is fragrant, crisp and deliciously fresh. With bright acidity as well as zesty white fruits and orange peel, it is perfumed and ready to drink for its freshness, or age until 2017 for extra richness.
Name: Yves Leccia 2015 E Croce Vermentino (Patrimonio)

Description: This offers enticing scents of white spring flower and green apple. The juicy palate doles out pineapple, peach and tangerine while a note of candied drop wraps up the finish.
Name: Corte Adami 2015 Cimalto  (Soave Classico)

Description: This is a perfumed, citrus and apricot-flavored wine. It is crisp, with a ripe character that fills the mouth with rich fruitiness. It has a light, mineral structure and a long, fruity aftertaste. Drink now.
Name: Clos Poggiale 2015 Vermentino (Corse)

Description: Full and perfumed, this wine has a rich character, with ripe apples, green plums and lively acidity. With its wildflower aromas and touch of pepper, it is both delicious and evocative.
Name: Domaine Vico 2015 Vermentino (Corse)

Description: Ripe peach, apple and exotic fruit aromas lead the nose and carry over to the round, easy-drinking palate along with hints of sage and white almond. A light mineral note lends energy.
Name: Coffele 2015 Castel Cerino  (Soave Classico)

Description: Called Vermentinu in Corsica, the grape gives an aromatic wine with wildflower scents. On the palate, it's crisp with pears and red apples that are cut by the squeeze of citrus. Drink this attractive wine now.
Name: Clos Venturi 2015 1769 Vermentino (Corse)

Description: This opens with subtle scents of acacia flower, lemon peel and green apple. The bright juicy palate offers ripe pear and a hint of nectarine that carry through to the clean, juicy finish.
Name: Fornaro 2015  Soave Classico

Description: Aromas of chamomile flower, Spanish broom and orchard fruit lift out of the glass. The ripe palate offers exotic fruit, juicy peach and a note of candied citrus zest.
Name: Inama 2015 Vin Soave  (Soave Classico)

Description: Round and ripe, this opens with fruity aromas of ripe apple and yellow stone fruit. The soft juicy palate delivers peach, pineapple and banana while a hint of mineral signals the finish.
Name: Fattori 2015 Runcaris  (Soave)

Description: This wine is nutty, with a pronounced aroma of stone fruit and preserved lemon. These characteristics follow through on the palate, buoyed by crisp acidity. The finish offers more voluptuous mouthfeel and weight.
Name: Portalupi 2015 Las Brisas Vineyard Vermentino (Carneros)

Description: The perfumed character of this pure Vermentino is right up front. It gives the wine its ripe character and fine orange blossom aromas. The wine is crisp, juicy and with a refreshing aftertaste.
Name: Clos Teddi 2015 Vermentino (Patrimonio)

Description: Aromas of ripe orchard fruit, pressed flower and a whiff of citrus zest take center stage on this enjoyable white. The bright palate offers golden apple and pear while a note of bitter almond closes the finish.
Name: Bolla 2015 Tufaie  (Soave Classico)

Description: Honeysuckle, white stone fruit and honeydew melon aromas lift out of the glass. The round, easy-drinking palate offers Granny Smith apple and white grapefruit. It finishes clean and fresh.
Name: Rocca Bernarda 2015  Soave Classico

Description: Oxidative in character, this ripe wine has melon, spice and almond flavors. It is ready to drink.
Name: Domaine Marengo 2014 Appolonia Vermentino (Patrimonio)

Description: Enticing scents of ripe orchard fruit, aromatic herb and fragrant white spring flower take center stage on this elegant sparkler. The generous palate doles out juicy white peach, ripe Granny Smith apple and tangerine zest. Fresh acidity brightens the creamy flavors while an elegant mousse imparts finesse.
Designation: Vigneto della Riva di San Floriano Brut
Name: Nino Franco 2015 Vigneto della Riva di San Floriano Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Lovely scents of ripe pear, white flower, Mediterranean herb, freshly baked bread and a hint of honey come together on this. The elegantly sparkling palate delivers white peach, green apple, lemon and nectarine zest. Fresh acidity brightens the creamy flavors while a soft perlage adds elegance.
Name: Dubl NV Brut Metodo Classico Falanghina (Vino Spumante)

Appellation: Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze, Veneto, Italy
Description: Intensely fragrant, this lovely sparkler offers enticing aromas of white spring flower and ripe orchard fruit. The savory palate doles out green apple, white peach, tangerine zest and chopped herb while fresh acidity lifts the rich flavors. A creamy perlage lends finesse.
Name: Villa Sandi 2015 Cartizze Vigna La Rivetta  (Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze)

Description: Made with 100% Trebbiano, this has fresh scents of white spring flower, orchard fruit and citrus. The vibrant palate delivers green apple, lemon zest, mineral and a hint of saline alongside an elegant perlage. It finishes bone dry.
Name: Suavia NV Opera Semplice Metodo Classico Trebbiano (Vino Spumante)

Description: Bread crust, citrus, chopped herb and orchard fruit aromas lift out of the glass. The vibrant palate offers lime, nectarine and toasted hazelnut alongside vibrant acidity. An elegant mousse carries through to the crisp, bone-dry finish.
Name: Fattori 2010 Roncà Pas Dosé Metodo Classico  (Lessini Durello)

Description: This fragrant sparkler offers aromas of pressed white flower, citrus zest, bread crust and a whiff of cake spice. The vibrant elegant palate tastes of tangerine, candied lemon drop, golden apple, crushed herb and ginger. Lively acidity brightens the rich flavors while an almond note backs up the finish.
Name: Corte Moschina 2010 Metodo Classico Brut Riserva  (Lessini Durello)

Description: Made with the Durello grape, refermented in the bottle and left on its lees, this lightly frothy wine has delicate scents of fragrant wild flower, citrus and a whiff of crushed stone. The vibrant palate doles out lime, grapefruit, pear and energizing mineral alongside bright acidity. It finishes crisp and refreshing. The sediment at the bottom of the bottle adds even more flavor to the last glass.
Name: Corte Moschina NV Purocaso sui Lieviti Durella (Veneto)

Description: Lovely floral aromas of white spring flower meld together with scents of an orchard in bloom and a whiff of bread crust. The creamy palate doles out apple, yellow peach, toasted nut and a hint of honey alongside a persistent perlage.
Name: Dubl NV Dublesse Dosaggio Zero Metodo Classico Greco (Vino Spumante)

Description: Aromas of fragrant white flower, chopped herb and white stone fruit jump out of the glass while the creamy palate presents juicy yellow peach, mature green apple and a note of candied nectarine zest. A soft foaming mousse accompanies the rich flavors.
Name: Nino Franco 2015 Primo Franco Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Appellation: Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze, Veneto, Italy
Description: Aromas of delicately fragrant wild flower, orchard fruit and citrus waft out of the glass. The savory, vibrant palate presents green apple, white peach, lime and aromatic herb alongside fresh acidity and a softly foaming mousse.
Name: Bisol 2015 Dry  (Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze)

Description: Crisp and refreshing, this opens with aromas of white spring flower and pear. Made with native grape Turbiana, the vibrant palate offers green apple, lime and bitter almond. Racy acidity lifts the finish.
Name: Zenato 2013 Brut Metodo Classico  (Lugana)

Description: Creamy and refreshing, this offers aromas of white spring flower, white peach and tropical fruit. The bright frothy palate offers mature pear, apple, tangerine zest and candied lemon drop alongside an elegant perlage and fresh acidity.
Name: Santa Margherita 2015 Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Pear, citrus, chopped herb and yeasty aromas lift out of the glass. On the vibrant palate, bread crust and toasted nut accent a citrusy core of lemon and lime. Zesty acidity gives it a firm finish.
Name: Fattori 2010 Roncà Brut Metodo Classico  (Lessini Durello)

Description: You'll find scents of spring flower, white stone fruit, citrus and bread crust on this bright sparkler. The firm palate offers mature yellow apple, yellow pear, citrus zest and a hint of roasted nut alongside a vibrant, persistent perlage.
Name: Corte Moschina 2012 Metodo Classico  (Lessini Durello)

Appellation: Shenandoah Valley (CA), Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Fresh and lively with apple, almond and orange flavors, this light-bodied wine is well balanced, crisp in mouthfeel yet rich enough to be satisfying.
Name: Bella Grace 2015 Vermentino (Shenandoah Valley (CA))

Description: This bright sparkler opens with aromas of ripe orchard fruit, dried wild flower and a hint of bread crust. The palate offers mature yellow apple, white peach and a note of bitter almond alongside a vibrant perlage.
Name: Cascina Le Presceglie NV Ishuara Brut  (Lugana)

Appellation: Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze, Veneto, Italy
Description: Jasmine, aromatic herb and pear aromas waft out of the glass. The bright, creamy palate doles out ripe green apple, candied nectarine zest, ginger and a mineral note alongside fresh acidity and frothy bubbles. This is a fun, delicious sparkler for all occasions.
Name: De Faveri 2015 Dry  (Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Toast, bread crust and vanilla aromas lead the nose. The lean palate offers yellow-apple skin, toasted hazelnut and a hint of lime alongside a light effervescence.
Name: Garofoli 2009 Brut Metodo Classico Riserva  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi)

Description: Made with the Cortese grape, this fresh sparkler opens with scents of pressed wild flower and bread crust. The bright palate offers mature peach, hazelnut and mineral alongside an elegant perlage.
Designation: Brut Balcn de Blancs Metodo Classico
Name: Villa Sparina 2012 Brut Balcn de Blancs Metodo Classico  (Gavi)

Appellation: Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze, Veneto, Italy
Description: Aromas recalling toasted walnut, underbrush and bread crust make themselves known. The vibrant, rather lean palate offers yellow apple, pear and lime alongside small, persistent bubbles and zest acidity. Bitter almond closes the finish.
Name: Bisol 2013 Private Brut  (Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze)

Appellation: Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze, Veneto, Italy
Description: Wild flower, apple and citrus aromas lead the nose. The lean, racy palate offers lime, grapefruit and unripe pear alongside brisk acidity and vivacious effervescence. It finishes crisp and clean.
Name: Bisol 2014 Private Noso Brut  (Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze)

Description: Aromas of wild flower and green apple lead the nose on this lightly sparkling wine. The frothy palate offers Bartlett pear, yellow peach and grapefruit alongside crisp acidity.
Name: Bisol 2015 Molera Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: White spring flower and orchard fruit aromas float out of the glass. The bright breezy palate shows crisp green apple, peach and a hint of tangerine zest alongside a soft mousse and vibrant acidity.
Name: Valdo 2014 Numero 10 Metodo Classico  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Fun and refreshing, this is led by scents of spring wild flower and white stone fruit. The lively enjoyable palate offers green apple, white peach, citrus and white almond alongside a firm but elegant perlage. Crisp acidity gives it a clean finish.
Name: Pasini San Giovanni NV Brut Metodo Classico  (Lugana)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Here's a fun, informal sparkler that has aromas of citrus, orchard fruit and toast. The racy palate shows golden apple, pear, bitter almond and a lemon drop note.
Name: Cantine di Marzo NV Anni Venti Metodo Classico  (Greco di Tufo)

Appellation: Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze, Veneto, Italy
Description: You'll find scents of honeysuckle, jasmine and yellow peach on this fun sparkler. The rich palate shows ripe apricot, candied citrus zest and a confectionary note alongside lightly foaming bubbles.
Name: Tenuta Sant'Anna NV  Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze

Description: Lightly scented, this racy sparkler offers subdued aromas of citrus, dried apple and toasted bread crust. The straightforward palate offers tangerine zest, lime and a nutty note alongside firm acidity.
Name: Fattori 2012 Brut Metodo Classico  (Lessini Durello)

Description: Aromas of bread crust, white flower and orchard fruit lead the nose. The sharp, bracing palate offers bitter almond, candied citrus zest and a note of medicinal herb alongside vigorous bubbles.
Designation: For You Extra Brut Metodo Classico
Name: Demarie 2012 For You Extra Brut Metodo Classico  (Roero)

Description: Fun and refreshing, this frothy sparkler opens with scents of spring flower and white stone fruit. The lively palate doles out creamy white peach and green apple alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Zonin NV Cuvée 1821 Brut  (Prosecco)

Description: Aromas of green apple carry over to the fresh simple palate along with vanilla and a confectionary note. Vigorous persistent bubbles generate a frothy perlage.
Name: Merotto NV Colbelo Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Aromas of ripe orchard fruit, yellow flower, liqueur and nut lead the nose. The mature palate offers green apple, candied lemon drop and a confectionary note alongside brisk acidity and big, harsh bubbles.
Designation: Faiv Blanc de Blancs Metodo Classico
Name: Tenuta Cà du Russ 2007 Faiv Blanc de Blancs Metodo Classico Arneis (Vino Spumante)

Description: At first whiff this wine smells burnt, but that fades to show a buttered popcorn, nutty aroma. A walnut-like astringency accompanies the otherwise smooth and viscous texture.
Name: Barrel Racer 2013 Fiano (California)

Description: Full body and powerfully fruity flavors make this sweet wine seem extra bold. It smells like toasted almonds and dried meat and tastes like poached peaches. A smooth but lively texture keeps the flavors zinging on the finish.
Name: Uvaggio NV Passito Vermentino (Lodi)

Appellation: Hudson River Region, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Boisterously fruity and aromatic, this full-bodied white offers a bounty of luscious peach, pineapple and mango flavors. It's voluptuously ripe yet briskly balanced, finishing on a crisp mineral tone. Drink now through 2018 to capture the essence of its fresh, fruity style.
Name: Millbrook 2015 Proprietor's Special Reserve Tocai Friulano (Hudson River Region)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: A deep amber color and a rich, almost thick mouthfeel support tempting aromas and flavors like honey, orange marmalade and toasted almonds. Complex and interesting, it's super sweet and syrupy, but still stays light in weight.
Name: Monte Volpe 2011 Dolce Alexandra Late Harvest Tocai Friulano (Mendocino County)

Appellation: Sutter County, North Coast, California, US
Description: This unusual varietal wine has steely, mineral aromas and lively flavors like apricot and white peach, along with a relatively light body and lively acidity.
Name: Rock Wall 2015 Fiano (Sutter County)

Appellation: Russian River Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: The producer continues to give a nod to its Italian roots with this creamy, viscous white, exotic in its blend of pear, melon and vanilla, a touch of wood adding texture and weight.
Name: Seghesio 2014 Arneis (Russian River Valley)

Appellation: Applegate Valley, Southern Oregon, Oregon, US
Description: This wine bears the blue label, and includes 20% Sauvignon Blanc in the blend. The grapes were co-fermented and aged in oak. The wine is grassy, woody and herbal, with tart acidity. Unusual, but perhaps it would have been better if left entirely in stainless.
Name: Troon 2014 Blue Label Vermentino (Applegate Valley)

Description: Confected and slightly artificial, there's a thick aroma of canned pineapple syrup and rose petals on the nose, which feels a bit off balance from the much less-intense palate. Bright canned fruit lingers on the finish.
Name: Los Pinos Ranch 2015 Lost Draw Vineyards Vermentino (Texas High Plains)

Description: Fermented and left on the skins in amphora for 120 days, this alluring orange wine offers an array of intriguing aromas including saline, dried yellow stone fruit, baking spice and honey. The vibrant, savory palate continues to open up in the glass, doling out dried apricot, candied orange zest, aromatic herb, tobacco and candied ginger alongside racy acidity. A flinty mineral vein backs up the finish.
Name: Tre Monti 2014 Vitalba in Anfora Albana (Romagna)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Honey, concentrated orange blossoms and very ripe jasmine flowers make for a sweet-smelling, nearly treacly nose on this dynamic bottling by Steve Clifton. And in the magic that is this Italian grape, the palate is bone-dry, with touches of lemon balm, lemon verbena and white flower petals. It's unique, interesting and tasty.
Name: Palmina 2014 Larner Vineyard Malvasia Bianca (Ballard Canyon)

Description: Made with the Albana grape, this opens with scents suggesting thyme honey, yellow stone fruit and a whiff of toasted nut. The bright, medium-bodied palate offers dried apricot, lemon drop and bitter almond while a mineral note adds energy.
Name: Tenuta La Viola 2015 Interra Bianco Albana (Forlì)

Description: Made with Grecanico, this amber-colored wine offers aromas suggesting candied nectarine zest, sea breeze, tilled soil and Mediterranean herb. The linear palate delivers dried apricot, mineral and bitter almond alongside bright acidity. A hint of tangerine closes the finish.
Name: COS 2014 Pithos Bianco Grecanico (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Aromas of candied orange zest, crushed herb, pressed Spanish broom and a hint of honey follow through to the medium-bodied palate along with ripe yellow apple and dried stone fruit. Bright acidity lifts the finish while a note of bitter almond wraps up the close.
Name: Villa Papiano 2015 Terra! Albana (Sillaro)

Appellation: Mendocino County, Mendocino County, California, US
Description: Fresh, bright and subtly floral in flavor, this dry and medium-bodied wine combines richness with good acidity for beautiful balance and a refreshing personality. It's not too fruity, not too thin, but just right.
Name: Monte Volpe 2014 Tocai Friulano (Mendocino County)

Description: Made with Albana grapes fermented in Georgian amphorae, this opens with intense and unusual aromas of resin, dried stone fruit and candied orange zest. The palate is structured and dense, offering honey, mineral and walnut alongside racy acidity. You'll also feel some heat on the finish.
Name: Braschi 2015 Campo Mamante Anfora Albana (Romagna)

Description: Aromas of apricot and white spring flower lift out of the glass. The apricot note follows through to the palate, along with yellow peach, honeydew melon and almond, all framed in bright acidity. This one closes on a flinty note.
Name: Tenuta La Marchesa 2015 Gold Label  (Gavi)

Description: Delicately scented with white spring blossom and a whiff of tropical fruit, this medium-bodied white offers pineapple, ripe melon and nectarine zest. Lively acidity brightens the enveloping texture.
Name: Cantina Fratelli Pardi 2015 Trebbiano Spoletino (Spoleto)

Description: This opens with subdued aromas of citrus blossom and yellow stone fruit while the weighty palate doles out unripe apricot, yellow peach and bitter almond. Showing the heat of the vintage, this shows less overt freshness than it does in cooler vintages. You'll also notice a hint of evident alcohol on the close.
Name: Argillae 2015 Grechetto (Umbria)

Description: Aromas of spring blossom and yellow stone fruit delicately lead the way on this refreshing white. The vibrant palate offers raw peach, lime and a hint of almond alongside racy acidity. A saline note closes the tangy finish.
Name: Olivetta 2014 Cortese (Piemonte)

Description: Restrained aromas suggesting acacia flower, nut and honey lead the nose. The subdued palate offers yellow apple skin, hazelnut and mineral alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Rocca di Fabbri 2015 Grechetto (Colli Martani)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Heady scents of honeysuckle, acacia and yellow stone fruit lead the way on this radiant white. On the vibrant, elegantly structured palate, energizing mineral frames mature apple, white peach, fresh apricot and chopped mint. Hold for even more complexity. Drink through 2023.
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2013 Studi Laura  (Greco di Tufo)

Description: Tantalizing aromas suggesting beeswax, orange blossom, Spanish broom, lemon pastry and a subtle whiff of crushed stone come together in the glass. Full-bodied and mineral-driven, the palate delivers ripe pear, mature apple, citrus and a balsamic note. Vibrant acidity provides an impeccable balance and brightens the wine's creamy flavors. Hold a few more years for even more complexity. Drink 2018 through 2023.
Name: Contrade di Taurasi–Lonardo 2013 Grecomusc' Roviello (Campania)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Acacia flower, chamomile, chopped mint, beeswax and orchard fruit aromas lead the way along with a whiff of smoke. The taut, elegant palate boasts yellow apple, juicy citrus, yellow peach, dried herb and resin framed in flinty mineral. Mouthwatering acidity lends balance while a tangy saline note closes the fresh, lingering finish. Drink through 2025.
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2013 Studi Arianiello  (Fiano di Avellino)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with aromas suggesting pear, yellow stone fruit, Mediterranean herb and a whiff of citrus while the vibrant palate delivers crisp green apple, juicy lime, saline and energizing mineral. Racy acidity provides the backbone. Give this time to fully develop. Drink 2017 through 2024.
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2014 Studi Bussi  (Greco di Tufo)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Perfumed with enticing scents of yellow flower, beeswax, orchard fruit and crushed stone, this shows the serious nature of Greco di Tufo. The elegant, mineral-driven palate delivers yellow apple, lemon zest, dried Mediterranean herb and mineral framed in tangy acidity. It's an extremely impressive showing especially given the cool, wet vintage.
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2014 Studi Laura  (Greco di Tufo)

Description: Enticing aromas of crushed stone, acacia flower, citrus and sea breeze lift out of the glass. The elegant, medium-bodied palate offers ripe yellow apple, mineral, dried herb and honey alongside well-integrated acidity. A note of candied citrus zest gives it a succulent but focused finish.
Name: Vivera 2012 Salisire Bianco  (Etna)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Delicately perfumed and elegant, this offers scents of jasmine, Spanish broom, beeswax and pear. The aromas follow through to the understated palate along with citrus and mineral. Vibrant acidity provides the framework. Drink 2018 through 2023.
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2013 Studi Bussi  (Greco di Tufo)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Citrus, acacia flower, white stone fruit and a whiff of honey are some of the alluring scents you'll find on this vibrant, refined white. The taut, well-structured palate doles out white peach, apricot, honey and hazelnut energized by flinty mineral. Give this a few more years to fully develop. Drink 2018 through 2025.
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2013 Studi Campo Aperto  (Fiano di Avellino)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Enticing scents of white spring flower, Spanish broom, Mediterranean herb and orchard fruit come together in the glass. On the elegant, full-bodied palate, a mineral vein underscores ripe pear, peach, candied citrus and mineral. Fresh acidity lifts the creamy flavors.
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2015 Pietracalda  (Fiano di Avellino)

Description: Fragrant wild flower, yellow stone fruit, citrus and chopped herb aromas lead the nose on this vibrant blend of 90% Carricante and 10% Riesling. The racy palate doles out fresh apricot, crisp green apple and energizing mineral framed in tangy acidity. A note of aromatic herb accents the succulent finish.
Name: Planeta 2015 Eruzione 1614 Carricante (Sicilia)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Opening with scents of mature orchard fruit, dried herb and a balsamic note, this nine-year-old wine aptly demonstrates the aging potential of Greco di Tufo. The surprisingly fresh palate shows an impressive depth of flavors including dried apricot, juicy tangerine, candied lemon drop and sage. A flinty mineral vein energizes the finish.
Name: Di Meo 2007 Selezione G  (Greco di Tufo)

Appellation: Falanghina del Sannio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Made with organically cultivated grapes, this opens with aromas of orange blossom, orchard fruit and nuts. The savory, medium-bodied palate doles out layers of juicy nectarine, lime zest, ripe pear and mature yellow apple alongside a note of candied ginger. It finishes on a tangy note.
Name: Fattoria La Rivolta 2015 Taburno  (Falanghina del Sannio)

Appellation: Falanghina del Sannio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Honeysuckle, orange blossom, orchard fruit and citrus aromas meld together to create an enticing fragrance. The elegant palate offers mature pear, mouthwatering lemon drop, dried herb, minerals and a hazelnut note. Fresh acidity brightens the delicious flavors and gives it a clean, lingering finish.
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2015 Serrocielo  (Falanghina del Sannio)

Description: Made from old vines ranging between 100 and 120-years-old, this vibrant white opens with aromas suggesting citrus, orchard fruit, linden blossom, acacia and a whiff of beeswax. On the savory, radiant palate, a mineral vein underscores green apple, grapefruit, and aromatic herb. Give this a few more years to fully develop. Drink 2018 through 2025.
Name: Pietradolce 2015 Archineri Bianco  (Etna)

Description: Alluring scents of linden blossom, Spanish broom, orchard fruit and Mediterranean herb lead the nose. The young, racy palate delivers ripe Bartlett pear, juicy lime, lemon and steely mineral while a hint of acacia honey closes the vibrant finish. Give this one time. Drink 2018 through 2025.
Name: Tornatore 2015 Pietrarizzo Bianco  (Etna)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Dried yellow flower, yellow stone fruit and a whiff of acacia honey meld together in the glass. The vibrant, linear palate includes lemon zest, lime, pineapple, dried herb and flinty mineral framed in tangy acidity. A note of wild fennel closes the finish. Hold for even more complexity. Drink through 2024.
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2014 Studi Arianiello  (Fiano di Avellino)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of citrus, orchard fruit and crushed stone slowly take shape on this elegant white. On the vibrant, linear palate, a mineral vein and a smoky note add depth to crisp green apple, peach and tangerine. Racy acidity leads to a crisp, clean finish. Hold a few years to let this fully develop. Drink 2028–2024.
Name: Villa Raiano 2014 Contrada Marotta  (Greco di Tufo)

Description: Vibrant and savory, this opens with lovely aromas of spring flower, citrus, herb and white stone fruit. The round, juicy palate offers ripe white peach, juicy grapefruit, pineapple and mineral alongside fresh acidity. A saline note backs up the finish.
Name: Donnafugata 2015 Sur Sur Grillo (Sicilia)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: The nose is a bit shy but the ripe, enveloping palate has impressive depth, delivering smoke, nut, candied nectarine zest, mature Bartlett pear and ginger. A honeyed mineral note closes the lingering finish. Drink through 2020.
Name: Villa Raiano 2015  Fiano di Avellino

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This delicate but plush bottling is of a rare grape known in the Rhône as Rolle. Sharp aromas of pear skin and Meyer lemon rind evolve into fleshier scents of stone fruit, white flowers and wet river stone. Lime juice and fine flavors are laced across sizzling acidity and grippy minerality on the palate.
Name: Tablas Creek 2015 Vermentino (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Juicy and delicious, this has aromas of ripe orchard fruit and fragrant Spanish broom. The succulent palate doles out crisp Granny Smith apple, Anjou pear, nectarine and mineral alongside bright acidity.
Name: Cantine di Marzo 2015  Greco di Tufo

Description: Apple, yellow flower and sea breeze aromas lead the way. The bright, elegant palate displays lemon, lime and walnut alongside vibrant acidity. A mineral vein underscores the savory flavors. Drink now or hold another two or three years for more complexity.
Name: Cusumano 2015 Shamaris Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: This Slovenian Ribolla Gialla has aromas of peach and vanilla, with flavors of freshly baked peach pie, canned apricots and green apple. It is soft on entry, rounded in the mouth and shows good minerality on the finish.
Name: Colliano 2013 Estate Bottled Ribolla Gialla (Goriska Brda)

Appellation: Ballard Canyon, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This most intriguing white grape, which the Larners grow as an ode to their Italian past, shows a sweet nose with a bone dry palate. Sugary citrus scents of orange blossoms and peach syrup give way to a brisk palate full of honeysuckle, night jasmine and a nearly pine needle bitterness that cuts dynamically through it all.
Name: Larner 2015 Malvasia Bianca (Ballard Canyon)

Description: Fragrant and fresh, this Grillo opens with alluring scents of acacia flower, beeswax and white stone fruit. The succulent palate offers creamy white peach, juicy nectarine, almond and mineral framed in tangy acidity. A note of chopped herb closes the lingering finish.
Name: CVA Canicattì 2015 Aquilae Bio Grillo (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Aromas of citrus, white stone fruit and a vegetal hint suggesting tomato leaf lead the way. The racy palate offers grapefruit, pineapple, fresh white peach and flinty mineral while a pleasantly bitter note closes the finish.
Name: Cottanera 2015 Bianco  (Etna)

Description: Scents of pressed white flower, orchard fruit, smoke, citrus and a whiff of nut lead the nose on this savory white. The round, medium-bodied palate offers mature pear, pineapple, peach and hazelnut while a note of flinty mineral lifts the finish.
Name: Fattoria La Rivolta 2015 Taburno Fiano (Sannio)

Appellation: Falanghina del Sannio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Jasmine, honeysuckle, apricot and citrus aromas open. The bright, savory palate presents juicy pineapple, ripe pear, white peach and lemon zest framed in tangy acidity. Hints of Mediterranean herb add depth while a mineral note energizes the finish.
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2015  Falanghina del Sannio

Description: Alluring scents of fragrant spring flower, citrus and ripe orchard fruit set the tone. The lively, refined palate doles out lemon zest, Mediterranean herb, juicy nectarine and apple alongside bright acidity. A saline note closes the succulent finish.
Name: Terre di Giurfo 2015 Grillo (Terre Siciliane)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Lightly scented, this opens with aromas of yellow stone fruit, citrus and a whiff of aromatic herb. The bright, medium-bodied palate offers creamy peach, mature green apple and a hint of nectarine while a mineral note fills in the juicy finish.
Name: Villa Raiano 2015  Greco di Tufo

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of pear, Spanish broom, flint and Mediterranean herb emerge in the glass. The juicy, medium-bodied palate offers ripe apple, peach and lime alongside fresh acidity and a mineral vein. A hazelnut note marks the close.
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2015  Fiano di Avellino

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Heady aromas of citrus and orchard fruit almost jump out of the glass. The savory, medium-bodied palate tastes of ripe pear, mature apple and creamy peach interspersed with energizing mineral notes. Fresh acidity brightens the creamy flavors.
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2015  Greco di Tufo

Appellation: Falanghina del Sannio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Vibrant and savory, this linear white offers scents of ripe orchard fruit, white flower and a whiff of spice. The juicy palate doles out pear, apple, nectarine and mineral along with a note of ginger.
Name: Mustilli 2015 S. Agata dei Goti  (Falanghina del Sannio)

Description: This opens with earthy aromas of brimstone, scorched soil, hay, orchard fruit and dried herb. The palate offers pink grapefruit, white stone fruit, sage and a marked saline note that creates a briny mineral finish.
Name: Baglio di Pianetto 2015 Timeo Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Here's a delicately scented wine that offers aromas suggesting mature orchard fruit, botanical herb and wild flower. The subtle palate is a bit more reserved, showing yellow apple, nectarine, saline and a hint of bitter nut alongside bright acidity.
Name: Cantine Rallo 2015 Bianco Maggiore Grillo (Sicilia)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: At an impressive 13-years-old, this deeply golden-hued wine opens with subtle aromas of toasted nut, pressed acacia flower and honey. The round, evolved palate still boasts freshness while the tertiary flavors include lemon zest, ginger, smoky mineral and a hint of marzipan.
Name: Di Meo 2003 Erminia De Meo  (Fiano di Avellino)

Description: This luminous white offers delicate scents suggesting crushed rock, pear and a whiff of botanical herb. The taut, vibrant palate recalls Granny Smith apple, nectarine and mineral set against a backbone of firm acidity.
Name: Di Meo 2015 G  (Greco di Tufo)

Description: Crisp and linear, this offers delicate aromas of Spanish broom and orchard fruit. The vibrant palate offers fresh green apple and juicy citrus while energizing mineral backs up the fresh, flinty finish.
Name: Tornatore 2015 Bianco  (Etna)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This offers aromas of yellow stone fruit, chopped herb and a whiff of white almond. The round, juicy palate shows apricot, white peach, candied orange zest and a mineral note. Fresh acidity brightens the ripe flavors.
Name: Villa Matilde 2015  Greco di Tufo

Description: Subdued aromas of spring wild flower, hay and orchard fruit float from the glass. The vibrant palate offers lemon zest, sage, dried herb and a hint of saline framed in lively acidity.
Name: Tenuta Rapitalà 2015 Grillo (Sicilia)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of ripe orchard fruit, Mediterranean herb and toasted hazelnut lead the nose while the bright palate offers green pear, peach, unripe apricot and bitter almond. A mineral note signals the close.
Name: Mastroberardino 2015 Novaserra  (Greco di Tufo)

Description: Fragrant white flower and ripe orchard fruit aromas take center stage. The fresh palate offers mature yellow apple, pineapple, aromatic herb and a light toasted note while a hint of oak-driven spice accents the finish.
Name: Tenuta Rapitalà 2015 Vigna Casalj Catarratto (Alcamo)

Description: Aromas of beeswax, yellow spring flower and botanical herb blend together. The young, vibrant palate offers lemon, lime, green apple and mineral. It's still a very young wine and needs time to come together. Drink 2018 through 2025.
Name: Barone di Villagrande 2015 Superiore Bianco  (Etna)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: You'll find aromas of dried orchard fruit, beeswax, Spanish broom, acacia and an earthy note on this spry nine-year-old. On the mature, waxy palate, fruit flavors have given way to tertiary sensations of honey, toasted nut, candied citrus zest and flinty mineral that carry through the to lingering finish. A saline note signals the close.
Name: Di Meo 2007 Colle dei Cerri  (Fiano di Avellino)

Description: Aromas recalling hay, yellow flower, dried herb and a light vegetal note carry over to the bright, medium-bodied palate along with lime and green apple. A flinty mineral note underscores the vibrant flavors.
Name: Pietradolce 2015 Bianco  (Etna)

Description: This offers aromas suggesting mature apple, citrus, hazelnut and a whiff of dried herb. The rich, full-bodied palate doles out candied nectarine zest and ripe pear while a mineral note lifts the finish.
Name: Fattoria La Rivolta 2015 Taburno Greco (Sannio)

Description: Alluring aromas of citrus, white flower and a whiff of tropical fruit come together on this. The racy palate offers lemon zest, mango, sage, saline and an almond note alongside vibrant acidity.
Name: Stemmari 2015 Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of melon, fennel, hay and tomato vine float out of the glass. The crisp, creamy palate offers white peach, lemon and Mediterranean herb alongside fresh acidity. A mineral note energizes the finish.
Name: Feudo Disisa 2015 Terre delle Fate Fiano (Sicilia)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Juicy and round, this opens with scents of honeysuckle, yellow stone fruit and a hint of aromatic herb. The full-bodied palate offers ripe white peach, pear and a hint of candied lemon drop while a mineral note backs up the finish.
Name: Villa Matilde 2015  Fiano di Avellino

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: White spring flower, pear and a whiff of exotic fruit lead the way. The floral note carries over to the medium-bodied palate, along with lemon, lime, peach and a note of bitter almond. Fresh acidity brightens the finish.
Name: Cantine di Marzo 2015  Fiano di Avellino

Description: Alluring aromas of Spanish broom, lemon and orchard fruit lead the nose while the juicy palate doles out mature peach, nectarine zest, toasted hazelnut and flinty mineral. Bright acidity lifts the rich flavors.
Name: Di Meo 2015 F  (Fiano di Avellino)

Description: Scents of Spanish broom, chamomile, aromatic herb and white stone fruit combine along with a whiff of hay. The zesty, linear palate offers juicy nectarine, candied lemon drop and a mineral note alongside bright acidity.
Name: Castellucci Miano 2015 Shiarà Catarratto (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of Spanish broom, acacia and oak lead the nose. The vibrant palate offers yellow apple, citrus, toasted hazel nut and mineral alongside lively acidity.
Name: Tenuta delle Terre Nere 2014 Santo Spirito Bianco  (Etna)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of hazelnut nut, smoke and dried chamomile flower slowly come together. On the racy palate, a mineral vein underscores yellow apple, lime and dried sage while a bitter almond note wraps up the finish.
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2014 Studi Fraedane  (Fiano di Avellino)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Subtle and elegant, this opens with a smoky aroma that underscores delicate scents of orchard fruit, citrus and botanical herb. The aromas follow through to the linear palate along with a racy mineral vein. A note of cured meat closes the racy finish.
Name: Villa Raiano 2014 22  (Fiano di Avellino)

Appellation: Falanghina del Beneventano, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Delicately scented, this offers aromas of honeysuckle, citrus blossom and pear while the round, juicy palate doles out white peach, mature apple and Mediterranean herb. A hint of almond closes the clean, lingering finish.
Name: Villa Raiano 2015  Falanghina del Beneventano

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Orchard fruit, nut and acacia flower aromas meld together on this elegant white. The firm palate offers green pear, lemon zest and mineral alongside zesty acidity. A note of almond closes the tangy finish.
Name: Tenuta Sarno 1860 2014  Fiano di Avellino

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Fermented and aged in acacia barrels, this deeply colored white has aromas of candied citrus, mature apple, toast and honey. The honeyed note carries over to the evolved palate along with yellow apple skin, coffee, dried herb and a hint of smoke. A walnut note marks the finish.
Name: Mastroberardino 2011 More Maiorum  (Fiano di Avellino)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Wild flower, toasted hazelnut, pear and aromatic herb aromas come together in the glass and follow through to the linear palate along with a dollop of honey. A light mineral note energizes the finish.
Name: Mastroberardino 2015 Radici  (Fiano di Avellino)

Description: Subtle yellow flower and orchard fruit aromas blend while the linear palate offers pear, citrus zest, a hint of oak and mineral. Fresh acidity gives it a crisp, clean finish.
Name: Caruso & Minini 2015 Timpune Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Initially closed, a few swirls of the glass releases subtle scents suggesting Spanish Broom, linden blossom, flint and a whisper of orange zest. While the palate is less expressive than the nose, it still offers yellow apple, citrus and mineral alongside crisp acidity. It's still very immature and needs additional time to age.
Name: Benanti 2012 Pietramarina Bianco Superiore  (Etna)

Description: Citrus, Mediterranean herb and cut grass aromas lead the way. The crisp palate offers Bartlett pear, unripe apricot and grapefruit alongside tangy acidity. A saline note backs up the succulent finish.
Name: Feudo Disisa 2015 Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Heady aromas of white wild flower, chopped herb and a whiff of honeydew melon lead the nose. The enjoyable palate offers ripe lemon and juicy nectarine that carry through to the tangy finish.
Name: Caruso & Minini 2015 Naturalmente Bio Catarratto (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of citrus, white flower and Mediterranean herb lift out of the glass. The round, juicy palate offers lime, apricot and pineapple alongside tangy acidity. A hint of white almond backs up the finish.
Name: Donnachiara 2015 Falanghina (Beneventano)

Description: Aromas of citrus blossom, lemon and fragrant wild flower open. The fresh, juicy palate offers lemon zest, mature apricot and grilled oregano while a tangy saline note backs up the finish.
Name: Marchesi De Gregorio 2015 Tenute Sirignano Catarratto (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Beeswax, mature orchard fruit and yellow flower aromas emerge from the glass. The refreshing palate offers lemon drop, peach and pear alongside tangy acidity. A grapefruit note closes the finish.
Name: Lombardo 2015 Catarratto (Sicilia)

Description: Fragrant lemon blossom, citrus, beeswax and almond aromas carry over to the bright palate along with juicy lime, nectarine zest and dried herb. It finishes on a tangy saline note.
Name: Valle dell'Acate 2015 Zagra Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Inviting scents of hay and chamomile lead the nose while the succulent palate offers juicy lemon, mature apple, peach and Mediterranean herb. Bright acidity lifts the finish.
Name: Masseria del Feudo 2015 Grillo (Sicilia)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Bright and refreshing, this offers aromas of orchard fruit and citrus. The lively palate delivers white peach, mature pear and nectarine alongside crisp acidity while a mineral note signals the close.
Name: Mustilli 2015 Sant'Agata dei Goti  (Greco di Tufo)

Description: Delicate scents of lemon blossom, spring wild flower and citrus waft out of the glass. The vibrant, easygoing palate doles out nectarine, aromatic herb, white peach and a mineral note alongside bright acidity.
Name: Principe di Corleone 2015 Pollara Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Intense aromas of tropical fruit, banana and white stone fruit lead the nose on this straightforward, refreshing wine. The vibrant palate doles out juicy pineapple, citrus and white peach alongside tangy acidity.
Name: Villa Matilde 2015 Rocca dei Leoni Falanghina (Campania)

Description: Made with Inzolia, this has subtle aromas of white wild flower and orchard fruit while the fresh, linear palate delivers nectarine, lemon zest and mineral. A saline note wraps up the finish.
Name: Masseria del Feudo 2015 Il Giglio Inzolia (Sicilia)

Description: Intense aromas of white flower, honeydew melon and tomato vine lead the nose while the bright, juicy palate offers pink grapefruit, kiwi and unripe peach. A briny note closes finish.
Name: CVA Canicattì 2015 Fileno Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: This opens with delicate scents of pear and pressed yellow flower. The tangy palate shows lemon zest, nectarine and a hint of Mediterranean herb while a saline note provides backup.
Name: Tasca d'Almerita 2015 Cavallo delle Fate Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of Spanish broom, citrus blossom, ripe orchard fruit and oak slowly emerge on this. Oak carries over to the linear palate along with toast, yellow apple and nectarine zest. A bitter almond note closes the drying finish.
Name: Tenuta delle Terre Nere 2014 Calderara Sottana Bianco  (Etna)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of citrus zest, orchard fruit and a hint of toasted walnut lead the nose. The palate includes mature peach, pear and mineral alongside bright acidity. A hint of hazelnut signals the close.
Name: Terredora 2015 Loggia della Serra  (Greco di Tufo)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of beeswax, acacia flower, honey and a waft of smoke drift out of the glass. The tangy, medium-bodied palate offers dried stone fruit, citrus zest and a note of honeyed mineral while bitter almond backs up the dry finish.
Name: Di Meo 2012 F Selezione Alessandra  (Fiano di Avellino)

Description: This Slovenian sparkling wine is made from 100% Ribolla Gialla in the Charmat method. It has aromas of green apple, brioche, toast and hazelnut. In the mouth, the bubbles are pleasant and prepare your palate for flavors of apple, hazelnut and toasted almond.
Name: Colliano 2012 Peneca Rebula Brut Ribolla Gialla (Primorska)

Description: Subtle but alluring aromas of yellow spring flower and white almond lead the way while the fresh palate shows mature apple, sage and mineral alongside bright acidity. A tangy saline note signals the close.
Name: Di Giovanna 2015 Grillo (Terre Siciliane)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with delicate aromas that recall pear, yellow stone fruit and a whiff of almond. The juicy palate presents yellow peach, citrus and a hint of hazelnut alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Donnachiara 2015  Greco di Tufo

Description: Enticing scents of jasmine, citrus zest, pineapple and orchard fruit waft out of the glass. The fresh, linear, palate offers pear, lime and toasted hazelnut alongside bright acidity. A mineral note lifts the finish.
Name: Mastroberardino 2015 Morabianca Falanghina (Irpinia)

Description: Aromas of toasted nut, brimstone, citrus and a balsam open. The palate offers yellow apple, medicinal herb and nectarine while a saline note marks the close.
Name: Feudo Antico 2014 Grillo Parlante Grillo (Terre Siciliane)

Description: This opens with delicate aromas that recall orchard fruit and yellow wild flower. The juicy, easygoing palate shows ripe pear, white peach and citrus alongside bright acidity.
Name: Feudo Principi di Butera 2015 Inzolia (Sicilia)

Description: Made with a 50-50 blend of Grillo and Catarratto, this presents aromas of Spanish broom and ripe orchard fruit. The refreshing palate tastes of juicy lime, unripe pear and mineral alongside zesty acidity.
Name: Zisola 2015 Azisa Grillo (Sicilia)

Appellation: Falanghina del Beneventano, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Refreshing and straightforward, this presents delicate aromas suggesting exotic fruit and a whiff of spring blossom. The bright palate offers banana, green apple, juicy citrus and a light mineral note alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Vesevo 2015  Falanghina del Beneventano

Description: This bright white offers aromas of lime, pineapple and citrus blossom. The fresh palate delivers juicy lemon, apple and a hint of nut alongside tangy acidity while a saline note closes finish.
Name: Marchesi De Gregorio 2015 del Marchese Grillo (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Enticing aromas of pear, white flower, exotic fruit and a whiff of Mediterranean herb lift out of the glass. On the bright palate, a light mineral vein underscores green apple, pineapple and banana while fresh acidity adds zest.
Name: Di Meo 2015 S Falanghina (Campania)

Description: Aromas recalling Spanish broom and orchard fruit come together on this one. The bright palate offers nectarine, pineapple and yellow apple alongside vibrant acidity while a hazelnut note closes the finish.
Name: Feudo Maccari 2015 Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: This fresh, straightforward white offers aromas of lime, acacia flower and a whiff of Mediterranean herb. The bright palate offers lemon zest, unripe peach and bitter nut accompanied by bright acidity.
Name: Feudo Principi di Butera 2015 Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: This opens with pretty aromas suggesting white spring flower, citrus and white stone fruit. The bright palate offers nectarine, chopped herb and pear alongside refreshing acidity.
Name: Firriato 2015 Caeles Biologico Catarratto (Sicilia)

Description: Yellow wild flower and white stone fruit aromas lead the nose while the enjoyable palate doles out white peach, juicy nectarine and a hint of sage. Tangy acidity brightens the ripe flavors while a note of honeydew melon backs up the finish.
Name: Castellucci Miano 2015 Catarratto (Sicilia)

Description: Intense aromas of fragrant white flower, lemon and aromatic herb lead the way. The palate isn't quite as expressive as the nose but offers lime, grapefruit and a hint of sage alongside fresh acidity. A saline note wraps up the finish.
Name: Barone Sergio 2015 Alègre Grillo (Terre Siciliane)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This offers pretty aromas that recall white spring flower, almond and acacia. The juicy, medium-bodied palate offers ripe pear, lemon peel, hazelnut and a hint of dried mint alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Donnachiara 2015  Fiano di Avellino

Appellation: Falanghina del Sannio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Delicately scented with whiffs of white spring flower, citrus and orchard fruit, this straightforward wine offers flavors suggesting pear, juicy pineapple and bitter almond. Tangy acidity brightens the finish and gives it a clean close.
Name: Mastroberardino 2015  Falanghina del Sannio

Description: Delicate aromas recalling exotic fruit and citrus lead the way. The fresh, straightforward palate offers lime and peach while a white almond note signals the close.
Name: Curto 2015 Poiano Inzolia (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Straightforward and fresh, this opens with aromas of jasmine and exotic fruit. The round, juicy palate is reminiscent of citrus, pineapple and pear while a note of bitter almond adds interest.
Name: Taba 2015 F  (Falanghina del Sannio)

Description: This offers aromas suggesting honeysuckle and honeydew melon while the fresh, linear palate displays grapefruit, pineapple and sage. A hint of bitter nut closes the finish.
Name: Fazio 2015 Aegades Grillo (Erice)

Description: Extremely subtle aromas of toasted oak, yellow flower and a whiff of dill waft out of the glass. The firm palate offers yellow apple and nectarine peels and a hint of oak.
Name: Duca di Salaparuta 2015 Kados Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Fresh and zesty, this opens with aromas suggesting white spring flower, pear and exotic fruit. The tangy palate offers white peach, citrus and pineapple while a mineral note accents the finish.
Name: Gran Passione 2015 Falanghina (Beneventano)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of white flower, hazelnut and orchard fruit follow over to the savory palate along with mature pear, lime zest and smoke. A mineral note signals the finish.
Name: Agricola Bellaria 2015  Fiano di Avellino

Description: A blend of equal parts Grillo, Chardonnay, Inzolia and Catarratto, this has delicate scents of spring wild flower and orchard fruit. The tangy palate offers nectarine, lemon, apple and mineral alongside bright acidity.
Name: Baglio del Cristo di Campobello 2015 Grillo (Terre Siciliane)

Description: This opens with aromas suggesting aromatic herb, hay, yellow flower and light balsamic note. The bright, restrained palate offers lime, lemon peel and sage while a mineral note signals the close.
Name: Barone di Villagrande 2015 Villagrande Bianco  (Etna)

Description: Initially rather shy, this eventually reveals delicate scents of fragrant yellow flower, orchard fruit and a whiff of citrus. The linear palate is a bit austere, offering yellow apple skin, lime and a mineral note alongside firm acidity.
Name: Benanti 2014 Bianco  (Etna)

Description: Made with Catarratto, this bright sparkler opens with scents of pressed white flower and a whiff of sea breeze. The racy palate delivers lemon and nectarine before finishing crisp and clean.
Name: Castellucci Miano 2015 Brut Catarratto (Sicilia)

Description: Bright aromas of lime, lemon zest and a hint of white flower lead the nose while the straightforward palate offers exotic fruit, citrus and a hint of pineapple. Notes of dried herb and bitter almond add interest.
Name: CVA Canicattì 2015 Acquilae Catarratto (Terre Siciliane)

Description: Scents of citrus blossom, fragrant white flower and orchard fruit emerge while the vibrant palate offers lemon, juicy nectarine, white stone fruit and mineral alongside tangy acidity. A saline note signals the close.
Name: Cantine Europa 2015 Eughenes Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: The nose doesn't give much away but the fresh, linear palate offers plenty of citrus zest, dried aromatic herb and tangy saline. It's made entirely with native grape Inzolia.
Name: Cantine Rallo 2015 Evrò Inzolia (Sicilia)

Description: Honeysuckle and tropical fruit are noticeable as the primary scents. The straightforward palate offers lime, unripe apricot and a hint of bitter nut alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Marchesi De Gregorio 2015 Tenute Sirignano Inzolia (Terre Siciliane)

Appellation: Falanghina del Sannio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This has aromas of yellow flower and orchard fruit while the rather lean palate shows green pear, saline and obvious alcohol. A note of bitter almond closes it down.
Name: Cantine Foschini 2015  Falanghina del Sannio

Description: This opens with aromas suggesting pressed yellow flower, orchard fruit and an unusual whiff that recalls brimstone. The brisk palate offers yellow apple, citrus and a bitter medicinal note.
Name: Terredora 2015 Corte di Giso Falanghina (Irpinia)

Description: Opening with aromas of citrus blossom and acacia flower, the straightforward palate offers yellow apple, nectarine and chopped herb. Fresh acidity produces a tangy finish.
Name: MandraRossa 2015 Grecanico (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of citrus, dried herb and yellow flower lead. On the straightforward palate, fresh acidity underscores yellow apple and lemon zest while a bitter almond note closes.
Name: MandraRossa 2015 Grillo (Sicilia)

Appellation: Falanghina del Sannio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Made with organically cultivated grapes, this has subdued aromas of pressed flower, apple and nut. The somewhat lean, straightforward palate shows lemon, green pear, saline and a touch of bitter almond.
Name: Terra di Briganti 2014  Falanghina del Sannio

Description: Aromas of yellow flower, citrus and dried herb float out of the glass. The palate is a bit on the lean side, offering lime, grilled sage and bitter almond alongside zesty acidity.
Name: Principe di Corleone 2015 Bianca di Corte Grillo (Sicilia)

Description: Aromas of honeysuckle and tropical fruit lead the nose while the lively palate doles out pear and juicy nectarine. A touch of bitter almond adds interest.
Name: Agricola Bellaria 2015 Falanghina (Irpinia)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Toasted oak, citrus zest and honey aromas lead followed by a balsamic note. The palate offers walnut, oak and the barest hint of butterscotch but it lacks fruit richness.
Name: Terredora 2012 Campore  (Fiano di Avellino)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with aromas that recall tropical fruit, hay and a whiff of chopped mint. The palate has weight and an almost oily texture but it lacks fruit richness, suggesting unripe pear, lemon zest and flint alongside brisk acidity.
Name: Agricola Bellaria 2014 Oltre  (Greco di Tufo)

Description: Yellow flower, hay and orchard fruit aromas lead the nose. The bright, straightforward palate provides lemon, lime zest and a hint of pineapple alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Fazio 2015 Calebianche Catarratto (Erice)

Description: Aromas of white peach and citrus lead the nose. The bright, simple palate offers suggestions of Anjou pear and a hint of tangerine alongside lively acidity.
Name: Taba 2015 G  (Greco di Tufo)

Description: Aromas of pressed acacia flower, nut and smoke lead the nose. The lively, lean palate doles out unripe Bartlett pear, yellow apple skin and a flinty mineral note alongside zesty acidity.
Name: Agricola Bellaria 2014 Ottant'anni Coda di Volpe (Irpinia)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: The shy nose doesn't give anything away but notes of citrus zest, unripe peach and a hint of crushed stone emerge on the lean palate. Brisk acidity gives it a tangy finish.
Name: Montesole 2014 Vigna Acquaviva  (Fiano di Avellino)

Appellation: Fiano di Avellino, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of dried chamomile flower and toasted nut lead the nose. The scents carry over to the somewhat lean palate along with a bitter note that recalls adhesive bandage.
Name: Terredora 2015  Fiano di Avellino

Description: This is extremely lean and acrid, with flavors of yellow apple skin and bitter walnut but no fruit richness.
Name: Feudi del Pisciotto 2015 Baglio di Sole Inzolia (Terre Siciliane)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Finesse abounds on this radiant wine, starting with alluring scents of Spanish broom, aromatic herb, citrus and a delicate whiff of beeswax. On the elegantly structured palate, a mineral vein underscores crisp apple, pear, lemon zest and white almond. Vibrant acidity provides the backbone. It's still young so give it time to develop to its full potential. Drink 2018 through 2028.
Name: Bucci 2013 Villa Bucci Riserva  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Subtle scents of white spring blossom, white stone fruit, aromatic herb and a whiff of beeswax float out of the glass. The round, concentrated palate offers a wonderful depth of flavors that include juicy Anjou pear, lemon pastry, anise, honey and a hint of marzipan. Fresh acidity brightens the creamy flavors. Hold for more complexity.
Name: Bucci 2012 Villa Bucci Riserva  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Description: Delicately scented, this radiant wine opens with ultrarefined scents of white field flower, citrus blossom, aromatic herb and a whiff of orchard fruit. The creamy, elegantly structured palate boasts layers of juicy white peach, crisp green apple, tangerine and a hint of white almond. Fresh acidity brightens the creamy flavors while an energizing mineral note closes the lingering finish.
Name: Tenuta Roveglia 2013 Vigne di Catullo Riserva  (Lugana)

Description: Aromas of white spring flower, mature orchard fruit and a whiff of graphite float out of the glass. The fresh, concentrated palate doles out ripe white peach, mature Granny Smith and Bosc pear while mineral and almond notes back up the finish.
Name: Marangona 2015  Lugana

Description: Exquisite floral aromas of honeysuckle and jasmine are joined by a whiff of mature pear. The round, juicy palate doles out ripe peach, juicy citrus and yellow apple while a white almond note backs up the lingering finish.
Name: Le Morette 2015 Mandolara  (Lugana)

Description: Herbaceous aromas of hay and tomato leaf meld together with notes of stone fruit, citrus and flint. The round, medium-bodied palate offers white grapefruit, candied nectarine zest, white peach, aromatic herb and mineral. Fresh acidity brightens the rich flavors.
Name: Ottella 2013 Molceo Riserva  (Lugana)

Description: Fresh and elegantly structured, this opens with aromas of Spanish broom, acacia flower, citrus peel and a whiff of hazelnut. The vibrant, full-bodied palate offers citrus zest, beeswax, almond and a honeyed note alongside bright acidity. A mineral accent gives it a clean, focused finish. Hold for even more complexity. Drink 2018 through 2023.
Name: Vigne Marina Coppi 2013 Fausto Timorasso (Colli Tortonesi)

Description: This enticingly fragrant wine offers scents of white spring flower, apple, ginger and flint. On the elegantly structured palate, radiant acidity underscores crisp apple, Bosc pear, white peach and lemon drop, while a salty mineral note closes the tangy finish. It's an impressive effort for what was overall a washout vintage. Drink through 2024.
Name: Gini 2014 La Froscà  (Soave Classico)

Description: Aromas of fragrant white blossom, stone fruit, honeydew melon and tomato vine come together on this savory white. The round, medium-bodied palate offers creamy peach, tropical fruit, dried herb and an energizing mineral note. Bright acidity provides freshness and balance.
Name: Ottella 2015 Le Creete  (Lugana)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Structured and elegant, this opens with scents that recall beeswax, honey and almond. The vibrant, balanced palate offers white peach, fresh orchard fruit and a saline note alongside bright acidity. Drink now or hold for even more complexity. Drink through 2023.
Name: Umani Ronchi 2013 Casal di Serra Vecchie Vigne  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Description: This single-vineyard bottling opens with aromas of fragrant white flower, yellow stone fruit, dried herb and a whiff of tropical fruit. The concentrated, elegantly structured palate delivers creamy white peach, mature apple, crystallized ginger and mineral. Fresh acidity lifts the rich flavors while an almond note closes the lingering finish.
Name: Selva Capuzza 2015 Selva  (Lugana)

Description: Enticing scents of fragrant white flower, stone fruit and crushed herb lead the way while the creamy, savory palate doles out white peach, mature yellow apple and tangerine zest. A blast of mineral energy lifts the lingering finish.
Name: Tenuta Roveglia 2015 Limne  (Lugana)

Appellation: Verdicchio di Matelica, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Made with organically farmed grapes, this delicious white opens with aromas of citrus blossom and white stone fruit. The tangy, medium-bodied palate offers a lovely depth of flavors that include juicy tangerine, lime, white peach, bitter almond and mineral. Crisp acidity brightens the rich flavors and carries through to the clean finish.
Name: ColleStefano 2015  Verdicchio di Matelica

Description: Intriguing scents of pressed flower, dried orchard fruit and aromatic herb unfold in the glass. The savory, medium-bodied palate shows nice depth, offering candied citrus, dill, apple, kiwi and toasted almond. Zesty acidity provides balance and freshness. This is an impressive effort, especially for the 2014 vintage.
Name: Cà dei Frati 2014 I Frati  (Lugana)

Appellation: Verdicchio di Matelica, Central Italy, Italy
Description: With a little time in the glass, this eventually reveals subtle aromas of toasted almond, pressed yellow flower, beeswax and a whiff of honey. The honeyed note follows over to the enveloping palate, along with candied citrus peel, marzipan and mineral. Fresh acidity brightens the rich flavors and provides balance. It's already enjoyable but hold for more complexity. Drink through 2023.
Name: La Monacesca 2013 Mirum Riserva  (Verdicchio di Matelica)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Alluring aromas of acacia flower, beeswax, citrus and a whiff of honey float out of the glass. The elegant, linear palate offers green pear, grapefruit, lemon zest, almond and mineral framed in racy acidity. Give this time to fully develop. Drink through 2021.
Name: Garofoli 2013 Podium  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Appellation: Friuli Colli Orientali, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of yellow flower, candied orange zest and a balsamic note emerge in the glass. On the enveloping palate, a ginger note accents baked Gala apple and eucalyptus honey. Fresh acidity brightens the rich flavors.
Name: Gigante 2008 Picolit (Friuli Colli Orientali)

Description: Fragrant white flower, yellow stone fruit and dried herb aromas open. The vibrant, elegant palate offers mature yellow apple, creamy white peach and mineral alongside bright acidity. A white almond note closes the lingering finish.
Name: Citari 2015 Conchiglia  (Lugana)

Description: This fragrant, elegant white opens with scents of orange blossom and white wild flower. The savory palate has a lovely depth of flavors, including yellow peach, Bosc pear, juicy lime and mineral alongside fresh acidity. A hazelnut note backs up the finish. It's an outstanding effort, especially given the difficult vintage.
Name: Negro Angelo e Figli 2014 Perdaudin  (Roero)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas that recall jasmine, green apple and honeydew melon lead the nose. The juicy, medium-bodied palate has good weight and concentration, offering tangerine, ripe pear, bitter almond and a hint of banana. Bright acidity offsets the rich flavors while a ginger note closes the finish.
Name: Umani Ronchi 2015 Casal di Serra  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Description: Enticing aromas of acacia flower, nut, honey and a hint of paraffin float out of the glass. The honeyed note carries over to the enveloping, full-bodied palate, along with candied citrus zest, mature yellow apple and an energizing mineral blast. Drink through 2020.
Name: Vigne Marina Coppi 2011 Fausto Timorasso (Colli Tortonesi)

Description: Aromas of pressed white flower, citrus and mature orchard fruit lead the nose on this vibrant white. The savory palate doles out ripe white peach, Golden Delicious apple, chopped herb and a flinty mineral note alongside tangy acidity. A pleasant hint of bitter almond wraps up the finish.
Name: Citari 2015 Sorgente  (Lugana)

Description: Citrus blossom, beeswax and white almond aromas float out of the glass. The juicy, full-bodied palate presents yellow peach, creamy pear and tangerine while a mineral note backs up the finish. Tangy acidity lends freshness and balance.
Name: Il Falchetto 2015 Arneis (Langhe)

Appellation: Friuli Colli Orientali, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of chamomile flower, yellow peach and candied citrus zest lead the nose on this bright dessert wine. On the palate, notes of acacia honey, fig and sweet almond accent a core of mature apricot. Fresh acidity keeps it from being cloyingly sweet.
Name: La Tunella 2011 Picolit (Friuli Colli Orientali)

Description: This vibrant, savory white opens with alluring scents of pear, tropical fruit and a whiff of fragrant white flower. The round, medium-bodied palate shows white peach, golden apple and mineral. Fresh acidity brightens the creamy flavors while an almond note backs up the finish.
Name: Selva Capuzza 2015 San Vigilio  (Lugana)

Description: This lively, elegant white, made with 100% Trebbiano, opens with heady scents of white spring flower and orchard fruit. The vibrant, linear palate delivers white peach, crunchy pear, tangerine and a mineral note. Racy acidity provides balance and generates a crisp, clean finish.
Name: Suavia 2013 Massifitti Trebbiano (Veronese)

Description: Deeply hued gold, this offers aromas suggesting pressed yellow flower, citrus zest, thyme and sage. The vibrant palate doles out lemon, crushed herb, toasted nut, acacia honey and mineral framed in zesty acidity. It shows impressive structure and depth for what was a cool, wet vintage.
Name: Elvio Cogno 2014 Anas-cëtta Nascetta (Langhe)

Description: Made with 100% Garganega grapes, this rich wine offers aromas that suggest tropical fruit, citrus and a whiff of light spice. The ripe palate offers mature apple, candied orange zest, apricot and a hint of ginger. Mineral notes weave throughout, giving precision and elegance.
Name: Suavia 2012 Le Rive Garganega (Veronese)

Description: Vibrant and savory, this polished white offers scents of perfumed white flower and ripe orchard fruit. The tangy palate doles out Granny Smith apple, white peach and juicy tangerine. Crisp acidity provides balance while a mineral note energizes the clean finish.
Name: Gini 2014  Soave Classico

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of white spring flower, honeydew melon and citrus lead the way. The savory palate doles out white peach, juicy tangerine, aromatic herb and white almond alongside tangy acidity. A saline note closes the finish.
Name: Vignamato 2015 Versiano  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Appellation: Lake County, Lake County, California, US
Description: This fascinating wine has a deep gold color, aromas like toasted nuts, flavors like apricots and a rich but tangy texture. Winemaker Pietro Buttita fermented it with the skins like a red wine and aged it without oak. It would be fun to try with a chunk of Pecorino or some liver pate on toast.
Name: Rosa d'Oro 2013 Vermentino (Lake County)

Description: Aromas of citrus zest, stone fruit, toasted almond and a whiff of light baking spice lead the way on this polished white. The vibrant, elegantly structured palate shows Bosc pear, white peach, nectarine and a hint of ginger. A mineral note backs up the finish.
Name: Gini 2013 Salvarenza Vecchie Vigne  (Soave Classico)

Description: Spanish broom, aromatic herb and orchard fruit aromas lift out of the glass while the rounded palate offers white peach, honeydew melon and a white almond note. Fresh acidity brightens the creamy flavors.
Name: Castellari Bergaglio 2012 Pilin  (Gavi)

Description: Pressed honeysuckle, beeswax and orchard fruit aromas come together on this. The medium-bodied palate offers passion fruit, creamy white peach, vanilla and mineral while a hint of toasted almond closes the finish.
Name: Cornarea 2011 Enritard  (Roero)

Description: Aromas of mature apricot, tropical fruit and citrus zest lead the nose. The round, juicy palate offers ripe yellow peach, poached pear and juicy tangerine alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Ancilla 2015 Ella  (Lugana)

Description: Delicate aromas of white stone fruit, ripe pear and white flower lead the nose while the bright palate offers crisp green apple, juicy white peach and a hint of bitter almond. Fresh acidity lifts the finish.
Name: Pasini San Giovanni 2015 Il Lugana  (Lugana)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Spanish broom and beeswax scents float out of the glass. The round, juicy palate doles out mature yellow apple, tangerine zest and a hint of honey while a note of marzipan backs up the finish. Bright acidity lifts the creamy flavors.
Name: Pievalta 2012 San Paolo Riserva  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

Description: Subdued aromas of oak and citrus zest slowly take shape in the glass. The linear, svelte palate offers oak driven spice, lemon zest and yellow apple skin framed in racy acidity. A hint of toasted nut closes the finish.
Name: Villa Russiz 2014 Friulano (Collio)

Description: Alluring aromas of jasmine and wild flower lead the nose. The fresh palate offers mature apple, white peach and a citrusy note alongside bright acidity. A touch of white almond note fills in the finish.
Name: Vite Colte 2015 Masseria dei Carmelitani  (Gavi)

Description: Bright and refreshing, this opens with scents of honeysuckle, jasmine, pear and yellow stone fruit. The round but lively palate offers peach, green apple and a hint of white almond. Fresh acidity lifts the rich flavors.
Name: Ceretto 2015 Blangè Arneis (Langhe)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Alluring aromas of Spanish broom, chamomile and a whiff of crushed stone come together in the glass. The bright palate offers peach, nectarine and a pleasant touch of bitter almond alongside vibrant acidity. A mineral note closes the finish.
Name: Bucci 2014  Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Appellation: Friuli Colli Orientali, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Muted aromas of toast, oak, crème caramel and a hint of aromatic herb lead the nose. The full-bodied palate doles out acacia honey, dried fig and vanilla. It's rather shy on freshness and very sweet but not quite cloying.
Name: Livio Felluga 2009 Picolit (Friuli Colli Orientali)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with delicate aromas of pressed chamomile, Spanish Broom and toasted nut. The rich, rather evolved palate offers pineapple, candied citrus zest, dried herb and a hint of papaya freshened by rather fresh acidity.
Name: Stefano Antonucci 2011 Tardivo Ma Non Tardo  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

Description: Aromas suggesting honeysuckle, citrus blossom, honeydew melon, aromatic herb and a whiff of tomato vine lead the way. The round, medium-bodied palate is full of grapefruit, white peach and mature Bosc pear while a mineral note closes the finish.
Name: Monchiero Carbone 2015 Cecu D'la Biunda  (Roero)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with aromas suggesting toasted almond, Spanish broom and grapefruit. The bright, linear palate shows lemon zest, chopped herb and mineral alongside tangy acidity.
Name: Tenuta di Tavignano 2013 Misco Riserva  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico
