Description: Lovely floral scents of black locust flower, orange blossom and a whiff of aromatic herb float out of the glass. The round but elegantly structured palate offers white peach, white currant, sage and mineral. Soft acidity lifts the creamy flavors.
Name: Cascina Val del Prete 2015  Roero

Description: Aromas of green apple, tuberose and a whiff of bread crust meld together on this vibrant white. The palate offers honeydew melon, white peach, bread crust and tangerine while tangy acidity gives it a crisp finish.
Name: Castellari Bergaglio 2013 Rovereto Vignavecchia  (Gavi)

Description: Aromas of dried chamomile flower, nut, honey, hay and whiff of smoke all carry over to the palate along with lemon zest. Notes of saline, mineral and hazelnut add depth while firm acidity provides the backbone. It's unusual and intriguing.
Name: Germano Ettore 2014 Nascetta (Langhe)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Linear and vibrant, this opens with scents of tangerine zest and green apple. The vibrant palate delivers crisp pear, lime and white almond alongside racy acidity. An energized mineral vein underscores the flavors.
Name: Tenuta di Tavignano 2014 Misco  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Description: Delicate aromas of honeydew melon, white spring flower and a whiff of lemon lead the nose on this refreshing white. The lively, straightforward palate offers green apple, white peach and a flinty note alongside bright acidity.
Name: Tenuta La Marchesa 2015 White Label  (Gavi)

Description: Aromas of banana, apricot, honeysuckle and tropical fruit lead the nose. The round, medium-bodied palate offers creamy white peach, green apple, tangerine and a hint of honeydew melon. Fresh acidity brightens the rich flavors.
Name: Zenato 2015 San Benedetto  (Lugana)

Description: This opens with aromas that recall white wild flower, orchard fruit and a hint of beeswax. The medium-bodied palate offers creamy white peach, vanilla, citrus and a hint of white almond alongside bright acidity.
Name: La Bollina 2015 Ventola  (Gavi)

Appellation: Verdicchio di Matelica, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Fresh and savory, this offers aromas and flavors of fresh apple, green Anjou pear and almond. Bright acidity gives it a crisp, clean finish while a hint of saline signals the close.
Name: Belisario 2015 Vigneti del Cerro  (Verdicchio di Matelica)

Description: Jasmine, orange blossom and aromatic herb aromas lead the nose on this round, friendly white. The soft, bright palate offers yellow peach, apricot and pear while a note of white almond backs up the finish.
Name: Deltetto 2015 Daivej  (Roero)

Description: Honeysuckle, white stone fruit and honeydew melon scents are at the fore along with a whiff of tomato leaf. The bright, juicy palate is full of white peach, mature apple and a white almond note while fresh acidity perks up the creamy flavors.
Name: Ottella 2015  Lugana

Description: Made with organically farmed grapes, this offers aromas of tropical fruit and white stone fruit. The round, juicy palate doles out white peach, yellow apple and a mineral note with a pleasantly bitter almond finish. Tangy acidity brightens the creamy flavors.
Name: Pasini San Giovanni 2015 Il Lugana Biologico  (Lugana)

Description: Round and juicy, this opens with delicate scents of white field flowers, orchard fruits and a hint of aromatic herbs. The soft, medium-bodied palate offers yellow peaches, lemon zest and pears while a note of white almond backs up the finish.
Name: Matteo Correggia 2015  Roero

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of yellow stone fruit and Spanish broom lead the nose while the juicy palate offers mature yellow peach, citrus, pineapple and a hint of almond. Bright acidity provides balance and a crisp finish.
Name: Tenuta di Tavignano 2015 Villa Torre  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Description: Delicate but alluring scents of jasmine and aromatic herb float out of the glass. On the medium-bodied palate, zesty acidity offsets Golden Delicious apple, citrus zest and a note of bitter almond.
Name: CàMaiol 2014 Molin  (Lugana)

Appellation: Verdicchio di Matelica, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Made with organically farmed grapes and produced with certified organic vinification practices, this unusual white has a deep golden color and a fragrance of pressed yellow flower and toasted almond. The round, medium-bodied palate delivers ripe tangerine, white almond, mineral and a hint of honey alongside tangy acidity.
Name: Belisario 2014 Vigneti B  (Verdicchio di Matelica)

Description: Aromas of pressed flower, nut and a whiff of citrus lead the nose. The ripe, juicy palate delivers tangerine, mature Golden Delicious and a hint of bitter almond alongside bright acidity.
Name: Ancilla 2015 1909  (Lugana)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Delicate aromas of yellow flower and citrus lift out of the glass while the racy, linear palate offers grapefruit, nectarine and graphite alongside zesty acidity. It finishes crisp and clean.
Name: Moncaro 2014 Verde Ca' Ruptae  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Subdued aromas of oak and citrus zest slowly take shape in the glass. The linear, svelte palate offers oak driven spice, lemon zest and yellow apple skin framed in racy acidity. A hint of toasted nut closes the finish.
Name: Umani Ronchi 2013 Plenio Riserva  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

Description: Aromas suggesting Anjou pear, almond, grilled herb and a whiff of smoke come together in the glass while the palate offers tangerine zest, ginger and mineral. Fresh acidity lends balance.
Name: Perla del Garda 2013 Vendemmia Tardiva  (Lugana)

Description: This opens with aromas of ripe orchard fruit and a whiff of citrus. The bright, juicy palate offers mature pear, peach and nectarine while a pleasantly bitter almond note fills in the finish.
Name: Perla del Garda 2015 Perla  (Lugana)

Description: Fermented in barrel, this opens with aromas of pressed flower, vanilla and a whiff of toasted oak. The round palate offers yellow apple skin, oak, candied citrus peel and a hint of butterscotch alongside fresh acidity. A nutty note signals the close.
Name: Tenuta Carretta 2013 Canorei  (Roero)

Description: Delicate scents of white spring flower and citrus lead the way while the racy, linear palate offers nectarine, mineral and bitter almond. Zesty acidity provides the framework.
Name: Villa Sparina 2013 Monterotondo del Comune di Gavi  (Gavi)

Description: Made with grapes cultivated with organic and biodynamic methods, this opens with aromas of pressed white flower, honey, toasted hazelnut and mature orchard fruit. The vibrant, linear palate doles out mature yellow apple, honeydew melon and white almond alongside bright acidity.
Name: La Raia 2013 Vigna della Madonnina Riserva  (Gavi)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of toasted oak, chamomile and acacia flower lead the nose. The round palate offers yellow apple skin, dried tropical fruit, oak, coffee and a butterscotch note alongside well-integrated acidity. Drink soon to capture the remaining fruit.
Name: Marotti Campi 2012 Salmariano Riserva  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

Description: Delicate scents of white flower and apricot lead the nose. The bright, round palate doles out ripe peach, pear and a hint of hazelnut that lead to a fresh finish.
Name: San Silvestro 2015 Parvo  (Roero)

Appellation: Verdicchio di Matelica, Central Italy, Italy
Description: The nose is rather subdued but this eventually reveals hints of pressed acacia flower and nut. On the palate, flinty mineral, almond and a hint of honey accent citrus zest while fresh acidity gives lifts the finish.
Name: Belisario 2012 Meridia  (Verdicchio di Matelica)

Description: Honeysuckle, citrus blossom and an intriguing whiff of smoke open on the nose. The bright palate doles out creamy peach, mature pear and citrus zest while a light almond note backs up the finish. Fresh acidity lifts the creamy flavors.
Name: Demarie 2015  Roero

Description: Aromas of lemon blossom, banana and yellow stone fruit lead the way. The round, generous palate offers juicy peach, Bosc pear and white almond while a mineral note closes the soft, juicy finish.
Name: Negro Angelo e Figli 2015 Serra Lupini  (Roero)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of white flower and citrus follow through to the racy palate alongside juicy grapefruit, green pear and a mineral note. Zesty acidity gives it a tangy finish.
Name: Montecappone 2014 Federico II A.D. 1194  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Description: Delicate scents of honeydew melon, orchard fruit and a whisper of white spring flower lift from the glass. The savory palate offers white peach, green apple, sage and a hint of toasted almond alongside bright acidity. A light mineral note signals the close.
Name: Michele Chiarlo 2015 Le Marne  (Gavi)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Aged in barriques, this deeply hued yellow-gold wine opens with aromas of toasted oak, dried citrus and aromatic herb. The lean, somewhat evolved palate offers pink grapefruit, mineral, almond and oak-driven spice. Drink soon.
Name: Garofoli 2010 Serra Fiorese Riserva  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

Description: Aromas of white flower, tropical fruit and an herbal note lead the nose on this medium-bodied white. The juicy, generous palate doles out ripe pear, tangerine, mineral and white almond. Soft but fresh enough acidity offsets the creamy flavors.
Name: Marco Porello 2015 Camestri  (Roero)

Description: Subtle aromas of white spring flower and ripe orchard fruit lead the nose. The round palate shows white peach, mature pear and aromatic herb while a note of bitter hazelnut closes the finish.
Name: Giribaldi 2015 Prato della Porta Arneis (Langhe)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of pressed acacia flower, beeswax and a balsamic note come together on this. On the full-bodied palate, notes of vanilla and honey accent the primary flavors of candied tangerine zest and white peach. A note of toasted almond closes the finish.
Name: Vignamato 2011 Ambrosia Riserva  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

Description: Aromas of white spring flower and yellow stone fruit lead the way on this easygoing but generous white. The round, juicy palate offers mature peach, ripe pear and a white almond note. Fresh acidity balances the creamy flavors.
Name: Monchiero Carbone 2015 Recit  (Roero)

Description: Spring flower and yellow stone fruit aromas lift out of the glass. The round, juicy palate doles out creamy peach, nectarine zest, Bosc pear and a hint of hazelnut. Soft acidity brightens the creamy flavors.
Name: Cascina del Pozzo 2015 Montemeraviglia  (Roero)

Description: White flower, honeydew melon and lemon aromas meld together on this lively white. The savory, juicy palate doles out green apple, white peach and a white almond note alongside flinty mineral and bright acidity.
Name: San Silvestro 2015 Fossili del Comune di Gavi  (Gavi)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of pressed Spanish broom, oak, marzipan and citrus blend in the glass. The rich, medium-bodied palate offers candied nectarine zest, vanilla and toasted almond alongside bright acidity. Drink now or hold for a few more years.
Name: Casalfarneto 2012 Crisio Riserva  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

Description: This vibrant white opens with delicate scents of white flower and tree fruit. The zesty palate offers lime, Bartlett pear and a hint of white grapefruit alongside racy acidity. A note of bitter almond backs up the finish.
Name: Cornarea 2014  Roero

Description: Made entirely with Garganega, this offers aromas of maple syrup, pressed white flower and candied orange zest. The round palate doles out dried apricot and tangerine while a hint of orange blossom honey backs up the finish.
Name: Suavia 2009 Acinatium  (Recioto di Soave)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Restrained aromas of white flower, beeswax and a light whiff of Mediterranean herb lift out of the glass. The racy, linear palate is more expressive, offering juicy tangerine, Bartlett pear and a hint of mineral alongside tangy acidity.
Name: Tenuta dell'Ugolino 2014 Vigneto del Balluccio  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

Description: Aromas of banana, yellow stone fruit and a heady whiff of jasmine jump out of the glass. The rounded palate offers peach, pink grapefruit and an herbal note alongside bright acidity.
Name: Malavasi Daniele 2015  Lugana

Description: Delicately scented with a fragrance of spring wild flower and orchard fruit, this medium-bodied white delivers mature pear, yellow peach, citrus and a mineral note. Tangy acidity brightens the creamy flavors while a touch of hazelnut closes the finish.
Name: Fontanafredda 2015 Pradalupo  (Roero)

Appellation: Livermore Valley, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Taking a whiff of this wine is like walking into a florist's shop. The aromas are roses and magnolias, and the flavors are like ripe white peach and crisp apple. For all that dreamy floral character, however, this light-bodied wine is only slightly sweet, and has good crisp acidity for balance.
Name: Occasio 2015 Del Arroyo Vineyard Malvasia Bianca (Livermore Valley)

Description: Soft and juicy, this opens with a delicate fragrance of white spring blossom and an orchard in bloom. The soft, round palate offers white peach, citrus and a suggestion of pear. A hint of white almond closes the finish.
Name: Massucco 2015  Roero

Description: This is delicately scented with aromas suggesting white spring wild flower and a hint of white stone fruit. The soft, fresh palate offers Bartlett pear, juicy citrus and yellow peach while a note of bitter hazelnut closes the finish.
Name: Battaglio 2015 Piasi  (Roero)

Description: Aromas of white spring flower, exotic fruit and an herbal note waft out of the glass. The medium-bodied palate offers white peach, pear, vanilla and toasted oak alongside modest acidity. A citrusy note closes the finish.
Name: Deltetto 2015 San Michele  (Roero)

Description: Delicately fragrant, this offers scents of citrus blossom, white wild flower and yellow stone fruit. The soft, round palate presents creamy peach, nectarine, white almond and a hint of mineral alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Pelassa 2015 San Vito  (Roero)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Delicately scented, this opens with subtle aromas of yellow spring flower and a whiff of citrus. The vibrant palate offers crisp Golden Delicious apple, grapefruit and mineral alongside zesty acidity. A delicate note of white almond signals the finish.
Name: Pievalta 2014  Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Description: Aromas of toasted oak, mature orchard fruit, and baking spice open. The medium-bodied palate offers yellow apple skin, grapefruit, butterscotch and toasted nut alongside bright acidity. A graphite note signals the close.
Name: Zenato 2013 Sergio Zenato Riserva  (Lugana)

Description: Delicate aromas of white flowers, dried fruit and a whiff of cake spice come together on this medium-bodied dessert wine. Made with 100% Garganega, the round palate offers mature apricot, cinnamon and touch of pine nut.
Name: Tessari 2012 Tre Colli  (Recioto di Soave)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of yellow flower and acacia honey take center stage on this bright wine. The zesty palate offers pineapple, peach and citrus alongside racy acidity that gives it a tangy finish.
Name: Casalfarneto 2014 Fontevecchia  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Description: White spring flower and citrus fruit aromas lead the way while the bright palate offers juicy nectarine and a hint of papaya. Zesty acidity gives it a tangy finish.
Name: La Bollina 2015  Gavi

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas recalling chamomile flower and acacia honey lead the way. The medium-bodied palate offers candied lemon drop, grapefruit and toasted nut alongside vibrant acidity. Drink soon.
Name: La Staffa 2013 Rincrocca  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Description: Pear, apricot and honeysuckle scents lead carry over to the soft, round palate along with a hint of pear. A white almond note fills in the finish.
Name: Malabaila 2015  Roero

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi, Central Italy, Italy
Description: White spring flower and citrus aromas lead the nose on this easygoing, savory white. The juicy palate offers juicy tangerine and a note of sea salt alongside fresh acidity. It's simple but well made.
Name: Stefano Antonucci 2015  Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Deeply colored gold, this unusual white opens with aromas of beeswax and pressed white flower. The concentrated but rather evolved palate offers dried citrus fruit, chamomile, acacia honey and pear.
Name: Colonnara 2014 Cuprese  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi)

Description: Lightly scented, this medium-bodied white opens with whiffs of white spring flower and orchard fruit. The soft, round palate offers mature pear, citrus peel and a hint of toasted hazelnut.
Name: Giacomo Vico 2015  Roero

Description: Pretty scents of fragrant white wild flower and white stone fruit lift out of the glass. On the round, straightforward palate, fresh acidity offsets ripe Bosc pear, lemon zest and a hint of hazelnut.
Name: Castello di Neive 2015 Montebertotto Arneis (Langhe)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of fragrant broom, white wild flower and a whiff of damp earth lead the nose on this straightforward wine. The vibrant palate offers green apple and tangerine alongside zesty acidity. A slightly bitter almond closes the finish.
Name: Brunori 2014 Le Gemme  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

Description: Deeply colored, this opens with subdued aromas of smoke, pressed wildflower and a whiff of orchard fruit. The vibrant, linear palate offers pear, tangerine, white almond and a mineral note alongside bright acidity. Reflecting the cool, wet vintage, it's refreshing but a bit lean.
Name: Negro Lorenzo 2014  Roero

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with subdued aromas of citrus, nut and a hint of honey. The tangy palate offers grapefruit, candied lemon peel, tangerine and bitter almond alongside zesty acidity.
Name: Stefano Antonucci 2014  Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Description: This savory, straightforward white opens with fruity aromas that recall ripe peach and tropical fruit. The round, juicy palate offers mature yellow apple, passion fruit and white peach while fresh acidity lift the creamy flavors.
Name: Santa Sofia 2015  Lugana

Description: Delicately scented, this opens with aromas of white spring flower and citrus blossom while the bright, refreshing palate doles out green apple, lemon zest and a mineral note. It finishes crisp and clean.
Name: Villa Sparina 2015 del Comune di Gavi  (Gavi)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with aromas that suggest orchard fruit and citrus. The zesty, straightforward palate offers white peach, nectarine and green apple alongside bright acidity.
Name: Stefano Antonucci 2015 Le Vaglie  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This linear white opens with delicate aromas that recall citrus blossom, citrus peel and orchard fruit. The racy palate offers green Anjou pear, lime and a note of bitter almond alongside a backbone of firm acidity.
Name: Montecappone 2014 Mirizzi  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with aromas that recall acacia flower, chamomile and a whiff of beeswax. The zesty palate offers grapefruit, green apple and hint of white almond alongside racy acidity.
Name: Marotti Campi 2014 Luzano  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Appellation: Verdicchio di Matelica, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of toasted oak, white flower and a whiff vanilla lead the way while the medium-bodied palate offers butterscotch, white almond, mineral and candied lemon zest. Drink soon to capture the remaining fruit richness.
Name: Belisario 2012 Cambrugiano Riserva  (Verdicchio di Matelica)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas recalling spring flower and lime lead the nose while the crisp palate offers grapefruit, white peach and a hint of mineral alongside racy acidity. A bitter almond note marks the finish.
Name: Cantine Politi 2014 Loretello  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi)

Appellation: Verdicchio di Matelica, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Delicate aromas suggesting chamomile flower and acacia honey carry over to the linear but somewhat lean palate along with hints of citrus and yellow apple. Racy acidity provides the backbone while a bitter almond note marks the finish.
Name: La Monacesca 2014  Verdicchio di Matelica

Appellation: Verdicchio di Matelica, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Here's a vibrant, easygoing white wine that offers flavors of citrus, apple and a hint of bitter almond. Bright acidity gives it a crisp finish. It's straightforward but well made and refreshing.
Name: Belisario 2015 Terre di Val Bona  (Verdicchio di Matelica)

Description: Subtle aromas of acacia flower and a whiff of almond lead the way. The round, easygoing palate offers pear, citrus peel and a hint of hazelnut alongside soft acidity.
Name: Bersano 2015  Roero

Description: Aromas of oak, dill and citrus lead the way. On the medium-bodied palate, butterscotch and other oak-driven spice sensations dominate candied nectarine zest and yellow apple.
Name: Cà dei Frati 2014 Brolettino  (Lugana)

Description: Floral aromas reminiscent of citrus blossom, tuberose and black locust flower lift out of the glass. The bright, straightforward palate offers Bosc pear, lemon drop and toasted hazelnut alongside soft but fresh enough acidity.
Name: Agricola Pace 2015  Roero

Description: Delicate scents of beeswax and white spring flower lift out of the glass. The round, juicy palate offers mature pear, white almond and a hint of citrus alongside soft acidity.
Name: Cascina Chicco 2015 Anterisio  (Roero)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This zesty, straightforward white offers aromas of Spanish broom and acacia flower while the bright palate offers golden delicious apple and citrus. A pleasant note of bitter almond backs up the finish.
Name: Garofoli 2014 Macrina  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with subdued aromas that recall yellow flower, toasted nut and a whiff of citrus. The rather lean but quenching palate offers lemon zest, white almond and a hint of mineral alongside zesty acidity.
Name: Marchetti 2014 Tenuta del Cavaliere  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Description: Light and vibrant, this opens with delicate scents recalling white flower, orchard fruit and a whiff of almond. The slender palate offers Bartlett pear and citrusy notes alongside racy acidity.
Name: Suavia 2014  Soave Classico

Description: This opens with subdued aromas of orchard fruit and a whiff of hazelnut. The racy palate is a bit lean but still offers Bosc pear, lime, bitter almond and a trace of mineral. Drink soon.
Name: Castellari Bergaglio 2014 Fornaci  (Gavi)

Description: This has subtle aromas suggesting beeswax, green pear and a whiff of nut. The lean, racy palate offers lemon zest, crisp Granny Smith apple and bitter almond alongside brisk acidity.
Name: Castellari Bergaglio 2014 Rolona del Comune di Gavi  (Gavi)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This fresh, simple white smells of white wild flower and yellow stone fruit. The zesty palate offers lime and Bosc pear alongside tangy acidity that leads to a clean finish.
Name: Raphael 2015  Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

Description: Subdued aromas of pear and white spring flower lift out of the glass. The lean palate offers grapefruit, pear bitter almond and mineral alongside tangy acidity.
Name: Malabaila 2014 Pradvaj  (Roero)

Description: Lime blossom, bread crust and a whiff of toast lead the nose. Slightly fizzy when first poured, the lively palate offers citrus, green Anjou pear and bitter nut while a hint of flinty mineral closes the finish.
Name: Malvirà 2014 Non Filtrato  (Roero)

Description: The nose isn't very expressive but eventually reveals whiffs of pressed white flower and orchard fruit. The straightforward palate offers suggestions of mature yellow apple, candied lemon drop and a bitter almond note.
Name: Marchesi di Barolo 2015 del Comune di Gavi  (Gavi)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This fresh white has delicate aromas of white spring flower and yellow stone fruit. The bright, easygoing palate offers yellow peach, bitter almond and a light saline note alongside bright acidity. It's simple but well made.
Name: Tenuta dell'Ugolino 2015 Le Piaole  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

Description: Pressed jasmine, yellow stone fruit, oak and a whiff of medicinal herb lead the nose. The lean palate shows toasted oak, vanilla, yellow apple skin, coffee and a note recalling adhesive bandage.
Name: Perla del Garda 2013 Madonna della Scoperta Riserva  (Lugana)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Deeply colored gold, this opens with scents suggesting dried chamomile flower and toasted walnut. The palate is evolved, offering grapefruit and bitter almond alongside racy acidity. Drink soon to capture the remaining fruit.
Name: Fattoria Coroncino 2015 Il Bacco  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: The nose is rather shy but eventually reveals aromas suggesting nut and acacia honey. The lean palate shows unripe pear, lime, saline and a hint of bitter nut alongside brisk acidity.
Name: Fattoria La Vialla 2014  Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Description: The nose is rather shy but eventually reveals whiffs of spring wild flower and beeswax. The straightforward palate offers pear, citrus, mineral and a hint of almond alongside rather fresh acidity.
Name: CarlindePaolo 2015 Arneis (Terre Alfieri)

Description: This opens with aromas that recall spring flower, citrus and a whiff of honeydew melon. The rather lean, linear palate shows grapefruit and flint alongside racy acidity. A bitter almond note signals the finish.
Designation: Bruno Broglia del Comune di Gavi
Name: Broglia 2013 Bruno Broglia del Comune di Gavi  (Gavi)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of honeysuckle and a whiff of passion fruit lead the way. The round, simple palate offers yellow peach, tangerine and a note of bitter almond alongside fresh acidity.
Name: Velenosi 2015 Quercia Antica  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi)

Description: Aromas of jasmine and citrus blossom lead the nose. The soft, bright palate offers yellow peach, Bartlett pear and a hint of candied lemon rind. A note of white almond closes the finish.
Name: Vite Colte 2015 Villata  (Roero)

Description: The nose is subdued but eventually reveals whiffs of pressed white flower and dried herb. The rather lean palate offers hints of green pear, citrus, mineral and a note of bitter almond.
Name: Chiesa Carlo 2014 Quin  (Roero)

Description: Aromas of toasted oak, tropical fruit and a marked medicinal note lead the nose. The round palate offers oak, pear, citrus peel and a bitter note recalling adhesive bandage.
Name: Malvirà 2013 Vigna Saglietto  (Roero)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi, Central Italy, Italy
Description: White flower, citrus and beeswax aromas open. The enjoyable, easy drinking palate offers Anjou pear, lime and a hint of bitter almond alongside zesty acidity. It's simple but well made.
Name: Stefano Antonucci 2014 Pignocco  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi)

Description: Subtle aromas of acacia flower and a whiff of almond lead the way. The round, easygoing palate offers pear, citrus peel and a hint of hazelnut alongside soft acidity.
Name: Dezzani 2015 Monfrigio  (Roero)

Description: Aromas of citrus, herb and black locust flower lift out of the glass. The taut, racy palate offers lime, crisp Granny Smith and steely mineral alongside bracing acidity.
Name: Coppo 2014 La Rocca  (Gavi)

Description: This opens with aromas that recall walnut and orchard fruit. The lively, simple palate offers Bartlett pear, citrus zest and a hint of hazelnut alongside bright acidity.
Name: Costa Alessandro 2014  Roero

Description: This opens with delicate scents of white wild flower, herb and a whiff of smoke. The bright, straightforward palate offers suggestions of tropical fruit, mineral and a note of toasted almond alongside bright acidity. It's refreshing but rather lean.
Name: San Silvestro 2014 Ghercina del Comune di Novello Nascetta (Langhe)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Simple but well made, this offers aromas and flavors of citrus, pear and a hint of bitter almond. Bright acidity gives it clean finish.
Name: Umani Ronchi 2015 Villa Bianchi  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This has aromas of hay, tropical fruit and a whiff of tomato vine. The bright, straightforward palate offers fruity flavors suggesting honeydew melon, white peach and citrus alongside zesty acidity.
Name: Vignamato 2015 Valle delle Lame  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi)

Description: Aromas of apricot, citrus peel and honeydew melon lead the nose. The dense, almost syrupy palate offers yellow peach and candied orange before a short, flat finish.
Name: Italo Cescon 2014 Svejo Manzoni (Veneto)

Description: Restrained aromas of white flower lead the way on this fresh, straightforward white. The round, simple palate shows light notes of peach, apple and a hint of bitter almond on the close.
Name: La Scolca 2015 Black Label  (Gavi)

Description: You'll find aromas of black locust flower and a whiff of beeswax on this. The beeswax note carries over to the straightforward palate together with pear and a hint of bitter nut alongside soft acidity.
Name: Giacomo Vico 2015 Donna Anita  (Roero)

Description: Lightly-scented with hints of black locust flower and citrus blossom, this easygoing, straightforward white offers flavors that suggest Bartlett pear and green apple. A note of white almond closes the finish.
Name: Michele Chiarlo 2015 Le Madri  (Roero)

Description: Aromas of toasted nut, smoke, dried wild flower and mature orchard fruit lead the nose. The medium-bodied, rather evolved palate shows notes of honey, yellow apple skin and a hint of hazelnut. Drink soon to capture the remaining freshness.
Name: Marchesi di Barolo 2015  Roero

Description: Delicately scented, this lively wine has aromas of white field flower and a whiff of almond paste. The bright palate offers green apple and lemon alongside tangy acidity. It's simple but well made and refreshing.
Name: Vite Colte 2015 Aureliana  (Gavi)

Description: Opening with subtle aromas that recall white flower and citrus, this straightforward white offers flavors of Granny Smith apple and lime alongside bright acidity. It's extremely simple but also clean and refreshing.
Name: Gran Passione 2015  Gavi

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: This has light floral aromas of dried chamomile and acacia flower. The palate is lean and not very expressive, offering bitter almond and yellow apple skin alongside brisk acidity.
Name: La Staffa 2014  Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Vibrant and straightforward, this opens with delicate aromas of Spanish broom, citrus fruit and herb. The bright, simple palate offers tangerine and a bitter almond note alongside zesty acidity.
Name: Marotti Campi 2014 Albiano  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico, Central Italy, Italy
Description: While it's not complex this is certainly well composed. It opens with subtle aromas of yellow flower and orchard fruit while the light, easygoing palate offers pear and citrus. Crisp acidity gives it a clean, refreshing finish.
Name: Garofoli 2015 Serra del Conte  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

Description: Lightly scented, this opens with aromas suggesting white spring flower and orchard fruit. The rather lean, racy palate offers unripe apple, a hint of citrus and a medicinal note alongside brisk acidity.
Designation: La Meirana del Comune di Gavi
Name: Broglia 2014 La Meirana del Comune di Gavi  (Gavi)

Description: This simple, refreshing white has a subdued nose while the palate offers delicate flavors suggesting peach, green apple and a hint of citrus. Bright acidity leads to a clean finish.
Name: La Scolca 2015 White Label  (Gavi)

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Central Italy, Italy
Description: The nose is inexpressive while the lean, rather diluted palate offers dried herb, citrus zest and a note of bitter almond. Brisk acidity completes the picture.
Name: Frati Bianchi 2014 Il Priore  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore)
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore

Appellation: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico, Central Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of tropical fruit and citrus lead the nose on this simple white. The bright, refreshing palate offers grapefruit and lemon zest alongside brisk acidity.
Name: Marchetti 2015  Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico
Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico

Description: Subdued aromas of pressed blossom, fennel and orchard fruit come together on this. The lean, rather diluted palate offers hints of green pear, citrus rind and a mineral note alongside tangy acidity.
Name: Marco Porello 2014 Camestri  (Roero)

Description: Amber gold in the glass, this Ribolla Gialla has aromas of wet river rocks, vanilla bean and honeycomb. It has a luscious mouthfeel with pronounced minerality and flavors of apricot, apple and ripe pear.
Name: Ferdinand 2009 Brutus Ribolla Gialla (Goriska Brda)

Description: Buy this for its balance and welcome sense of restraint that gives way to richness on the finish. Crisp apple and light citrus aromas, then nicely concentrated and similar flavors, put an attractive spin on this medium-bodied, fresh and appealing wine.
Name: Bailiwick 2014 Vermentino (California)

Description: This 100% Ribolla Gialla has aromas of green apple and apple cider. There's nice minerality in the mouth with flavors of apple pie, apple cider and a touch of creaminess. The finish is pleasantly bright.
Name: Ferdinand 2013 Rebula Época Ribolla Gialla (Goriska Brda)

Description: Aromas of honeysuckle, yellow canned peach and wet slate lead to flavors of grapefruit peel, citrus blossom and lemon zest in the mouth. The finish is crisp and zippy.
Name: Ferdinand 2014 Rebula Ribolla Gialla (Goriska Brda)

Description: It's fun to try this wine from an Italian grape variety that is rare in California. It tastes unusually lean and tangy, with earthy aromas. Dry and taut on the palate, it has a mineral or metallic tinge to the rather austere fruit flavors.
Name: Borra 2014 Limited Release Vermentino (Lodi)

Description: Briny tropical-fruit aromas suggest pickles and cactus. This is chunky in build, with citrusy acidity. Briny citrus flavors cannot be further defined, while citric acidity keeps this fresh through the finish.
Name: El Grifo 2014 Malvasia (Lanzarote)

Description: One of the most unusual and fascinating wines coming out of Italy, this vibrant 11-year-old opens with aromas of pressed wildflower, chopped herb, spice, dried fruit and flint. On the rich palate, a mineral vein underscores mature apricot, candied tangerine zest and ginger. It shows the impressive aging potential of this native grape. Drink through 2024.
Name: Radikon 2004 Ribolla Gialla (Venezia Giulia)

Description: Made entirely with Friulano, this stunning wine delivers dried apricot, candied nectarine zest, baked apple, almond and dried herb sensations. A mineral vein weaves through the elegantly structured palate, adding both depth and complexity. Drink through 2023.
Name: Radikon 2008 Jakot Friulano (Venezia Giulia)

Description: This amber-hued wine is Josko Gravner's calling card, and it not only helped kickoff Italy's orange wine movement, but it put the native grape Ribolla Gialla on the map. Delivering dried apricot, orange zest, saline, resin, ginger, anise, dried herb, nut and a blast of smoky mineral, it has an extreme character. While it's not for everyone, it's an impressive effort that combines structure, restraint, depth and complexity. Serve only slightly chilled. Drink through 2027.
Name: Gravner 2007 Ribolla Ribolla Gialla (Venezia Giulia)

Description: Lovely scents of orchard fruit, citrus, almond blossom and a whiff of light baking spice emerge on this radiant wine. The lively, balanced palate delivers yellow apple, bitter almond, ginger and a note of tangerine zest. A salty note closes the finish.
Name: Raccaro 2014 Friulano (Collio)

Description: Aromas of white flower, citrus zest, chopped basil and sage lead the nose on this stunning wine while the vibrant, full-bodied palate shows nectarine zest, mineral, dried apricot and lemon drop. Firm acidity bestows a clean, crisp finish.
Name: Draga 2012 Miklus Malvasia (Collio)

Description: Lovely aromas of Spanish Broom, white cherry, peach and light spice emerge on this radiant, elegant wine. The crisp palate offers Kaiser pear, apple, nectarine zest, white pepper and a hint of ginger. Vibrant acidity carries the flavors while a pronounced mineral note energizes the finish.
Name: Raccaro 2014 Malvasia (Collio)

Description: Aromas of nut, apple skin, pear and chopped sage lead the nose while the fresh, inviting palate shows citrus zest, yellow apple and crystallized ginger. A blast of tangerine and a mineral note back up the finish.
Name: Tenuta La Ponca 2014 Friulano (Collio)

Description: The nose on this amber-colored wine is initially shy but eventually reveals ripe stone fruit, crushed rock, spice and a balsamic note. The mature palate offers tangerine zest, dried apricot, anise, vanilla and mineral together with bright acidity. It boasts complexity and depth.
Name: La Castellada 2009 Ribolla Gialla (Collio)

Description: This opens with subtle aromas of white stone fruit, yellow flower and crushed rock. The structured, savory palate offers tangerine zest, yellow apple, lime and minerals. Toasted almond marks the close.
Name: Borgo del Tiglio 2013 Ronco della Chiesa Friulano (Collio)

Description: Deep orange, almost amber in color, this boasts aromas of candied tangerine zest, ginger, mineral and a balsamic note. The aromas carry over to the palate along with white pepper, berry, apricot and anise, all offset with bright acidity. It's still fresh. Drink through 2021.
Name: Primosic 2011 Ribolla di Oslavia Riserva Ribolla Gialla (Collio)

Description: Beeswax, acacia and aromas of pressed yellow flower are front and center on this lively wine while the vibrant palate offer yellow peach, crisp apple and toasted almond. It's lively and balanced, with a fresh finish.
Name: Ferruccio Sgubin 2013 Friulano (Collio)

Description: Toasted vanilla, chopped herbs and ripe orchard-fruit aromas unfold in the glass. The firm palate delvers yellow apple, peach, vanilla, ginger and bitter almond alongside bright acidity.
Name: Livon 2014 Manditocai Friulano (Collio)

Description: White flower, Spanish Broom, chamomile, exotic fruit and a hint of hazelnut unfold in the glass. The linear, razor-sharp palate delivers Kaiser pear, citrus, sage and white almond while a salty mineral note closes the finish.
Name: Sturm 2014 Friulano (Collio)

Appellation: Friuli Colli Orientali, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Fragrant and linear, this has delicate scents of white spring flower and green apple while the bright palate offers white peach, pear and lemon peel. A light mineral note adds interest while zesty acidity gives it a tangy finish.
Name: Collavini 2014 Turian Ribolla Gialla (Friuli Colli Orientali)

Description: A few swirls of the glass release subtle, refined aromas of yellow stone fruit and hazelnut. The lively palate offers yellow apple, sage, mineral and bitter almond alongside bright acidity.
Name: Gradis'ciutta 2014 Friulano (Collio)

Description: Aromas of fragrant yellow flower, apple and a whiff of hazelnut come together on this structured white. The bright palate offers Kaiser pear, nectarine zest and a honeyed note alongside vibrant acidity.
Name: Ronco Blanchis 2013 Friulano (Collio)

Description: Heady aromas of cut grass, yellow stone fruit, dill and a hint of tomato leaf are showcased on this fragrant wine. The bright, focused palate delivers yellow peach, yellow apple, sage, saline and mineral note. Toasted almond signals the finish.
Name: Russiz Superiore 2014 Friulano (Collio)

Description: Aromas of fragrant yellow flower, apple and a whiff of hazelnut come together on this structured white. The bright palate offers Kaiser pear, nectarine zest and a honeyed note alongside vibrant acidity.
Name: Ronco Blanchis 2013 Friulano (Collio)

Appellation: Friuli Colli Orientali, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of pressed wildflower, orchard fruit, citrus and a whiff of nut lead the nose. The luminous palate delivers yellow apple, Kaiser pear, nectarine and bitter almond accompanied by tangy acidity.
Name: Terlato 2013 Friulano (Friuli Colli Orientali)

Description: Delicate but enticing aromas of citrus and apple follow through to the vibrant, polished palate along with peach, tangerine zest and a mineral note. Crisp acidity gives it a clean, quenching finish.
Name: Gradis'ciutta 2014 Ribolla Gialla (Collio)

Appellation: Vigneti delle Dolomiti, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Intense scents of apricot and peach, not to mention a hint of rose, lead the nose and follow over to the bright palate along with orange zest and lime. Sharp acidity leaves a tangy finish.
Name: Moser 2014 Moscato Giallo (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)

Description: This is a 100% varietal wine, fermented and aged in stainless steel, from a prized vineyard better known for Pinot Noir. Asian pear, tangerine and lemon-lime combine atop a crisp, dry and mineral-driven palate, finishing with a refreshing bite of peach.
Name: Mahoney 2014 Las Brisas Vineyard Vermentino (Carneros)

Description: Aromas of ripe pear, pressed yellow flower and a toasted note waft out of the glass. The mature, elegant palate shows dried apricot, yellow apple skin, bitter almond and crushed rock. Fresh acidity provides balance. It's not loaded with fruit richness but has a mineral-driven appeal.
Name: Renato Keber 2012 Zio Romi Friulano (Collio)

Description: Toasted hazelnut and Kaiser pear aromas come unfold in the glass. The focused, svelte palate shows Golden Delicious apple, fennel, bitter almond, anise and crisp acidity. A graphite note closes the finish.
Name: Mario Schiopetto 2013 Friulano (Collio)

Description: This lively white opens with aromas of peach blossom, crushed stone and whiff of toasted nut while the linear palate shows yellow peach, lemon zest and vibrant acidity. A mineral note closes the finish.
Name: Tercic 2013 Ribolla Gialla (Collio)

Description: This opens with notes of toasted walnut, yellow flower and orchard fruit. The fresh, elegant palate delivers yellow apple, mineral and bitter almond alongside bright acidity.
Name: Venica & Venica 2014 Ronco delle Cime Friulano (Collio)

Description: Dried herb, crushed yellow flower and a whiff of aromatic herb drive the nose on this racy white. The linear palate offers unripe apple, citrus, anise and mineral alongside zesty acidity that leaves a crisp finish.
Name: La Rajade 2014 Ribolla Gialla (Collio)

Description: Enticing aromas of a citrus orchard in bloom, peach and Alpine herb lead the way on this vibrant, racy wine. The lively palate is all about citrus zest, raw apple, mineral and racy acidity.
Name: Sturm 2014 Ribolla Gialla (Collio)

Appellation: Friuli Colli Orientali, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of white orchard fruit, spring wildflower and a hint of nut unfold on this bright wine. The round, structured palate tastes of Williams pear, apple and a bitter almond note alongside fresh acidity.
Name: La Tunella 2014 Friulano (Friuli Colli Orientali)

Description: Delicate scents of citrus, white stone fruit and a whiff of crushed rock come together on this luminous wine. The vibrant palate offers peach, citrus and a hint of apple alongside lively acidity and a mineral note.
Name: Jermann 2014 Vinnae Ribolla Gialla (Venezia Giulia)

Appellation: Friuli Colli Orientali, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Delicate scents of white spring flower and orchard fruit waft out of the glass. The bright, round palate offers Bosc pear and white peach while a pleasant note of bitter almond rounds off the finish.
Name: Comelli 2014 Friulano (Friuli Colli Orientali)

Appellation: Friuli Colli Orientali, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Delicately scented, this offers aromas of apple, candied citrus peel and a hint of pressed yellow flower. The palate offers Kaiser pear, lemon drop and toasted almond alongside bright acidity.
Name: Torre Rosazza 2014 Friulano (Friuli Colli Orientali)

Description: Subtle aromas of apple skin, yellow flower and nut lead the way. The nervy palate offers citrus, acacia honey, green pear and a mineral note. It's racy and linear, but not quite lean.
Name: Ronco Blanchis 2014 Friulano (Collio)

Description: Yellow wildflower, white stone fruit and crushed rock aromas lead the nose while the lively palate offers mineral, almond and yellow apple. It's vibrant, with bright acidity.
Name: Alessio Komjanc 2014 Friulano (Collio)

Appellation: Friuli Colli Orientali, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Vibrant and linear, this offers scents of orchard fruit and citrus. The crisp, straightforward palate tastes of juicy grapefruit, white peach and a mineral note alongside lively acidity.
Name: La Tunella 2014 Ribolla Gialla (Friuli Colli Orientali)

Appellation: Friuli Colli Orientali, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of wildflower, orchard fruit and hazelnut open on the nose. The lively, linear palate shows crunchy green pear, bitter almond and a hint of nutmeg alongside racy acidity.
Name: Petrucco 2014 Friulano (Friuli Colli Orientali)

Description: Orchard fruit and citrus aromas emerge on this vibrant white while the slender, linear palate shows nectarine zest, apple and a hint of mineral. It's savory if a bit lean, with bracing acidity and lots of verve.
Name: Tenuta La Ponca 2014 Ribolla Gialla (Collio)

Description: This lively white offers aromas of fragrant white flower, orchard fruit and crushed stone. The vibrant, linear palate delivers Anjou pear, citrus and an almond note alongside firm acidity.
Name: Collavini 2014 Friulano (Collio)

Description: The nose on this one isn't very expressive but eventually gives up whiffs of paraffin and chopped herb. The palate is more open, offering yellow apple skin, mineral and a subtle almond note. It's reserved but refined.
Name: Ca'Ronesca 2014 Friulano (Collio)

Appellation: Friuli Colli Orientali, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Fresh and delicately scented, this offers aromas of white spring flower, orchard fruit and citrus. The vibrant palate shows crisp apple, white peach and lemon zest balanced by firm acidity.
Name: Dorigo 2014 Ribolla Gialla (Friuli Colli Orientali)

Appellation: Friuli Colli Orientali, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of apple, nut and citrus lead the nose. The lively palate offers pear, lime and a hint of bitter almond accompanied by bright acidity.
Name: Castello di Buttrio 2014 Friulano (Friuli Colli Orientali)

Description: Beeswax, acacia honey and toasted nut aromas carry over to palate along with yellow apple and mineral. It closes on a note of bitter almond.
Name: Fruscalzo 2014 Friulano (Collio)

Description: This offers charming floral aromas while the reserved palate provides subtle sensations of yellow fruit, bitter almond, herb and a hint of nutmeg. Crisp acidity lifts the finish.
Name: Draga 2014 Friulano (Collio)

Appellation: Friuli Colli Orientali, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of citrus, yellow stone fruit and a whiff of geranium lead open on the nose. The tangy palate offers apricot, yellow peach and candied nectarine zest along crisp acidity. A note of bitter almond signals the close.
Name: Comelli 2013 Locum Nostrum Malvasia (Friuli Colli Orientali)

Description: Intense aromas of pressed broom, dried herb, hay and a whiff of tomato vine come together in the glass. The palate is fresh but rather closed, eventually revealing yellow apple skin, mineral and a saline note.
Name: La Rajade 2014 Friulano (Collio)

Appellation: Friuli Colli Orientali, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of toasted nut, citrus and oak lead the nose. The linear, rather lean palate shows yellow apple skin, bitter almond and lime zest. A mineral note signals the finish.
Name: La Tunella 2013 Col Livius Friulano (Friuli Colli Orientali)

Description: Scents of yellow flower, orchard fruit and hazelnut emerge on this lively white. The airy, luminous palate offers up yellow apple skin, green pear and a hint of almond alongside zingy acidity.
Name: Bortoluzzi 2014 Friulano (Collio)

Appellation: Friuli Colli Orientali, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of chamomile and summer orchard fruit delicately float out of the glass. The zesty palate offers yellow apple, white peach and a hint of bitter almond alongside vibrant acidity. It finishes crisp and clean.
Name: Dorigo 2014 Friulano (Friuli Colli Orientali)

Description: The nose is a bit shy but reveals delicate scents of citrus and a whiff of peach blossom while the vibrant palate displays crisp apple, tangerine and a hint of steely mineral. Brisk acidity gives it a clean, refreshing finish.
Name: Ronco Blanchis 2014 Ribolla Gialla (Collio)

Description: This straightforward white has subdued scents pear and wildflower. The palate offers mature yellow apple, bitter almond and a hint of candied lemon zest accompanied by brisk acidity.
Name: Valle 2014 Friulano (Friuli)

Description: The nose is rather shy but eventually reveals delicate scents of spring flower and lime. The vibrant, straightforward palate delivers grapefruit and a hint of tangerine accompanied by brisk acidity.
Name: La Vis 2013 Sette Fontane Nosiola (Trentino)

Description: Aromas of toasted almond and yellow apple skin lead the nose. The aromas follow through to the palate along with a hint of peach and a mineral note. It's rather lean, with brisk acidity.
Name: Fantinel 2014 Tenuta Sant'Elena Friulano (Collio)

Appellation: Friuli Colli Orientali, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with delicate aromas of yellow apple, nut and a faint whiff of pressed yellow flower. The shy, slender palate is on the lean side, showing notes of citrus, mineral and the barest hint of almond accompanied by bright acidity.
Name: Livio Felluga 2014 Friulano (Friuli Colli Orientali)

Description: Pretty aromas of white rose, aromatic herb and stone fruit come together on this. The rather lean palate doesn't live up to the nose, offering apple skin, lemon peel and mineral. Brisk acidity gives it a nervy vibe.
Name: Miklus 2014 Friulano (Collio)

Appellation: Friuli Colli Orientali, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Scents of yellow flower and orchard fruit lift out of the glass. The tangy, straightforward palate offers citrus and peach framed in zesty acidity.
Name: Gigante 2014 Ribolla Gialla (Friuli Colli Orientali)

Description: Appealing aromas of beeswax, citrus blossom, orchard fruit and crushed stone lead the nose while the zesty palate offers lemon rind, tangerine and mineral. Racy acidity gives it a clean, refreshing finish.
Name: Ronco dei Tassi 2014 Malvasia (Collio)

Appellation: Friuli Colli Orientali, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: The delicate opening scents are broom, beeswax and pear. The thin palate is made up of yellow apple skin, dried herb and a hint of almond alongside nervous acidity.
Name: Poggiobello 2014 Friulano (Friuli Colli Orientali)

Description: Aromas of chamomile flower and toasted nut waft out of the glass. The spare, rather diluted palate shows the cool, wet conditions that dominated 2014 while offering up yellow apple skin, mineral and brisk acidity but not much fruit richness.
Name: Conti Formentini 2014 Furlanà Friulano (Collio)

Description: The shy nose doesn't give much away except for a hint of beeswax. The lean palate shows suggestions of mineral and lime alongside bracing, almost crackling acidity.
Name: Tenuta La Ponca 2014 Malvasia (Collio)

Description: This opens with aromas that recall white flower, orchard fruit and a light medicinal note. The lean, rather diluted palate offers apple skin, mineral and a hint of bitter almond alongside brisk acidity.
Name: Subida di Monte 2014 Friulano (Collio)

Description: The nose isn't very expressive but eventually gives up aromas of toasted walnut, citrus and crushed rock. The lean palate offers lime, raw yellow peach and a mineral note accompanied by bracing acidity.
Name: Fiegl 2014 Ribolla Gialla (Collio)

Appellation: Friuli Colli Orientali, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Aromas of toasted nut and yellow apple lift out of the glass. The airy, zippy palate offers unripe pear, lime, almond and mineral alongside brisk acidity.
Name: Gigante 2014 Friulano (Friuli Colli Orientali)

Description: The nose is quiet but the bright, simple palate offers lime and a hint of bitter hazelnut. It's rather lean, with brisk acidity.
Name: Bottega Vinaia 2014 Nosiola (Trentino)

Description: Nut, flint and apple skin aromas lead the nose. The palate is quite lean, showing mineral and bitter almond alongside racy acidity.
Name: Marco Scolaris 2014 Friulano (Collio)

Appellation: Friuli Colli Orientali, Northeastern Italy, Italy
Description: Intensely floral, this opens with aromas that recall air freshener and lilies past their prime. The floral aromas carry over to the lean, rather diluted palate along with a note of candied nectarine zest.
Name: Poggiobello 2014 Ribolla Gialla (Friuli Colli Orientali)

Description: This wine reflects the difficulty of the cool, wet 2014 vintage. It's lean and diluted, with medicinal sensations that recall adhesive bandage and mineral.
Name: Subida di Monte 2014 Malvasia (Collio)

Description: Aromas of toasted hazelnuts, chestnut honey and caramel take center stage on this complex fortified wine. Made with 100% Grillo, the smooth, enveloping palate delivers stewed apricot, orange zest, licorice, walnut, crème brûlée and a vanilla note.
Name: Florio 2000 Baglio Florio Vergine  (Marsala)

Description: Made with 100% Grillo, this full-bodied dessert wine opens with aromas of apricot jam and candied date while the rich palate offers cooked plum, white almond and a hint of caramel. It has just enough freshness to offset the sweet flavors and lend balance.
Name: Florio NV Donna Franca Superiore Riserva  (Marsala)

Description: Made with 100% Grillo grapes, this opens with aromas of crème brûlée, caramel and sweet pipe tobacco. The aromas follow through to the warm palate along with licorice root and vanilla notes.
Name: Florio 2001 Terre Arse  (Marsala)

Appellation: Val di Neto, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Made with dried Mantonico grapes, this opens with aromas of orange zest and dried apricot. The apricot note carries through to the full-bodied palate along with fig, lemon honey and sweet almond. Fresh acidity brightens the concentrated flavors.
Name: Librandi 2009 Le Passule Mantonico (Val di Neto)

Description: Made with 100% Grillo and aged for seven years in oak, this opens with intense aromas of dried apricot and stewed prune. The velvety, robust palate delivers fig, candied date and walnut.
Name: Florio 2002 Targa Riserva 1840 Superiore  (Marsala)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: Compelling scents of acacia flower, beeswax and yellow apple skin waft out of the glass. The vibrant palate offers white peach, pear and a hint of citrus zest alongside crisp acidity that gives this a clean finish.
Name: Montesole 2014 Vigna Breccia  (Greco di Tufo)

Appellation: Greco di Tufo, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This opens with scents of orchard fruit, beeswax and a whiff of white flower. The light, linear palate shows Bartlett pear and citrus peel alongside zesty acidity that lends verve.
Name: Montesole 2014  Greco di Tufo

Description: Very light in color, this wine shows lemon zest, white rocks, nectarine and cold apple flesh on the nose. There's a touch of quinine and botanical gin flavors to the palate, with lemon verbena and other exotic nuances, proving quite intriguing and unique.
Name: Danza del Sol 2013 Vermentino (Temecula)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: The nose on this rarely used grape is indeed voluptuous with caramel richness alongside seared pears and vanilla. It's bright at the tip of the sip, then the denser vanilla-bean notes settle in, evolving to smoked apples and a slight crème brûlée aftertaste.
Name: Clavo Cellars 2012 Voluptuous Vermentino (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Falanghina del Sannio, Southern Italy, Italy
Description: This offers subtle aromas of wild spring flowers and stone fruits. The lean palate suggests Bartlett pear and unripe white peach alongside brisk acidity.
Name: Montesole 2014  Falanghina del Sannio

Description: Packed in an elegant bottle, this is a 100% Vermentino (aka Rolle) wine. The wine has a naturally rich character that is generous while also having plenty of acidity. Lemon and ripe apricots combine easily and giving a smooth, creamy aftertaste.
Name: Château Sainte-Marguerite 2014 Symphony Vermentino (Côtes de Provence)

Description: Enticing scents of jasmine, wisteria and white stone fruit lead the way. The vibrant palate doles out green apple, juicy pear and white peach accompanied by a soft mousse. A white almond note closes the crisp finish.
Designation: Rive di Santo Stefano Brut Millesimato
Name: Mionetto 2014 Rive di Santo Stefano Brut Millesimato  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Made with dried Graganega grapes, this opens with aromas of pressed wild flower, white and yellow stone fruit. The palate doles out ripe peach, dried apricot and acacia honey. It closes on a toasted almond note.
Name: La Cappuccina 2011 Arzimo  (Recioto di Soave)

Appellation: Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze, Veneto, Italy
Description: This offers aromas of jasmine, hawthorn and ripe pear. The round palate delivers creamy green apple, white peach, tangerine zest and a note of honeyed almond accompanied by racy acidity and a foaming mousse.
Name: Mionetto NV  Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze

Appellation: Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore, Veneto, Italy
Description: White spring flower and white peach aromas jump out of the glass and follow through to the vibrant palate along with crisp green apple. A soft mousse lends finesse.
Name: Raphael Dal Bo NV Extra Dry  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Aromas of honeysuckle, jasmine and stone fruit lead the nose on this vibrant wine. The juicy palate delivers creamy white peach, green apple and honeydew melon alongside crisp acidity.
Name: La Cappuccina 2013 Monte Stelle  (Soave Classico)

Description: Produced with dried Garganega grapes, this boasts aromas and flavors of dried apricot, baked apple, citrus zest and toasted sensations. It ends on a note of roasted hazelnut.
Name: Pieropan 2011 Le Colombare  (Recioto di Soave)

Description: White flower and Granny Smith apple aromas come together on this refreshing sparkler. The racy palate offers crisp Bartlett pear and green apple alongside small, persistent bubbles.
Name: Mionetto NV Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Produced from vineyards in the mountains away from the coast, this cool wine still gives free rein to the richness of Vermentino. There is an herbal touch, some spice and ripe apricot flavors. Balanced and fruity now, it will be better from 2016.
Name: Hecht & Bannier 2014 Vermentino (Côtes de Provence)

Description: Aromas of jasmine, green apple and a whiff of exotic fruit lead the nose and follow through to the vibrant palate, along with ripe pear and juicy white peach. A foaming, vivacious mousse accents the rich fruit flavors.
Name: De Faveri 2014 Millesimato Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Appellation: Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore, Veneto, Italy
Description: Creamy and fresh, this opens with scents of white spring flower and pear. The vibrant palate offers green apple and white peach offset by a soft mousse.
Name: Ballancin 2014  Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore

Appellation: Hudson River Region, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Tropical fruit and floral notes abound on this intensely perfumed white. Aged six months in neutral oak, it maintains all it's fruity, forward charms along with a backbone of acidity that's pert and mouthwatering. It's blossomy bouquet might be a bit overwhelming for some.
Name: Millbrook 2014 Lollipop Hill Estate Bottled Tocai Friulano (Hudson River Region)

Appellation: Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Spice, smoke and dusty minerals accent shades of almond and hazelnut in this uniquely savory, dry wine. It's deeply textural, contrasting a slick, rolling richness on the palate against touches of tannin. It finishes with a lingering tang of salt.
Name: Channing Daughters 2013 Sylanus Vineyard Tocai Friulano (Long Island)

Description: Pressed yellow flower, dried fruit and toasted oak aromas lead the nose. The lean palate offers candied citrus zest, vanilla and drying, wood-driven sensations but not much fruit richness. It finishes on a bitter, nutty note.
Name: La Cappuccina 2013 San Brizio  (Soave)

Description: Aromas of toasted oak, candied citrus, pressed white flower and vanilla lead the nose and follow through to the palate, along with nectarine zest and baked apricot. Enjoy soon to capture the remaining freshness and fruit.
Name: Nardello 2012 Monte Zoppega  (Soave Classico)

Appellation: The Hamptons, Long Island, Long Island, New York, US
Description: Spine tingling acidity and sharp lemon and lime flavors mark this zesty dry Trebbiano. Crisp green apple and nectarine notes fill out the midpalate a bit. The finish is brisk and clean.
Name: Wölffer 2014 Trebbiano (The Hamptons, Long Island)

Appellation: Hudson River Region, New York Other, New York, US
Description: Sweet-tart pineapple and apple tones contrast leafy swathes of fresh herbs in this savory Tocai Friulano. Dry and full bodied, it's luscious and silky on the palate but finishes briskly.
Name: Millbrook 2014 Proprietor's Special Reserve Tocai Friulano (Hudson River Region)

Description: The bright, lively nose of citrus spray, white peach, red apple and gooseberry carries through to the light-bodied palate. Tart green-apple tones keep the flavors spritely in this easy, enjoyable white.
Name: Duchman Family 2014 Bingham Family Vineyard Trebbiano (Texas)

Description: Luminous and fresh, this opens with aromas of jasmine, citrus and tropical fruit. The lively palate offers unripe yellow peach and juicy pineapple brightened by brisk acidity.
Name: Nardello 2014 Meridies  (Soave Classico)

Description: Peach, yellow plum and underripe banana tones mark the nose. Banana makes an appearance again—in candied form—on the medium-bodied, almost oily palate. Sharp lemon citrus tones race on the finish.
Name: Duchman Family 2014 Bingham Family Vineyard Vermentino (Texas)

Appellation: Seneca Lake, Finger Lakes, New York, US
Description: Tart and lean, this unusually brisk Tocai Friulano juxtapoes savory apple and citrus against a bounty of leafy green and herbal tones. It's refreshingly spry but vegetal in tone.
Name: Ventosa 2012 Tocai Friulano (Seneca Lake)

Appellation: Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze, Veneto, Italy
Description: Made only in small quantities, this newest addition to Bisol's sparkling line up is indeed impressive. Refermented in the bottle and made with no added dosage, it offers ripe apple, bread crust, chopped herbs, mineral and citrus sensations. It seamlessly combines elegance, structure and depth with sheer drinking pleasure.
Name: Bisol 2012 Private Non Dosato  (Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze)

Description: This dazzling sparkler opens with enticing aromas of wisteria, spring wild flowers, vineyard dust and freshly picked orchard fruit. The crisp, linear palate doles out green apple, nectarine, pear and energizing mineral notes alongside a creamy perlage and vibrant acidity. It's perfectly balanced and refreshing.
Designation: Vigneto della Riva di San Floriano Brut
Name: Nino Franco 2014 Vigneto della Riva di San Floriano Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Made with 100% Glera grown inside a walled vineyard, this stunning wine boasts unusual depth and structure. It delivers aromas and flavors of ripe yellow apple, pear, lemon drop, chopped sage and a ginger note while the foaming, silky mousse lends it a creamy, elegant texture. A recent vertical tasting back to 2007 proves this wine can develop more complexity after several years in the cellar.
Name: Nino Franco 2012 Grave di Stecca Brut Glera (Vino Spumante)

Description: This elegant sparkler opens with alluring aromas of fragrant jasmine, wisteria and white peach. Thanks to 80-year old vines, the linear palate has both finesse and concentration, offering ripe yellow apple, Bartlett pear, energizing mineral tones and a saline note alongside a creamy mousse.
Name: Ca' dei Zago 2013 Dosaggio Zero  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Silky and fragrant, this opens with aromas of Spanish broom, pressed white flowers, baked apple and citrus. The firm, vibrant palate delivers ripe Bartlett pear, nectarine zest, lime and a note of crystallized ginger alongside tangy acidity and firm, refined perlage.
Name: Corte Moschina 2009  Lessini Durello

Description: Linear and vibrant, this delicious white offers aromas of Spanish broom, Mediterranean herb and orchard fruit. The savory palate doles out juicy pear, crisp apple, creamy white peach, citrus zest and mineral alongside tangy acidity. It closes on a note of lemon drop.
Name: Tenuta Cocci Grifoni 2013 Colle Vecchio  (Offida Pecorino)

Appellation: Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore, Veneto, Italy
Description: Fragrant and refined, this opens with scents of white spring flowers and just picked orchard fruit. The bright, creamy palate doles out green apple, pear, white peach and a hint of chopped herbs. Bright acidity lifts the juicy flavors while a soft mousse lends elegance. It closes on an almond note.
Name: Vettori NV Brut  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Heady scents of jasmine, wisteria, chopped herbs and fresh orchard fruit lead the way on this delicious sparkler. The creamy palate doles out Bartlett pear, yellow apple and a hint of white peach alongside bright acidity and a soft perlage. One bottle might not be enough of this.
Name: Terre di San Venanzio Fortunato 2014 Demi Long  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Creamy and fresh, this off-dry sparkler offers heady aromas of exotic fruit, candied orange peel and ripe peach. The foaming palate doles out ripe apple, Bartlett pear and crystallized ginger alongside crisp acidity that gives it an almost linear quality.
Name: Nino Franco 2014 Primo Franco Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Delicate scents of pressed white flowers, chamomile, Bartlett pear and a whiff of almond lead the nose on this elegant sparkler. The creamy, scintillating palate delivers crisp apple, citrus zest and mineral alongside vibrant acidity and small, persistent bubbles that lead up to a dry, refreshing finish.
Name: BiancaVigna 2014 Rive di Soligo  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Made following the principles of biodynamic agriculture, this bright, savory sparkler offers aromas of white peach, green apple and chopped herbs. The palate doles out ripe Bartlett pear, lime, ginger and sage alongside zesty acidity and a foaming mousse. A note of candied nectarine closes the finish. This would be perfect for toasts or as an aperitivo.
Name: Perlage 2014 Col di Manza Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: This stunning sparkler opens with lovely aromas of hawthorn, wisteria, white orchard fruit and herbs. The crisp, savory palate offers white peach, green apple, lemon zest and minerals while a creamy mousse softens the vibrant acidity.
Name: Perlage NV Canah Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Fresh and fragrant, this delivers aromas of ripe orchard fruits and nuts, with a whiff of yellow wild flowers. The linear palate offers crisp pear, apple and lightly toasted almond alongside brisk acidity and a firm, refined perlage. It closes on a note of fresh peach and chopped herbs.
Name: Sorelle Bronca NV Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Appellation: Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze, Veneto, Italy
Description: Delicately scented, this alluring sparkler opens with aromas of white flowers and freshly picked orchard fruit. The vibrant, linear palate delivers crisp apple, pear and a citrus note accompanied by racy acidity and an elegant perlage.
Name: Terre di San Venanzio Fortunato NV Brut  (Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze)

Description: Enticing scents of wild flowers and white peach lead the nose, with a whiff of dried herbs. The creamy palate offers juicy apple, yellow pear and crushed minerals alongside zesty acidity and a frothy, elegant mousse. It's elegant and linear, with vibrant acidity that lifts up the fruit richness.
Designation: Cuvée del Fondatore Rive Col San Martino
Name: Graziano Merotto 2014 Cuvée del Fondatore Rive Col San Martino  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Heady scents of jasmine, wisteria, white peach and mountain herbs come together on this rich but racy wine. The aromas carry over to the palate of green apple, lime and a note of candied ginger offset by racy acidity and a refined mousse. The finish is clean and refreshing, and drier than one would expect from the Extra Dry category.
Name: Ruggeri & C. 2014 Giustino B. Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Creamy, fresh and delicately scented, this lovely sparkler opens with a fragrance of pressed yellow flowers, mango and a hint of flint. The elegantly structured palate offers nectarine zest, white peach, mineral and a honeyed note are accompanied by bright acidity.
Name: Feudi di San Gregorio 2013 + Brut Metodo Classico Greco (Vino Spumante)

Description: Crisp and refreshing, this lovely sparkler offers sensations of white wild flowers, green apple, citrus and Bartlett pear. Vibrant acidity balances the creamy, elegantly foaming palate and gives it a dry, invigorating finish.
Name: Nino Franco NV Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: This traditionally crafted, unfiltered sparkler opens with heady aromas of white spring flowers, wisteria, hawthorn and white tree fruit. The bright palate offers green apple, pear and lemon-lime while a mineral note backs up the finish. Bracing acidity provides support while a refined mousse adds softness.
Name: Marchiori 2013 Fondamentale Zulle Glera (Colli Trevigiani)

Description: Enticing aromas of chopped herbs, wild flowers and white stone fruit float out of the glass. The refined, focused palate offers white peach, pear, grapefruit and pineapple alongside zesty acidity and tiny, persistent bubbles.
Name: Bortolin Angelo 2014 Sommaval Rive di Guia  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Notes of chopped star anise, sage, white spring flowers and Bartlett pear float out of the glass. The elegant palate offers yellow apple, white almond and citrus zest alongside a refined perlage. Bright acidity gives it a clean, quenching finish.
Name: Foss Marai 2014 Guia Millesimato Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Appellation: Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze, Veneto, Italy
Description: Enticing aromas of white and yellow spring flowers, peach and a hint of pastry cream lead the nose. The palate offers creamed green apple, nectarine zest, ripe pear and a hint of mineral alongside vibrant acidity and an elegant, persistent perlage.
Name: Terre di San Venanzio Fortunato NV Dry  (Valdobbiadene Superiore di Cartizze)

Description: Aromas of wisteria, young Bartlett pear and citrus lead the nose on this quenching sparkler. The racy, elegant palate offers grapefruit, green apple and lime alongside tangy acidity and an energized perlage. An almond note closes the finish.
Name: Marchiori NV Profili Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Aromas of fragrant yellow flowers, hay, toasted hazelnuts and citrus zest emerge on this dazzling sparkler. Made entirely with native grape Durello, the elegant palate offers ripe yellow apple, white peach, lime and bread crust alongside a silky perlage.
Name: Corte Moschina 2011 36m Metodo Classico  (Lessini Durello)

Description: This luminous sparkler opens with aromas of jasmine, orange blossom and white peach. The crisp, refreshing palate doles out green apple, Bartlett pear and white almond alongside vibrant acidity and a silky mousse.
Name: Nino Franco NV Rustico  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Aromas of pressed yellow flowers, Bartlett pear and a hint of citrus lead the nose. The bright, savory palate doles out creamy white peach, green apple, pear and a mineral note alongside vibrant acidity and a frothy mousse.
Name: Montesel 2014 Vigna del Paradiso Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Even in a challenging year like the cool and rainy 2014 vintage, this dynamic firm has made a stunning sparkler thanks to rigorous grape selection. Refermented in the bottle, it offers aromas and flavors of white spring flowers, lemon-lime, green apple and peach. Vibrant acidity and a foaming mousse offset the linear palate while a mineral note backs up the finish.
Name: Ca' dei Zago 2014 Col Fondo  (Prosecco)

Description: Wisteria, orchard fruit, aromatic herbs and citrus zest aromas lead the nose on this vibrant sparkler. The linear, focused palate offers pear, lime and apple alongside bracing acidity and an invigorating perlage. It boasts a crisp, quenching close.
Designation: Col Credas Rive di Farra di Soligo
Name: Adami 2014 Col Credas Rive di Farra di Soligo  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Delicate aromas of white flowers, stone fruit and pear lead the way. On the palate, a core of green apple and citrus is carried by vibrant, fresh acidity. Small, lively bubbles lend finesse.
Name: Drusian NV  Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore

Description: Jasmine, wisteria and dried herbs aromas mingle in the glass while the creamy palate offers ripe white peach, yellow apple, pear and a note of candied nectarine zest. Bright acidity and a frothy mousse offset the rich flavors and carry through to the white almond finish.
Name: Terre di San Venanzio Fortunato 2014 Millesimato  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: This opens with attractive floral aromas of Spanish broom, acacia and chamomile while the bright palate offers white peach, green apple and citrus. Brisk acidity gives it a crisp, clean finish while a note of white almond signals the close. Small persistent bubbles add finesse.
Name: Terre di San Venanzio Fortunato 2014  Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore

Description: Aromas of fragrant white flowers, acacia and orchard fruit float out of the glass. The frothy, linear palate delivers crisp green apple, pear and citrus alongside racy acidity and small, persistent bubbles.
Name: Fratelli Bortolin NV Extra Dry  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)

Description: Delicately scented, this refined wine offers aromas of white and yellow spring flowers with a whiff of white stone fruit. The foaming palate offers pear, peach and crisp green apple alongside vibrant acidity and a frothy mousse.
Name: Montesel 2014 Riva dei Fiori Brut  (Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)
